58.description: Nadia has given me the best brows of my life and to her I am eternally grateful! I never had a proper arch until she went to work on mine last year. She is the best in the business and I'm so glad I found her at Benefit back in the day and would follow her anywhere. Her new Suite 120 is also super adorable and she really takes her time to get it right which sets her apart from others i've seen in the past. She's also a total sweetheart and truly loves what she does with her clients. I always look forward to seeing her smiling face. Book your appointment now and thank me later!

56.description: SO glad I found Nadia after she left Benefit.  She has set up a super cute space where she can do her amazing brows all the day long.  There is no one better in Chicago! Nadia is so nice, professional and fun to be around.  Cannot recommend highly enough!

29.description: I have to agree with all the reviews for Nadia. She is excellent! She is very sweet and she made sure to educate me on the proper shaping technique for my brows. I specifically booked a brow tweezing appointment because I have very sensitive skin. She honored my wishes and she shared with me what the benefits of perhaps using a hard wax in the future. She also asked me to research the hard wax so we could talk about it next time I came. Overall I'm very pleased with my brows. I took a picture to share because when I was looking at all the reviews there were no pictures available to give me an idea of her work. For some people seeing is believing!

42.description: I went to Nadia based on a co-workers recommendation when she still worked at Benefit and would never let anyone else do my brows again. She is amazing at what she does and I was so excited when she opened her own space. She is not only a great at waxing but she is the most friendly and energetic person and always so fun to chat with. I always look forward to my appointments. Love her!

23.description: I'm relatively new to the city and have been trying to find a good place to get my eyebrows waxed. After a few disastrous experiences at a few places around the city, I took my poor uneven overgrown eyebrows to see Lina, who cleaned them up and made them look great again in only 15 minutes! She was very friendly and knowledgeable and I've finally found a great place I can stick with!

47.description: I am verrrrrry particular about my eyebrows.  I've never been a fan of threading, but I have tried most of the four- and five-star threading salons in Lakeview and on Devon, hoping for a good brow.  At best, I got a clean up.Nadia got me very close to the perfect arch that I wanted.  She was honest with me from the beginning and said that they wouldn't be PERFECT this time, because the last time I had gotten my brows done they took off too much.  She shaped them, told me not to touch them for a month, and said we'd be pretty close to perfect next time.  I believe her.  They look pretty amazing.  She even gave me a few pointers on tinting and filling them at home to help in between (and all the time).She's a keeper.

8.description: Ok, so I'm super lazy but it's about time I write this review.First of all, before even getting to the brows, Nadia and Lina are both awesome. Great conversation, hilarious, and make you feel right at home the second you walk in.Now for the brows: I am a redhead and my brows are basically clear. On one hand, this is great because when they start getting overgrown harder to tell, but on the other, it's not so great because most brow ladies don't feel the need to do a thorough job with them. I've been all over Chicago and have never had someone take as much care as Nadia in making sure that both brows are shaped evenly and that every stray hair is gone.Seriously, if all of these 5 start reviews haven't convinced you, you need to just take the leap and go to Nadia and Lina -- your brows will thank you.

31.description: THE BEST IN THE CITY TO DO YOUR BROWS BAR NONE, NO LIE.I never thought I could have nice brows until I started coming to her when she was at Benefit at Bloomies.  She branched out on her own and since she is so !#$ good, I had to go with her!!!   She does amazing work. I actually have people look at my Instagram photos and say "woman, your brow game is on point!" and I'm all like "gee... I'm known for a lot of stuff, but not my brows!"  Nadia is the secret to my sexiness and I hate giving this tidbit out because I don't want her to get so busy she can't see me anymore.Anyway... NADIA IS THE WOMAN.  GO. NOW.

34.description: Easy to make appointments and starts on time. Friendly, professional demeanor aside, she knew exactly what to do and did it quickly and confidently-- No hemming or hawing here.  I left pleasantly surprised by how clean and natural my brows looked as I was afraid (due to traumatic past experiences) that I would leave with overly thin arches.  Will return.

16.description: Been going to Nadia since my first review and I'm not sure what I'm going to do when I relocate to Charlotte, NC.I'm still amazed that she truly "sexified" my eyebrows despite that I have a scar right on the brow bone. I even have an arch that I never thought possible. I have to dig up an old pic with my thinning brows and post it here so you can see what I mean.Nadia just changed the type of wax she uses to something organic and gentler. That's a bonus for me since I'm all into natural and organic these days.And yes, she works out of a place that is difficult to find parking by, but I take the CTA  to get to her. She's worth it. Trust me.If you've been trying to call her number and cannot get through, you are better off booking an appointment via her new online appointment link below. Faster and easier than waiting for a call or text back. She's not ignoring you on purpose. You barely get reception in that place and it's proven challenging for her to keep up with the hundreds of texts she receives each day on her personal cellphone.secure-booker.com/nadiad…PS- she also does make-up application...and make sure to bookmark the link above.

13.description: I've been dragging on writing a review for Nadia, but her work deserves to be known!I am super picky about my eyebrows - I'm a Middle-Eastern mix, which means my eyebrows indeed FRAME my face like no other!! In fact, my last eyebrow girl was an Instagram-famous brow lady down the hall from Nadia, but after much disappointment and uneven eyebrows, Nadia managed to bring them back to life after just two sessions.She just recently raised her prices to $30.00, but if you maintain your eyebrows in between sessions, spending $30.00 every month on eyebrows on someone with the skill set and someone who actually listens to you, like Nadia, it is WORTH it!! Try her once and you won't be disappointed.

11.description: I have had an appointment and it was terrific. The appointment was on time, its clean, professional and she's lovely. Good suggestions about upkeep and I will recommend her and return for another appointment

39.description: As the other reviews indicate, Nadia is the best! She has perfected the craft of waxing and shaping brows, and she genuinely cares about her clients and their happiness with her service. I moved to Chicago is August and I refuse to allow anyone else to touch my eyebrows.

37.description: The holy M#*@& F&#^@N Grail of eyebrow styling. If its possible to be perfect at something,Nadia embodies it! Do you believe that perfectly arched eyebrows can change your face? your profile? your wow factor? HELL YES it can! I let my eyebrows grow in for months...after some other eyebrow gal made mine too thin. When, I finally started to mimic one of the Star-trek men, I was going to hit the local chain mall and let them botch it up...but first, I perused through Yelp, only to discover that Nadia had opened up her own space! Heaven's doors opened and I could hear a harp in the background...Nadia has the perfectly cute and quaint space. Her personality is stellar as always, and what's more, the gal has free chocolates! Do yourself a favor....go see Nadia (p.s. if your eyebrows need to grow out...suck it up, let them grow out and be prepared to be amazed...)

0.description: After Lina cleans up my brows, I feel like me, but better!  She keeps them looking very natural, and I love how conscientious she is.  My brows aren't perfectly symmetrical, but usually I'm dismissed with something along the lines of "the difference is so minimal, no one would notice."  That may be true, but I definately do, and so did Lina when she worked on me for the first time (without me bringing it up).  If you drive, you know that parking in the area is a hassle, but  there are the 15 min standing spots in front of the building or meter parking on Oak St.  I'm not the best planner so the ease of scheduling appointments online, within the next couple days is a big plus.  For first timers, you should know that the studio is in a maze-like lower level and entrance is down the black stairs, next to the salon.

38.description: Love Nadia. I discovered her on yelp almost 2 years ago and decided to see if she really was as good as her reviewers were saying she was. Verdict? Perfect brows. When I first came to her, my brows were thin, and I had no clue how to shape them/ fill them in with a brow kit. She not only helped me with growing them out & shaping them, but she also took the time to show me how to use my benefit brow kit to fill them in/shape them so I could DO IT everyday at home. My brows were perfect for my August wedding and I plan on continuing to see Nadia for my brows.Another reason for the five stars- she is a very sweet and down to earth person. She also really pays attention to her clients- she remembers everything we talk about and makes you feel like you are visiting an old friend. :)

51.description: I used to see Nadia regularly at Benefit before moving away from Chicago, so I went to write a review for her there and saw that she had moved, so I am writing it here. I've been getting my brows done for years everywhere from Indiana to Chicago, now to NYC, and Nadia is simply the best. She shapes them perfectly and CORRECTLY, and makes you look like a star. And as an added bonus, she is so sweet and fun to talk with. Go see Nadia for your brows! You will never go anywhere else!

32.description: Been going to Nadia since my first review and I'm not sure what I'm going to do when I relocate to Charlotte, NC.I'm still amazed that she truly "sexified" my eyebrows despite that I have a scar right on the brow bone. I even have an arch that I never thought possible. I have to dig up an old pic with my thinning brows and post it here so you can see what I mean.Nadia just changed the type of wax she uses to something organic and gentler. That's a bonus for me since I'm all into natural and organic these days.And yes, she works out of a place that is difficult to find parking by, but I take the CTA  to get to her. She's worth it. Trust me.If you've been trying to call her number and cannot get through, you are better off booking an appointment via her new online appointment link below. Faster and easier than waiting for a call or text back. She's not ignoring you on purpose. You barely get reception in that place and it's proven challenging for her to keep up with the hundreds of texts she receives each day on her personal cellphone.secure-booker.com/nadiad…PS- she also does make-up application...and make sure to bookmark the link above.

54.description: I have so anal about my eyebrows it's ridiculous.  I've been going to the same lady for the year I've lived in Chicago and I absolutely love her.  She recently went on vacation causing me to find a new person to do my eyebrows while she was gone. I did some research and ended up booking an appointment with Nadia and am SO glad I did!She is the nicest person ever and her studio is super cute and clean.  She spent a lot of time explaining to me what my eyebrow should look like and showed me my eyebrow each time after she did a wax strip.  My eyebrows look awesome now and I plan to only visit her.If you're looking for an eyebrow waxer that will actually listen to what you want and does a great job check her out! Her prices are super affordable and am already looking forward to my next appointment!

48.description: My friend and I have been getting our eyebrows waxed by Nadia over the past 6-7 months and both of us couldn't be happier with the results! Let me preface this by saying, I have had some pretty traumatic experiences in the past with getting my eyebrows waxed. I won't got into the gory details, but over time I have found it is VERY hard to find someone who does a good job, and nearly impossible to find someone as talented as Nadia.I like how she takes the time to study your brows and come up with a game plan opposed to just diving in. She does a great job of emphasizing your natural arc and is detailed with trimming and shaping. Also, she won't let you leave her chair until your brows look amazing! As you can tell by the yelp reviews, she is a pretty popular lady, but she doesn't let that take away from your appointment time or your brows. Also, she is probably one of the friendliest, easiest to talk to you, nicest people that I have met in that industry :) I know she offers other services, but I have only had my brows done by her. However, on that note, I have thought about possibly getting a make-up tutorial through her. Her make up is great...I am jealous...I need to know her secrets :) :)

44.description: "What she said"....No, seriously. The rumors are true. Nadia is the real deal. I didn't even know how terrible my eyebrows were until Nadia fixed them and I saw how incredible I looked (her everyone, come see how good I look). She trims, measures, waxes, and plucks and you walk out the door feeling like a million bucks. She is fast, professional, super clean, and makes a point to get your eyebrows from good to great. Did I mention this is adorable and makes the whole appointment feel like a chat with friends?

24.description: My brows look great. I have an arch again and I will be going back so she can craft them even better. Yelp you rock. Thanks for my new brow girl.

7.description: Nadia was super friendly and clearly an expert in her field.  Great job on my stubborn, sparse brows. I was taken aback a bit as my total ended up being $50 for the brow tint and was.  After tip, $60.  I would love to go back I just don't how feasible it would be at that price point.

49.description: Nadia is hands-down the absolute best in the city!All of these amazing reviews are proof in the pudding that Nadia just simply has a gift.  Gals walking out of her studio just look so damn good...Be prepared for Nadia to take your eyebrows very seriously.  She will have you look in the mirror and explain to you your natural shape, how your eyebrows will be waxed, and how your face will look better after the wax.  And she is always right!!As an added bonus, Nadia is just so extremely sweet and welcoming.  I've been going to her for a couple months and for the first time in my life I look forward to eyebrow waxes.  There simply needs to be more Nadia's out there!

40.description: I've gotten my brows done at countless places in Chicago, New York, and Philadelphia, but Nadia is the best! Her new studio is very cute and, most importantly, clean and professional. She really walks you through what she's doing and explains how to keep up your brows between appointments and outlines goals to set for growing out certain areas. She let me watch as she filled them in slightly which was a huge help since I'm pretty clueless about that. Really friendly and personable, but above all, excellent brows! Only downer is she doesn't put concealer over your redness. It's $20 FYI

53.description: Love Nadia! I found her at Benefit and followed her to her new place across the street at Phenix Salon Suites (100 East Walton, Suite 120).  I never really paid too much attention to my eyebrows until I met her.  After my first appointment, there was no turning back!  There were full, arched, and perfect!Her studio is small but super cute.  She is very sweet and always fun to talk to!  She even remembers small details from your last appointment.  She is easy to get a hold of via text (and will also text you a reminder the day before).Oh and for every ten visits, you get a free eyebrow wax.

30.description: I never thought I'd get my brows waxed but with my wedding one year away I started going to Nadia as part of my effort to get my skin/hair care regimen in order before the wedding. Now I can never go back to doing my own brows.After the wedding, this is the only part of my pre-wedding prep that I'm actually going to keep doing. I didn't even know how asymmetric my brows were until she got her hands on me. The first 3 times were odd because she had to let certain parts grow in while waxing other parts, but after my 4th visit I was hooked. She is a serious business-woman, always runs on time and respects her clients' time. I just can't say enough good things about her.

46.description: Alright.  So I'm basically going to mimic everyone else's reviews of Nadia.  I found her on Yelp and chose to make an appointment based on her 5 star rating.  I have had such horrible experiences getting my eyebrows shaped.  Nadia is just as sweet as the reviews say, very easy to talk to, friendly, knows her stuff when it comes to proper brow shape.  She is now my go to person for brows.  Love her!  She walks you through the whole process and actually talks to you before she gets started to understand what it is you are looking for.  The only con is that her suite is located in the Phenix Salon Suites on Walton in Streeterville, parking is expensive around the area, so be prepared for that.

1.description: Was in the area and needed a quick fix. I called for an appointment and was able to be seen within 15 minutes. The "boutique" was not what I expected...although I am not sure I was really expecting anything. A very simple room with a salon chair, service station, a cabinet, and a bench. Service was good. I prefer waxing over threading - I do not handle pain very well. which must have showed, because I was asked several times if I was doing alright. The end result was just as I requested. I'm not sure if Nadia or Lina performed the service but I was pleased. One thing that I thought was odd, there was a gentleman that sat in the room with us while the service was being done.  I didn't mind, I just thought it was strange. I will be back.

55.description: Nadia is the absolute best. I followed her from her last company because she spoiled me for anyone else! She does a phenomenal job, and I've converted several friends to Nadia devotees as well. I can't recommend her highly enough!

9.description: Nadia is a brow genius. NOT KIDDING!  I went for my first appointment 8 weeks ago and she  took time and went over my eyebrows with me. We talked about the shape they should be & how long I should grow them out.  Im so antsy when it comes to my brows so I was a little apprehensive when she told me to come back in 4 weeks but she proved me wrong.  The shape was perfect and she made a real believer out of me.  I also love that she shows you how to apply makeup to them so they look even better.    Im sure some people think that $30 is probably a bit much for a brow wax but with Nadia it is well worth it.  I feel like i have the best brows ever!

26.description: Nadia is the most amazing person ever, I ADORE her! My eyebrows have been through the worst, and then this magical loveable adorable lady saved them. She's legit my only wish is that I lived closer to her so I could have her tame my brows on the regular ; )

25.description: I do not trust anyone with my eyebrows except for Nadia! She is the best!!! You will not regret getting your eyebrows waxed  by her.

12.description: It's really heaven on Earth. I have never trusted someone so much with my eyebrows. I started going to Nadia when she started at Benefit Brow Bar at least 6 years ago and have followed her since. Really give her a try it's worth the money to never have to play Russian Roulette with how your brows will come out. The last couple times I've went I've trusted Nadia to let Lina work on my eyebrows and they came out the exact same way Nadia does them! Taught by the best! So ladies please don't hesitate to change your appearance by having amazing brows that will help shape your face and compliment your features!!! Love you Nadia & Lina!!

59.description: I am a baby about pain.  HUGE baby!  I would cry every single time I had my eyebrows waxed.  Now?  I don't even tear up!  Nadia does an amazing job doing a completely pain free wax.  My brows have never looked better.  They are full, with a nice arch, and are finally growing back from my disasters in threading.  And Nadia touches them up with makeup after she waxes, so I don't walk out with crazy red marks.  She takes her time working on them, and always shows you as she goes along.Her suite is really cute too-and she has refreshments as well!  Nadia is the sweetest and truly seems to love her clients and her job.

21.description: Booked my appointment online and was lucky enough to get a same day appointment. I was expecting Nadia, but was slightly disappointed that she was not my esthetician. However, I did have the very lovely, Leena do my brows! Such a sweet and fun gal! She helps you relax with her conversation. And did I say she is a sweetheart?! lol She did a very good job with my brows! They are full and neat! My brows were slightly imbalanced and she paid attention to that and even worked to fix them! No one has ever done that or even mentioned my issue to me. I truly appreciated it. I love the shaping she did for my brows!

17.description: I highly recommend going to Lina for your eyebrows. I have seen her twice and she is an expert at shaping and tinting brows! I came in with ok eyebrows to begin with but now my brows are a million times better thanks to Lina! On my first visit she showed me where I needed to let them grow in and she filled them in beautifully. HIghly highly recommend!

10.description: I went to get my eyebrows done by Nadia a few weeks ago because of all of the great reviews. Booking was easy - even same day.  I don't think she is the best if you are Asian. She doesn't get the nuances of Asian bone structure.She ended up taking too much off the top to try to create an artificial arch instead of refining the naturally existing arch. She's a very nice person, but I'll keep looking for a brow person while my brows grow back out.

5.description: The brow boss, indeed! Absolutely the biggest fan of Nadia and her business. Lina is also really amazing. Combined, I feel I get the full beauty experience whenever I have the pleasure of coming here to get my brows done. I actually live in New York and ONLY get my brows done by Nadia and Lina...considering I am brow-obsessed, this speaks volumes as the trip to Chicago isn't a short one. I willingly wait months until I am able to get to Chicago for an appointment. Nadia is so professional that she will even schedule me while she is training in NYC during her makeup and beauty courses -- does client service get any better?! I have tried Benefit and Anastasia and just don't feel they have the expertise and personal touch that these girls have. My brow tint is always the perfect tone for my hair and skin and the girls always make sure to never get wax or tweeze happy, which is a pet peeve of mine. I typically have Nadia do my brows as she's always done them, and it's a learning experience along the way. I, like most, have one good and one bad brow, so she teaches me what to do to make them look identical as possible and even shows me techniques for filling them in. I never feel rushed and really feel like she adds the personal touch that so many girls look for in a beauty experience. Super professional and love how sweet she is -- and most importantly, I can tell she knows what she is talking about and listens to what I want. I hate when people do their own thing, it never ends well. I've had Lina do my makeup on a number of occasions, since Nadia usually takes care of my brows, and she's amazing. I think one of life's biggest struggles (ha) is putting on false eyelashes, and she does it so perfectly that they last all night on me without any pain or coming loose. To me, that's worth the entire makeup appointment in itself. She's super fun and such a sweetheart, and always makes my face look flawless for a night out or special occasion. I'm not a fan of getting my makeup done, but they get the colors and understand the look I am going for, so it's been all wonderful for me. I even had some costume makeup done here last Halloween when I was in town, and I got so many compliments on it. l can't say enough about this place! I am so obsessed and selfishly wish I had them on my doorstep so I didn't have to fly out to Chicago for brow maintenance, but they make it worth the trip every time!

3.description: Hands down, Nadia & Lina truly are as good as it gets!I see Nadia every 2 weeks & it's always fun! She's SO fast, so you're in & out, but never rushed. Lina & Nadia really do make it feel like you're just there to catch up with friends (friends who happen to give you amazing eyebrows).The best part is you can book your appointments online - I HIGHLY recommend doing this to get your choice of appointments (if you work a traditional schedule & plan on popping in after work, M-F evenings fill up quickly, so the online booking is REALLY handy to schedule regular appointments - and you can change your appointments online as well). I know a few Yelpers mentioned not getting through on the phone - it's only because these awesome girls are really busy because they are so great! But you'll have your appointment in just a few clicks online. I love these girls - I can't imagine seeing anyone else! I love my brows!

35.description: This is long overdue as I've been a client of Nadia's since her benefit brow bar days. As others have noted, she's a perfectionist, but more importantly listens to you. My brows are now much fuller (she's instilled patience in me) and beautifully shaped. I even brought my mom here and she was likewise impressed!

19.description: This will be my first review on yelp and I have to say Lina is amazing! I've been going there for a couple weeks now, and not once has Lina disappointed me in any way! She enjoys conversations, she's a really out-going person, and she's amazing at doing brows. Trust me, I've done threading and waxing and by far Lina is the best. I used to go to the Anastasia Brow Studio and since I couldn't book an appointment, I found myself on yelp looking at Nadia Daniell, and I now understand why this place has 5 stars! I love Lina she gives my brows life.

28.description: I'm sorry, but I don't see what all the hoopla is about. Maybe because I didn't spend as much as the person before me, but my experience was subpar. I had to wait about 6 minutes into my appointment and then I wasn't even offered any makeup afterwards to fill in my bald spots because she wanted to keep my brows thick. I really didn't see much of a difference before I got my eyebrows done. I'm entitled to my opinion and I wasn't satisfied AND felt rushed.

45.description: Like everyone else, I am obsessed with Nadia. She does an amazing job, is super friendly, and you can text her to make appointments. Overall, just a fabulous experience!

33.description: So I'm pretty anal about my eyebrows and truly believe that eyebrows can make or break your face. I am indian and have had my eyebrows threaded since I was 13 years old. I have been EVERYWHERE in Atlanta, DC, NY, MD, VA and have always been able to find a place that knows how to do good threading. However, when I moved to Chicago it was impossible. I tried Devon, and a bunch of threading places in Chicago for the past SIX years and have never been satisfied by their threading job. I have usually been the complete opposite of satisfied, and even more annoyed when they tell me it's "just the way my eyebrows are." In any case, after reading the reviews online about Nadia, I decided to give waxing a try. She is everything they say and more. Truly. Not only does she listen to you (she even agreed to look at a photo of my old eyebrows and didn't make me feel crazy), but she explains what she is doing and is HONEST regarding what can and can't be fixed about your eyebrows in one session. She has an eye for the perfect arch and will even fill in your eyebrows before you leave if you would like her to. I don't know if I am sold on waxing yet, but I am definitely sold on Nadia. It's such a relief to know that I have finally found my eyebrow place. After my first appointment with her, my girlfriends actually NOTICED my eyebrows and insisted that they wanted to see her as well since she was able to work wonders with my botched eyebrows. Appointments are easy to make online which is really nice. Parking is next to impossible which is the only downside, but she's totally worth the hassle. Also, if you are used to threading prices, her prices are a bit higher ($20 for eyebrows), but again, totally worth it. Her suite is super cute and she has always been on time every time I have seen her. She's also very sweet and easy to talk to :)I highly recommend Nadia. She knows what she is doing, will be honest with you, and will do her very best to make sure your eyebrows are as they are supposed to be.

43.description: I truly believe that eyebrows are something that can make or break a person's overall look and that's why I am obsessed with mine looking perfect. Luckily, after a lifetime of trying out different people who never quite got it, I found Nadia. She is friendly, sweet, flexible in her appointments, and THE EYEBROW QUEEN! Don't bother going to anybody else in the entire city and just go to Nadia, you won't regret it.

2.description: Wish I could've tried Nadia out but I didn't get the opportunity. After all of the great reviews, I wanted to book an appointment to get my eyebrows done properly before my upcoming relocation to a smaller city. Since the Yelp online booking link didn't work, I tried calling...and calling. The first time, I left a message. The next time, the mailbox was full, but my (2nd) missed call which should've registered and been returned. A couple of days later, I called a different number that reached another suite and was advised to call her assistant, Lena and was given her number. I left a voice message with Lena and she called me back the next day. I explained that I wanted to set an appointment with Nadia and was booked. Woohoo finally! I hoped my brows would be worth the hassle of simply making an appointment.No such luck. After a 20 minute drive to get there and paying for parking, I was greeted by Lena who was working on a client. She introduced herself and told me she would get to me shortly. Wait what? Where is Nadia??? A few minutes later Nadia walks in. I was about to sit in her chair when she realized I was not her scheduled client. We had an awkward exchange (in front of Lena and her client) in which she apologized for the inconvenience, blamed the mixup on likely poor reception in the suite, and told me Lena would be able to do the same job she would. The client being worked on felt the need to cosign. This was not the point. I don't doubt that Lena would've done a nice job, but I came in after having read reviews specifically for Nadia...and at $30, it doesn't come cheap. Since she is from whom I requested the service, I believe I should've received it, rather than be asked to accept an alternative. I think that a better solution could've been proposed that wouldn't have come at my time and experience expense, and it wasn't. So I left and went to Benefit's Brow Bar. The additional star is because they both were nice ladies and Nadia was verbally apologetic.

18.description: I'm relatively new to the city and have been trying to find a good place to get my eyebrows waxed. After a few disastrous experiences at a few places around the city, I took my poor uneven overgrown eyebrows to see Lina, who cleaned them up and made them look great again in only 15 minutes! She was very friendly and knowledgeable and I've finally found a great place I can stick with!

41.description: Until I met Nadia, my eyebrows did nothing for my face.  After one session with her, she shaped them perfectly.  She literally gave my face a makeover just by fixing my eyebrows!  I hope she never decides to change careers because then I'm in trouble.  I have gotten my brows shaped elsewhere and I can honestly say no one else has done such a detailed and fabulous job as Nadia.  Thank you Nadia!

52.description: Love Nadia and she is amazing at what she does! I also found her via velp reviews at Benefit Brow Bar at Bloomingdales, and have followed her to her new suite, which is clean and inviting. I like that she places her angle marks on your brows and explains the area where your brows should start, end and arc, she explains her process so that you know where to not pluck and allow to grow ( if needed).  She truly enjoys what she does, and gets excited about it.I have thick, corse eyebrows (I'm 75% Mexican) and like shapely but natural looking arches and she does fabulous eyebrows.I cannot recommend her more.

50.description: Nadia is amazing--a brow whisperer. I started seeing her before my wedding. I'd previously gotten my brows threaded, and they were sparse and over-plucked. It's been a little over six months, and my brows are almost fully grown in but still have a shape. I love how they look now, and it's seriously because of her. The fact that she is super warm, friendly, bubbly, and a lot of fun are all added bonuses. :) Highly, highly recommend!

4.description: I went to see Nadia and she was great.  She's super nice and she's great at what she does.  Definitely coming back and I've recommended her with several people now.  The prices are a bit on the high end but she really delivers!  My only complaint is that the location is a bit difficult to find and of course parking!

6.description: Nadia is my eyebrow savior. Seriously, she's that good. I had been growing out my eyebrows for about 8 months before I went to Nadia. I told myself I'd rather be the crazy brow lady than have them repeatedly butchered and thinned out. My eyebrows are a little special, they're not exactly the same shape and there's a small scar on my right arch. People who have done my eyebrows in the past usually act like they know what they're doing. Nine times out of ten I usually leave the place with barely any eyebrows left because they fixate on trying to match my scarred eyebrow with my normal eyebrow. (It's like they've never heard of an eyebrow pencil.)When I first saw Nadia, she immediately went over my eyebrows with me. What shape they should be, where I still needed more growth, and most importantly my scar. She was able to make my eyebrows nearly identical without making them thinner. She also applies makeup to them so they look even more polished.Her prices just went up. It used to be $20 to do eyebrows with her but now it's $30. Although it's substantially more than what other places charge, I'd  rather see Nadia than pay someone money for terrible brows.

22.description: Love this place!!! I never leave disappointed and get tons of compliments on my brows!

15.description: Nadia is truly an eyebrow expert. I've had my eyebrows done in so many different places and always ended up with thin eyebrows which I hate. She follows my natural shape and just makes them look polished and clean. Also she's fast and super nice. Worth the trip if you don't live nearby.

57.description: Nadia is hands down the best brow person in Chicago. As a CA transplant I have gone all over the city and felt like I had been to every salon (Exhale, Anastasia at Nordstrom, Red Door... you name it) until I finally thought I would put some trust in my CA roots and hit up the Benefit Bar at Bloomingdales. My first meeting with Nadia was the same as the other places I had gone (which subsequently completely botched my brows and "gave" me the "trendy" Chicago skinny brow (not a good look on me)) by me coming in with guns blazing and several pictures to show her what I wanted. She was very patient with me (I know I can be a difficult client) and showed me what was wrong and what I needed to do in order to get my brow back to my full arch. Needless to say, I will not go to anyone else and I have even ditched my go to when I fly back to CA. I am so happy she is no longer at Benefit/Bloomingdales anymore and she can run her own schedule. She lives to make sure that every single one of her clients has the best brow for their face, and now she has the flexibility to fit me in around my crazy schedule! Remember everyone that she does not stop at brows- she did AMAZING individual eye lashes on me that lasted for days! I totally trust her and will be very sad when my life takes me away from Chicago, and ultimately Nadia. She is truly a gem and unbelievably talented. The secret is exposed- Nadia is the best and I am so glad I get to brag about how amazing she makes my brows look. So, to everyone, you're welcome and go see what Nadia can do for  you!

20.description: After being fed up with having my brows butchered, I decided to take my time and look for the best brow artist. I came across Nadia on Yelp and am so grateful I did! Today was my first visit with her and WOW! I had let my brows grow out since my last horror story in January so, I walked in the salon looking like a lumber jack. Nadia and her artist in training (?) Lena, were both so very sweet and courteous. They were so warm and welcoming I felt like I had been a client for years. Nadia is very knowledgeable and thorough, and she takes the time to educate the client. She explained to me the importance of shaping the brows to fit each individual face and even took the time to show me how to correctly fill my brows. The cost is only $20 which may be expensive for some, but I've spent way more at other places with mediocre results. Overall, Nadia and Lena are gems that I am so glad to have found. I have no problem driving from the Southside to get to them. This is definitely my new brow spot!

36.description: Nadia is by far the best brow gal I have ever come across. I have lived in many cities across many countries and always cringe and trying to find a new go-to brow gal. I came on yelp to find one in Chicago when I moved here last year and have never had a better experience. Nadia takes the time to care for your eyebrows and doesn't just wax haphazardly like most other places. If you are picky about your 'brows and want them shaped by a true expert, go to Nadia! I promise you will not be disappointed!

14.description: Nadia did a wonderful job! She was super quick and made my eyebrows look amazing!  She clearly is an expert with brows and makes you feel welcome from start to finish. A great experience overall!

56.description: Went here (for the first time) with the family and 2 friends from out of town and got:italian beefchili friesfrozen lemonadedeep fried cheesecakeIt was all very very good! In fact, I'm craving it again right now!

29.description: Fast friendly inexpensive. Yelp  wants words. .it's a hot dog stand. Its a menu that never changes,and shouldn't. Parm,beef ,proper dog with a snap from the casing.

42.description: Just stopped in at Frannie's with my boys yesterday. It is one of those timeless kind of places that still seems the same every time we return, even if we've been away for half a year. The fries are just as good as the day I fell in love with them nearly a decade ago. But there is one change this time: Blueberry Italian ice joins the growing lineup of ices to choose from. And I can say I love this flavor too.

23.description: I've only had their Pepper and Egg sandwich and holy smokes that thing was AMAZING!It was overflowing with pillowy soft eggs, spicy giardiniera, and gooey mozzarella cheese. One sandwich filled two of us to the brim.I'm docking two stars only because of the lack of consistency with the place.  I called once to pick up an order of the Pepper and Egg sandwich, only to hear the person that made this particular sandwich wasn't in--which I understand, and was fine.  Two other times I got this sandwich, they didn't taste at all like the other experiences I've had eating the same exact thing.  Once they had used another type of giardinera, another time they had skimped on the egg--the lack of consistency has made me wary of making the trek down River Rd since there are so many other places nearby who do a better job at remaining consistent with the quality of the food they serve. If this is a sandwich Frannies serves once a week, and there is one particular person that is designated to making this sandwich, then how come there is so much inconsistency?

47.description: I used to eat lunch there once or twice a week when i worked near there.  Not expensive and great vienna beef hot dogs, fresh cut fries and good milkshakes.Just went to Gene and Judes for 1st time tonight, but IMO, Frannies is much better.  I like KETCHUP on my fries, LOL, and I want a milkshake, not just a coke.

8.description: Absolutely great Italian beef! The Au jus is just right, get it double dipped and bring your own bib. Hot peppers is best on mine! There's no comparison in the Schiller Park area. I got 3 bypasses already and don't really give a fuck what the doctor says, I says I rather die eatin Frannies Italian beef.

31.description: Soggy fries, dry burger, improperly sliced gyros meat that was dry. Will not order again.

34.description: Great lunch spot, the classic Chicago hot dog/beef/polish/chicken/gyro stop. Pizza puff is a must, fried zucchini is great, good people. If you happen to be traveling on River Rd in Schiller Park/Rosemont and hungry, make a quick stop. It will be worth your time.

16.description: I love Our city's signature Italian Beefs and let me say FRANNIES is a legit Joint! Great portion! Great tender beef !...awesome home made gardineira ! I gotta say Johnnies and Frannie's are pretty close ! I'll be making my final decision shortly on which is better ! They should have a food war contest!!!

13.description: Pretty good combo, nice and soggy.  You'll need at least three napkins.  If you're a novice, probably six.  Beef was good, juice was good, and the sausage tucked in there was really good.  It amounts to a pretty hefty sandwich.  The giardinara was not as hot as some other places but it worked well for the sandwich.  Fries came right out of the fryer so they were nice and hot and crispy.  Topped it off with a chocolate shake which was nice and thick, and lasted all the way to the Wisconsin state line.

11.description: Just got into town from Boston. I've had Italian beef in a few different places here in Chicago. Frannie's is a local neighborhood place and their beef can definitely compete with the best. I'm not a Chicagoan but I am a professional chef and when it's good, it's good. Shout out to the owner, very friendly people.

39.description: This is your typical Chicago/Suburban Hot Dog Stand... In my opinion they do nothing great but they are still better by leaps and bounds compared to Hot Dog Stands outside of Chicago. I have yet to have something I did not like. I might even say I really like their fries and they also have Italian Ice... I like the beefs here better than Jays. The owners are always there and mostly nice but keep the pace moving during lunch. Chicago Style Baby! The place is actually bigger than most stands but has the most uncomfortable seating that is apparently standard with your first Vienna order. They have 3 or 4 picnic tables so in the warmer months you might have a place to sit outside! They also have a convenient parking lot. All in all, I will be back to this neighborhood standard...

37.description: One of the best homemade beef and Italin ice places yet. This place has a small town feel to it in an extremly busy suburban sprawl area of Cooc County. The service was good and food great. I wish I could live nearby here to eat more often but alas that is life and Dupage County wants only taquerias or something.

0.description: I just left Frannies!!! The best beef in the city!! I just got my Feb fix before the month ends!!!  The Seasoning and flavor were right on

38.description: Let me start by saying that I'm a HUGE fan of the CHICAGO HOT DOG and more specifically Gene & Jude's.  But G & J has NOTHING on Frannies!Frannies has much more of an offering than just Hot Dogs, Fries and Tamales.  The variety at Frannies is awesome!  They even make their very own Italian Lemonade!  When I asked the owner if they made it in house, he offered me a taste, well, the taste I was expecting was a spoonful, what I got was a small size Lemonade for free!  It was one of the tastiest I've had!I did have a hot dog and fries and both were very good.  My husband had an Italian Beef sandwich that was packed full, he enjoyed his lunch very much.Since Frannies is close to where I work I now frequent the establishment!  I am a fan!  Thanks Frannies for being more than just another hot dog stand!Hat's off to Frannies!

51.description: Have a hankering for "char" grilled ? Frannie's has got its own parking lot and on your walk up you're greeted with a bunch of signage indicating the many grilled favorites you can order. The building is a house which has been shifted into a restaurant. Inside there are all kinds of knick knack type dated décor, a glitter ball and a working stop light. I wish the stoplight worked in relation to making and receiving orders. There are four booths that can seat up to six each, depending on the size of your party. The smells are of a mixture of meatballs and cheese. It's your typical char house with burgers, hot dogs, fries, meatball sandwiches, Italian beef & sausage, gyros, etc. A few details that make them stand out: Triple layer fries which come with cheddar cheese, sour cream and bacon bits, beef which can be purchased by the pound, their tasty milkshakes and who can forget the Italian ice. The Italian ice comes in three flavors during the warmer months, like lemon, cantaloupe, watermelon and only lemon during the winter. Burgers and dogs are pretty standard, their burgers look like frozen patties and I'm sure the dogs are boiled. Their fries are "home cut". For a quick but average meal it's okay. Frannie's offers many combos so no matter what your food spend; there is something for you.

27.description: If you're expecting Portillo's, best pass this one by.Stopped into Frannie's for lunch.  Nothing special.  Parking lot could use some paving.  Five booths seating inside, three picnic tables outside on the porch.  Order and pick up at the counter.  Had the combo italian beef and sausage with hot peppers on the side, an order of breaded mushrooms with ranch dip, and a regular sized root beer.  Sandwich was okay, not the best I've ever had, but definitely not the worst.   I asked for mozzarella on the sandwich, but the little bit that was added was practically baked into the bread...could barely see it, let alone taste it.  Mushrooms were fairly tasty, but they only gave me 9 1/2 (see pic below)...and I expected a few more than that for the price.  The total bill came to $11.78, you tell me if it looks like the portions were worth it.  I could see myself giving it another try, but it's not at the top of my 'regulars' list.

32.description: Such a great local place for Dogs & such. Was staying at the Comfort Suites down the street. Had the Classic Chicago with pickles and tomato, a Polish with onions & relish and they were so great I had to try the meatball sandwich. That was even better. If coming thru you gotta try Frannies!

54.description: After a semi-productive meeting in the 'burbs, I was in the car with two of my bosses and we were wondering what the heck we would have for lunch. It had to be a sit-down place, but not a Taco Bell or McDonald's. They brainstormed Frannie's, a joint in Schiller Park not far from the hotel row of Rosemont. They have mentioned to me how good this place was before, so I had high hopes for a good Italian beef. I was not disappointed at all - the beef was juicy and so tender, the bread was firm enough to withstand (for the most part) the ladling of beef gravy, and the sweet peppers added the necessary vegetable requirement. Our group also dug the meatball sandwich, gravy bread, fries, and lemon ice. I'd have to say the beef was a 9 on a scale from 1 to 10, very comparable to the Al's beef I have enjoyed during my formative years at UIC. As an added bonus, this is the place where I first heard the breaking news of Governor Rod Blagojevich being taken into federal custody via Frannie's house TV. Aah...the memories!

48.description: How could I have been passing Frannies on my morning commute to Rosemont for almost a year, but never stopped in for lunch or dinner? The kind but brusk owner of Frannie's would probably say "I dunno, buddy, 'tiniest violin music evah', Whatchu wanna order?"No sooner had I stepped into Frannie's did I get a greeting from the owner behind the counter. I make no bones about being from Wisconsin and ignorant about native Chicago traditions, so I asked about their Friday "Pepper and Egg Sandwich". It drew raised eyebrows from the Mrs., but Mr. Frannie's didn't bat an eye, and sold me on it. It was great- filling, tasty, slightly greasy, but hit the spot! Their home made fries were excellent too. This place gets lots of in and out traffic from regulars, and a regular who had moved away got the "Where ya' been" business, which just added to the nice atmosphere. Frannie's does Chicago Style hot dogs, Italian beef, Gyros, milk shakes and all of that Chicago jazz. They have a catering menu and also sell homemade Italian lemonade. I plan to stop in on my reverse commute someday, to pick up a Liter to go!Step away from the Pup! Just down River Road is the colorful and equally excellent, Frannie's.

44.description: Straight forward fast food at good prices. Decent hot dogs - get the special which is 2 dogs with fries for $5 - hard to beat that deal. Nothing much more to say - I stop in when driving down River Road and am looking for a quick bite to eat at a fair price.

24.description: Skip everything else here and go straight for the Italian beef!!! This beef is only very very very slightly beaten out by the likes of Johnies on North Ave, and since Frannies is closer to where I live, it def gets the nod for me. The beef is absolutely perfect and melts in the mouth. The ordering process takes a bit more time than normal, but they must be doing something extra special back there because this is Italian beef perfection. My buddy and I did an Italian beef crawl and this was one of our three spots (Johnies and Lukes on Harlem were the others). Both of us agree that Johnies and Frannies were a near tie for first. Love it here, def one of the best needs I've ever had.

7.description: i live close by so it was only a matter of time before i actually tried frannies! Great, ordering process is easy and the italian styled beef was superb! I stopped in also to have a sadwich as well.... killer !!!

49.description: I discovered Frannie's from Bob Schwartz's book, "Never Put Ketchup on a Hot Dog" and decided to give it a try. Frannie's is located on River Road--about three blocks north of Irving Park on the west side of the street. The building appears to have once been a single family house (raised ranch) and enjoys a large paved parking lot. It's a bit of a dive, which is usually a good sign if you like to eat. I ordered a beef special, which comes with fries and a large drink ($6.95). I ordered the sandwich with sweet peppers. The beef was delivered with fresh Italian bread. It came juicy, but not so much that it couldn't be picked up. It was served with a plastic fork, which I initially took advantage of. The fries are fresh cut with skins,.but a bit too salty for my taste. My lunch compadres also ordered beef sandwiches. Their taste buds desensitized long ago by spicy foods--thought Frannie's hot giardianera was too mild. I have an aversion to spicy foods and thought the beef was flavorful, but not overly spicy. One of my colleagues ordered the triple threat fries, which includes cheddar cheese, sour cream and bacon (imitation) bits. I must confess I'm not much of a beef sandwich kind of a guy. For fast food, I have an affinity for fat burgers with grilled onions. I enjoyed Frannie's beef sandwich much more than Portillo's though. One of these days I'm going to venture back to Johnny's in Elmwood Park to see if it's as good as I remember. There are several tables inside and some picnic benches outside. If I'm in the area, I'll be sure to stop in to try something else on their extensive menu. They even offer pasta, which looked and smelled delicious. On the way out, the counter man thanked us and asked us to come again. This is a very nice personal touch. I could learn to really like this place.

40.description: Stick with the italian beef and hot dogs and you'll be fine.  The burger patties are right out of the freezer (not good) and the chicken sandwhich is a processed chicken breast - again  cheap, right out of the freezer (not good).  How hard would it be to cook a real chicken breast?

53.description: Love this place.. The beef is juicy, the bread is great and able to hold the sandwich together.  Born and raised in chicago and have add a share of hot dogs, beef and polish and this place will not disappoint.  The fries are fresh cut and different from Chain restaurants. I have ordered the beef for parties and guests always ask where i got the beef and bread from.   Try it you will not be disappointed.

30.description: I finally tried their gyro.  It was delicious.  I love this place.

46.description: Great food - great experienceSpent 3 days in  Chicago last week for business.  Ate at a number of the established joints - Giordanos' etc.   Wanted a something a little off the beaten path.  This certainly fit the bill - this epitomizes big city diners.  Mostly carry-out biz, but a few folks eating in the dining room.  Service is efficient, fast, etc.  I had the beef & sausage combo with peppers - one of the best italian beef sandwiches I have had in a very long time.   Great fries, free refills on my drink.  Could not have asked for anything more!If you are from out of town, like me, and want some local flavor, give this place a try.  Don't let the looks of the place fool you - the buidling may be a bit shabby, but the food is anything but.

1.description: I have always been a Johnnies guy, but I do believe this joint blows them away. Excellent beef, and lots of it. Great fries, great ice. I'll be back for sure.

55.description: Great beefs, great hot dogs, great fries.  In fact all the food I've had here is really good.  Great atmosphere (neighborhood joint atmosphere, that is.)  The ONLY thing I'd change is that their giardiniera is vinegar-based, not oil-based, which is my preference.  Still, I always make it a point to stop here whenever I get to the area.

9.description: The best place for Italian beef. I use to be a Johnnie's fan on North ave. I found my new place home for beefs here at Frannies. They also have a to die for meatball sandwich that knocks it out of the park. They have great fast food and friendly service it is worth the stop.

26.description: Nothing special. The staff/owner aren't very friendly. Food is decent but the serving sizes are small.  The place could use a decent cleaning.

25.description: Are you kidding me? A whole-in-the-wall, middle of nowhere place makes juicy, tender beef sandwiches topped with sweet or spicy (not really spicy) peppers.  The fries taste like real potatoes and comes out hot and fresh. Their beef sandwich combo with fries and drink is about $8.00 with tax. We also tried their garden hot dog. It's topped with pickled peppers, pickles, onions, tomatoes and relish. The only bad thing is that their hot dog is pretty thin. It's tasty but not too filling. As for their customer service,  it's awesome.  The man who runs the place is uber friendly and professional.  Just a quaint place for quick, cheap and tasty eats.

12.description: Are you kidding me? A whole-in-the-wall, middle of nowhere place makes juicy, tender beef sandwiches topped with sweet or spicy (not really spicy) peppers.  The fries taste like real potatoes and comes out hot and fresh. Their beef sandwich combo with fries and drink is about $8.00 with tax. We also tried their garden hot dog. It's topped with pickled peppers, pickles, onions, tomatoes and relish. The only bad thing is that their hot dog is pretty thin. It's tasty but not too filling. As for their customer service,  it's awesome.  The man who runs the place is uber friendly and professional.  Just a quaint place for quick, cheap and tasty eats.

21.description: With such great accolades and legend this was a big letdown. I truly expected some old school banter and "beefy" personality. Went there on reputation and recommendation thinking I could take my 10 y/o daughter to a bit of a salty atmosphere so she could see some ol time personality. And don't get me wrong, sitting with me watching a Lions game she's heard some of the saltiest adjectives ever known to man but...going to a legendary beef stand for a dog and a wet one and my daughter having to listen to what I think was the owner, and his old friend from, in between "f" words and suck this and banged that, I gathered was from LA/California, talk about things better left said at a bar in Goodfellas...Just not worth it. We weren't the only table with a young one (two others) at 1:30 on a Saturday afternoon, listening to this spew. Loved some of the story but the only way I'd go back is if it quickly turned into a belly up that you knew better bringing your children in. HUGE disappointment! So needless to say, the beef was fatty and nasty, Au Jous way too salty and cold, fries tasted no better than turd and the root beer was flat! F-------

17.description: Pot hole on the road to a lunch spot near to work.This is not a place I will return.Hot dogs were super skinny and blah.Fries were terrible, just awful. I've moved on with my lunch search.

10.description: We walked to this great spot and had the Italian beef Sandwhich and fries and there was nothing bad about it! The crew made a suggestion on what to put on it and we went with it.  It was so tasty with great flavors and the french fries were so fresh! We are stuck in Chicago for a few days and I'm excited to try something different at Frannies!

5.description: I was going to pick up some subs from Al's deli when I came across this place that I had forgotten about long ago. They make a darn good Italian beef sandwich here and a combo too.The homemade giardiniera alone is worth stopping in for. Reminds me of Mr. Beef in the city. It's nothing like the stuff you get in the jars at the grocery stores.They try to make the hot dogs like Gene & Jude's with the no tomato thing but if you want a G&J dog go to G&J because Frannie's doesn't come close. When you go to a beef place you get a beef right?This tiny little joint with outdoor seating on their deck and plenty of parking is going on my best beef list.

3.description: I feel it is one of the best beef places in the entire Chicago area.  The fresh cut fries and the gardienera are perfect.

35.description: Let me start off by saying this. WhenI finally received my food it was pretty good. My issue is with the delivery. My food was an hour and 45 minutes late. I received call from the driver around the projected delivery time. He said that he was outside my building. I told him that I don't see him. He said that he was right outside in the front. So I went outside ad looked up and down the block and told him that I was standing in front of my house and that me may be on the wrong block. I also told him that I don't live in a large building, I live in an actual house. He said he would call back and hung up. He never called back. Hour and 45 min later the owner called me to apologize. He said that his driver got pulled over by the police. I can only assume that the driver was actually arrested. Sorry but I won't be ordering again.

19.description: If you're expecting Portillo's, best pass this one by.Stopped into Frannie's for lunch.  Nothing special.  Parking lot could use some paving.  Five booths seating inside, three picnic tables outside on the porch.  Order and pick up at the counter.  Had the combo italian beef and sausage with hot peppers on the side, an order of breaded mushrooms with ranch dip, and a regular sized root beer.  Sandwich was okay, not the best I've ever had, but definitely not the worst.   I asked for mozzarella on the sandwich, but the little bit that was added was practically baked into the bread...could barely see it, let alone taste it.  Mushrooms were fairly tasty, but they only gave me 9 1/2 (see pic below)...and I expected a few more than that for the price.  The total bill came to $11.78, you tell me if it looks like the portions were worth it.  I could see myself giving it another try, but it's not at the top of my 'regulars' list.

28.description: Pot hole on the road to a lunch spot near to work.This is not a place I will return.Hot dogs were super skinny and blah.Fries were terrible, just awful. I've moved on with my lunch search.

45.description: Used to love it.  Then I got food poisoning.  The guy behind the counter, presumably the owner, was never all that friendly.  In fact, I dreaded having to have face to face contact with him.  I have never been to a place that puts more ice in their soda.  What up with that?  The hot dogs are delicious, the the guy behind the counter (owner) sucks, you'll likely get more ice than soda, and you may or may not get food poisoning.Good luck.

33.description: Best beef in town. They have great portions and great prices. The staff is very friendly.

43.description: I do a fair amount of traveling for work and stayed at a hotel down the road from this place. Searched yelp for lunch and found this place; turned out to be an unreal decision.The Price is probably more than average (10$ for a simple lunch) but it WILL fill you up. A ton of meat piled high and it's all delicious.The owner was awesome and gave the two others I was with and myself some free Italian ice stuff they sell there. Also delicious. Definitely recommend if you want a tasty (non vegetarian) lunch for around 10$. Tell him you saw his place on yelp and he'll be super happy too haha

2.description: I took us out of our way trying to find a shop and happened upon this little place. AMAZING! Italian beef was fantastic. Huge portions. Great prices. Good old home town cooking. Staff was friendly and food was ready quickly. I can't wait to return.

18.description: Ok. Beauty is in the eye of the beholder, but the delivery that just arrived - rather smooshed, but flavor fully intact - was quite gorgeous. The lemon italian ice is pretty close to perfection, tart and smooth with a few small pieces of lemon peel stuck in there so we know they're fulfilling their promise that it's home made. Small but satisfying Chicago style hot dog, nestled in fries.Italian beef! generously sized. ordered little sides of giardinera and sweet peppers and  stuffed these into the pile of shredded beef - mwah! so good.Finally, had initially put in a gyro order, but something was going on with their gyro machine (?), so after a phone consultation with a super friendly guy, got a polish instead, with peppers and grilled onions. spicy, juicy, even a little sweet. it is really really good - the winner of the night.If you like your fries crispy, this is not the place for you. Every single thing was incredibly delicious, and clearly made with loving hands! Perfect silver lining to my blizzard induced layover.

41.description: I have been eating at this place since I was a child. I am now 30yrs old. The owners have always been very nice and recognize me everytime I come in. I would take their double cheeseburger over most bars half pound burger anyday. I brought my gf there for a burger and she said it was the best burger she has had from a restaraunt. Beefs are good here as well. The fries can be hit or miss on occasion but for the most part they are done just right. Summer time comes their cantaloupe and lemon ice are awesome. I tried the pineapple, wasnt bad but not as good as the lemon or cantaloupe.

52.description: yum...canteloupe italian ice...ill take it :)classic chicago fare is abundant and tasty (ital beef...chicago dogs...etc) ...my sister comes here just to get their milkshakes (unfortunately the last time i went their machine was out of commission)chili fries are doable but could use a bit of a kick in the pantsits hot and crowded inside but service is quick...not always friendlydefinitely worth a stop

50.description: OMG. When I first moved to Chicago, I lived right around the corner. Yes my first apartment backed up to a gas station....I digress. This place has phenomenal food. You won't find "atmosphere" here but you don't need it. The vibe is always pretty busy and "rushed" but the staff is nice, and GRACIOUS for your business. The fries are incredible and you must try the Italian Steak Sandwich; OMG!!! It has yummy steak with this bruschetta-like topping. TO-DIE-FOR. **Bring napkins!!!  The hot dogs are yummy and really so is everything. Whenever I am in this area, I hit this place and so should you. And the LEMONADE is amazing!!!

4.description: Delicious Italian beef and close enough to the airport without losing that diner feel. Can't wait to go back!

6.description: Okay first time ordering from here and EEK! I read the reviews and seemed like a great place to get a sandwich. So I ordered online which was quick and easy. Food was delivered way before the time they estimated which was great but the food wasn't so much. I ordered the gyro and I wished I would of taken a pic! The pita was burnt and the meat was dry and crispy!! The burnt pita ruined the taste of the whole sandwich. And I had ordered an extra pita and that was burnt too! It wasn't burnt as much as the other one so I threw the other pita away and put my meat on the other. Which I had to pay extra for. My co-worker ordered the Philly steak sandwich and it was soooo salty it wasn't very good! The fries and onion rings were good but how can you mess that up!!? So I spent close to $30 for crappy a** food! I will not be returning!!!!

22.description: First time here, didn't know what to order so I went with the Gyro BIG MISTAKE. As we were sitting waiting for our food, they didn't touch the gyro pit at all. The chick behind the counter pulled a basket of gyro meat out the microwave and looked at us to see if we saw her... Oh I did. I was starting to worry about my choice. Once we got the gyro it looked grey and nasty. I asked the guy why did they microwave the gyro meat? He says we have a holding station where we put the meat... I said we it looks gross he says no it's doesn't, did you try it yet? Very rudely he said. He said well forget it ill make you a new one off the pit... Well no shit That's how it should have been made in the first place. $16 and some change for grey microwaved gyro... NEVER going back. They use that microwave for everything. Yuck

15.description: I've only had their Pepper and Egg sandwich and holy smokes that thing was AMAZING!It was overflowing with pillowy soft eggs, spicy giardiniera, and gooey mozzarella cheese. One sandwich filled two of us to the brim.I'm docking two stars only because of the lack of consistency with the place.  I called once to pick up an order of the Pepper and Egg sandwich, only to hear the person that made this particular sandwich wasn't in--which I understand, and was fine.  Two other times I got this sandwich, they didn't taste at all like the other experiences I've had eating the same exact thing.  Once they had used another type of giardinera, another time they had skimped on the egg--the lack of consistency has made me wary of making the trek down River Rd since there are so many other places nearby who do a better job at remaining consistent with the quality of the food they serve. If this is a sandwich Frannies serves once a week, and there is one particular person that is designated to making this sandwich, then how come there is so much inconsistency?

57.description: As a Chicagoan, I can appreciate a great hot dog.  This place looks like a tiny little house, but inside, it contains lots of goodness.  Personally, if I order a hot dog, it has to be a char dog.  You bite into it and it just snaps.  That is how you know you have just bit into a great dog.The price is right and the food is great.

20.description: Ok. Beauty is in the eye of the beholder, but the delivery that just arrived - rather smooshed, but flavor fully intact - was quite gorgeous. The lemon italian ice is pretty close to perfection, tart and smooth with a few small pieces of lemon peel stuck in there so we know they're fulfilling their promise that it's home made. Small but satisfying Chicago style hot dog, nestled in fries.Italian beef! generously sized. ordered little sides of giardinera and sweet peppers and  stuffed these into the pile of shredded beef - mwah! so good.Finally, had initially put in a gyro order, but something was going on with their gyro machine (?), so after a phone consultation with a super friendly guy, got a polish instead, with peppers and grilled onions. spicy, juicy, even a little sweet. it is really really good - the winner of the night.If you like your fries crispy, this is not the place for you. Every single thing was incredibly delicious, and clearly made with loving hands! Perfect silver lining to my blizzard induced layover.

36.description: Nice guys, donate to the church. Great food and just the cutest place, good prices too.

14.description: Skip everything else here and go straight for the Italian beef!!! This beef is only very very very slightly beaten out by the likes of Johnies on North Ave, and since Frannies is closer to where I live, it def gets the nod for me. The beef is absolutely perfect and melts in the mouth. The ordering process takes a bit more time than normal, but they must be doing something extra special back there because this is Italian beef perfection. My buddy and I did an Italian beef crawl and this was one of our three spots (Johnies and Lukes on Harlem were the others). Both of us agree that Johnies and Frannies were a near tie for first. Love it here, def one of the best needs I've ever had.

58.description: This is the best thin crust pizza in the O'Hare area. Its just greasy and fatty enough to satisfy the most dignified tastes. Its one of those mom and pop operations that has avoided sale and resale so that the original flavor remains with a good old school eye-talian kick. The delivery is quick, the staff is great, and the food never fails to satisfy. Just don't get on a scale after eating here for at least 72 hours and 2 rounds on the treadmill.

56.description: Second best thin crust in the area (the best being Biji's on Irving).  Very flavorful, fresh ingredients, good crust.

29.description: Truly excellent pizza. I like Gigio's thin crust the best, but this place is pretty amazing. A little bit more cheese than I like (to give it 4 stars in lieu of 5), but still excellent place for food. Sauce is great, lots of ingredients. And, unlike Gigio's, you don't have to worry about being mugged or shot in this area.

42.description: I was in town recently and wanted none other than Villa Napoli pizza.  It was fantastic, except we ordered Mushrooms on our pizza and when it came the mushrooms were from a can.  I have never in my life ordered pizza and got mushrooms from a can.  You are a great pizza place, please start using fresh mushrooms it makes a world of difference!

23.description: Placed my order for delivery online (here on yelp) and that was really convenient.14" pizza ....thin crust, half pepperoni/half sausage:  4-stars  ...tasted good, just not a big fan of the 'party cut'Also got an order of chicken fingers..... 5-stars  ....def recommend!!Only took 35 min for delivery on an estimate of 45.... 5-stars

47.description: Wanted to try a new place in the hood and based on some Yelp reviews Villa Napoli it is. Ordered some chicken fingers, calamari, and a pepperoni pizza. The chicken fingers were tasty, but puny and the portion was small in my opinion for a $6 appetizer. Asked for marinara with my calamari and got pre-packaged cocktail sauce- boo!. The calamari was oily and rubbery, just disappointing. I will admit that they redeemed themselves with the thin crust pizza. Nice and crisp crust hearty enough to handle all the toppings, sauce, and cheese. The sauce was tangy, and the crust and cheese made this a solid pie. Overall I will order again, but i'll stick to the pizza from now on.

8.description: JUST LOST A CUSTOMER!!!! I love the food at this restaurant....been eating here for years but unfortunately they just lost a customer over something  very stupid. They have repeatedly messed up our order several times and when the lady that takes your order hear's your complaint she puts the manager on and he says the same thing all the time. Sir, i was standing right next to her when you placed your order....1st of all how can you hear me placing the order if I'm on the line with one person and second how can you sit and tell a customer that has spent not hundreds, but thousands of dollars on food at your restaurant. Very stupid if you ask me. I hope it was worth losing business over a stuffed pizza that i ordered and not the pan pizza i received. What "class"

31.description: Fantastic EVERYTHING! I'd give the fifth star if they'd just use FRESH MUSHROOMS. The flavorless canned mushrooms need to go. Other than that, I've really enjoyed everything I have ordered.

34.description: We live in the area and have been using the same few pizza places in rotation for years and years.  We wanted to start branching out and trying different places.  We read the reviews for villa and decided to try.  My husband will only pick up a pizza, never have it delivered.  He hates waiting and hates having it cold.  He went in to pick up our mushroom pizza and witnessed the " yelling at the customers" ordeals that were mentioned in prior reviews.  He was not getting yelled at, but someone else was.  Hhmmmm....He returned home with our pizza pie.  We always order pizza well done, brown crispy spots of cheese....yum.  They did not disappoint.  The pizza also had a nice sauce that went all the way to the end of the crust.  I liked that a lot.  No bare crust.  However, canned mushrooms?  Really?  They were not fresh.  Boo!  Get some fresh mushrooms.  An entire 8oz container  is $1.50 at Mariano's.

16.description: Best best pizza in town.  Went with my girl and had the thin pizza.  The cheese was so fresh and tasty.  It's not to expensive just right. Vote service was good and quick.  Place gets really busy at night do go early.

13.description: I ordered the Veal parmigiana sandwich today, it was delivered very quickly.  I have to say it's one of the best I've ever had. I added a smidgeon of sauteed garlic, onion powder, Mrs Dash, made it even better!  It's very good, I loved the sauce and the cheese!  I also ordered the baked clams, I found them to be salty and too chewy. I ordered that based on a Yelp review, so maybe it's just me. I also love their tossed salad, it's head lettuce, tomato and red onion. It's very fresh, crisp and the lettuce is not wet, I hate wet salads! The price is very reasonable too! I highly recommend their garlic dressing!

11.description: Placed my order for delivery online (here on yelp) and that was really convenient.14" pizza ....thin crust, half pepperoni/half sausage:  4-stars  ...tasted good, just not a big fan of the 'party cut'Also got an order of chicken fingers..... 5-stars  ....def recommend!!Only took 35 min for delivery on an estimate of 45.... 5-stars

39.description: Mom and pop pizza place. Thin CRISPY crust just the way I like it.  I'm not a pizza person, but love Lou Malnalti's and love thin crust pizza if it's done right.  Villa Napoli does thin crust excellently.  One large pizza of fresh garlic, tomatoes, mushrooms and sausage is enough to feed an army. They don't skimp on their ingredients and you have extra fod lunch for at least 2 days.  Unless you are feeding 6-8, opt for a medium. The crust was buttery, nicely crisped to perfection.  The sauce wasn't too bitter or acidic. This is going on our irregular rotation of pizza, when the timing is right.  I wouldn't be surprised if this is GO TO spot in our neighborhood for Superbowl Sunday

37.description: Great pizza! Don't get to complicated with the girls answering the phones. Delivery drivers are fast and courteous. Overall best thin pizza in the area.

0.description: Great pizza. A little thick for thin crust but still  great. I feel like the food is cooked with a little bit of old school love

38.description: Good stuff! I like their thin crust with. Will order again.

51.description: Tried this place since it was close to my building. There aren't very many places around the neighborhood, so picked this place based on reviews from yelp. The crust was very chewy and almost tasted stale (how this could be who knows). The sauce was bland and they were stingy with the toppings. Have not gone back and will not plan on going back.

27.description: I absolutely LOVE this place. I've come here for over 13 years! The chicken Parmesan is always my number one. Vodka pasta I just recently tried and wow is it good. Everything is homemade. Great fresh taste. Pizzas are very good too! If I were to ever have a last meal it would be from here no doubt! The restaurant isn't very fancy at all because they mainly do take out and delivery. But you can still eat there. Trust me, try the food you won't regret it!

32.description: Damn good pizza. Best in the area if you ask me. Also have had their chicken vesuvio witch was also very very good.

54.description: This is my go to pizza place. Yes, I have their number on speed dial on my phone....don't judge me :)Tried just about everything here, and I don't have anything bad to say about it. I'm just glad I have a guaranteed good pizza joint like this so close to me. Here's a little tip: Tired of just getting the regular thin crust? Opt for the Pizza Margarita....oh boy, this one's killer!

48.description: might be my favorite pizza place i've tried so far.
