44.description: Hmmm...what to say about Villa Napoli....I think my situation may be unique, but it was a disappointing experience none-the-less.We came here for the specific purpose that I had restaurant.com coupon I bought and wanted to use.  Of course, I forgot to print it out.  So we pulled it up on my hub's phone and asked if they would just accept the code (SINCE, they just call a number and put in that code to get the $$).  They said "SURE!", so we grabbed a table and ordered jalapeno poppers, pops and a pizza.  Poppers came out, and were ok, but not spicy at all (womp wooomp).  THEN, the waitress comes back, to let us know they will NOT be accepting my restaurant.com coupon.  Ummm....what??  Ok, well then can we cancel our pizza?  NOPE.  Ok, well now I'm pissed and forced to sit there and wait for a pizza we no longer want.  Pizza comes out, and it may have been ok, but the stench of deceit that lingered was just too much.  Just remember there are no accommodations at this place, so make sure you got everything you need before you walk in the door.

24.description: I have eaten here a few times  and it is always very good  and consistent  ,  Pizza, shrimp,  pastas  have always been  very good  and delicious

7.description: We ordered delivery to our hotel. Came in less than 45 min. I would say average pizza. Your not going to toss it in the trash and you probably had a better slice at the food court mall.  If you want pizza order . If you have ANY expectation - move along.  Btw. A teller was correct about the mushrooms - cheap rubbery canned ( what cheap asses) I EVEN ASKED THE GIRL ON THE PHONE "" do you have "" fresh "" mushroom ..  Yes we do. Not canned??  """ NO "" !    Lastly-  capris salad...  Not a hint of basil . Just 4 little tomato slice with mozzarella cheese. YAY

49.description: I have lived in this neighborhood for many years & will never go to Villa Napoli again. The owner, Pete, should learn customer service. There are to many pizza joints in this neighborhood for him to be so arrogant & rude, & as I am finding out, some of the other places are excellent. I don't miss this place at all !!!!!

40.description: I've done takeout and delivery several times from here. The regular pizza is fantastic. I've had their combination, veggie, pepperoni and created my own meat lovers type pizza. The crust isn't too thin or too thick. It had lots of toppings and cheese. Tasted great reheated the next day.

53.description: I can still remember the coupons piled up in our kitchen drawer, and counting them every time I placed an order to see if I was close to the 20 necessary for the free pizza.  If I was short, I would call my friend down the street to see if I could "borrow" a few of his.  God I loved this place!  So many good memories of family and friends revolved around ordering from there.  Hell, even pizza days at my old grade school used to have the pizza supplied by Villa Napoli.  Thin crust, pan, stuffed, it's all excellent pizza.  Their sauce is so friggin' addicting as well.  Sometimes I would switch things up a bit and get their baked mostaccioli, which was super tasty too.  When I go back to my old 'hood and want a pizza I almost always order from here.  The same owners are there and although my hair has gotten thinner, I'm still recognized and am always asked about my family.  The only reason I dock it one star is that for some reason I cannot eat this pizza reheated, or cold.  There is something about having it fresh out the oven that makes eating it any other way seem like a letdown.

30.description: Great pizza!  It's been a favorite of mine for years. Nothing beats their thin crust with double cheese, sausage and garlic.

46.description: Disgusting. Sausage on pizza has inedible "chewy" parts. Ugh. Ate four pieces then hit that disgusting sausage with cartilage on two different pieces in it and Im done. I'm throwing it away.

1.description: One star because I told the rude girl on the phone to have the driver call me when he was there. After she confirmed my order I repeated that I need the driver to call and she gave me attitude and told me that she already wrote it down. Sure enough, no such instructions were given to the driver and he woke up the house by knocking on the door.A medium 2 topping pizza was $20 and it definitely was not worth it. Bitter sauce and cardboard crust.

55.description: Very good pizza.  I had the vegetarian special and a couple glasses of Chianti.  The server was very polite and attentive.  The crust was very crispy.  The veggies were piping hot and tasted great.  The eat-in area is pretty bare bones, but that's fine.  Neon beer signs in the window.  The delivery guys hang out and watch the tiny TV between deliveries.

9.description: Had to stop in the old neighborhood & the amazing smells from Villa Napoli's made me do a U-turn. So yummy! You know when you bite into a pizza & you can taste the sauce?  The cheese has this amazing pull. The sausage has just the right amount of bite to it. Oh my gosh! It made my taste buds sing!!! Restaurant is super cute, family friendly & clean.  All employees were very nice & accommodating.  See you soon.

26.description: Live in the area and just love this place! Wish I would have known how great this place was before I used to order Annetti's! Pan pizza is amazing as well as their meatball sandwiches! Food is delivered super fast and everything is always fresh!

25.description: Great pizza! The Villa Napoli Special pan pizza is the best. I've also had the thin crust and it is awesome. The staff is always friendly. I'm looking forward to trying the other food aside from pizza.

12.description: I have to say when I went to pick up a pizza it was the most horrible thing to see an owner treat his staff  I live in around the neighborhood they make great pizza I will never go there again because he doesn't know how to talk to people

59.description: I have been coming here for years and it has always amazed me how this little storefront in a strip mall could survive with little or no parking. Good solid food. The Italian beef sandwich is house made and has a little different taste than any other you might get at the gazillion spots around the city that serve this Chicago classic. There is a spice combo that I cannot quite put my finger on, but it is unique and very tasty.  My carboholic enabler Monica, you know you are, twisted my arm into ordering their special pizza consisting of fresh sliced tomato, mortadella, and four cheese. This topping combo is out of this world. My only issue is that their thin crust is a bit thick for my taste, but just the same, try this pizza if you are in the neighborhood. Solid 3.5.

21.description: i can't belive this restaurant i placed annordered a pizza like more than once a week,   look me up. they took my order wrong horrible customer service. the phone girls were confrontational.   called me out on ordering wrong.  when i spoke to. a manager he was rude to me.  i'll never order again. i've never had  anyone treat me do disrespectful.ALSO I FEEL REAL UNCOMFORTABLE ORDERING

17.description: It's one of my favorite places to eat pizza and other Italian food.  It's more of a carryout place rather than sitting down in their small and open dining area.   It's worth you time to get it a try.   If anyone knows of another pizza place in the area, please let me know.  I would be willing to try it out. Thanks!

10.description: The quality of pizza went down, just too bad I really used to like it there

5.description: very disappointed after ordering a "cold" sandwich for delivery.  It was warm and soggy when it arrived and was very difficult to eat.   The menu described a cold sandwich.  If it were described as a hot sandwich, I would not have ordered it.    I used grub hub.

3.description: Order at your own risk!  At times, they are good but lately not so much.

35.description: In Chicago for business and did not feel to go out to eat so I decided to order in. You know as they say "when in Rome do as the Romans" great pizza and great taste.

19.description: Jose is one of the best waiters in this business! Love you the ambiance, food, and drinks

28.description: Thin and delicious crust and awesome sauce! Have had their pizza man times and I've never had a bad one! One of my favorite pizzas in Chicago! Fast delivery and puck up times.. You won't be disappointed!

45.description: Delisioso... Reminds me of the pizzas of Little italy in NY...  Love them!

33.description: I LOVE THEIR PIZZA! Very friendly people. And quick delivery. Great edition too the neighborhood.

43.description: Great place. One of the best pizza places in Chicago.Will recomend to all my friends.

2.description: My review is for their pizzas only. I can't see how it's a four star place if we just base it on their pizzas. I checked this place out recently for the first time since I was in the area based on the reviews but wasn't satisfied with the pizzas I had. I tried their thin crust (villa napoli special) and jalapeno + garlic pan pizza. Both were mediocre in taste. The thin crust lacked sauce and salt. It had a couple of different type of cheeses it seemed and it was a bit well baked. It was bland. It left me desiring for something much better. The pan pizza was not what I expected. It was like a pizza made on toasted foccacia bread. That's not good, in my opinion. The cheese, sauce and toppings tasted okay but the texture left me wanting for a proper pan pizza (the ones similar to Chicago style). The place is cozy, menu looked good, prices were reasonable and service was fine.

18.description: Who does not like pizza :p try out some pizza toppings that are new. Good place, decent pricing.

41.description: Good pizza & its a shame a super nice waitress counter girl doesnt work thre anymore, thats the reason I was coming! I think her name was Rachel :) What a sweetheart. Calamari is good as well.Good Luck Pete.

52.description: I grew up on their thin-crust pizza. I have their phone number memorized. When I was in college, it was usually my first meal back when I came home on breaks. It's that good. If you are ever on the far northwest corner of the city, it's the best eats you can get.

50.description: I live really close to this pizzaria and truly love their thin crust pizza. I have tried many other places but you can never truly get the taste that Villa Napoli has from anyone else.

4.description: I have been coming here since I was a kid and the fact this place has not changed since i was a teenager shows passion. It was a nice throwback experience that'll i remember for a while.

6.description: i can't belive this restaurant i placed annordered a pizza like more than once a week,   look me up. they took my order wrong horrible customer service. the phone girls were confrontational.   called me out on ordering wrong.  when i spoke to. a manager he was rude to me.  i'll never order again. i've never had  anyone treat me do disrespectful.ALSO I FEEL REAL UNCOMFORTABLE ORDERING

22.description: The best pizza in Chicago area for sure. Only problem is they seem to raise their prices frequently. I know this because I have kept many paper menus over the past couple years and they jack up the prices often. Otherwise thin crust pizza is da best!

15.description: I really like the flavor of their pizza.  However, I received a couple pizza's where the cheese was lily white or what I call, "not set" I like the cheese to have the slightest bit of brown on top.  Twice I requested this, and twice the cheese was dark brown on top, this made the crust hard, dry and burnt on the bottom.  Both times when I complained, I was told, they'll put a note in the computer and do better next time.  One time I think I was speaking to the owner. Well, there's not going to be a "next time" as most of those pizza's wound up in the garbage.  I also think they put way too much cheese on it, the first one I had made me constipated for a week!  Don't they know the danger of eating too much cheese?  They're slowing killing their customers!  Even when I asked for light cheese, there was way too much!  I live in the neighborhood, they could have had me as a life long customer, if they made any effort to please me. After all, the customer is "always right"!

57.description: Unexpectedly awesome pizza. Go for spinach, mushroom, green pepper pie! YUM!

20.description: I was totally caught off guard. This pizza is incredible and beat my expectations. We are not from the area and took a chance calling a local pizza place. Thanks for the great pizza and a super nice delivery guy!

36.description: Best pizza on the Northwest side of the City.Fast delivery. Please don't compare this place to Phil's or Dino's. Try Villa Napoli and you will never order from anywhere else again. One minor complaint is the liters of pop often come warm.

14.description: Wish I could give zero!!  My pizza just showed up as box of slop with a pool of grease!!  Called them to complain and got ahold of a child who couldn't even refund my money. I was told I'd get a call back. What a joke!!

3.description: Have ordered several times & have received flowers from here (posted tropical bouquet-from hubby on Mother's Day), and arrangements always stunning. Only negative, but realistic for quality, is pricing.

1.description: That woman is polish doesn't know how to count first of all of the flowers are dead they smell like rats ass nothing special in that FLOWER SHOP it smells terrible in there like rotten eggs

2.description: Great customer service, gorgeous sympathy spray, reasonable pricing.  Will use for all future commemorative floral needs.

5.description: I needed a bouquet of roses for my Fiance's Birthday. I had already got her a present, so I figured that I would surprise her with a dozen roses. Life with Flowers is located in a small strip mall on Cumberland Ave. It looks pretty crappy from the outside, but the inside is beautifully decorated with different flower arrangements. The florist hooked me up with a beautiful arrangement of a dozen red roses. The were packaged beautifully and looked fresh. The roses were a bit pricey, but for the work that the florist put into the arrangement, it was worth it. I would gladly use Life with Flowers for any occasion.

6.description: Bought flowers here for my father's wake & funeral. They did a wonderful job and were competitively-priced. Delivered on time, even though they were ordered on very short notice.

7.description: My corsage was from Life With Flowers last year for homecoming. They did an excellent job, and it was very reasonable. I highly recommend it.

8.description: Will not come back here again. Flowers received were very poor quality. Was quoted $75 and charged over $106 on my credit card without notice. Owner asked me not to come back because I did not agree with her over charging me, even after admitting she made a mistake on price. Way to keep customers happy. You wont be in business long with crappy service like that.  I have used this place over the years and will not be coming back. Good riddance!!!

0.description: To be fair, I have never been to this florist shop, but I am the receiver of the flowers from Andy M and I can attest that this joint does awesome work as well as have great quality flowers.  The first flowers he ever bought me came from here as a matter of fact.  They do a great job arranging and packaging the flowers and the roses this time around were freaking huge!  As in, once they open all the way they are going to be about the size of a grapefruit.  Nice!Not the most convenient location for most, but if I need a nice bouquet for someone I would definitely make the trip.

4.description: Had a friend that lived close to here that I wanted to surprise her with.  From the moment I called, I felt like I was listened to and cared about.  When I first called, there were a few people they were taking care of in the shop.  The woman who answered the phone asked if she could call me back so she could take care of those that were there.  I appreciated that rather than being put on hold and her rushing them of me.  She called back quickly, we had a really lovely conversation and I ordered a $70 bouquet.  They arrived, my friend loved them and I was very pleased.  Great caring experience! And beautiful, beautiful flowers!

3.description: Wow. Can't really complain about franchise food which is always the same, and you know what you're getting, but this place failed, and needs to be yelled at. Never have I seen such holding back when making their subs at a Subway franchise. Six sliced pickles on a foot long. SIX....pickles... on a footlong Veggie Sub. It was hard to find where the bread stopped and the actual subsistence began. Never have I had such a lack of ingredients on a sandwich as I had here the other day. Only reasoning for the lack of ingredients has to have been they were waiting on a delivery and cutting corners where they could. Just bad...and sad...

1.description: ZERO STARS but have to give something!Terrible customer service! Employees to busy shit-chatting and very unfriendly to listen to what customer wants! Never will go there ever again!!!

2.description: It's not often that I'd review a fast food chain like this.  By definition, the service and food you get at a place like this is supposed to be mediocre and consistent across locations.  So what's the point of reviewing a place when everyone already knows what to expect?Well, that is the point.  When you don't get what you expect.  And it's not always a place that delivers less than the expectation; there is the occasional place that over-delivers.  Fortunately, I've experienced that and written a review for one of those as well.  However, this Subway is not one of those.Two major "flaws" at this location.  So I go there today and order a veggie delight.  I asked for the shredded cheddar cheese... they're out.  Then I asked for the pepper jack... they're out.  Later for the dressings, I asked for Caesar... again no dice.  I mean, these seem to be basic ingredients, right?  And it's not like I was there late at night or something.  This is 12:30pm, in the middle of the heart of lunchtime.  On the other hand, it's not like this place was so crowded for lunch that they ran out.  I was the only person in line when I got there.  Is it so hard to stock the ingredients you're supposed to stock?  Especially given how stingy this place is on ingredients.Which brings me to my second problem with these guys.  So I'm getting this veggie delight, which comes with pretty much just cheese and guess what... veggies!   So this guy making my sandwich is literally counting every piece of veggie he puts on my sandwich.  It was like 5 black olives in my foot long sandwich, 4 pieces of green pepper, 4 slices of pickle.  Ridiculous...  I'm sure it wasn't just this sandwich guy, cuz this is the second or third time I've been and one thing they're consistent at is being stingy.  Point being, it's not just the sandwich guy, I'm sure the owner must have given everyone specific instructions on how to be gyps.  Do owners of such places really think they're going to boost profits by putting 3 less olives and 3 less pieces of pepper?  Definitely not at the expense of an annoyed customer.This Subway has definitely lost me as a customer, and if the above bothers you then I urge you to skip out on this location as well.  I'm sure there's a nearby location that knows how to execute on the basics.

0.description: I like this subway. It is the closest subway from my home, so I use it pretty often. Good customer service and fresh food - that's all I need. I dont understand, why other people don't like this place.

4.description: Hmm not sure why the bad reviews are in, after 10 pm and before 10 am its a 4$ footlong. Employees are very friendly, are generous on the food amount. Definitely my favorite subway in the area.

58.description: Good food. Ordered an omelette and hash browns. Came out in a timely manner. Good coffee but need to work on customer service. Check in on customers more to make sure they don't need anything.

56.description: Recently went here for breakfast while staying in Rosemont for business.  HUGE place, great diner atmosphere, plenty of parking and prices were great.  big menu with options for every one.  Vegetarian, carnivores and everything in between.  Homemade juices and such.  I had a create-your-own-omelette with egg white, turkey sausage, jalapenos, onions and avocado and it may have been the best omelette I have ever had, no joke.  I can only imagine how good the pancakes must be based on the quality of everything else.  Oh yeah, and the coffee was incredible!  Best diner coffee I've ever had.  Can't wait to come into town again to go back.

29.description: Elly's Pankcake house has the best omelette I've ever had. The eggs are so fluffy and do not ooze when you cut into it but they still remain ever so tasty. I would also recommend the skillet. The juices are all fresh and the coffee is smooth and strong, perfect for those who need to wake up. The restaurant is very clean and I had a very pleasant experience overall. Will definitely come back if I'm ever in the area and I would highly recommend you check it out.

42.description: As outstanding a breakfast as I've ever had at a restaurant. Grandma would approve. Not only did my steak skillet taste great but, along with the pancakes, it was more than I could eat. My server was very attentive and did an outstanding job. And the meal was very reasonably priced. Myself and my two friends could not have left any happier. Thank you very much, Elly's. I hope we'll meet again one day.

23.description: Good was average, my eggs were bland, sausage was tasty, French toast was OK. German pancake was average as well. Service was slow, didn't even get served syrup with my French toast. Service could be better. Customers need to be checked on more often than once.

47.description: What a hidden gem! I've never been here before but will definitely be back. Ambiance is super basic, but the quality of the food is outstanding. I went here for brunch and enjoyed black cherry crepes: so good! My friends had omelettes, waffles, and chicken, and everything looked and tasted great. Total cost for five adults and three kids was under $80, including tip. You really can't beat that.

8.description: Very good food. First time here  and I got there amazing corned beef hash. Crispy outside, meaty and smokey. Much yum. Super fast too, barely had time to get the crew in my coffee before the food was on the table. Will be back.

31.description: Fantastic! Don't go when it's very busy because you will find yourself waiting but I didn't mind as the food was fantastic! The omelet and Nutella crepes... Yum!!

34.description: I went there based on the overall reviews on Yelp. Have to give this a 3 star since my hubby liked his omelette and hash browns. Whereas I was very disappointed in my cold, rubbery blueberry crepes and process potato pancakes. Suppose that I have been spoiled by the fresh ingredients, made to order meals offered by The Family Palace. But wanting to try a different place, I gave Ellys a chance. Service was fair and restaurant open and bright. Not bad and not great. I won't go back

16.description: Food was descent nothing to go crazy for. I had alot better. Service was good thou. Coffee was that great either, i had alot better diner coffee. To be honest I wouldn't recommend it here unless it was between McDonalds or here

13.description: Sometimes it pays to wait, as one gets experiences one hadn't bargained for. In this case the waiting was for the half of our party that ran late (though the restaurant kindly seated us before they arrived). One of the Daves got the excellent idea to order a couple of Dutch Baby pancakes as appetizers to share, and I got to try one for the first time in memory - and loved them all the more when I was shown how to eat it with an ample squeeze of lemon!And then I was nearly too full to want to order anything else once the other folks arrived, but where would be the fun in that? and so I decided to see how Chicago does with my beloved potato pancakes. Verdict: Not bad. They clearly understand what a latke is supposed to be (read: not a hash brown) and served it with the right kind of accompaniments (read: sour cream and apple sauce). I still like the ones I make better, but then again at least this time I got to enjoy them without breaking an oven range in the process, so all in all it was a win.

11.description: If you're a breakfast food snob like I am I wouldn't recommend coming here.  I came for a late lunch with coworkers and Elly's was practically empty and yet we had to wait to be seated because there was no hostess anywhere in sight. The food and service overall was mediocre to poor at best.  I ordered the Ole omelette which had chorizo, jalapenos, cheddar cheese, salsa and sour cream.  When I dug into the skillet, it was extremely watery!  Blech! The eggs weren't cooked, the chorizo was super greasy and I know it typically is, jalapenos were concentrated in the middle of the omelette, and overall the dish was super heavy.  Our waitress barely checked on us and we had to wait before we got our check.  Maybe I had a bad experience but based on my first visit here I wouldn't recommend it.

39.description: Kelly was our waitress today at Elly's in Norridga, Il. And she was spectacular!!!!  She came to our table frequently asking if we needed anything! It was our daughter's birthday party and she made it so special by taking pictures of our family and bringing a special dish of ice cream and singing happy birthday to our daughter Nicole!!!  If anyone at that restaurant thinks  Kelly is not fast enough....they are wrong!!  Not only was she fast but she was efficient, friendly, caring, and when she got busy she notified our table that she would be back just as soon as she could be and she was!!!  She was the reason we will come back to Elly's!!!!  I would like her to receive some recognition for her excellent service and I will be calling the restaurant on Monday to make sure they are aware!!!  By the way the food was good as well and she kept the coffee coming! A+ for Kelly!!!!

37.description: Ok breakfast. Our waitress was overloaded with tables but she did the best she could. Food was tasty

0.description: Not only did my husband and I enjoy a delicious breakfast today at Elly's, but our waitress Kelly was fantastic!  I'm a pretty needy customer when it comes to my food and service and she took excellent care of us.  She was very positive,  upbeat, and waited on us with a smile. I really appreciate that when I go out to eat.I've been to Blossom Cafe down the street from Elly's twice before and left the restaurant each time before ordering because the hostess and wait staff were rude.  I will never go back to the Blossom Cafe, but I'll definitely be back to Elly's!  Kelly is awesome!

38.description: Last 3-4 visits have been pretty bad. Egg shells in omelettes, wrong order, extremely long wait on food to come out etc. I really liked this place the first couple of times we went, but things have definitely gone downhill for some reason.

51.description: My husband and I have been going to Ellys for a while, and we've noticed wait times for food have been getting longer. The food is good but last weekend was our last visit to the place... We were seated immediately (good) but at a booth with a ripped seat (bad) and were promptly given water by the water guy, and a lady came by and filled our coffee. Given my water glass was scratched up so much I had to do a double take to make sure it wasn't a dirty glass (its okay to retire glasses like this, please do!). There also was no cream or sugar on the table so despite having coffee we couldn't drink it. In the end we sat there for 20 mins, with our menus closed giving sad eyes to the kitchen area, and never even met our waitress. I suppose we should have stopped someone walking by but everytime they did we told ourselves, "They'll stop here next." They did not. It was awful. We finally just got up and left. No one said anything. We went to Blossom Cafe down the street and it will from now on be our place of choice. (We laughed as the second we sat down there our waitress came and took our drink order. That is how its done!)

27.description: The create your own skillet is a really nice option here. The pumpkin pancakes are delicious also. I would order them without the sauce & whipped cream thought. Reasonably priced for the quality they give. I'll return soon!

32.description: Big problems here. Dined there with my family for a late breakfast on Halloween. Food was simply ok at most. Steak skillet horrible, probably low quality meat. Pancakes were very dry, needed a lot of syrup to make edible. Omelets were good. Potato pancakes  were actually pretty good, but were not homemade, as you can see from previous pictures they are premade and deep fried.Here's the problem. We sat facing the kitchen. We can see the food "staging" area, where they have one person pulling the ready food dishes off of the counter to pass to the server. I watched this guy grab every single plate with his thumb on the bottom and his four fingers on the top of the plates and in the food. The reason for this backwards handling of food is this guy was short and the counter was pretty high. He had to stretch and pull the plates towards him. At the same time this person was wearing a Halloween mask, he kept taking off his mask to scratch his sweaty hair. I asked to speak to the manager thinking she would accept feedback and teach her staff how to properly handle a plate. I was wrong. I could tell she was upset with the feedback. She Makes up some gibberish about health dept. code stating if the person doesn't handle money he is to wash his hands every 30 minutes????? Are you kidding me? So we have 30 minutes worth of sweaty fingers on our plates??? I informed her she was wrong and ended the conversation. She walked away upset. Oh, and she made it a point not to thank us for our business. I think the owner should defiantly spend some time there. Very easy for a ditsy airhead to ruin business.

54.description: Very nice find! Portions are super large and delicious. Could easily share a meal...especially the skillets. Pancakes are a little on the sweet side, but some may like that. Overall, very good and we will return when we come back to  Chicago!

48.description: I love coming here when I'm in town.  Sometimes they get a little bogged down and service suffers. I noticed the last few times I've been in it's been a long time from the time I'm seated until they say hi or acknowledge me.

44.description: Great breakfast and friendly service. Can't ask for much more. Needed to do some work and they provided a table by the window and let me do what I needed to do. Very nice place!!

24.description: First timer here for breakfast and it was amazing! The service was very friendly and efficient, the food came out in less than 10 minutes! The atmosphere and friends and family oriented, very homey. The food was exceptional. The omelettes are made with fresh ingredients. If you're into spicy, get the Óle skillet, you won't be disappointed! Get the Dutch apple Pancakes to share, they're mouth watering good.

7.description: My wife and I frequently patronize this restaurant. The service is always good, but today, our server Kelly, was awesome! I never saw the bottom of my coffee cup, and she topped it off while holding a platter full of food  too! She took out time to answer questions honestly and was courteous to the end. Kudos !

49.description: Went in for breakfast and honestly had a hard time choosing what to get. Ended up with a monte cristo, fries and cup of clam chowder. The monte cristo was very good, though they had their grill a little too hot and it had that slightly burnt flavor you can get. The meat and cheese on it were amazing though. The fries were also very good but the portions were too big to finish by a long shot. Also, my "cup" of soup was a huge bowl of soup and I'm not complaining, it was excellent. Our server was also very friendly and on top of everything. It was hard avoiding this place to try new ones because the experience was so good.

40.description: Great food and amazing service! Pumpkin pancakes were perfect! Kelly our server was the best! Thank you Kelly!

53.description: Ordered over the phone for pick up and asked for strawberry Nutella french toast. When I got home I did not see any Nutella so I gave them a call and asked if they may have forgotten and she said no there is "hershey chocolate " on it. They put chocolate syrup on it. For all Nutella lovers this is defiantly not the same. Just go to blossom cafe a block away they actually get their orders done correctly.

30.description: I was pleasantly surprised by this place. I am in Chicago for a day and needed a place to pick up a quick breakfast before an interview. I came around 8 am and was immediately seated in their huge dining room.The service was quick and appropriate. It maybe took 5 mins for me to get my meal after I ordered. That's what I call service!I ordered the #1 pancake special which includes fresh squeezed orange juice as a side. It definitely was fresh squeezed, and fantastic. The special included the juice, two pancakes, two eggs, 2 strips of bacon and a sausage link. Not bad for $8.50 and Chicago prices. The scrambled eggs were not overdone, bacon was crispy, and pancakes were fluffy and tasty. It's a simple breakfast, but you'd be surprised how easy it is screw up. They did not.Overall: just a solid breakfast spot. If I'm ever back in the area, I will stop back again.

46.description: My boyfriend and I just got off our flight at O'hare and needed a bite to eat close by because we were driving 2 hours to Milwaukee right away. We found this spot that got a lot of reviews and decided to give it a shot. Their corned beef has is certainly above average, but everything else about their breakfast food is standard. But make sure that you get the german pancakes (NOTE: it takes 30 minutes to cook, so make sure you're either not that hungry or willing to wait - they note this on the menu as well). We've never heard of or had a german pancake before, and when it came out, we were shocked at how huge it was. We've been looking for another place around our neck of the woods in Boston to get a german pancake but have yet to be successful. If you're in and around the airport and just want some decent breakfast food, this is your spot.

1.description: Took forever to get the food. Had to wait almost 40 minutea for a patty melt.Place is unappealing and boringNothing special, I felt like eating inside of a car garage.Not coming back!

55.description: If you're looking for a great, affordable breakfast restaurant near O'Hare Airport, Elly's is the place to be. Everything was delicious. Service was fast and friendly. We were in the area on vacation. We ended up going to Elly's two days in a row. I suggest the Crepes!

9.description: I loved this place! Years ago I had a mean BF that brought me here and refused to wait the lousy 30 minutes to eat on a Sunday morning. I am smarter now though. This year I was with a man that waited. This place was actually worth waiting a few years! It was that good.The wait went by pretty quick. I don't think we waited over 20 minutes or so and it was packed! Our server was friendly and fast. She did forget my soup but apologized and made up for it. It was no big deal. My skillet was cooked the exact way I asked. I cant even remember what my BF ordered because I was so busy shoving food in my face. The fresh juices are great too!

26.description: Great find upon arriving in Chicago through O'Hare! We had an early morning flight and were pretty hungry after picking up our rental car so we checked yelp and stopped here. The service was fantastic, our waitress was super friendly, prompt, and helpful. She had coffee & water for us right away, recommended the special pumpkin pancakes and had our breakfasts out super fast. The pancakes were delicious!! A stack of 4 bigger than my face, there was no chance I'd finish it, so I brought it with us and enjoyed the rest for breakfast the next day. My fiancée got an omelette that looked like it was made with at least half a dozen eggs. Also delicious! Will definitely come here again if looking for a quick bite to/from O'Hare!

25.description: I loved this place! Years ago I had a mean BF that brought me here and refused to wait the lousy 30 minutes to eat on a Sunday morning. I am smarter now though. This year I was with a man that waited. This place was actually worth waiting a few years! It was that good.The wait went by pretty quick. I don't think we waited over 20 minutes or so and it was packed! Our server was friendly and fast. She did forget my soup but apologized and made up for it. It was no big deal. My skillet was cooked the exact way I asked. I cant even remember what my BF ordered because I was so busy shoving food in my face. The fresh juices are great too!

12.description: Elly's did not disappoint. In fact it exceeded expectations. Our server, Arturo, was eggcellent. I started with their fresh juice, springilicious, substituting carrots for the orange. It was very good as was their fresh OJ. My partner in crime for breakfast ordered the Dutch baby, yummy. I had the skillet with chorizo. Sensational!!! It is in my top 5 all time favorite breakfast creations. Hash browns on the bottom, chorizo/onions/jalapeños in the middle, a layer of cheese and then 2 eggs. Mmmmmm mmmm good.We would definitely come back if we were in the area.

59.description: We found this eatery through yelp while in town for a wedding and were not disappointed. I ordered a make your own skillet with bacon, sausage, feta cheese and avacado with eggs over medium. It had to be the best skillet I've eaten. The pancakes were not as good as I found them dry and crumbly. My kids shared a Mickey pancake and finished off almost the whole plate between the two of them. My husband ordered the Ole skillet and enjoyed it saying the charizo sausage was rich and the skillet had just the right amount of jalapeno after ordering light on those. This place would be dangerous to our budget if we lived closer. All in all, very pleased.

21.description: Now this place rocks for breakfast! Great coffee, my sausage and cheese omelet was fluffy, flavorful, and more than filling....friendly service....good value....shut up and just go!

17.description: Elly's Pankcake house has the best omelette I've ever had. The eggs are so fluffy and do not ooze when you cut into it but they still remain ever so tasty. I would also recommend the skillet. The juices are all fresh and the coffee is smooth and strong, perfect for those who need to wake up. The restaurant is very clean and I had a very pleasant experience overall. Will definitely come back if I'm ever in the area and I would highly recommend you check it out.

10.description: Got off the plane in Chicago, was hungry, googled and yelped some places to try, ended up here. This place has a nice and clean feel to it, very spacious inside. Food came quickly, (the place wasn't filled at the moment). Breakfast food was good, no complaints. I typical breakfast fare, eggs, pancakes, bacon, etc. I just felt it was a little pricey for what I ordered.

5.description: I was on my way out of town and wanted to have breakfast some place close to O'Hare Airport. We just happen to stumble upon this restaurant. It was the BEST decision ever! I am all about turkey products so I decided to get the turkey sausage, eggs, potatoes and wheat toast. I really enjoyed every bit of my breakfast. Oh and the coffee....GREAT!!

3.description: I was pleasantly surprised by this place. I am in Chicago for a day and needed a place to pick up a quick breakfast before an interview. I came around 8 am and was immediately seated in their huge dining room.The service was quick and appropriate. It maybe took 5 mins for me to get my meal after I ordered. That's what I call service!I ordered the #1 pancake special which includes fresh squeezed orange juice as a side. It definitely was fresh squeezed, and fantastic. The special included the juice, two pancakes, two eggs, 2 strips of bacon and a sausage link. Not bad for $8.50 and Chicago prices. The scrambled eggs were not overdone, bacon was crispy, and pancakes were fluffy and tasty. It's a simple breakfast, but you'd be surprised how easy it is screw up. They did not.Overall: just a solid breakfast spot. If I'm ever back in the area, I will stop back again.

35.description: Ordered the "homemade corn beef hash" with two poached eggs and it came with a side of hash browns and an English muffin. The corn beef was ground so fine it was hardly recognizable and both that and the hash Browns were greasy and tasted like they had been cooked on an old dirty grill. My eggs were poached and were good. My friends French toast tasted as bad as my corn beef because it was cooked on the grill  The other two girls that were with us ordered the chicken salad fruit plate. Nothing was fried and they were both 5 star quality. I complained about my dish and they did remove it from the bill.  I'll go there again but will not get anything fried on the grill.

19.description: I am grateful to have come here for breakfast this morning. Me and my kids were stuffed from the delicious food. The deals are great with a large quantity of food. If you can handle a big breakfast than come here. Would totally come back! Happy eating all. :3

28.description: Had breakfast there based on Yelp reviews. Definitely worth a visit if you stayed in a nearby hotel. Food and service is excellent. It is not an expensive menu.

45.description: Crepes!!!! Crepes!!! Love it...  the ambiance was cozy, service was good and for my first dine in, I was impressed. I came here for brunch with my sister and cousin. I had crepes and Canadian bacon - it was delicious!  My sister had the make your own skillet and was also satisfied.  My cousin had the old fashioned pancake and he enjoyed it.  I would definitely come back and recommend it.

33.description: If you're a breakfast food snob like I am I wouldn't recommend coming here.  I came for a late lunch with coworkers and Elly's was practically empty and yet we had to wait to be seated because there was no hostess anywhere in sight. The food and service overall was mediocre to poor at best.  I ordered the Ole omelette which had chorizo, jalapenos, cheddar cheese, salsa and sour cream.  When I dug into the skillet, it was extremely watery!  Blech! The eggs weren't cooked, the chorizo was super greasy and I know it typically is, jalapenos were concentrated in the middle of the omelette, and overall the dish was super heavy.  Our waitress barely checked on us and we had to wait before we got our check.  Maybe I had a bad experience but based on my first visit here I wouldn't recommend it.

43.description: I stopped at this place around 8 a.m as the morning crowd was starting to flow in. It was the closest place at the moment so I decided to give it a shot. I had a steak skillet that had sunnyside up eggs, onion, mushrooms, and hashbrowns. I ordered it with toast. I would have to say the steak was pretty bland and I had to add salt and pepper to my food to find it edible. I thought my server was friendly although she was a little awward and seemed overwhelmed. The coffee was average. I will probably try a fresh fruit juice if I come back.I think this place is ok if you are passing by and want to get some breakfast in a low key environment.

2.description: Love the atmosphere Amazing foodAmazing service Try the strawberry topped blintze stuffed with ricotta and cottage cheese Turkey patties as sides were a great addition for the protein I was looking for (allergic to eggs) They also have gluten free toast! Perfect for my pops who can't eat wheat. :) And don't forget to get your fresh cup of juice- we tried the grapefruit and orange, but they have lots of options to choose from including smoothies

18.description: Huge seating area, wonderful service.  Huge variety of food for breakfast.  Everything was excellent.  I tried the ham and pineapple omelette was interesting, the Benedict was good, Mexican frittata was also good!!!  Side of pancakes were delicious!!  Did not need syrup they were that good.Would go back in a second next time I am there!

41.description: This Elly's location keeps Udi's bread in stock and can substitute any bread item for Udi's sandwich bread for $1 extra. I was considering the french toast but decided on the veggie hollandaise. Amazing! Great service. Fair prices. Will be back to try the gluten free french toast

52.description: Great service and great food! The avocado bacon omelette is my favorite! It comes with hash browns and sweet, vanilla pancakes, yum! The berry smoothie or the green goddess are also my favorite. I love this place! Best breakfast in the neighborhood for sure :)

50.description: Never been disappointed! They have a standard and I had always same equal service.Its always a good breakfast option!

4.description: Much better than your average breakfast joint. The food is pretty good. Salads, if you are a chick of course, are huge and delicious. You can't go wrong.Omelettes and pancakes are also very good. Give this place a try when in the neighborhood. French fries are better-than-average as well.I recommend this place. It's by far the healthiest option on this stretch of Cumberland Avenue. A refreshing break from hot dogs, hamburgers and gyros. The normal staple of the Northwest side.

6.description: I wouldn't drive out of my way to come here but it's a good neighborhoody option. Portion sizes are generous. The Hawaii Five O omelet was good. I'll skip the Potato Benedict next time though. If the parking lot is full, you can park at the nearby church - according to the sign by the door.

22.description: Elly's did not disappoint. In fact it exceeded expectations. Our server, Arturo, was eggcellent. I started with their fresh juice, springilicious, substituting carrots for the orange. It was very good as was their fresh OJ. My partner in crime for breakfast ordered the Dutch baby, yummy. I had the skillet with chorizo. Sensational!!! It is in my top 5 all time favorite breakfast creations. Hash browns on the bottom, chorizo/onions/jalapeños in the middle, a layer of cheese and then 2 eggs. Mmmmmm mmmm good.We would definitely come back if we were in the area.

15.description: Good was average, my eggs were bland, sausage was tasty, French toast was OK. German pancake was average as well. Service was slow, didn't even get served syrup with my French toast. Service could be better. Customers need to be checked on more often than once.

57.description: This place is great! We enjoyed the breakfast quite a bit. Comparing it to similar style restaurants, I'd say 4 1/2 stars, but there's no half stars so I'll bump it up. I had an omelette and my friend had strawberry French toast.

20.description: The best brunch place I have ever been too.  I had the steak skillet and it was unbelieavable.  The orange juice and pancakes were very good too.  Everything, including the service was top notch!

36.description: I have always had a good experience here, good food and my favorite fresh squeezed orange juice!

14.description: The best brunch place I have ever been too.  I had the steak skillet and it was unbelieavable.  The orange juice and pancakes were very good too.  Everything, including the service was top notch!

12.description: I won a stay at this hotel from a local charity event.  It's only .5 miles from where I live but we thought the kids would enjoy the pool.  We were at this restaurant for dinner and were pleasantly surprised.  I admit I didn't have high expectations because it's a hotel restaurant. I first have to mention the supurb bead basket.  It may seem funny to mention but I love my carbs.  It came with warm pretzel rolls, homemade crisps, and an excellent flavored butter. My kids both had the kids mac and cheese meal.  It is homemade mac and cheese (versus the crap out of the box) and came with a side and drink for $6.  They had the fruit and it was a beautiful mixture of fresh fruit (blackberries, raspberries, cantaloupe, honeydew).  I had the chopped salad which was very good and my husband had the buffalo wings which he said were very good.  For dessert they have these great small portion shooters.  My kids had the brownie sundae and my husband and I had the turtle cheesecake.  Perfect portion amount and very tasty.  I don't know why more restaurants don't do petite desserts like this. Prices are a little high but not bad. Our server was very friendly and attentive.  I never would never have thought to try this place had we not won the raffle for the overnight stay at this Marriott.

7.description: Slightly above average for a hotel bar. Decent drink selection, food looked edible, and the bartenders were attentive. It's tough for me to give a hotel lobby bar higher than 3 stars although I considered giving this one 4 stars.

20.description: I normally don't eat at hotel restaurants but I wanted to meet a friend near O'Hare so checked out Brickton at the O'Hare Marriott.I took a look at the web site before I headed out to Park Ridge and really liked the menu, it looked like there were a lot of great steak / meat options. The web site really made the restaurant seem more like a "non-hotel" restaurant (unique branding, menu etc.).The restaurant has a nice layout but once we set down it felt like another hotel restaurant (I had the impression that we were the only people eating there who did not stay at the hotel) . When we received our menus the items on them were different than the web site. When I ask the server about this he just shrugged shoulders. The service was average, once I had to ask another waiter to get our server but it wasn't bad either.The dinner was fine but again it felt like food you would expect in a hotel restaurant by the airport there was nothing unique about the meal.. nothing that motivated me to drive back to the Marriott for dinner. There is free parking which is nice, just present your ticket to the hostess and she will validate for you.I probably would not eat at this restaurant again as there are many options in the O'Hare area unless I was meeting someone at the Marriott.

19.description: My husband and I were staying at the hotel and decided to try out the restaurant since it was cold outside and the restaurant was so open and welcoming.  We both ordered the bison chili and it was amazing!  The best chili I've ever had.  Our server was engaging and our food was prompt.  I had a pasta dish with sausage and it was delicious.  My husband had a burger, which he quickly ate and looked very satisfied.  We also had a glass of wine with our dinner and the waiter was very helpful with choosing the perfect wine for our meal.  The desserts were the perfect size and price.  For only $3 you can choose a dessert flight from a selection of flavors.  It was just a nice touch of sweetness after a satisfying meal.  Great restaurant, would highly recommend.  Next time we stay here we will definitely be eating at Brickton again!

1.description: Fairly good location inside the hotel.Bartenders were engaging and there were some very good beer/liquor options despite the location.A few of us split the shrimp cocktail and hummus which were decent. My main was the brick chicken which was good but the bacon-potato hash was uninspiring as the bacon was the frozen/precooked type and too salty.Service was attentive.

2.description: A while ago, my girlfriend and I stayed at the Chicago Marriott O'Hare for a couple of days. During our first night, there was a severe thunderstorm that persuaded us to dine in instead of braving the dangerous elements. Down stairs, we went!The Brickton is spacious, comfortable (hey, super plush carpet), and classy (in an old "I smoke a lot of cigars and wear a sports coat all the time" kind of way). For residing in a hotel, it surprisingly has a poppin' buzz! When we first walked in, we were enveloped in what I call the Post-Conference Cacophony. It's where people that attend a conference for work finally have some free time and let their hair down or unbutton their collars over some drinks with strangers/ new professional friends. A room can easily fill with the belches of loud fake laughs. Thankfully, with so much seating available, finding a private and quiet table was no problem.Bricketon's staff members rock! Ernie, our server that night, was by far the friendliest and smiliest person we met during our stay in Chicagoland. (Ernie, if you're reading this, please know that you're awesome!) We couldn't ask for anyone better! Unfortunately, the food just did not match up to the atmosphere and service. Really too bad.We started off our meal with some complimentary bread and butter, which neither of us found appetizing. I think the buns were a pretzel bread of some sort, and it just reminded me of ones from a grocery store that were left out too long on the dining room table. But whatever, I looked forward to enjoying the entrees, anyway. My girlfriend ordered the quesadilla ($9), which had a spread of guacamole, diced tomatoes, and sour cream. Even though I was starving, after several bites, I couldn't stomach anymore. As for me, I got the shrimp cocktail ($11), which came with only five measly shrimps and a cocktail sauce. You would think for the price, I would get more than that. In addition, it wasn't even in a cocktail glass, rather in a small jar. That dish was just underwhelming.Luckily, their drinks somewhat salvaged my meal. Thank you whomever made my Moscow Mule ($12). Thank you.Overall, I would give the food a 2/5, my drink a 3/5, and Ernie a 5/5. I think a 3/5 is more than fair.If I stayed in this Marriott again, unless the Brickton totally redesigned their menu, I would only return for the drinks and great service.

9.description: Good bar, well for a hotel lobby bar. Gets crazy busy from 5:30 until 7:00 usually. Good good, but a short menu. Drinks are very very expensive.

6.description: Loved the buffet breakfast here! An omelet made to order, pastries, yogurt, cottage cheese, fruits, pancakes, waffles (made to order), fresh juices, coffee.... I'm actually quite impressed with the buffet served here. The only downside is, the lady who makes the omelets is very UNATTENTIVE. My friend and I ordered two omelets, mine came out right, and my friends was the complete opposite of what she had ordered (Ie. whole eggs instead of egg whites, cheddar instead of mozzarella, no ham when she had asked for ham...) The omelet Chef really needs to step up her game (she also needs to be able to multi-task and make more than one omelet at a time WITHOUT burning them!) There's a reason there is 4 range-tops in front of you and 4 skillets! sorry for the rant, but I ended up waiting about 10 minutes each day for her to make my omelet. A bit ridiculous. On another note... My waitress (same one both days) was very attentive and welcoming. She would chat about the weather and current events which was great. Told me a few cool sites to check out. Overall, I would recommend this place as a great place to eat breakfast. (and I would have given 5*s had it not been for that omelet chef) The Marriott/Brickton definitely needs to do some retraining.

18.description: I've worked next door to the Marriott for almost a year and a half and hadn't yet eaten in the restaurant.  Decided today was the day.  Meh, I've experienced better, is right.  I ordered the salad of their namesake (Brickton) to go.  I wish I would have checked it before I left the restaurant (my mistake).  It is a large to go box of iceberg lettuce (maybe 6 pieces of romaine) and red onion.  My boss walked by just now and said "that's the whitest salad I've ever seen." I have to agree.  I've eaten about half of the salad now, and I've located 4 M&M (plain, not peanut) sized pieces of chicken, and one slightly larger piece.  I specifically ordered this salad because it had chicken on it.  I wasn't expecting to have to hunt for it.  For an $11 salad, I'm disappointed.  It's fresh, thus the two stars.  But if you run into a girl with horrible onion breath who's hungry angry in about an hour, that'd be me.  Sorry, I tried to eat.  :(  From now on I'll stick to Gino's for my salads.

10.description: We had 3 meals while staying here and were pleasantly surprised.  Meal 1 was dinner.  I had landed earlier in the day and my friend took me for an afternoon & evening around town.  After a long day exploring, we decided to just grab a bite at the hotel.  My friend had the "Turkey BLT", he said it was one of the best sandwiches he'd ever had and loved the lemon mayo they used.  I was having some acid reflux issues (TMI, yeah...sorry!) so I went with the "Brickton Chicken Soup", described as "Slow roasted Indiana Amish chicken, ton of veggies, egg noodles, fire roasted Iowa corn".  I don't see a "ton of veggies" but I didn't care this was goooood soup!  Just for good measure, I added a side of "Loaded Mashed Potatoes" and I was disappointed.  They were lukewarm and just sort of blah, not quite "loaded" enough for my taste and the potatoes didn't have the buttery creaminess I wanted.Meal 2 was breakfast.  With the room came a free "Good Start buffet" but we were told that for $5 we could get the $18 full breakfast buffet.  Feeling less "reflux-y", I went for it.  Wanting to start the day with a light meal, my friend stuck with the "Good Start" which still had a number of offerings; cold cereal, oatmeal (with add-ins like brown sugar, raisins, milk, bananas, berries) and bread, bagels, English muffins (with butter, cream cheese, jam, honey, etc...).Meal 3 was breakfast again and this time we both went for the upgrade.It included all the stuff in the "Good Start buffet" PLUS omelets, eggs, pancakes and French toast made-to-order, a hot buffet with Eggs Benedict, breakfast meats including a couple specialty sausage types, a few kinds of breakfast potatoes, croissants, muffins, pastries, breakfast sandwiches, fresh fruit (apples, oranges, fruit salad), carafes of fruit juice and the list goes on!  Scarily enough, I think I tried a little bit of almost everything but the cereals or bread.Both days the buffet was delicious and fresh.  Service at the Brickton somewhat lacking in timeliness (it seemed like there wasn't enough staff for the number of guests). Little things like getting a coffee refill, a pitcher of half & half or a glass of water took far too long.  Despite that issue, we were happy with the staff who tried to be as accommodating as possible & very friendly.

13.description: My dinner of beer cheese soup and a field greens salad was tasty and pleasant.  The wine I selected was good but pricey.  Breakfast buffet the next morning was very expensive but clean and well stocked.  Multiple kinds of sausage.  Fresh fruit and baked goods.  Oatmeal with lots of fun toppings.   Would return!

16.description: Cheese dip was fresh out of a can, or jar... I got the roast beef sandwich and should have walked across the street to Al's. Most of it was dry and cold, some of it was extra hot and dry, thanks for nuking it real quick on the way out. I was with my sister who ordered the chicken which I am guessing took longer which is why mine was off. The little desserts were not bad. I'd have those and champagne again but thats it.

17.description: I normally don't eat at hotel restaurants but I wanted to meet a friend near O'Hare so checked out Brickton at the O'Hare Marriott.I took a look at the web site before I headed out to Park Ridge and really liked the menu, it looked like there were a lot of great steak / meat options. The web site really made the restaurant seem more like a "non-hotel" restaurant (unique branding, menu etc.).The restaurant has a nice layout but once we set down it felt like another hotel restaurant (I had the impression that we were the only people eating there who did not stay at the hotel) . When we received our menus the items on them were different than the web site. When I ask the server about this he just shrugged shoulders. The service was average, once I had to ask another waiter to get our server but it wasn't bad either.The dinner was fine but again it felt like food you would expect in a hotel restaurant by the airport there was nothing unique about the meal.. nothing that motivated me to drive back to the Marriott for dinner. There is free parking which is nice, just present your ticket to the hostess and she will validate for you.I probably would not eat at this restaurant again as there are many options in the O'Hare area unless I was meeting someone at the Marriott.

15.description: Veggie burger very good with a black bean and veggie patty. Not your typical Gardenburger found at most hotel restaurants. Ordered with fruit (mostly melons, of course) and the mini mint dessert shooter. Both were very good.

0.description: The food here was pretty good, even for vegetarians. There weren't a whole bunch of options but they were pretty accommodating. We ordered a mushroom burger and a chicken quesadilla but substituted the chicken with mushroom. The service was pretty nice and the ambiance was obviously nice since it was inside the Marriot.I bought a Yelp deal for the first time! But this place didn't know about the deal so when it came to the check, it was a teensy bit time consuming...also I couldn't use the 10% off for checking-in because I was using the Yelp Deal...which doesn't make sense because I should be able to use the deal like I would use a gift card...but whatever...This is an affordable place for a good meal! Oh and our orders came with fresh fruit on the side as well!

5.description: I was at the AMA center in Chicago for a two-day seminar. Because it's Chicago in March, the most convenient lunch option was the Brickton in the Marriott simply because it's attached by sky walk.And I'm glad it was convenient because it was also delicious.The In and Out lunch special is a half sandwich with a cup of soup and your choice of chips or fruit. On day one, I had that with the cheddar ale soup, a soup of the day, with a turkey BLT, and the fruit. There was a ton of food (the cup of soup is more comparable to a bowl), and it was all wonderful. I went back on day two and had the Brickton salad, which was a huge salad full of smoked chicken, cheddar cheese, tomatoes, pretzel pieces, and topped with a lemon vinaigrette. Service both days was excellent. Servers were conscious of timing and pleasantly responsive to the group needing separate checks. If you're at the Marriott or the AMA center, don't overlook Brickton just because it's the "hotel restaurant."

11.description: The Brickton Restaurant and Bar is your only drinking & dining choice within the Chicago Marriott O'Hare hotel, and fortunately the recent hotel renovations included a full makeover of the lobby area, including the restaurant and barThe bar area is right off the main lobby with plenty of high-top stools and long tables, and lots of flat screen TVs over the bar. The place gets crazy busy in the evenings, and so expect the noise level to be rather high.Behind a comfy living room-type lobby you'll find the Brickton Restaurant which also stays busy all day long. The restaurant is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The menu is classic American cuisine served in a contemporary atmosphere. Since I was still full from our big steak dinner the night before, I just wanted something light for breakfast, and settled on a yogurt and granola parfait with a side of fresh berries and a cup of hot tea.I was able to wrap up a quick breakfast business meeting, and then hopped the shuttle van back to O'Hare and the flight home.

8.description: I got in late on a plane and was happy to see that the Marriott's bar was still open on a Sunday night.   I took a seat at the bar after checking in and settling down my hotel room,  and was immediately welcomed by the bar tender Melissa.   Melissa asked me if I wanted a drink,  and I asked for an opinion on a beer.   She asked what my style and taste was and offered me a taste of Half Acre,  which I never had before.   I really love it when I am offered a taste of a new beer before I buy it.   Great first impression of a place.   I liked the Half Acre,  and ordered a glass and asked how the venison was.   Melissa said she just had it in a tasting and loved it,  so I took the bait.   I sipped on my beer,  watched Sunday night football and made friends with Marty,  an attorney from St.  Louis who said the wine selection was great too.   My venison came out a little slow,  about 20 minutes.   It was dressed well,  but the meat was small in portion.   The sides were ample though,  and tasted amazing.   The venison was good,  but not great.   It was cooked to perfection though and I would recommend it if someone was looking for a decent venison on the bone.   Melissa did ask how it was and I was honest,  which she apologized for.   It was a nice touch to the service.   Overall,  the service was A+,  beer selection A+,  and food A-.

3.description: What a treat! The food was amazing. The pork chops were cooked perfectly. Salmon and risotto delicious.  Even the kids Mac and cheese pleased our picky eaters.

14.description: I stopped in to have a beer with my friend before we walked over to Hooters to enjoy some beer and chicken wings. However we noticed PORK WINGS on the menu and decided to try them. We ordered Buffalo and Southside and they were awesome. Ill be back to try more things simply because the service was awesome and the food i did have this time around was great.

4.description: Hotel staff is attentive and friendly. The bar is expensive, but they make a tasty Moscow Mule. Food selections are great, I stayed over 8 days here and the food was always spot on. My favorite dishes were:1. The Market Mixed Green Salad (subbed bleu cheese w goat cheese) and added grilled chicken2. The Summer Watermelon Salad...pistachio vinaigrette is so fresh and light. 3. House Made Fettuccine (the Andouille is spicy but good) I also had it grilled chicken and it was even better!

3.description: If I could give this jewel no stars I would. I used to go here before and had so much trouble over getting wic or prices being wrong and horrible customer service. So I decided to try to go here again 5 years later. Well the same people seem to be working there and still have bad customer service esp the lady cathy and still had a issue getting wic. Even though other jewels I have gone to I get the same exact thing but this jewel they have no idea what they are doing

1.description: Waiting at the deli is agonizing,  I know remember why I drive to Marianos. It's worth diving another 5 minutes to get quality customer service and fast service.  I'm literally standing here waiting and writing this review.  I've now been here for ten minutes.  It seems as if you have to physically yell to get your order in NEVER AGAIN

2.description: I think this is a great store!  I've never had any problems and I've been shopping here for 7 years!  I've had great customer service experiences. I'm a customer service rep, so I ought to know! I think people are more likely to post a review, if they have something to gripe about!

5.description: EW, this place is incredibly gross, went and I'm never going again ever. Stay away from this dump.

6.description: I think this place has changed abit since the last review....they redid the inside (probably to compete with Dominicks with their new look) and to me the aisle seem more roomy than before.  Busy.  Staff seemed friendly.I do agree with the parking lot...weird and usually full, but it is in a strip mall also, so it is shared with like 6 other stores; they should have accounted for making a bigger lot I suppose.

7.description: This place isn't the greatest. The parking lot sucks. The variety is good. The aisles are small and the people are pushy.

0.description: Grocery shopping sucks in general... This Jewel or Jewels as we call them in Chicago doesn't make shopping suck any less or any more!I think all the people in the butcher shop are nice less one guy and I have never had a bad experience in the deli. The food is priced decent... There is fine balance between paying to much and going to 3 grocery stores for food. I believe that you can buy a good percentage of your groceries at Jewel and not feel ripped off. The meats and produce regardless of price have always been adequate.I did once have a problem with some chicken that may have been dated/labeled wrong and they took care of that with no issue or question. I have not had a problem with parking, but I also comprehend that I am going to be walking around in the store so I don't search for the closest spot. Although trying to make a left (go west) onto Lawrence can be tricky if traffic is heavy.Checking out is pretty much terrible... The self checkout people are the grumpiest people in the store. They have to deal with people making mistakes! OMG that must be the worst! It's almost like they have to help customers that are paying money and they don't want to... The young cart pushers are not yet jaded so they always tend to be polite! All in all, its my local grocery store so I will continue to shop here for mere convenience...

4.description: They were great 3 months ago, what happened? New model store, plenty of new options to buy and all day fresh products. Today the Fresh bread variety are all out and it's 5pm. Come on now, make some bread for the afternoon crowd. The worst part, I really got I to the Jewel monopoly game, got most of the pieces other than the rare ones which are winners. 100 game pieces later still no winners other than winning more game pieces. That not the bad part, it's May 9th and all the stores in the neighborhood are out for a game that ends May 20th. I understand the rules say while supplies last,  but most stores have been out since May 1st.

29.description: Every time I have been here, it was due to some type of work event. So I don't have oodles of insight to offer here. I will say that the bar staff tend to be fairly efficient. The prices are a bit too much for what you get, but you are paying for the convenience. The facility is located within the Hyatt. This Hyatt happens to be fairly isolated. Meaning, if you think you are going to go exploring by walking around in the winter time, and you are say from the West Coast and showed up with your wind breaker; good luck. So either bring warmer clothes, take a taxi or of course you have Red Bar as an option.

23.description: located on the second floor of the hotel. laid back place bar and tables around the bar. good sushi good place to catch the game or a drink not overly crowded when i went.

47.description: Had some delicious drinks here while waiting for the shuttle to pick us up to get to Rosewood. I took off points, however, because the service seemed to be a little off that day. But at the end up the night, way after closing hours, they let us take up a section of the bar for our impromptu BYOB late-nite crowd! All in all, a pretty nice place!

8.description: Wasn't expecting much from a hotel bar, but was pleasantly surprised. Had the mustard-crusted salmon dish with quinoa. Food and service were great. The entree was actually really well-priced. Will be back.

31.description: Average bar food.  We had a cheese pizza, buffalo wings, soda, an apple pie. Total before tip was $39. Soda was $3.50.  I think the "seat yourself and wait for a server" is a poor business model for this bar. I saw two people leave because no one noticed them for about 10 minutes. After about 5 minutes of waiting, I went to find a waiter. To be fair, this was around 4:30pm. The staff almost doubled around 4:45pm.

34.description: Nate the waiter was great! Sushi was amazn n shrimp pasta was da bomb, shrimp were huge!! Order the Diamond Rasberry Ricky cocktail yum!!

16.description: Rarely do I order Nachos, yet tonight I just felt like having them. They are cheap quality and below sub standard here. Super Thick mass produced unauthentic chips. Wasn't sure if they were stale or just horrible. Nasty Plastic cheese. Jalapeños straight from a jar (so gross). And nearly non existent 'avocado cream'. The nachos were horrible, with prepackaged toppings (nothing fresh) and non foodie. Chicago is a city boasting some of the best food in the country. These nachos were rookie, cheap and made with the cheapest ingredients. Blach! Never gain!

13.description: This was a good option for dining at the Hyatt Regency Hotel.  I had a Chicken Cesar Salad and it was fairly well done.  The chicken was grilled very well and tasty and the dressing was a nice supplement.

11.description: This place is pricey for what you get! The food is ok. It's mostly junk food, salad, and sandwiches. Luckily, there is sushi too which is the only thing I would order from here. I noticed that the leather seats in the booths were quiet tattered. For a nice place... They should get on that. In general, it is a nice ambiance. FYI - They do validate parking.

39.description: Good thing my expectations for hotel food in Rosemont were already pretty low.  Service was fine. Mojito was large, but still pretty pricy and way too sweet.  French fries were flavorless and undercooked.  The maki we ordered as an appetizer was falling apart at the seams - i.e. it was not even rolled up all the way - sort of like what happened the first time I attempted homemade sushi.I guess when you have a captive audience at a suburban hotel, you don't have to excel at your craft though.  You just have to meet nutritional, alcohol and sports-viewing needs to occupy the guests.

37.description: great little bar! quality of servers is hit-or-miss but our server, nick, more than made up for the others. whoever was making the appletinis that night was the *bomb.com*. the hotel was just okay, but the bar is a little gem!

0.description: It is funny because every single time that I travel to Chicago for team meetings, we stay at the Hyatt Regency O'Hare and the Red Bar is down in the lobby.  You would think that the number one focus would be that we go out to grab some deep dish pizza or some Chicago style fare but we always migrate to the Red Bar in the lobby.The bar is not listed as a sports bar but it could be.  It has tons of hanging televisions that has sports on all of the stations and it has a great feel to the place.The food is a good mix of everything from wings, to nachos to sushi to shrimp style pasta.  Trust me when I say that you will not be disappointed in their food and their attempt to create a fine dining pub food style establishment.I personally had the hot wings and the cheese quesadilla and I loved everything about it .. the service was great and attentive and they had an ok selection of drafts on tap (I think about 5 of them).  If you are traveling or just looking for a place to relax and eat and drink some wobbly pops, then check this place out.

38.description: Tiny food menu. Mostly drinks. Mostly paying for ambiance.But the main reason I gave this such a low rating is because the service was HORRIBLE! What's with the sourpuss? Would it kill you to crack a smile? Several times the waiter looked at me like I had just spoken to her in a different language.Boo.

51.description: My wife and I went to the Red Bar in Rosemont for a late evening dinner.  I must say we have lived in the neighborhood for over 7 years and we have never been there. The appetizers were excellent, we had the marinated chicken quesadillas.  For our entrees, my  wife had the grilled cheese and I had the Angus burger, both were very good and prices were comparable to other restaurants, like Chili's or Longhorn for example. The price of drinks was quite expensive, but they were mixed and proportioned well, and tasted good. For dessert, we shared an apple pie, like all the food, it was outstanding.  Our waitress, a pleasant young lady with accent, was professional and gave us just the right amount of attention. My wife and I will definitely be going back to the Red Bar. Oh yes, use the valet service, if you eat at the restaurant or the bar, valet parking is free, just keep your receipt and show it to the valet.

27.description: It was too cold to toddle down the street to Morton's, so we canceled that reservation and just ate in the hotel. Excellent service. I don't like that flavor crap on my steak & I've found it's easier to ask for it on the side than have a long discussion with the serve about going without it all together. The steak was delicious & tender, three drinks just kept coming, and the hospitality was warm & welcoming.

32.description: Cool atmosphere. One of the nicest hotel bars I've ever been to. Being near O'Hare and the convention center means lots of patrons to make the place hum.

54.description: I came here prior to a show for appetizers and drinks with three girlfriends.  The place was packed!  Luckily, we scored the last table.  There was a buffet special for $12 but we opted to get something tasty off the menu. The food was pretty good for bar food.   The drinks were tasty too.  I had a $25 gift certificate that I used with out a problem.I never go out here...but if you are in the area and looking for a drink, I would recommend.

48.description: Nice sports bar inside the Hyatt O'Hare.  Even if you're not staying at the hotel, it is a great place to hang out.  The food preparation and service are good and the beer choices is quite nice.

44.description: I normally wouldn't write a review for hotel food, but I was so impressed with the food here, I'm writing this!!I was staying here and a friend came to visit, so we ended up just coming here to eat since it was easiest, and their service was super friendly, quick, and the quality of the food was really GOOD!!!I got their cheese fries- super  DELICIOUS!!! SO crispy with a really good, quality white cheese melted on top (not your typical orange American cheese) and some spices- SOO GOOD!!Their tortilla soup was very good too with large chunks of tomatoes, tortilla strips and melted cheese on top, their chicken sandwich was good too, and it was served with a VERY fresh tomato and cucumber salad that was seasoned just right- and generous portions too!!!Their apple tart was delicious too- buttery with a LARGE scoop of ice cream and lots of caramel- just how I like it!!If you stay here, you must check it out, it's TOTALLY WORTH IT!!!!

24.description: Great bar-food dinner with great service after a flight that was way too long. At least something went right.

7.description: Over priced food that is not that memorable, but you are in a hotel after all. I give the place credit for having revolution in a can at least, a can of eugene porter will run you 7. They also offer sushi if your wallet can handle it. As a place to sit, relax and enjoy company or the game, Red Bar wins. Tip - there is a very generous plate of chips and salsa that can be had for around 7. It comes with red and green salsa with just enough kick and I am told that the salsa is handmade at the hotel.
