The biggest challenge Red Bar has is whether it is open when you need it. Sometimes it is closed when it does not make sense, i.e. opens at 4pm on a Sunday.

49.description: Since I do not live or frequent Rosemont, Illinois I had no idea where to go for a drink when my buddy came to O'Hare to drop off his girl for a flight.  I found this place on Yelp and it was okay. There is a valet service that will allow you to valet for free (for 3 hours) if you present a receipt from the bar, so that worked-out without a hiccup and I was pleased with the service of the valet.The bar had a big selection, but we both went for the Seasonal Samuel Adams as I did not see Miller High Life on tap.  The ambiance of the place was neat, the service staff was friendly and quick.  But it is a hotel bar so the prices were a little higher than your typical neighborhood dive bar that serves Schlitz in a can for $1.Only complaint is that I thought there would be more people at the bar, but it was about 7 degrees Fahrenheit outside.This place is next to the Donald Stephens convention center.

40.description: Ended up here after not being able to get a reservation at Capital Grill down the street and lets just say we were impressed.  The hotel is beautiful and the food was good we ended up with the sushi and and burger and both were delicious.  The prices were also very reasonable with our bill for appetizers drink and the sushi and burger coming to $80.  Definitely coming back.

53.description: I SWEAR I reviewed this place a few weeks ago, and now suddenly the review is gone?  Was it all in my head?  Well I can't let a place slip by on me now.  I have a flight attendant friend who breezes into Chicago every so often and we try and meet her on her layovers.  She happened to be staying in this hotel so we went to meet her at Red Bar.The hotel is super swank and modern, looks pretty amazing except for these weird Buck Rogers disco lights on the elevator.  The bar is no exception, and they even had these cool see through panels that TV projectors are aimed at so you can see the show on both sides of them.  Too bad is was all sports.  Not sure why sports is seen to be the universal thing that everyone wants to watch, personally I'd like to see episodes of Cops playing with closed captioning.  But I guess I am weird like that.To back up a little when we first arrived we pulled up near the hotel entrance and asked the doorperson where to park.  She directed us over to a lot and said the first two hours were validated if you were eating at the bar.  This becomes an issue later.The meal at the bar was fine, the atmosphere was fine.  The service was WEIRD. Our server must have been on something.  I don't think I've ever had so many uncomfortable pauses, moments of silence, and stares from a server.  Weirdfest '09 was totally on that night.  They also had some computer problem towards the end of the night.  Our friend went over to check on it and the manager sort of snapped on her.  Nothing horrendous but kind of weird.When we went to go get the parking validated the guy at the front desk tells us it's only 20 minutes not two hours.  I was wondering where the conversation would go because he was being a jerk about it, and we wouldn't have parked there had we not been told we'd have two hours free.  Luckily a supervisor stepped in and took the charge off.Okay so normally I'd two or one star this fiasco of a night, but we got to sit and catch up with a good friend for a couple of hours, I had a decent burger, and the atmosphere was visually impressive.  I am hoping the place was just a little off that night, I'd totally try it again.

30.description: Staying at Hyatt for a flight tomorrow and the bar's location is very convenient for any hotel guests . Friendly staff but took them a while to figure out who was suppose to take care of me since it was open seating. Being by myself on this trip, the big screen TV's kept me company. I highly recommend their steak sandwich served medium rare, it was beyond my expectation a bar sandwich. I would come back again.

46.description: Sat down to eat and ordered a glass of red wine ($13) from a waiter. 15 minutes pass, and I see the waiter chatting with his friend at another table.A new server comes over and I ask where my glass is. She disappears.Third waitress comes over and I reorder, only to be told they stopped carrying that wine three years ago (note: I ordered by reading off the menu, not by yelling out arbitrary wine-related words).I ordered a salmon burger ($13) and asked for a salad instead of fries. The original waiter drops off a salmon burger with with fries and no salad. I ask about the salad - he says, "If you wanted a salad why did you order fries?"I've now stayed at this Hyatt six times and the service at Red Bar is par for the course. The food is decent (except the desserts - all premade garbage), and it's a nice looking place to have a drink, but everything is overpriced and the service is consistently bad.Perks (and the Diamond lounge, if you're eligible) have much better food and the service to go along with it.

1.description: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. So this became the go-to place for dinner. Food = okay.  (They have a standard menu, and a sushi menu.)  It was hit or miss on a few items. Chips and salsa were great. But that's easy (usually). Red salsa and salsa verde, both had great flavors and spicy. House made chips = crunchy, thick and addicting. $6.50.Chicken quesadilla = 3 chicken tacos with pico de gallo and chipotle sour cream on the side. It was okay. I wasn't a fan. $10.50.Mustard crusted sustainable salmon with red quinoa and wilted swiss chard. Perfectly cooked, tender salmon, and the whole dish was a great combination of flavors--spicy, tart and nutty. This was one of my favorite dishes from here. $18.00.Buffalo chicken wings, comes with celery sticks and bleu cheese dressing. Asked for ranch dressing.  The wings were good but a bit on the dry side.  $11.00.Cobb salad (Grilled chicken, smoked bacon, egg, avocado, blue cheese and tomatoestossed with lemon-Dijon dressing). I skipped the bleu cheese and asked for extra egg. It's ginormous, filling and delicious.  Another one of my favorites from here. $15.00.Service = friendly. Attentive. Prices = moderate. (Typical pricing for a hotel restaurant/bar.)Plenty of seating, dark inside. TV screens galore. Overall, not a bad place for a quick bite or just a place to hang out.

9.description: Had a Pepsi with no refills and was charged $7. I recommend ordering a beer instead for the same price.

26.description: After giving a presentation, I decided to stop here for a quick lunch before heading into the city.  I thought the staff was pretty attentive, nice and fast.  The menu was pretty diverse and I was able to order something that fit within my dietary needs, which was the cobb salad.  The salad was a good size and ended up being much better than I expected.  I was in and out in about 30 min and was even able to work with the free wi-fi that the hotel offered.  I hear the sushi is amazing here and will probably order that the next time I am in town.

25.description: Overpriced, even for a hotel bar. Staff is friendly enough.

12.description: Red Bar is still pushing out the good drinks and food in a contemporary environment.Had the sushi on this go around and while okay- they do better with standard bar fare like the nachos, pizza and burgers.The level of fun is always dependent on who is in the place . . .but since biz travelers all have the same mojo when at a hotel bar . . .it always seems to work out just fine.

21.description: This place is pricey for what you get! The food is ok. It's mostly junk food, salad, and sandwiches. Luckily, there is sushi too which is the only thing I would order from here. I noticed that the leather seats in the booths were quiet tattered. For a nice place... They should get on that. In general, it is a nice ambiance. FYI - They do validate parking.

17.description: Best sushi ever!!! I'm definitely a sushi lover, and ordered some sushi for room service. I have to say, at the standard of a hotel-restrant, the sushi here is amazing~! A little bit pricy, but it totally worth it!

10.description: Stopped in for a late night meal.. I was disappointed that the sushi wasn't available after ten, but I loved the watermelon basil non-alcoholic drink. It was refreshing, full of flavor and only 55 calories! I didn't try a true cocktail, as the alcoholic cocktails on the menu went for as much as $16, which was shocking!!I had the southwestern wrap for dinner, it was ok. The chicken was moist and had just enough spice, but I felt there was too much cold shredded cheddar in the wrap. It was grilled so the warm and cold clashed. Overall, I was happy with this hotel bar - warm and trendy ambience and a decent place for a late night snack.

5.description: So being a local around this area. I've decided to try this place out. The sign once you walked in said seat yourself. So as I'm seating myself. I'm looking at their menu for dinner. I waited for 20mins. Still no service to come greet me or ask me for my drink order. I had to yell at one of the staff members to come take my order. In order to get their attention. I would imagine nice hotel like this would have staff on their customer service A game. I recommend people to try this place out for ONLY THE FOOD. NOT FOR THE SERVICE. the waiters and waitresses don't even greet you or say Hi or make it feel Welcoming to come into their Hyatt Regency Home.

3.description: Maybe the servers here were all having a bad day...Yuricka (my waitress) chose to give me a scolding because I chose a dirty table. Well this was because another waitress instructed me to sit there and then never returned to clean it or take my order. You never blame the customer for something like this. Super unprofessional. I was ready to walk out but since I was staying at this hotel I had no other options for food.They get 2 stars because the calamari appetizer was huge (it needed more seasoning and more than one lemon). Also the hot wings were fairly decent. I'm going to assume that the food will always taste the same and that this business would deserve 2 stars without the poor service so the 2 stars are my way of being fair.

35.description: Amazing Sushi!!! Amazing service!! Nate is the man!! If you can request him!

19.description: Great dining in an eclectic hotel setting. Perfect spot to catch up on Big Ten football games and scores on the multiple television monitors , whether you're getting jiggy with wings and beer, or handling your Sushi & Sashimi chopsticks business.

28.description: Really good pita with spinach and artichoke dip. The pita bread was nice and soft. I also had some egg rolls. Good food for a bar in a hotel.

45.description: Slow service, expensive food and sub-par sushi.Service... it started off at "average", some tables hadn't been cleared yet so we walked past a few tables to find a clean and dry table.  Once seated service was decent with people dropping by to get our orders and make sure we knew what we wanted.  The quality of service dropped heavily after that.  The staff was often socializing with one another.  Often time I saw servers get to one or two tables and turn around before checking an entire area.  And with multiple staff servicing one area we had a few repeat questions (for drinks, if we've ordered, etc...).Food... we had the following items:* Volcano Roll - 2/5 stars.  Decent presentation, but I thought the flavors were light compared to other Volcano rolls I've had.* Spicy Tuna Roll - 2/5 stars.  We questioned whether it was really a 'spicy' roll at all.  It was definitely tuna, but not prepared with the flavoring you'd expect.* Chips and Salsa - A bit more food was needed to hold us over, and though good in quantity, I was just tired of this place and we left before finishing this.Overall, the venue is nice, modern and in a nice hotel.  It's convenient for the convention center, but not a place I'd visit if I have a car or any other options.

33.description: A relative of mine was staying at this Hyatt for a night to do business, so myself and my family met up here to eat and drink. The previous reviews did sure help to alleviate my fears about this place being really bad, since I luckily realized a few hours in advance that this is where we were going to likely end up at. I'd put this at 2.5 stars.I still can't help but admit it was average, and that I got the impression that this was better for drinks than for eating. Ordered the chicken nachos, and while they weren't bad, they didn't blow me away either. Tried a few fries that another person got, and they just seemed typical for fries. Also tried a quesadilla that a different person ordered, and I got the feeling I had better. I just only ordered a beer, but did notice that a person who ordered a gin and tonic there happened to like it. The yelper who said earlier in his/her review that you're paying for the bar's atmosphere with their food/drink prices hit the bullseye with that description. Also my dad described it correctly, by saying it felt like a million other sports bars(along those lines, but I added to him that it felt more upscale atmosphere-wise, than a typical sports bar). If I had to find a place in this area to eat dinner at and was paying(luckily my relative who was on business paid with his business account), I probably would've hit one of the nearby Park at Rosemont(next to Muvico) restaurants/bars instead. And that not surprisingly was what I suggested at first, since I remember reading about that development opening up online. More I think about it(and unlike when I first wrote this), I think I'd round down on this instead of up, particularly when you consider that I was hoping the food would be a tad better here. And I agree the service isn't the best, either.Free validated parking is offered in their rear lot on the north side of Bryn Mawr(where it dead ends) if you go here, btw.

43.description: Hotel food/restaurants are a tricky subject...typically overpriced and bland, you leave feeling unsatisfied and broke. I'm happy to say that hubs and I hit up Red Bar for a late bite and left satisfied and not completely railed over by the prices!It's a good looking bar and restaurant with a million TVs for all of the sports fans out there. Seriously, TVs everywhere. The menu is a combo of classic bar food, sushi and a handful of desserts. The sushi, while nothing to write home about, filled the belly for a fairly affordable price - especially considering the location. The edamame had an interesting spicy salt mix, the Negi Hamachi was tasty, but the Rainbow Roll featured quite a few pieces of tough fish. Not my fave. We finished off the meal with the warm apple pie with ice cream...a delectable treat to end a long day. With solid service and a decent menu, Red Bar is a fine choice for a few bites at the Hyatt.

2.description: Typical big hotel restaurant and bar in terms menu items, but I was surprised of the quality of the burger I got.  I was stuck here because of flight delays, and after 2 weeks aboard a cheeseburger sounds pretty good.  I was surprised by the juiciness of the burger, and how well put together the burger was.Service was pretty good even though they had more guests than they were expecting due to flight delays, it made the place feel crowded on a Saturday night. No complaints, the food is priced appropriately for a large, chain hotel at the airport.

18.description: It was too cold to toddle down the street to Morton's, so we canceled that reservation and just ate in the hotel. Excellent service. I don't like that flavor crap on my steak & I've found it's easier to ask for it on the side than have a long discussion with the serve about going without it all together. The steak was delicious & tender, three drinks just kept coming, and the hospitality was warm & welcoming.

41.description: Love love love.  Get the specials.   Sushi was awesome.  The redbar sushi staff was accomodating and the food was outright delicious.  The wings bbq from the bar were huge and the menu was not overpriced for the quality and design you're getting.LOVED IT!  Two thumbs up.

52.description: What can you say, this is a hotel bar that's slightly upscale but matching for the most part the clientele of the Hyatt it's in.  I exclusively stay here when I'm covering the NPC Jr Nationals outside of Chicago every year and consume many an adult beverage here as well as at least one meal.Nothing special but it's not bad or anything.  It's a solid bet and when it's open I prefer to eat here than the schmancier O'H restaurant.  But being where the hotel is if you don't wanna take a cab to get out of the area then this is about your only option.Cheers!

50.description: It is a Hotel Bar so guess what....expensive!   Now do not get me wrong, I enjoyed myself at Red Bar and the staff is great but....just slightly expensive for my taste.The decor is great with and excellent amount of TV's for sports viewing although they had the TV's all on the same channel.  Variety people, not everyone like watching baseball.As I said before the staff was great and I enjoyed the Red Bar but...just hate paying that much for a drink.

4.description: Was staying at the hotel for a few nights. Would normally have room service but decided to eat in the bar. Service was fine, wine was just okay and food was average. I had the pesto bacon pasta. It was definitely a good size portion, however it was a serious overload of pesto. A little too overpowering so I couldn't taste anything else in the dish. If I stay at that hotel again, would definitely try something else or go somewhere else.

6.description: First to thing to accept is the the fact this is a restaurant in a hotel. So expect pricing to be a little steep. I started off the spinach and artichoke dip which was good. One my favorite appetizers of all time.  I then got an Angus burger which that costed about $13   but it did fill me up after that dip. The beer selection was not all that great but it was alright to have something to drink at least with my food.

22.description: Red Bar is still pushing out the good drinks and food in a contemporary environment.Had the sushi on this go around and while okay- they do better with standard bar fare like the nachos, pizza and burgers.The level of fun is always dependent on who is in the place . . .but since biz travelers all have the same mojo when at a hotel bar . . .it always seems to work out just fine.

15.description: The restaurant didn't have enough servers. We had to clean off our own take before sitting down. And the sushi? Disgusting. I ordered a green dragon roll and it tasted like the eel has been left out for days. It was so gross, I spit it out rather than swallow it.The calamari also tasted old. The chicken on the chicken nachos was as dry as the Sahara. The only reason I'm not giving this one star is that the waiter did his best for us, and they didn't make us pay for the food we didn't like. The manager came over and told is they were removing the bad items.Time to fire the chef there though. For three people of a party of 6 not to like their food. Bad odds, my friend. That chef needs a kick in the ass

20.description: It is funny because every single time that I travel to Chicago for team meetings, we stay at the Hyatt Regency O'Hare and the Red Bar is down in the lobby.  You would think that the number one focus would be that we go out to grab some deep dish pizza or some Chicago style fare but we always migrate to the Red Bar in the lobby.The bar is not listed as a sports bar but it could be.  It has tons of hanging televisions that has sports on all of the stations and it has a great feel to the place.The food is a good mix of everything from wings, to nachos to sushi to shrimp style pasta.  Trust me when I say that you will not be disappointed in their food and their attempt to create a fine dining pub food style establishment.I personally had the hot wings and the cheese quesadilla and I loved everything about it .. the service was great and attentive and they had an ok selection of drafts on tap (I think about 5 of them).  If you are traveling or just looking for a place to relax and eat and drink some wobbly pops, then check this place out.

36.description: The Red Bar is a nice appetizers restaurant in the airport area Hyatt hotel.

14.description: Better than most hotel bars but still a hotel bar, so sot expect too much. Steak sandwich - ok as such goes. The server was friendly and helpful. So a bigger than average tip just for that. Other than that, average place. Higher prices than it should be, but that's what you get from a hotel place. Tip - order your drink neat or on the rocks. If you order a mixed drink you won't think there's any booze at all

1.description: Everything in here is Great. One of my favorites, if I can get up early enough to get it as fresh as possible in the italian rice balls...It is a great way to start the day

9.description: pops called morning of and placed an order for a ridiculous amount of cannolifilling was amazing...shells were a bit crispy and oily (still yummy thou)ill be back to try some coffee cake cause they looked and smelled delish

12.description: Nice little place I wish I'd known about sooner. Reminds me of L'appetito downtown, only smaller. Prices are fair and relatively inexpensive.Spinach arancini was delicious, as was the eggplant/mozzarella/salami panini. I just wish the latter's ingredients were also warm like the nice toasty bread they were served on. So many treats to choose from, but I only had the pumpkin slice and a couple of the glazed lemon cookies--both tasty as well.I'll be back.

21.description: Sadly,  I wish I could have had the same orgasmic reaction to the Sicilian Bakery's offerings like some of the other reviewers, but to me, everything was just...OK.  I guess it may have to do with my exceptional pickiness or my Sicilian heritage, but there are certain things I just insist upon having knock me out and sadly, Sicilian Bakery wasn't doing it for me.  The cannoli are small and thin, which I could deal with, but the overpowering sweetness was a real turn off.  It was like the sugar coated your mouth to the point where you could taste no other flavour, except sweet, sweet, sugary sweet.  Have you ever wanted to become an instant diabetic from just one bite of a dessert?  You just might after one of these!The bread I bought was fresh and decent, but without much of a crunchy crust.  The tiramisu was a soggy nightmare.  It was soaked in something, probably just sugar water, since there was no other discernable taste to it aside from the heavy, waxy whip cream topping.  The one thing that did please me was the iced lemon cookies (Anginetti).  These were a perfect size, light, airy, and perfectly flavoured.  Not too sweet, not too bland. I am glad these were so good, because I have to make a second trip here.  When I got there it was less than an hour before they were to close and I noticed they sell pizza, sandwiches and focaccia to order.  Of course it was too late that day but it still intrigues me to see how good these are.  OK Sicilian Bakery, you have a second chance.  Now get ready to work your Italian magic and knock me out!

16.description: Sorry, but this bakery is very over priced!! I baught a few pastries and I wasn't too satisified with them.

17.description: Sadly,  I wish I could have had the same orgasmic reaction to the Sicilian Bakery's offerings like some of the other reviewers, but to me, everything was just...OK.  I guess it may have to do with my exceptional pickiness or my Sicilian heritage, but there are certain things I just insist upon having knock me out and sadly, Sicilian Bakery wasn't doing it for me.  The cannoli are small and thin, which I could deal with, but the overpowering sweetness was a real turn off.  It was like the sugar coated your mouth to the point where you could taste no other flavour, except sweet, sweet, sugary sweet.  Have you ever wanted to become an instant diabetic from just one bite of a dessert?  You just might after one of these!The bread I bought was fresh and decent, but without much of a crunchy crust.  The tiramisu was a soggy nightmare.  It was soaked in something, probably just sugar water, since there was no other discernable taste to it aside from the heavy, waxy whip cream topping.  The one thing that did please me was the iced lemon cookies (Anginetti).  These were a perfect size, light, airy, and perfectly flavoured.  Not too sweet, not too bland. I am glad these were so good, because I have to make a second trip here.  When I got there it was less than an hour before they were to close and I noticed they sell pizza, sandwiches and focaccia to order.  Of course it was too late that day but it still intrigues me to see how good these are.  OK Sicilian Bakery, you have a second chance.  Now get ready to work your Italian magic and knock me out!

10.description: Had my daughter's bday, cake from here...absolutely amazing!!! Not overly rich--we had choc/yellow cake with custard and strawberries--all my guests including the kiddos were asking for 2nd's!! I will be back!  I love my sweets, but nothing that is overly rich, and they know how to make it perfect, no heavy frosting, soft cake, just delightful--this place will not let you down!

5.description: I utilize this bakery for all my kids birthdays. The owners are very friendly and have made my kids happy with cakes others have refused to make. This is my one and only bakery, and the best tasting cakes in chicago. The cake is moist the icing is just right, not too sweet and the service gets a 10 out of 10.

11.description: The sfincione is excellent. In particular, the tomato variety was top-notch. We also got an iris, which is like a breadcrumb covered bombolone filled with sweet ricotta. It was a little doughy, but something that I would definitely get again. Easily one of the top tier Italian bakeries in Chicago.

22.description: BEST ITALIAN PASTRIES EVER.  I mean it.  I've had lots of pretty good stuff.  This place rules over all.  Go ahead, get the weirdest thing in the store.  It's friggin' delicious.  Get some more and bring them to your friends.  They will ask you where the hell you got this awesome stuff.  You will tell them about this little joint in Norridge.  They won't be impressed.  Oh well.  But seriously, I wish I could get out there more often.

0.description: This is the BEST bakery in Chicago for just about everything Italian. The cannoli, the cookies, the foccacia - it's ALL good!!   La migliore Pasticceria a Chicago. I cannoli sono buonissimi ed anche le pizze e le foccacie!! MMMMMMMM

20.description: Nice place with good pastries. I personally like it a lot.

19.description: Most recently popped in here for a quick cannoli fix. They are filled in advance and in the refrigerator case, and I am always concerned that the shells will be soggy. What can I say I am a texture snob. Did not eat them right way and the shells were just fine with a deep dark shell. Filling was a bit dense for my taste, but it tasted okay. Also tried the arancini which was again being held under a heat lamp. Crispy exterior and a good amount of meat filling, but rather bland overall. have also sampled several varieties of their cookies, I would put them in the same category as the rest of items sampled, good but not "holy" cannoli good.

2.description: Apple strudel is excellent!!

18.description: I've been going to this bakery since it opened years ago, and been delighted every time by their excellent breads, pastries, and cookies.  My personal favorites are the hard rolls, the chocolate hazelnut biscotti, and the apple slices.  Every once in a while, I have to go in for my cannoli-fix, and have one with some espresso.  The amaretti and the lemon cookies are unforgettable, and the submarine sandwiches are generous and incredibly delicious.  If you can't go to Italy, go to the Sicilian Bakery!

13.description: This has got to be the best bakery in the Chicago area,try just about anything there and you are hooked.I try to get there as much as i can my family craves there pastries and so do i.

4.description: Read the reviews and decided to give it a go. The folks working there were welcoming and explained some of the baked goods to me. I had a slice  of tomato pizza, which was tasty, but kind of cold. I think sandwiches are the real specialty. Unfortunately, I made it in a little too late to have one since they stop making them at 3:30. The cannoli, though, was delicious. Again, I'm not an expert, but I really enjoyed the crunch texture of the shell. Prices were very good for such quality! I'll be back when I can brave the walk in the cold again!

6.description: The people here were super nice, and the pastries we got were quite good.  But the pizza was....it wasn't pizza. It was a piece of bread with tomato and cheese on top that had been sitting in a display case for Lord knows how long, and which they re-heated to the point of luke-warmth. Maybe we were wrong to trust Yelp that this is a place that serves pizza, since it seems to primarily be a bakery, but don't make that same mistake!

15.description: A lot better than previously thought going in.  Location can be tricky at first since it occupies a small storefront in a strip mall.  They make some really good cannoli's here while the shell was crispy, not mushy and the filling had a lot of flavor and I never had sfogliatelle that was so amazing since I dislike it in general.  Prices for the pastries varied but were around $2 each.  Pretty good pizza bread as an 8" went for $3.50.  What a great find!

7.description: I LOVE THIS BAKERY!they byfar have the best  canoli creme in chicago.I love their canoli cakes!and eggplant sandwich is to die for!and the amaretti cookies.......yum

8.description: My husband I catered a sweet table for our wedding through Sicilian Bakery and had a very positive experience. The bakery was helpful and worked with us to develop a personalized sweet table with Italian sweets (cookies, cannoli) and Polish sweets for my family (kolaczki.) The bakery also delivered the sweets to my wedding venue for an incredibly low price. On the day of the wedding, our sweet table looked and tasted amazing. Thanks Sicilian Bakery!

3.description: Ordered my daughters confirmation cake from here. Paid $65.00 for a 1/2 sheet and when I went to pick it up my eyes probably fell out of the sockets(I've attached a picture). Everyone asked me if a 5 year old did the writing, live and learn my friends., live and learn. 4 stars for taste, 0 stars for appearance.

14.description: My dad always gets desserts from this bakery so recently we supplemented the pastries at our wedding venue by adding mini canolis, tiramisu, and napoleons.   So good, all the guests loved them!

3.description: I like Deli Time, but I warn everybody to stay away from the salad bar.  I don't know what it is about their salad bar, but I have had co-workers on more then one occasion, and myself included, become stricken with a strange stomach virus that causes you to run to the bathroom more often then not.Otherwise, its pretty decent food.  The have a pretty small variety of hot panini's and sandwiches - but the menu isnt too extensive.  They serve breakfast also, but I have never gone in for that.  Plus they sell your normal corner store type chips and snacks too.

1.description: I returned to Deli Time the next day to buy my lunch (I know... it was my only choice that day) and when I was paying at one register (avoiding the woman from the previous day, who was at the other register), she came over and stopped the woman ringing me up and said, "I've got this. This one is one me." She proceeded to apologize and give me a free lunch. Well done, Deli Time. I Not sure if it was because of yelp or that I wrote to their Web page, but I never dreamed I'd get a response. Apparently fine customer services isn't dead after all. Grateful, because as you can see, I got there a lot.

2.description: I will say that over the past couple months Deli Time has really gotten a lot better.  It is the "default" place, if you will, for employees of the complex to grab a quick bite. Since September, they have introduced a few new menu items, including the chicken taco salad and the crispy gourmet pizzas.  The prices really aren't too bad either.  The staff is pretty friendly as well.

5.description: Just ok. Unfortunately there are not a lot of eating options around this office park. This is the best place by default.They have a salad bar where they charge by the ounces, a grill that serves hamburgers, gyros and weekly specials, and a sandwhich area.Food is better than what you would expect, but not earthshattering. Decor is kind of lame.

0.description: Deli Time was a favorite of mine when I worked in the complex.  Not because the food was great, or even cheap for that matter.They had the BEST hangover breakfast I think I may have ever had.  When I worked in the area, a lot of heavy drinking was required of me.  I didn't want to, honestly, but I left that office everyday with the knowledge that I'd have to go right back again in the morning.  I mean, what else was I supposed to do to cope??? [Ha ha, just kidding.  Potential employers: Drinking is evil and that's my official stance.  I never swallowed.  (It worked for Bill Clinton and marijuana!)]The ham, egg n' cheese on an english muffin was awesome, as was the breakfast burrito.  And if I was still feeling the aftermath of the previous night's festivities, I would have a grilled cheese on texas toast or pannini.  If not, it was super easy to make my own salad.There was always ample seating, much like a high school cafeteria, where my classmates.... I mean coworkers and I would congregate to not-so-discreetly vent our frustrations.

4.description: This place must love the fact that Bennigans closed down! Where else can one go on a cold winters day? I had a meeting at our O'hare office and so this was the easiest and closest place to grab a bite. I have to say, not bad. I had the salad bar and soup. Both were good. The salad bar was fresh and had a good variety of selections. I luckily didn't get the stomach issue that some of the other reviewers mentioned. My co workers got the make your own sandwiches which they seem to enjoy. The prices weren't bad either. Pretty basic stuff but good if you are looking for something easy and reliable.

29.description: To quote another reviewer: " If I could add more stars - I would!"Loved this place, even though there are many choices, in four days that we spent in Chicago, we went there twice.  The food is great!!!  The combo plate had the most tender beef that I ate in a long time.  We have a 6 yr old who is not a big fan of meat and she had a lentil soup the first time (she loved it), but decided to order a chicken meal the second time around after trying some of our food. It is not a fancy place, but it is clean and the service is very fast.  The staff was super nice!  WELL DONE!!!  If in the area again, we will come back.

42.description: If I could add more stars - I would! I'm completely smitten with Bab Al Salam. Hands down - best falafel sandwich I've ever eaten. For a whopping $3.99 you get a pita stuffed with falafel, hummus, and Jerusalem salad (tomatoes, cucumbers & tahini sauce). You can't even go to McDonald's and get a Big Mac for that price anymore (although, I can't imagine why you would want to...)I've had falafel sammies at other places, and nothing compares! The falafel is seasoned perfectly, has the perfect crisp, and never over fried or oily. The hummus is as authentic as it gets. It's super creamy and has just the right amount of sesame oil and spices. Although the falafel sandwich is my go to option, I've also had the chicken shawerma sandwich and the good ol' combo plate. I would also recommend those. Anyway you go, you won't leave hungry and will always have a consistent experienceI will definitely mention that you come to BAS for the ambiance and decor. The restaurant is tucked away in the corner of a rundown strip mall. Inside, you will find a handful of tables and a few Middle Eastern posters and maps on the walls. That's about it. However, the service is impeccable. The owners and servers are friendly, caring, and truly appreciate their customers. If you choose to dine in, your water will always be refilled, you won't wait long for your food, and the server will more than willing to help you choose something off the menu if you're new to Middle Eastern cuisine. I'm starving. Lunch is about an hour away and after salivating over the thought of a falafel sammie...I may just run out and get one.

23.description: I often use Yelp reviews to find good restaurants and I usually participate and write my honest feedback. I have rated a lot of restaurants with 5 star regardless of their atmosphere when I note that the chef serves an extraordinary food.As usual, I checked the Yelp and I chose this restaurant with a 4 star rating.  I ordered chicken shawarma and lentil soup. It took over 45 minutes to deliver the food and since I was notified about the delay, I did not mind. Unfortunately the food was not tasty. The chicken was not marinated, the rice was too dry, the lentil soup had barely any lentil in it, and salad dressing was very strange, which later I realized that it was diluted tahini. The small plastic fork-spoon combo was the cheapest plastic utensil you could find in the market. I was even charged $3 delivery charge which was not disclosed, but I wonder why the delivery charge was included in the total amount of the food which was subject to tax.All of these little details shows the intension of the restaurant. As I see, they have used every opportunity to cut corners of the quality of the food and nickel and dime the customer. Once they raise the quality of the food and the  service, I am sure they will generate more business to make up for the difference.

47.description: I think the falafel sandwich at this place was actually pretty good.  So it's unfortunate that I have to give them 3 instead of 4 stars.Well, the kicker was that they charged me for sauce.  I can see if they charge for extra sauce, but one little container of tahini was $.60.  And same for the hot sauce, $.60.  That's disappointing.The I wanted hummus.  They don't really have like a side of hummus.  It's these big containers.  Still they accommodated and gave me some in a smaller container.  There was way too much oil, though.  There was this taste... which I didn't care for.  Rancid isn't the right word... neither is sour.  IDK... it just wasn't that good.All this added up to a really expensive lunch for what it's worth.  Like $9?  I will probably go back here, but stick with only the Sandwich next time.  But then again, falafel sandwich without tahini and hot sauce?  Hmmm... we'll see.

8.description: The BEST Food & Service!! I try to visit the great restaurant as often as I can.The best Middle East food in this area!The waiter are attentive and handsome which is a big plus!

31.description: I work not far from here and when the office was receiving sandwiches for lunch, a few of us went to try it out - based on the high praise from one co-worker. I was very pleased with everything - the service was very fast, even if the waitress wasn't necessarily conversational. I ordered the falafel sandwich, which was very tasty and very filling. I would have liked more Jerusalem salad in there, but for $3.99, you really can't complain at all! I look forward to heading back and either having more falafel (I liked it that much) or trying something new.

34.description: Nice suburban authentic palestinian/jerusalem halal dishes. Service is grrat, and owner and server are pleasant. I like their daily specials as they mix things up a little.It's a LITTLE on the pricey side for lunch options, but I think the portion and taste make up for it..one of my fav middle eastern spots (after PITA INN ofcourse :)).

16.description: Never disappointed! Best middle eastern food in the area!I work nearby and make sure I frequent this authentic eatery almost weekly. You won't get a better bang for your buck anywhere, and you'll get your fill too.Try a falafel sandwich and some Jerusalem salad if you're wanting a vegetarian option. And the chicken shawarma sandwich will knock your socks off.The owners and staff are also very friendly and make sure your experience is authentic and genuine.

13.description: Loved the beef shawarma and the homemade hummus was soooo tasty. The beef kabobs have great flavor and the portions are decent. Mom, dad and I ate for $22

11.description: Went to this place recently for lunch and had the combination meal. All the meat was cooked to perfection and rice was good. Salad was excellent. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good meal.

39.description: I just roll my eyes with disappointment when my non-Middle Eastern friends like the food at this place.  With all the other middle eastern restaurants we have in Chicago, I think it's between blah to OK.   If they would go to Pita Inn, then they would know "how" Middle Eastern food should taste like.  I'm not impressed with the service & I think they are expensive.   I'm being generous by giving them two stars.

37.description: As a person who lived in Kingdom of Bahrain for 3 years (Small island east of Saudi Arabia) I know my Arabic food.  Actually, I just love to eat them.Only thing I've gotten from this place is the combination plate, which comes with rice, beef, chicken, schwarma, lamb, tomato salad, pickle radish and of course, pita bread.  This place is so called authentic and it is pretty close.  however, I've never been to a restaurant in Persian Gulf who never served us a freshly baked bread.  Not in this case, they actually gave me pita bread still in a bag it came with!  Meats are very moist but they lack in seasoning and traditionally, they are cooked over a wood burning grill.  Not here though.  But I can let that slide, this is U.S. after all.  Combination plate is actually enough for 2 people, I'm a pretty big dude and there is no way I can finish all of them in 1 sitting.  Now that's typical Arabic food portions!  Overall, I'm sure I will be a regular in this place.  Although I miss the food in Bahrain (so freaking cheap) but I sure don't miss that 130 degree summer plus humidity.  And when it rains, the whole country is under water because their sewage system sucks ass.

0.description: Definitely one of the best places!!!!! I order from this place at least once a week..

38.description: The food is pretty good here.I've never had anything I didnt like.I've eaten here many times in the last 7 or 8 years.I wouldnt say Its phenomenal but its consistently good Middle Eastern food.

51.description: I come here for lunch periodically since its fairly close to the office. The shish tawook is very tasty but I generally make a mess of myself. I will learn some day. Best to come with a few people and order a variety of dishes to share - you will get plenty of food at a very reasonable price. The hummus, baba ghanoush, and falafel are all pretty good, although I admit I am no connoisseur of these. Pretty basic interior, nothing fancy, but the staff have always been friendly.

27.description: not bad for a mid east restaurant. did the job and satisfied my hunger and cravings. you should double check if this place gets busy sometimes on the safe sode

32.description: Great food for a very reasonable price. Its not the place for a romantic date, just a place where u get damn good food for a good price. Try the kefta kabob...

54.description: Middle Eastern Cuisine.  This place just opened up.  I finally got a chance to try it yesterday.  It's a fairly small restaurant.  I placed a carry-out order: Hummus(4.50) - yum and had a bit of a kick, except that the pita was cold.  I'm use to the pitas being nice and warm.  Chicken Shawerma Sandwich (4.50) - good but the chicken was a bit dry and it needed more tomatoes and sauce.  Lentil soup(2.50) - too much lemon that gave it a weird sour/bitter after taste and I did not eat it.  $4.50 for hummus and $2.50 for a "coffee cup" of lentil soup seems a bit high.

48.description: i knew the food was going to taste authentic when i walked in the door and felt uncomfortable and stared at, like i felt when i was actually in the middle east.and i was right.  the food was delicious and fresh.  i had some combination kebab plate and everything on it was delicious, as was the arabic salad (tahini, cucumber, tomato, and something else) that came with it.it was also inexpensive and the waiter was nice.  would definitely eat here again if i lived in the neighborhood

44.description: I really can't say enough good things about Bab Al Salam.  The food is fresh, delicious and most importantly: consistent.  The owners are generous, friendly and clearly in the restaurant business because they love feeding people.  EVERYTHING on the menu is worth trying and I have indeed tried nearly every dish.  The keftah kabob and kibbeh maglia are my two personal favorites, but you literally can't go wrong.  The homemade hot sauce is thick and deliciously addictive and the salads are a refreshing treat.  The portions are super generous and the prices fair.  The falafel and hummus are  WAY better than the over rated, Check Please ruined Noonakapoop and you won't be ignored for an hour after walking in.  The decor isn't much to write home about.  Posters of Jordan and Palestine on the walls and Formica table tops.  While your eyes won't be stimulated, your nose definitely will be as you smell the sweet scent of meat over coals. To illustrate the level of customer service at Bab Al Salam: My fiancee thought she had forgotten her pocket book at home and was frantically digging in her purse.  One of the young men behind the counter told her: "Don't worry about it, just come back with the money before the end of the week.  I'm not going to let you go home hungry".  WOW...  Even though he no doubt recognized her face as a regular customer, this went above and beyond any type of service I'm used to anywhere.  If I absolutely had to find a couple of things to criticize about Bab Al Salam, I would start with the bread.  They use a locally bought pita and while more  than serviceable; I can't help but think the delicious meats and hummus they serve deserve a house made flat bread.  My only other minor complaint would be that a slightly expanded menu would be welcomed.  I get the feeling that if these guys did a braised lamb shank, it would be a thing of beauty.  If you're anywhere near the Northwest side, stop by Bab Al Salam and I promise you won't regret the trip.

24.description: I had the chicken shish tawook sandwich and it was amazing!! Also had the hummus plate which was also really good. Fresh pita bread for the table was a nice addition.

7.description: I'm not a Middle Eastern food expert, but I do eat at some pretty high-end restaurants so I know a thing or two about good food. I am obsessed with Bab Al Salam. I work pretty close by and ordered pickup 2 weeks ago, delivery today (also eaten there once in the past). The food is absolutely delicious. The last two times I ordered the Vegetarian Combo plate and an Arabic Salad. SO MUCH FOOD! And every bit of it is awesome! I don't even like falafel - and this place totally changed me. I am now a falafel fan. I also don't really write Yelp reviews, but this place deserves some love. Well done, Bab Al Salam! If you're on the fence at all, just eat there and thank me later.

49.description: Close to where I work, I go at least once a week with folks from the job. We always get the Hummas and a few pieces of falafel. I've had better falafel, but these are just fine for dragging through the Hummas, which is good stuff. I think the price is fair. I get the Chicken Shawerma sandwich and the Beef Schawerma sandwich.   They bring out a bowl of green olives, pickles and some sort of sliced purple veg - ANYONE KNOW WHAT THAT IS? It's good whatever it is. Very friendly folks running it. Like others have said, very simple and clean inside - tables, chairs and a few phots on the wall, but I'm there for the eats.

40.description: I like this place. A friend and I come here about every 2 months. I always get the combination plate and really enjoy the kifta kabob. The food is a 4 but the reason that I gave this place a 3 is because I came on Saturday and the female waitress was rude! I went here with my friend and the waitress never acknowledged until we were leaving. When she came to the table she'd only make eye contact with and speak to my friend. I may as well have not been there. Not cool!

53.description: I didn't remember the last time I had Middle Eastern food, so I sought out a place near where I work.  This one seemed driveable to, and it worked out nicely.  The place is very clean and simple.  The tables seemed to have no scratches on the place and indicative of a new restaurant that just opened up.  We sat in and the waiter was nice enough to leave a pitcher of water for us, which we were very appreciative of.  We also had some olives and turnips placed on our table until our food arrived.  We ordered hummus and the chicken shawerma entree that comes with rice and the Jerusalem salad.  All of it was very good.  There got value in the amount of hummus that was placed on our plate.  The prices are average compared to other Middle Eastern spots in the area.  The entree, I was only able to eat half of and was completely stuffed!  Our waiter joked with us and was extremely hospitable.  He asked if we wanted more of the pita bread, and even though we said no he brought more anyways.  I will definitely be back if I'm in the mood for this again.

30.description: Lentil soup is great with individual flavor. I tried something different. Eggs and meat scramble. Simple good.

46.description: It's pretty good here. The falafel sandwich is about  4-5 bucks.I liked it a lot. It's no sultans market.But come on people we're on cumberland and foster....I'm just happy it's not bakers square....

1.description: I used to work in the area and would often stop here. They have pretty delicious shawarma sandwiches. The lift is ahhhhhmazing!! It tastes homemade. Lift is pickled turnips and they're hot pink and yummy. They have a fresh delicious Arabic salad. I really miss this salad!! I can make it myself but theirs is just so much better. They also have really good hummus. It was definitely my go to dining spot in this area!

9.description: Had a great chicken shawarma sandwich. Needed something quickly delivered. It was fast, tasty, and delivery guy was INSANELY hot. Like... Ohhhhhhh boy.

26.description: Mmmmmmmm the chicken shawarma is super delish ,so is the beef shawarma my only issue is I can never decide which one I want!! The staff is very friendly..whenever I'm in the area I have to stop here..the food is always fresh only bad thing it takes a while to actually get your food..but it's worth the wait!

25.description: Thought I was going to pick up dinner from subway next door, until I saw this little spot tucked in the corner. $10 minimum for credit cards, I think, so I ordered hummus with my chicken shawarma sandwich. The very friendly man making my food threw in two super fresh falafel's - literally the best I've ever had! They were moist and flavorful on the inside, with perfect crisp on the outside. The chicken shawarma sandwich was also perfect. There was plenty of chicken for the whole pita, whereas it seems like most places fill it up with lettuce first, and throw a few pieces of chicken on the top. Not here! It was amazing. Highly recommend stopping in for a shawarma sandwich. I know I'll be back!

12.description: Great little diner-type joint in the corner of a strip mall.  The food is fresh and authentic and affordable.  Look out Pita Inn, there a new young gun in town!  Definitely worth a stop for a great Middle Eastern meal.

21.description: Decent place, better than the average Mid East joint.

17.description: This is the most authentic Middle Eastern food in the area.  If you are about the taste of the food and not the ambiance or other BS, this is the place to go.  It's not water down like Pita Inn, Naf Naf or other places in the area.  And it actually has natives cooking the food (also as opposed to other places in the area).  Prices are also reasonable and I have invited a person that wasn't satisfied.  Don't settle for knock-offs, try this place.

10.description: Amazing and authentic middle eastern food ! Only place I come to eat when I crave it ! Would recommend this restaurant to anyone that's wants to try good food !

5.description: This place could easily be 5 stars, but the pitas are so bad, they must be old store bought pitas, if these are being made at the restaurant, they should give up on them. However all the meat is incredibly flavorful, and perfectly cooked.

3.description: Authentic food.  Staff is very attentive and the food is delicious.  Don't forget to end your meal with a cup of their Arabic style coffee.  Great stuff and very affordable!

19.description: My dinner choices on this horribly cold, snowy evening were to eat at the restaurant at my hotel (yech) or find a place that delivered. I chose delivery from Bab Al Salam and I'm glad that I did. If you choose delivery, know that they have a very reasonable minimum ($12) so that makes it a good option for single diners.My chicken schwarma dinner was really good - not at all fatty or greasy, and it was a huge portion served on top of a mountain of yellow rice. This would easily serve two people. It also came with a nice tomato/cucumber salad, some pickles and a lot of pita bread - for $11! I also had a lentil soup which as another reviewer mentioned is a little watery and could stand to be more aggressively seasoned.All in all, the food quality was great, the delivery arrived on time and I really liked what I had. If you're out near O'Hare and looking for some good Middle Eastern eats Bab Al Salam is a good choice.

28.description: My dinner choices on this horribly cold, snowy evening were to eat at the restaurant at my hotel (yech) or find a place that delivered. I chose delivery from Bab Al Salam and I'm glad that I did. If you choose delivery, know that they have a very reasonable minimum ($12) so that makes it a good option for single diners.My chicken schwarma dinner was really good - not at all fatty or greasy, and it was a huge portion served on top of a mountain of yellow rice. This would easily serve two people. It also came with a nice tomato/cucumber salad, some pickles and a lot of pita bread - for $11! I also had a lentil soup which as another reviewer mentioned is a little watery and could stand to be more aggressively seasoned.All in all, the food quality was great, the delivery arrived on time and I really liked what I had. If you're out near O'Hare and looking for some good Middle Eastern eats Bab Al Salam is a good choice.

45.description: Much better than Pita Inn, and the portions are much more generous.  Every time I'm within 5 miles of this place I stop by for something to eat.  Their falafel is excellent and so is their tahini sauce.  I'm a regular at this place, and they have never charged me anything for the sauces I request with my sandwich (hot sauce & tahini).  I typically have the chicken swarama or beef skewer sandwich, and I ask them to add hummus to the sandwich, which they also do for no charge.  I also enjoy the olives, beats, and carrots they serve on the side.  The owner is from Jordan and very friendly.  I just wish this place was closer to my home.  It's great!

33.description: Close to work, decent food and generally very easy to get in and out. Always like the Chicken Shwarma sandwich. Hummos is generally good and the kabobs are fresh and tasty. Falafil is also very good. Skip the lentel soup though unless you like it very watery. I'm also not a big fan of their salads. Plated entrees are large enough to share, especially if you're having other sides.

43.description: Absolutely amazing place tucked into a crappy Norridge strip mall. Amazing kifta. You think you've dropped yourself in Albany Park. If you're around here, top place to go.

2.description: Had the combo plate: shish kabob, shish taouk, kifta and shawarma... Also had a tabouleh salad, but it think I enjoyed the Jerusalem salad more (tomatoes, cucumber, mint, tahini and yogurt - yum!)

18.description: Fresh everything and gracious service.  Completely authentic with older gentlemen talking business in native language.  There is a great deal of diversity in this area for food - some are risky but Bab Al Salam is a gem.  When close to O'hare you must go here.

41.description: My family and I order from here every Tuesday - And we LOVE it! The meat tastes authentic and fresh, as it's hallal meat. The prices are reasonable, and a great, filling meal. You get a great amount of food for a great, low price. (It's a million times better than Pita Inn, which we used to go to, but switched out for this place.) They do have seating in the restaurant though it's nothing much - we always take it to go. Let's just say that they don't have a 'gorgeous ambiance' that many people want. To get a variety, I always order the combination plate. It comes with a salad too, with no extra cost. I am so happy that my family and I have made this a go - to place. Plus, you get that happy feeling inside when you know you're supporting a non - chain, local restaurant.Bab Al Salam for the win! :)

52.description: Located about fifteen minutes away from the office, I ventured forth since I had a hardcore craving for hummus. So I got the Beef Shawerma and Hummus. Included was the Jerusalem salad and HUGE pitas. Well, for 16 bucks, I expect huge servings which I got...at least with hummas and pita. The beef and rice were a nice serving and it includes onions which is a nice touch.You sit in here, well, there's not much to look at aside from the ladies waiting for their hair to get done at the salon. I imagine the dudes in here stare.long.and hard. every.day.But, is this the place that would dethrone Kabob2 for my favorite Northside Middle Eastern place? Nope. Basically, 17 bucks for a meal that I can get from Kabob2 for 6 bucks?

50.description: it seems that the food was not freshdry chickenhard beef humus not so greatfriendly people but need the best food

4.description: Awesome food. Good Price. nice people.The stuffed Falafel and the arabian coffee were particularly excellent.

6.description: The Chicken Shawarma plate was delightful. Moist, flavorful, the note of orange made this suprisingly light. The rice pilaf was above average, the rice was right on and the sliced almonds were fresh, crunchy, and pleasantly nutty. The side salad was quite weak with chopped iceburg  and a slice of cucumber.I also had the falafil and they were very good, nice crunch, moist, and a hint of peppery heat.I'd would certainly eat there again.

22.description: Went to this place recently for lunch and had the combination meal. All the meat was cooked to perfection and rice was good. Salad was excellent. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good meal.

15.description: I often use Yelp reviews to find good restaurants and I usually participate and write my honest feedback. I have rated a lot of restaurants with 5 star regardless of their atmosphere when I note that the chef serves an extraordinary food.As usual, I checked the Yelp and I chose this restaurant with a 4 star rating.  I ordered chicken shawarma and lentil soup. It took over 45 minutes to deliver the food and since I was notified about the delay, I did not mind. Unfortunately the food was not tasty. The chicken was not marinated, the rice was too dry, the lentil soup had barely any lentil in it, and salad dressing was very strange, which later I realized that it was diluted tahini. The small plastic fork-spoon combo was the cheapest plastic utensil you could find in the market. I was even charged $3 delivery charge which was not disclosed, but I wonder why the delivery charge was included in the total amount of the food which was subject to tax.All of these little details shows the intension of the restaurant. As I see, they have used every opportunity to cut corners of the quality of the food and nickel and dime the customer. Once they raise the quality of the food and the  service, I am sure they will generate more business to make up for the difference.

20.description: Never disappointed! Best middle eastern food in the area!I work nearby and make sure I frequent this authentic eatery almost weekly. You won't get a better bang for your buck anywhere, and you'll get your fill too.Try a falafel sandwich and some Jerusalem salad if you're wanting a vegetarian option. And the chicken shawarma sandwich will knock your socks off.The owners and staff are also very friendly and make sure your experience is authentic and genuine.

36.description: We love Middle Eastern food, and this is overpriced and poor, honestly.  We got the beef shawarma, and the meat literally tasted as if it turned.  I have had this dish from many places, and this tasted spoiled.  The rice was mushy and flavorless.  The falafel was pretty bland and quite doughy  The pita they gave us came in the bag they bought it in.  There are FAR better Middle Eastern places in Chicagoland at better prices.  In all honesty, we threw out everything except the the falafel, for fear it was spoiled, and ate some leftovers out of the back of the fridge.I rarely slam a place like I did here, but it was just awful, and quite honestly, rancid.

14.description: Really good authentic food. The combo plate is always to die for and I like the lentil soup a lot. It reminds me of the soup I used to get at my favorite Nepalese restaurant funnily enough! Really good food and really nice people. I would highly recommend it!

58.description: I always go back and forth about how useful it is to render a decision about whether one Chinese joint is any better than another for my own recollecting, let alone bothering to issue an opinion for consideration by others, but LINS is a good place to eat Chinese food. Great crab rangoon and I really like their Orange Chicken and the cheap lunch specials. Some of the best Hot&Sour soup I've had and their veggies are not overdone. AND they are quick with the service. I love their beef dishes.

56.description: I love Lin's Mandarin - this must be the best Chinese food in the area! I love the shrimp fried rice and Kung Bao chicken. The portions are massive, especially when you dine in. Speaking of dining in, the restaurant is small, but quaint. I have mainly dined there in the evenings,  so we usually get decent service. We did make a mistake of going there for an early Saturday dinner and it was packed, so the service was slow. The food, fortunately, was still top notch.This is a family owned business and everyone contributes to customer service. This means that your food will be delivered to your table as soon as it is ready. I have to say that this restaurant serves the best Kung Bao chicken I have had.

29.description: The food was excellent and the service was too. While traveling, we were looking for a cheap place to eat dinner and thisn place had great dinner specials that exceeded expectations. With their dinner special you get an entree, soup, your choice of rice, and an egg role. The portion sizes were excellent for the price. We ordered the shrimp with vegetables, kung poa chicken, and vegetable beef and all were delicious! We also ordered an avocado smoothie which was one of the best we've had. If you're looking for a great lunch or dinner place with great food, great service and equally great prices. This is the place.

42.description: I love my Chinese food, but I think this is one of the best places around!!! The food is great, service is excellent, and the value is great. Definitely recommned trying this place. I prefer to dine in vs carry out... The dinner specials have great value!!!

23.description: Best chicken fried rice! Nicest workers and great food favorite Chinese food hands Down

47.description: If you live in the Park Ridge area, you know good Chinese is pretty much impossible to find. My bf and I had all but given up on trying when we went here. It's pretty amazing. Probably the best egg rolls I've ever had, and close to the best crab rangoon ever too. Really fair prices ($3 for rangoon? Unheard of!), and a really nice staff. Very small place, and when we went someone on the staff must've had family visiting...which was actually quite entertaining to watch them so excitedly interact while who I assume is the manager kept telling them to be quiet while we (the only ones in there) were eating. Will definitely eat from here again.

8.description: Very nice staff.  Have enjoyed quite a few lunches here.  They have good lunch specials that included a fab won ton soup we always love.  My co-worker enjoys the beef and broccoli.  I've tried almost 1/2 of the menu and have enjoyed most.  Especially General Tso's Chicken.  I will never attempt to try their potstickers again.  They were bad.  Very thick and doughy.  The egg rolls are good!

31.description: I've been here on many occasions and have always enjoyed myself.  Orange chicken is to die for. ALWAYS fresh! Great portions for the price. Plenty of parking and they have take out or dine in.

34.description: This was an impromptu stop for comfort food on a snowy night - we got them just before closing time, but they were very pleased to see us for a carry-out order.  Offered us some hot tea while our food was prepared.Of the items we ordered, the salt&pepper smelt was most pleasing, followed by the fried rice (lots of different stuff in the mix).  The pork lo mien was a good recipe,  The cashew chicken was mostly vegetables (I was hoping for more cashews, actually), but OK.  Equitable fare for a drive-by pick-up.

16.description: I love this place! I'm very picky when it comes to good hot and sour soup and this place has me ordering it a lot. Their smoothies are good, too. I've tried a bunch of things off of their menu and like it all. No complaints yet!

13.description: I've been coming here for nearly 8 years now.The food is excellent and tastes authentic & the staff is very friendly and welcoming.I highly suggest you order their Kung Pao Chicken/Crab Ragoon/Sweet& Sour Soup/Egg Roll/Mongolian Beef.

11.description: VERY DISAPPOINTING!Was expecting delicious food - what we got - well to me it tasted as if it were made in the microwave - and perhaps it was as it arrived at the table within minutes of ordering.Portions were rather small - and everything was very over sauced - probably to cover the lack of chicken & beef in dishes.From the reviews I read I was expecting WOW - but instead I was more like WHOAH - I think some folks don't get out much if they consider this top notch Chinese food.

39.description: The food was alright, I got chicken fried rice and steamed dumplings, instead of steamed I got fried. It was no big deal the dumplings were ok but they were rather dry, and were obviously reheated a few times, other then that the rice was okay, nothing out of the extraordinary.

37.description: The way a business presents themselves really speaks volumes to me. We ordered from here the other night and when we brought the food inside we realized it was incorrect. We ordered fried beef potstickers and house special fried rice for my husband (which was correct) and vegetarian spicy broccoli for me. When I opened the container I saw it was spicy beef broccoli. Immediately I called to make sure that I hadn't taken someone else's dinner. He looked at my ticket and realized the girl at the restaurant had wrote it down incorrectly but that he would have someone bring me the correct dish right away. He totally made my night especially getting back out in the snow. Every time they come the delivery people are so nice and they all deserve a wonderful tip. I'm blown away by the generosity they showed me and will continue to promote this great restaurant.

0.description: I normally order Chicken Fried Rice and Lo mein whenever I'm in a new city and I'm unsure about the chinese food from the restuarant I order from.  So I ordered the Chicken Fried Rice, the Combination Lo Mein, Hot and sour soup, String bean Szechuan style, and the Triple Delight.  This was food for the entire weekend.  The food turned out to be really good.  The price was great, all the dishes were inexpensive and the portions were huge.  The food lasted for 3 days in the hotel refrigerator.  I had a microwave in my room, so it tasted good even the next day.  The delivery guy was fast and he was really nice and friendly.

38.description: Good lunch.  Standard fare.  Egg roll was greasy, but food was otherwise solid.  Service was very good.  Great price.

51.description: Recently found out that China kitchen and  Lins are the same owner...the food is amazing....the people are nice.. :]

27.description: I love this place and order about 3-5 times a month from Lin's! I order mostly vegetarian / seafood dishes since I don't eat meat (red or white) but have friends do so I see them all! Great! Crab Rangoon, seriously solid filling and sizeGreat! kung bao and cashew dishes, doesn't matter which protein you pick!Also have solid eggrolls and lo mein!They pack the food so full and really have bang for your buck!Try Lins!

32.description: Fast and friendly service. Shrimp fried rice is great! Large pieces of shrimp in this dish!! Pretty good Chinese food for the area!

54.description: I love Lin's Mandarin!!!When we first moved to the area, 7 years ago, we tried out all of the Chinese places near us.  They all sucked, until we found Lin's.  They have huge portions and delicious food. We order from them a couple times a month and have never been disappointed. They also have extremely fast delivery!!! We order and about 15 minutes later, it's here.  It's further than several other places we order takeout from, but they always beat them in delivery time.  So, if your really hungry and want your food fast, try Lin's Mandarin.

48.description: You may pass this place given it's hole in the wall status, however, its good people and good eats truly make up for what it lacks in real estate.Tucked in the corner, you can get dinners specials which consist of an egg-roll, soup of your choice (wonton, egg drop, or hot and sour) and your pick of delicious entree.  Orange Chicken please, extra spicy!  The bill comes out under $8 for all this.Close by, inexpensive, and great eats. (And high-five!) Lin (the owner) is f***-ing awesome. Sadly, they close at 9:30 so no late night munchies.

44.description: Food is fresh but nothing special. Probably one of the cheapest options in the area due to proximity to airport. I paid 5 something dollars for a dinner pint...came with steamed rice and the portion was more than enough for me. Keep in mind I'm petite to begin with though so (WARNING: gross generalization) a truck driver might require more.

24.description: The food was ok. I found a piece of metal wire stuck inside a pot sticker. I'm thankful it didn't end up in someone's mouth! I hate to imagine what would have happened had one of my children bit into this pot sticker. I've attached a photo. It appears to be a piece of wire from a cooking utensil.

7.description: Food was delivered hot, which was awesome. My rangoons were good. My pad thai however was not.

49.description: With not too many Chinese food options by my office, I'm glad to have been introduced to Lin's by fellow co-workers. Whilst the place isn't spacious or glammy, it does have its good points. The lunch specials put this place in the good cheap eats that I need to have close by so I'm grateful for that. The food tasted good enough for the various times I've visited. It wasn't spectacular but overall a good value for price and amount that you get. I subsequently have found a few more Chinese places near work but this one is starting to become my first choice.

40.description: Standard Chinese food done well. Predictable and consistent. Comfortably kitschy.

53.description: Our office ordered lunch from Lin's Mandarin for lunch. I got sick. Threw away the food. Bleh! Never again.

30.description: I will not be ordering from here again. I should know better than to order Chinese food from an unknown place, but I was hungry and desperate, and all the other places were closed. As it turned out, I wasn't quite desperate enough to enjoy the meal.I had the beef fried rice, and the Kung Bao beef. The rice was a complete joke, but I wasn't in the mood for humor. The Kung Bao beef was like eating water with meat and peanuts.The eggroll was slimy inside, and the fried shrimp were so greasy, the crust wouldn't even stay on.Very displeased.

46.description: This place is terrible.  Service sucks and is slow and the food is very bland.  Will never repeat.

1.description: I just tried this place based on recommendations and I will never go back.  This was the worst chinese food I have ever eaten.... We ordered the Orange Chicken and Beef and Broccoli along with vegetable fried rice and a few appetizers.  The Orange Chicken had no flavor and was mushy and tasteless.  The food in general was such a major disappointment that we threw it out... I have never done this in my life with any food...

55.description: Went Friday 8/27/10.   A good American-style Chinese restaurant.  I wouldn't go here for dinner, but if you want a 1,000+ calorie lunch for less than $7, this is the place.  They lean a bit heavy on the corn starch.

9.description: Just went there tonight.  Not sure if they changed hands or not but the service was terrible.  And i dont usually rate a resraurant for service, but it was terrible.  They screwed up our order and even people around us had problems.  We even heard dome takeout order that was missing...   The good news is the food was still good...   Id also like to mention the place is starting to get dingy.  The mirrors need to be cleaned, bathrooms remodeled. And the mens room needs soap.Hate to do this but maybe they can turn it around...

26.description: hands down the best wonton soup in the city or burbs. I've had hundreds of wonton soups at hundreds of various Chinese restaurants, and this is by far the best ever. its nothing fancy, just a perfect taste in the broth and meat in the wonton. perfectly cooked every time. Food overall is ok. Too much breading on chicken meals. Egg rolls are also great. Eat in to get both free, or when ordering out, make sure you order the wonton soup.

25.description: Lins is hands down one of my favorite Chinese restaurants. It's such a neighborhood gem. Best in the area really. Cheap, friendly, and quick service. Also Lin is like crazy sweet when he recognizes you.

12.description: Placed a delivery order.  Was told it would be about an hour.  After an hour + 15 I called, and was told the driver was "5 minutes away"....long story short, after 2 hours I called to cancel and the rude, girl who answered the phone starts to argue with me!  "I can't control how long the driver takes!" she snaps at me.  Really?  I was less than 3 miles away, even if the delivery person was coming via a bicycle it wouldn't take 2 hours!  No apology, no customer service and it was probably a blessing in disguise because appears the food is terrible!

59.description: When I first got transferred to the O'Hare base, I lived in a flight attendant flop house with 12 people near the Cumberland Blue Line Station. Lin was my first real friend in Chicago. He always remembered me, he knew my order by heart, and he started teaching me phrases in Mandarin to use on unsuspecting Chinese passengers, like "Ni Hao! Wa Ay Ni!!" No matter how many times I have told Lin about the reasons why, after 7 long years of matrimony, I am still barren, Lin always greets me with a smile and the same phrase, "How many months along are you?" To which I always reply, "Zero months, Lin, my best friend..I am just fat and I need more Chinese Food please!"  He just does not get it!We had crab rangoons and my husband ordered their very delicious Kung Pao Chicken extra garlic. I ordered my usual dish, which I originally tried simply because the name is hilarious, it is called the vegetable HO FUN Noodle. This ho loves me some "Ho Fun Noodle." Lin's Mandarin, Me Love You Long Time....

21.description: The staff is always friendly, the food is always wonderful and fresh.  Their orange chicken is my favorite, has some orange flavor and it's crispy but not dry or overcooked, the steamed dumplings are amazing and the fried rice is always very yummy.  If you go for lunch it's a REALLY good deal, but for dinner it's only like $1.00 more and it's still a good deal!  You will be stuffed and happy you came here.  My friends and I drive from Gurnee to Norridge just for this food a few times a month.

17.description: We ordered the Hunan beef, the Cashew chicken and the Mongolian chicken and an order of egg rolls. All this for $19 and change (excluding tip). We placed our order on-line and also used our I-Phone to pay. This place has great technology. We dubitated about ordering from here, but we trusted the fellow Yelp community. My Mongolian chicken was not loaded with sodium, so I was very happy. The Hunan beef was hot (as in spicy heat), but it had enough of a kick without clearing your sinuses. The beef was very flavorful and satisfying. It wasn't rubbery like another Yelper stated, so I don't know WTF she was smoking that day! I was super fain with what I had. Also, the egg roll was not greasy. The exterior was crispy and it didn't taste like it was cooked in stale oil or burnt oil. The interior was loaded with vegetables (no meat of any kind). The ratio of onions and scallions for the Mongolian chicken was the perfect amalgamation. This is not a 5-star "as good as it gets" restaurant, but I am definitely a fan for several reasons. The vegetables were fresh and had the right "bite" (not overcooked and soggy). I have a sensitivity to sodium. I really do not care for salty foods. A lot of Chinese restaurants that we have eaten at use tons of sodium. I am not a huge fan of Chinese food for this reason. However. this Chinese restaurant seasoned their food in such a way that made it plain delectable. I didn't taste tons of salt. Our dinner also came with a small cup of soup (either Wonton or Egg Drop). We all got the Wonton soup and it was 4-star worthy as was my Mongolian chicken. If we are ever in this area again, for any reason, I would definitely stop in again. We had an enjoyable dinner. We were in the area for an appointment, so we decided to try this place based on some of the Yelp reviews. This restaurant is located on the west side of Cumberland just a tiny bit south of Foster Avenue. It is a few doors away from Dunkin' Donuts, Subway and Elly's Pancake. The parking lot is fairly large and we had no problem finding a spot even though the lot was fairly crowded. The restaurant can use an update. Yes, it  looks like it has been left back in the early 1990's. However, I appreciated that it is clean, semi-quiet with adequate lighting making it easy to read the menu.
