As you enter the restaurant, there are several booths to the right of the restaurant, with a very small bar on the left side toward the rear. They do not serve alcoholic drinks here. Instead the bar is used for making smoothies. I suppose you could bring your own wine (BYOW), but we didn't see anyone drinking wine or beer. Whatever!This is a family-owned restaurant. The family members are hard working people who truly care about their customers. Service was hospitable and prompt. Water glasses were filled without asking, and extra napkins were placed on the table when our food arrived. Hot tea was placed on the table as soon as we sat down, and wow, it was the best tea I've had at a Chinese restaurant. Bar-none!

10.description: Nice little restaurant in Norridge of authentic Chinese food. They have plenty of cooks and waiters and this place is popular with both Chinese and non-Chnese in the area. The portions were more than enough and they get the food out quick and correct. The shrimp dishes were great and well serving

5.description: Is this the most amazing Chinese food I've ever had? No, to be honest. But for the price (crazy cheap), portion size (huge), delivery speed (30 minutes during the dinner rush, all the way up to the 7th floor of my hotel room), this place really can't be beat. If you want decent delivery Chinese, fast and on a budget, you can't do better than this. The delivery guy was super nice too!

3.description: Placed an order for delivery to my hotel room. Friendly staff and the prices were good for someone on a budget. The dish I ordered was the sesame chicken dinner which includes an egg roll. The sesame chicken was ehhhh OK, had quite a bit of grizzle in my chicken which wasn't appetizing. The egg roll was pretty good. I also ordered crab ragoons which were ok too. This good was just "filler" food.

35.description: I have only had delivery from this place so I can only speak of their food and delivery service....and both are amazing! I have ordered different dishes each time and each dish was great! Personal favorite is the sesame chicken. The prices are fair and there is plenty for leftovers. Needless to say this is my go to Chinese take out place.

19.description: We tried this place based on a recommendation in a thread in one of our facebook groups. Decided to check it out tonight in honor of "The Chinese New Year"   So we ordered there tonight. The food was excellent! Great flavors and not salty. We had Soup, Egg Roll, Chicken and Beef. Nothing fried and extra vegetables, it was incredible..Cool thing is we order,tipped and paid online.. It was super simple and delivered fast and fresh. You can even order anytime of day and tell them exactly when you want it to be delivered later in day..

28.description: I've been coming here for nearly 8 years now.The food is excellent and tastes authentic & the staff is very friendly and welcoming.I highly suggest you order their Kung Pao Chicken/Crab Ragoon/Sweet& Sour Soup/Egg Roll/Mongolian Beef.

45.description: Pretty good Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood.Food is consistently delicious.Always good service.I've never had to wait too long for my food.Have been coming here for years and have never had a problem.

33.description: I work about 2 mins from this place and I was trying to find a good place to get Chinese food because I LOVE Chinese food. I found Lin's Mandarin on Yelp and saw some good reviews. Service was good so I can't complain there. I ordered Mongolian Beef and an order of egg rolls because the lunch special does not come with an egg roll. Meh- not good at all. I always scarf down Chinese food but I did not like the rubber thick pieces of beef. The tase was good but not the beef. It was dried out and laying on top of the steamed rice. I didn't even finish it and that is really unlike  me. Then it came time to try the egg rolls. Also bad. These are dripping in oil and have no taste whatsoever. Lets just say I will not be ordering from here again.

43.description: The delivery took an 1 hr and 20 mins.  They are 5 minutes from my office.We have ordered from them often but today they were so bad, i called there twice to find out what was taking so long? The driver mentioned nothing, so when I said he took and 1hr and 20 mins to deliver he stated he was SUPER busy today, so I told him that I was SUPER hungry today - I feel like the ownership changed or something did here because they used to be fast and half way decent.  This makes me sad because the next best option is Fong's and after eating fong's  you feel "Fonged".  And I know now that I am destined to be "Fonged", at least the food gets here on time and tastes good going down.  Super busy today - psh.

2.description: Consistently excellent. Perfectly sized portions and a great price. Staff is always super friendly, too. To be honest, everything tastes much better when dining in, but delivery is just so convenient. Whichever way, you can't go wrong by choosing Lin's.

18.description: Very good traditional and fairly priced food. The food are fresh and hot and you can tell its new. Would highly recommend

41.description: I was shocked to see the rave reviews for Lin's. Call me fussy. Call me a food snob. Either way - I found the food to rather mediocre. In fact, I think it fell on the less than mediocre side.I had my first Lin's experience and it totally fell short. I work right down the street and have been avoiding Lin's for quite some time. Despite how coworkers rave about it, I had one bad experience with takeout and I vowed never to return. Or so I thought. Let's start with the food. Yes, the prices for lunch (and dinner) are very reasonable. My guess is because the ingredients they use (particularly the meat) are questionable at best. Lunch options come with your choice of egg drop, wonton, or hot and sour soup. I went for the wonton (filled with pork). It wasn't the greatest thing I've ever eaten, but it wasn't terrible. My coworker opted for the hot and sour soup. We both found it tasted like sweaty gym shoes that had been sitting in a hot locker for 3 days. No exaggeration. There was a horrible pungent odor and taste that neither of us could get past. As for my entrée, I ordered Szechwan chicken with steamed rice. I was fine with the sauce and veggies, but couldn't handle the chicken. Let's put it this way, if what I had eaten had been in fact poultry, I would be shocked. I tried my coworker's General Tso's chicken and tasted the same rubbery chicken wrapped in a gargantuan sized blanket of dough and sticky sauce. As for service and ambiance - once again, nothing special. The service was fast and I never had to ask for my water refilled. However, our waitress didn't seem to know what was in half of the dishes. The décor is definitely outdated and in massive need of an overhaul. Final thoughts - You get what you pay for, and in Lin's you definitely sacrifice quality. In the Norridge area, there are definitely better options.

52.description: Rich; the owner really knows how to take care of the customers. He never charges any corkage fees and you can bring in any kind of your favorite beverage in with you and they will supply the glasses. The best food and the best value I have ever had at any restaurant. He remembers the loyal customers so when I go in he knows I want my food extra spicy and he never dissappoints me. Recommend this restaurant to all my friends and family who want to save money and still have a great meal.

50.description: Absolutely amazing. FAST delivery, FRESH and PERFECT order. they didn't get anything wrong. the food was amazing and the delivery lady was very sweet. great food. large portions!

4.description: My uncle told me to try this place out and to my surprise their orange chicken was pretty delicious. I really enjoyed it for lunch, however I also to tried their fried shrimp and that was a disappointment. The batter that covered the shrimp was so oily with each bite I decided to feed it to my uncle's dog instead. In all I only tried these two things and I really like the service so I would try them again.

6.description: Was in town for a few days, for business and craved some chinese food. Coming from LA, probably where the best chinese food can be found, I honestly kept my expectations realistic.But you know what? The food was very decent. I took the food to go - Mongolian beef (the lady who took my order recommended it) and the salt & pepper shrimp. So why just an "A-OK"? Well the main reason is because the flavors of the dishes, while good, are not what I'm used to eating. The mongolian beef doesn't quite resemble any mongolian beef dishes I've had growing up. And Lin's taken the liberty to re-interpret the salt & pepper shrimp dish. So, not bad. It may even be great for the midwest palate. But the food is not quite authentic. Trust this chinese gal, I'd know :)

22.description: Went there during the summer with some friends for dinner, party of six. The in-house experience was completely different than the lunch take-out experience. I'm not sure what happened, but eating in the restaurant on a Friday night was really good. The take-out experience is so-so, but in-house during the evening was much better.

15.description: The food is okay. Nothing special, just an average. The only great thing is their portion. The portion is huge, and one dish is enough for two people. That includes the lunch menu.

57.description: We wanted to try a different Chinese joint and due to the raving reviews I ordered Lin's. Everything started off well with quick delivery and the food was piping hot (pretty impressive as this place was 4 miles away). We ordered the General Tso's chicken and the sauce was tasty and not overpowering, the chicken was fresh and cooked right, wish it was a little spicier but good nonetheless. The shrimp fried rice was awesome, there was actual shrimp in here, decent sized shrimp, not the one out of the can where there's about 5000 to the pound. And it was a generous amount of shrimp, great start so far. The Egg Rolls weren't my favorite, but they were good. they were the thick mandarin variety with white cabbage (I prefer green, just my preference) And the Crab Rangoon was good and actually had some crab in it, only 4 to an order here. All for $23, very good value. The order taker and the driver were very nice. Between here and King's these are my go to Chinese joint's in the area. Can't go wrong with this place.

20.description: Friendly staff, tasty food, great portions and reasonable price. I'll be back for sure.

36.description: Don't get lunch at this place!!! I found hair in my Mongolian beef!!! It was horrible!!!!!!!!!!!

14.description: Ordered dinner from them while staying at a nearby hotel. We wished had done it sooner than our last night. Two dinner specials was enough for multiple meals. The food was very good. They forgot our egg rolls which we really weren't too upset by with the amount of food but a little later a knock at the door and they had brought them and the must have been fresh because the were supper hot. So they got a plus for honesty and speed.

1.description: My daughter loves hummus so I thought I'd just start making it myself.  I decided to stop into this small store and see what they had to offer.  I didn't get a change to really scope out the store since I had both of the kids but I did catch that it was three isles packed with foods, cooking supplies, hookahs, fresh pita bread, and a take out menu that included falafel sandwiches (you can order at the back of the store).The only brand named items that I recognized were Ziyad since the others were labeled in Arabic.  The owner, I think, asked if I needed help, found all of ingredients I needed, and put them of the front counter. The homemade hummus was hit for dinner.  The tahini I used was not something I would have use (labled in Arabic) but it was great.  I'll defiantly be going back to the little shop and hopefully enhance my Middle Eastern cooking skills.

0.description: Best grocery and people. The prices are cheaper than anywhere else and the owner so welcoming. Even though it is very small grocery you can find anything you need at best price. They have awesome home made food in the mornings.

If you're looking for an awesome place to chill and smoke hookah... you have this place in Norrdige. Not only does this place has Hookah, it also has a vast range of tobacco products. Oh did I forget to tell you the most interesting thing about the place, performance of BELLY DANCER. I found the place few weeks back and since then I'm hanging out with my friends here every week.  The owner is very polite and makes sure that you are satisfied with your visit and have lots of FUN!I will say its a MUST GO place and don't forget to try their White Peach hookah.

12.description: Great hookahs, fun atmosphere, friendly staff :)

3.description: the hookah was good but its to tight and too crowded. I swear the belly dancer had it in for me. She kept hitting me in the head with her fans or scarfs or what ever she had in her hand any given time. I also don't like that you have to try to squeeze you way in and our of this place. I had such high hopes but the price, atmosphere and the belly dancer just killed it for me.

1.description: Really disappointed at this place .. I just left this place ten minutes ago. I usually come here weekly .. Use to like the place till they started over charging me. Last time it was $20 dollars extra and it was just me and another person. They over charge without explaining why .. And now they charged us for two hookah and 3 drink and we only ordered one hookah.. They aren't honest ..I just paid them and left but they totally lost my business. Never going there again.

2.description: Did not give me the "wow factor" I was looking for. It's an average hooka place with a few nice looking girls. Just grabbed a few drinks and left. They had some decent drinks, some were a bit expensive for my taste of scenery. Check it out and put your own view on it.

9.description: This cozy hookah joint is filled with fun, friendly people and has a belly dance show EVERY Thursday at 10 PM. Many hookah flavors to choose from, and they are only 5 or 10 dollars, and it's BYOB if you're old enough. Wifi, TVs, good music...really great place to hang out.

10.description: This place isn't byob, like other reviews said it was. I've been there other times to buy a hookah and staff was helpful

4.description: The girlfriend and I arrived a bit late, around 11PM. So we were only able to stay leas than an hour. The service and was mediocre. There were two girls working this night but one was doing all the work while the other mingled with friends.When the girl first came up to see what we'd like she mentioned a discount if we wrote a good review on Yelp, soooo... The reviews here may be a hit skewed. We ordered smoothies which were pretty good ( strawberry banana). It took a good 15 minutes for the server/waitress to bring our hookah which I believed to be a bit long. She did however apologize for the delay. We saw she was pretty busy anyway since she was the only one actually working.Im not sure that I'd go back. The service needs improvement and I didn't really enjoy paying $24 for 30 minutes of hookah and 2 medium sized fruit smoothies.

6.description: Good flavor! Great service! Decent ambience. One sore point was min 5$ order per person. At a hookah joint you don't usually buy a hookah each. That apart would recommend this place.

0.description: So we wanted to try something different and arrived around 10pm. We walked in and there were 7 teenagers laughing and talking with their friend who was "working" possibly at the register. He (the "working" employee) didn't acknowledge us but we proceeded towards the back where we could see a sitting area. Not the best first impression! Once we sat down, the service was phenomenal. The young lady explained the menu, asked us if we wanted anything to drink and made recommendations based on our taste. She asked us several questions. She promptly brought us our drinks and hookah. The second young lady checked in with us as did the first. What great service. Complaint- the "worker" from the front register interrupted our server to say he was sitting a group of guests. Why didn't he sit us? And then why interrupt our service? Rude man! Luckily our server gracefully handled the situation. The preferred group this man sat down was a group of teen friends of his. Please- if the owner reads this - seriously have a discussion about this. Nice date spot for something different. Cheerful pleasant and attentive servers. Mostly mature crowd but some teens. Those teen friends he sat down were discussing how they could leave without paying the bill. We had a relaxing time overall. If you are coming in for hookah - spend and tip - geeze tip!

5.description: Probably best hookah bar around ohare airport area. The service and hookah are great. Plus the hookahs starts at $10. The hookahs are gewat and if you have a problem with them they fix the problem right away to a point that they will change the hookah for you if the problem is still there.. The owner is a nice guy as well.  They also sell hookahs and supplies and cigarettes there as well. The reason I took out a star is because the drinks are too expensive and they close at 12. But overall a great place..

13.description: Loved it! I will definitely be back!

11.description: Easily one of the worst experiences at a hookah bar.  Service is absolutely horrible.  We asked for a menu and it took the waitress about a half hour to come back and ask if we wanted to order something.  Because maybe it's normal to just admire the menu or something?  Then there's this confusing bull about how each person has to buy something that is $5 and up?  So basically, two people can't share a hookah because they each don't spend $5.  Is this making sense to anyone?  Oh, and that finger food I can find in my fridge.  And you don't have to tip them, because they take money out of the change you get back after you pay the bill.  Rude.

8.description: Great hookah, fast service, very comfortable hookah lounge.  - what else to look for ? Need to come !

14.description: Great place! The staff is AWESOME, atmosphere is welcoming, hookahs are good, BYOB, finger foods available, music is loud enough to hear but not so loud that you have to yell,   What else can you ask for!  I was sold! Check it out..

7.description: My favorite place to go chill ...my hookah is always made great...staff is super friendly!! Super clean...always a great time!

29.description: Very good pizza. The thin crust is so good. Will recomment to all my friends.

42.description: I had carry-out Pizza.  I ordered a sausage thin crust.The pizza had a good flavor. The crust was very thin, a good thing.I had a couple of problems with the pizza.One, there was some burnt leftovers on the bottom of some of the pizza. Someone didn't clean the oven.Two, there was a lot of grease on the top of the pizza. A good Chicago thin crust pizza is not covered in grease.I don't think I would try it again, since there are so many very good pizza places around Chicago.

23.description: for thin crust pizza oh my god this is the best around!!!!

8.description: The food is as fresh as it gets it is made to order there is nothing frozen, and the sauce is made with only the freshest ingredients with their own family recipe.When I am back intown i usually order from their Irving park location, i introduced the thin crust from als when i was back home to my 11 year old daughter and that is the only thin pizza she asks for as soon as we land in Ohare and it is superb. Not a pizza chain this is totally family owned its DELICIOUS!

31.description: This place is just great. I always get 18 inch pizza with 2-3 toppings and tye give you a small cheese pizza for free. This comes to about 22 bucks but the taste of it is something else. I would say my favorite pizza place so far

34.description: i never have to pay for pizza here (duh the pops always foots the tab when im near his 'hood)...so maybe thats what makes it taste so goodor it could be cause its actually yummy thin crust w just the right amount of toppings :)

16.description: Wonderful pizza.  Lots of cheese, good sauce.  Perfect thin but chewy crust.  It is exactly what I wanted and expected.  In a strip mall with a few tables.  Probably best for take out and delilvery.

13.description: Usually this place is very good. That's why I'm giving it 3 stars instead of lower. Tonight I just happen to have a very bad experience. The fried mushrooms were tasteless, overcooked and chewy. I usually like my fried mushrooms a little crispy and fresher. I used to get them before and they used to be better. So I'm not sure what happened. Then we had also ordered the mozzarella sticks. Again, definitely overcooked. The cheese wasn't stretchy when you pull it apart. It was tough and I couldn't eat more than one stick. Tonight was the first time trying their buffalo chicken sandwich and probably my last. Who puts lettuce and tomato on a very hot sandwich? The lettuce was wilted and soggy and a warm tomato is not a good thing. I expected the chicken to be a full boneless chicken breast with buffalo sauce on bread but the chicken was all chopped up. Definitely not what I expected at all. Although the sauce was ok, I wish they could get a "mild" sauce for those who can't stomach hot sauce. Above all, they should change their fried food times and make sure every order is exact. It was a loss of $30 tonight. Very disappointed.

11.description: Al's is absolutely delicious.  The thin crust cheese and sausage is my favorite pizza in or near the city.Just awesome food.

39.description: Alrighty I just had this place w/my bf tonight. We got a large pizza half of it with sausage, peppers, onions and mushrooms and the other pepperoni peppers and onions. Well it was okay, there was too many of the peppers and onions and it ruins the flavor of the pizza. Also it was very very greasy and I would like more sauce on it. It was okay though I liked the crust, though I am partial to a thicker crust, hello Giordanos! Anyways and the fries would have been good had they been fresh. We also got the breaded steak sandwich or wahtever it was okay too. I don't know how much it cost though, the bf paid for it. EHHH better pizza choices in the Chi area.

37.description: I'm not the largest fan of thin crust pizza but we ordered it with a couple coupons and both times came back high quality pizza. We stayed simple and got both cheese and spinach and sausage. Though the cheese and spinach had a great flavor and was great and plentiful in ingredients I fell in love with the sausage pizza. I tend to think I'm the reincarnation of a T-Rex sometimes. It's the type of pizza that because it's thinner you don't feel so bad eating a bunch of pieces but then even when you want to stop you can't because it's so addicting. They deliver and do carry out orders!

0.description: Great fresh pizza that tastes like little Italy. I would absolutely recommend this gem to anyone who loves authentic Italian pizza. They also have other menu options and everything is very fresh!

38.description: Hi,Al. It's me,Patty. I'd like to get together with you tonight,if you can work me in. You can? 25 minutes? Great! I'll be there with cash!I was craving pizza all day and this thin thin thin pie hit the spot.Thanks,Al.

27.description: Great pizza! one of the best.

32.description: Very good food! I've ordered different things from the menu before and each time, the food was really good! After ordering two days in a row, I had to post a review. Today's meal (calamari and cannoli) arrived hot, earlier than expected, and my goodness, the cannoli is excellent!I would right more but I'm stuffing my face at the moment.I've found a new lovah! (sorry, hubby)

44.description: Very Very good pizza.  The personal pizzas there are HUGE and very filling and the people there are real friendly.  Their really cheap too if you want a good pizza for cheap i would recommend this place.

24.description: Stopped here on a whim  with no clue what to expect; color me impressed. Ordered a thin crust pizza with spinach and ricotta and, man, was it good. I love thin crust so I was surprised that theirs is a tasty, browned cracker-thin crust. Not at all heavy on the sauce and the dusting of oregano really bumped up the flavor a notch. A big plus was that the cheese wasn't anywhere nearly as greasy like some pizzas I've had--no need to reach for the napkins after every bite--nor was it rubbery. And they sure don't skimp on the toppings either. For me this was a perfect pizza and I'll definitely be keeping them in mind when I want a classier pizza than the chain stuff.

7.description: Was recently in rosemont il. For the motorcycle show. I decided to order pizza and a sandwich.  Al's pizza has the best thin crust pizza and a great Italian beef sandwich.   I would recomend this place to anyone in the area.

40.description: I was in a bar across the side street from this place last night and a couple came in with one of these pies. The Phil Spector "wall of smells" filled the air like no beach boy album ever did. The visual matched the aroma. They offered me a slice but I had just eaten a huge dinner and respectfully declined. However I took note and made plans to check it out.Low and behold I found myself at this gin mill again tonight having skipped dinner only partaking in several Stellas as appetizers. I stumbled in @ around 10:30, they close at 11. Ordered a small sausage, paid, set my internal timer and was off to have one more beer. Upon my return the pie was just being cut, they walked it out to me, perfect timing. In a word, a great pie. Crust was thin and crisp, sauce was ample, tasty morsels of flavorful sausage with plenty of cheese. Pictures taken of this disc not one minute removed from the oven. I dined al fresco, if having the sunroof open counts.

30.description: Very good thin crust pizza, in fact the best we've found in the area.  Flavorful sauce, lots of toppings, and they deliver to Park Ridge.

1.description: I ordered deep dish through app when came to pick it up the price was different five bucks in change because it didn't charge on the application some ingredients when I asked why they didn't inform me they said because its cash payment had to pay the extra price about the pizza let you know when I'm done with it but now with the server for the service to starsPizza is good taste good little to much cheese for me but still very tasty wroth to try

9.description: I found this little gem while getting gas next door. Wow me and my family loved the atmosphere and the ladies up front were very nice,and professional,.We ordered thin crust sausage&pepperoni&green pepper it was cooked perfectly.so good i would recommend this place to anyone .keep up the great work guys will be back and will let others know

26.description: 4*??  Seriously?  What a disappointment.  So many great pizza reviews, but we ordered the stuffed pizza and... well - just say NO.  The stuffed artichoke was horrible,  I am in shock that it lives on the menu.  However, the bruschetta was decent and ended up being my meal.  And to make things worse, it was supposed to be 1hr and 15 minutes... huh?  We got our food in almost 2 hours.  I'd say Mama Mia's has Al's beat - by far.  Sorry Al's... maybe stick w/ the stuff on your menu that is great and leave the rest off!

12.description: We came by this location because it was close to the hotel we were staying at. After having Gino's East and Giordani's this place can't compare. Although the other 2 places were deep dish this place was not even better then Papa John's. We ordered an extra large and had plenty of left over which I never touched and if you know me that's free food I don't pass up. The pizza was lacking flavor nor was the crust even crunchy.  I scrapped off the toppings and ate it without the crust. It seems to be a local favorite though there were a lot of people coming in and out to pick up pizza but for me it just wasn't my cup of tea.

21.description: We came by this location because it was close to the hotel we were staying at. After having Gino's East and Giordani's this place can't compare. Although the other 2 places were deep dish this place was not even better then Papa John's. We ordered an extra large and had plenty of left over which I never touched and if you know me that's free food I don't pass up. The pizza was lacking flavor nor was the crust even crunchy.  I scrapped off the toppings and ate it without the crust. It seems to be a local favorite though there were a lot of people coming in and out to pick up pizza but for me it just wasn't my cup of tea.

17.description: AWESOME pizza, My husband and I met Al at Roma's in the city. We didn't know about Al's and learned that we are about 15 min's from them (if we get stopped by a train it can be 20 to 50 min's LOL) so we checked it out. Like I said awesome pizza, it only has a few tables but nice, stay there or take home. From the people taking the orders to the delivery guys, all around GOOD FRIENDLY people.

10.description: We just moved in to the area and because of the good reviews on Yelp we decided to order from here.  Their thin crust pizza is mediocre with a tangy sauce.The kids ages 13 and 10 took few bites and decided to make some other food and my kids usually eat anything. Now I have basically a whole box of pizza with nobody wanting leftovers (this never happens)We also got  the appetizer combo which included fried zucchini fried mushroom and mozzarella cheese sticks.  Well we got whole bunch of zucchini a few mushrooms and 3 cheese sticks.Next time i'm ordering elsewhere.

5.description: Yes yes yes. We thoroughly enjoyed eating here. Thinnest crust pizza I've had in years. Lots of real cheese and fresh toppings. We were taking a shot in the dark via a YELP recommendation (out of towners) and we did well.

35.description: I probably order Al's Pizza once a month and every single time, it is perfect.  I recently moved to chicago and tried various local pizza parlors and i have to say, Al's Pizza is top 3 in my list.  Fast delivery, pizza is hot and toppings are delicious.  I wish we had pizza like this in California. Thanks AL!

19.description: i never have to pay for pizza here (duh the pops always foots the tab when im near his 'hood)...so maybe thats what makes it taste so goodor it could be cause its actually yummy thin crust w just the right amount of toppings :)

28.description: My favorite pizza in the Suburbs of Chicago .... Thin crust with sausage, red roasted peppers, fresh garlic .... Yummy :)Try it out , it's the best

3.description: I would do 10 stars for this place if i could! By far the best thin crust pizza around. They should have a warning sign outside letting people know that their pizza is highly addicting. My husband and I order from them every Sunday night. I could eat this pizza everyday. LOVE.

33.description: Pizza was awesome. Thin and tasty. Delvery was fast and professional. Great first experience.

43.description: Love the place.  Yummy food, very friendly staff, and super cheap prices.  My husband is a big fan of the eggplant parmesan sub, served with french fries that are so good that they're worth mentioning (they make 'em super crispy here).  I get a panzarotti with spinach, which is kinda like a calzone with attitude.  They describe it as a pizza folded in half, with cheese and sauce and whatever topping you want inside, either baked or fried (I get it baked).They have a cooler filled with RC products, both cans and 1-liter bottles.  The 1-liter bottles are less than 2 bucks and are the perfect size to share between 2 people, which is another way to save a little cash.

2.description: Worlds "WORST" pizza!!!  Ordered a Family sized sausage pizza....easy sauce.  The order taker said "enjoy"....REALLY???It was burnt and  tasted like cardboard.  I think they measured the sausage by the 1/4 tsp. ... I  asked for "easy sauce" and got.......NO sauce at all...My guests had brought the salad to accompany the pizza and I ended up throwing away the Al' s pizza and having  hot dogs on the grill with their salad.....how embarrassing!!!!   I will ... NEVER ...EVER....order from them again.   Definitely.. ... NOT ....Chicago's # 1 Pizza.  Really Sad!!!

18.description: My favorite pizza. Canadian bacon, mushrooms and black olives and def it is as good as it gets. Order the 18 inch and get a free cheese pizza, which is equally good. Note you must mention the free pizza when ordering. Overall good place. Not the best customer service I'v got, but as far as the pizza is concerned it is def a 5 star

41.description: We ordered delivery twice.  Most recently got the Western BBQ pizza.  My husband loves Moretti's version but they are just so expensive!  So we did Al's.  Very good variety on the menu and we were very pleased.  I will definitely order from them again.  I did take away one star because pizza was tiny bit on the greasy side, but still very good.

4.description: Good Pizza But EXTREMELY SLOW DELIVERY!  Called after 1 1/2 hours and didn't even get a tepid apology...just "It will be there shortly".  Customer Service is just as important as the food to me...

6.description: We order from Al`s every week... we LOVE their thin crust. Trust me,its very thin,and it`s awesome and delicious. Also I love their Eggplant Parm sandwich...

22.description: Terrible! Horrible service, cold greasy bad food, long delivery times. Got order completely wrong - phone person argued when we called about this. Finally got correct pizza over 2.5 hours after we placed our original order - and it was cold, crust was soggy, and it had way too much cheese - Pizza Margherita should not have 5 lbs of greasy cheese on it ; was absolutely disgusting - we ended up throwing it out, it was so bad. The Fried calamari was literally grease sodden and dripping with cold congealed fryer grease. Onion rings were limp, soggy and grease squirted out when bitten into! Unbelievable - and the argumentative and nasty phone person was the icing on the cake. We will never order from this place again - cannot recommend, my guts are churning from this kitchen nightmare.. ughhhhhhhhh.

15.description: Al's has a great thin crust pizza. I'm a big fan of the thin crust with pepperoni and garlic. I've also had the chicken parmesan with rigatoni, which was excellent. The bruschetta is some of the best around. I've met Al and he is a very friendly guy. It is always nice when you get a chance to see the owner behind a restaurant. It shows they are committed to running a good business and committed to the customers.

20.description: Awesome pizza. Never had a bad slice, for some reason I always over eat when I go.

36.description: Pretty good but they take way too long to deliver.

14.description: Stopped here on a whim  with no clue what to expect; color me impressed. Ordered a thin crust pizza with spinach and ricotta and, man, was it good. I love thin crust so I was surprised that theirs is a tasty, browned cracker-thin crust. Not at all heavy on the sauce and the dusting of oregano really bumped up the flavor a notch. A big plus was that the cheese wasn't anywhere nearly as greasy like some pizzas I've had--no need to reach for the napkins after every bite--nor was it rubbery. And they sure don't skimp on the toppings either. For me this was a perfect pizza and I'll definitely be keeping them in mind when I want a classier pizza than the chain stuff.

28.description: This was an awesome hotel restaurant!!!  It seems like they pick a lot of fresh produce and had a seasonal menu.  It's definitely a plus that makes me want to come back for a hotel stay or meetings.I got their salmon with season roasted veggies and it was a delicious dish.  The salmon was cooked well and the veggies were great.  I also got their smoothie which was pretty good.  They had a variety of good dishes I would want to try from pan-Asian to good ol' American.  All my colleagues liked their dishes as well.

1.description: Staff needs MAJOR customer service training. Hyatt website says it opens at 11:15am for lunch but reception staff insisted it's 11:30am. Then, 11:30 came (finally) and I was asked to go the podium to order, the staff person did not acknowledge me and went on with what he was doing. I stood there for a good 15min (was not even busy yet since they just started. I love Hyatt but not a big fan of this particular OH grill branch. Staff are not friendly and no sense of customer awareness. NO STAR  because I ended up leaving. Wasted my time waiting for someone to help me.

39.description: I've been trapped in the O'Hare Hyatt/Stephens Convention Center for the last few days and I've had the majority of my meals at O'H American Grill.  Now that I've left and returned to reality, I'm totally bummed that I don't have hash browns with my breakfast!  Overall, the food was much better than I anticipated, but the prices are kind of steep, especially if you get room service.

9.description: Considering O'H American Grill is located inside the Hyatt Regency O'Hare, the hotel restaurant isn't bad. I didn't actually dine-in, but had a $50 credit to my room, which I used to get room service breakfast.The Hyatt offers a cool feature allowing you to pre-order your room service using your smart phone, which I forgot about so I didn't use. The cut-off time to order breakfast for the next day using the phone or door hanger was midnight, which I didn't make in time, so I placed an order off my room's TV.My Natural Grilled Chicken Hash & Egg Whites ($13.50), along with my OJ ($3.50), arrived exactly at the requested time of 6:30 am. Expecting the usual bad, dry and bland hotel food, I was pleasantly surprised to find that my breakfast was edible, even tasting quite good. The chicken was freshly grilled and the eggs were real eggs (none of that powdered egg crap), and the cherry tomato compote was a nice topping over my healthy breakfast. Water was also given, as well as a side of complimentary muffins and pastries, such as a mini croissant, which I devoured.If I were to stay at the Hyatt Regency O'Hare again, I definitely wouldn't mind grabbing room service from here again! The hotel makes it super easy and convenient to order without leaving your room (or if you're not in the area), and the food is tasty enough.

29.description: We went here for Breakfast while staying at the Hyatt in Chicago. Sunday brunch was great.  They had a brunch buffet with chicken sausage, pork sausage, bacon, danishes, cereal, yogurt, home fries, scrambled eggs, an omelette bar, and fruit.  All for about $22/person.Great service and food was very fresh.  Coffee is also excellent.Definately reccomend.

23.description: Considering O'H American Grill is located inside the Hyatt Regency O'Hare, the hotel restaurant isn't bad. I didn't actually dine-in, but had a $50 credit to my room, which I used to get room service breakfast.The Hyatt offers a cool feature allowing you to pre-order your room service using your smart phone, which I forgot about so I didn't use. The cut-off time to order breakfast for the next day using the phone or door hanger was midnight, which I didn't make in time, so I placed an order off my room's TV.My Natural Grilled Chicken Hash & Egg Whites ($13.50), along with my OJ ($3.50), arrived exactly at the requested time of 6:30 am. Expecting the usual bad, dry and bland hotel food, I was pleasantly surprised to find that my breakfast was edible, even tasting quite good. The chicken was freshly grilled and the eggs were real eggs (none of that powdered egg crap), and the cherry tomato compote was a nice topping over my healthy breakfast. Water was also given, as well as a side of complimentary muffins and pastries, such as a mini croissant, which I devoured.If I were to stay at the Hyatt Regency O'Hare again, I definitely wouldn't mind grabbing room service from here again! The hotel makes it super easy and convenient to order without leaving your room (or if you're not in the area), and the food is tasty enough.

5.description: Sashimi was pretty bad. Bartender was really nice. Told him sushi was pretty bad but he didn't know what to say.   Maybe he should have done something but I think it's separate from bar.

31.description: Had a business lunch here. Had Lobster Bisque and a Cobb Salad. Food and service were excellent. Saved a trip away from the hotel.

25.description: I have to review this without even going here. My review of the menu is the pricing. Giving the price range as MODERATE  is wrong. An $ 8.oo bowl of oatmeal is not moderately priced.  A $ 14oo omlette is not moderatley priced. I expect excellent food at these prices.

12.description: We took advantage of the breakfast discount  wheb we checked in.  Brought the cost of the buffet dOwn to $15 which was discOunted on our room Bill.  The buffet had two types off sausage and bacon.  Pancakes and plenty of eggs.  A nice fruit bar was  full of plenty of breakfast food.  The meal came with milk coffee or orange juice.  Food was tasty.

37.description: My husband travels for business and usually ends up looking to me for where he should eat. I always come to Yelp and look at the reviews close to his hotel (I love that move-able map). Tonight he called late and he was starving! This was across the street from his hotel. When I checked out the menu and saw whole wheat pasta and some good fish options, I thought it would be perfect for my health conscious husband. He showed up and they were closed. Apparently if Hyatt isn't at full capacity they don't open the restaurant. So call before you go to make sure they feel like opening that day.

21.description: This place is actually pretty good for a hotel restaurant.  The food was fine but it was the customer service that earned all these stars!From the second I walked up to the moment I left, the staff was so friendly, so welcoming, I really wondered if I was in a higher end restaurant versus the fucntional restaurant in the center of this busy convention hotel.  The host was so gracious in welcoming me and even though I was a party of one, he sat me at a large circular booth so that I could spread out.  He also asked if I was there for the "McDonald's meeting" (I was) and then he generously thanked me for my business.  Wow!  Impressive customer service.  And my server and busser also went out of their way to make sure my coffee up was never empty or that I had everything I needed.In terms of food, they have a buffet but I chose to order off the menu.  My breakfast came up quickly and was good.  And the coffee was strong and black.  And the prices are in line with a hotel restaurant.But what I will remember from this visit will be the warmth of the staff and the host who really acted like he was happy I was there.Sometimes it's the little things.

16.description: Went during anime central, really bad food, not many choices, little to no service. They only staffed one guy to run half the packed place. Barely ended up with one drink, no refills happened.

17.description: Healthy menu is a good option. Food was good, vegetables steamed and portion size   reasonable. My salmon was tasty. My wife would have preferred the shrimp being less salty.Downside is slow service. Waiter did what we asked, however.I suggest ordering off of dinner menu and avoiding buffet. Would come back.

10.description: Dedicated place for breakfast and brunch. Smoked salmon was really good and the portion was so impressive.

11.description: This was an awesome hotel restaurant!!!  It seems like they pick a lot of fresh produce and had a seasonal menu.  It's definitely a plus that makes me want to come back for a hotel stay or meetings.I got their salmon with season roasted veggies and it was a delicious dish.  The salmon was cooked well and the veggies were great.  I also got their smoothie which was pretty good.  They had a variety of good dishes I would want to try from pan-Asian to good ol' American.  All my colleagues liked their dishes as well.

26.description: This is one of the best hotel restaurants out there.  I always get a nice steak and they pick good cuts of meat.  One downfall is they are often closed.

27.description: My oh my... I have been too busy lately with Midterms, Birthday Party, Finals, work, Anime Central, Flying to Korea, Going to Lollapalooza... Well, I am back! Time to review an epic breakfast I had at Hyatt Regency O'Hare's American Grill.Atmosphere:Management really took the time to make this hotspot within the hotel stand out. Seats were comfortable and plush. Modern furnishings and bold art pieces gave you something to appreciate in your surrounding. Everything was kept clean, and it feels really great to be watched by people passing by wishing they the money to eat the food being served. This atmosphere would also be great for dates. It is not very noisy at all and there is enough space between tables for intimate conversations.Service:The staff was very friendly from the moment the host seated you. Every server and chef was a pleasure to have an exchange with. The omelette chef that morning was especially cheerful when he was making me my delicious omelette. It is also rare to find a staff of waiters so attentive. I could feel them reading my facial expression and body movements whenever I needed something. Glasses were always filled, and butter and other condiments were prompt to appear when requested.Food:I shed a single tear the first time I came for the breakfast buffet for the first time. Never doubt the $18+ buffet, it is worth every penny. There are breakfast items from around the world and many gluten free options. Pita Bread with Hummus, Miso Soup, and all the fresh fruits! The Omelette chef made Omelettes to your exact specification as well. Is this what it feels like to have Breakfast like a god? The ingredient choices for Omelettes were plenty. I had an amazing Omelette with mushrooms and diced tomatoes. But my favorite item was.... The Chicken sausage. Was never a fan of sausage ever until this point in my life. It is a food I can't really compare to anything else. It is Tender, Juicy, and.... Just Good! This place is a good reason itself to stay at the Hyatt Regency O'Hare lol.  I never expected to wake up that day enjoying the breakfast of my life. Dinner here is about 4/5 stars for the price, but still worth enjoying at the second half of your day. Who knew breakfast could be so special? This is a place I look forward to every anime convention at the Hyatt. I would also like to give this my Stamp of Approval for places to take girls! You feel very classy eating here especially when you spy jealous eyes from afar.

35.description: I've been to several hotels ranging from 5 star to 2 stars. I also happen to be a nerd who enjoys comic book conventions and cosplaying. (Cosplaying if you don't know is dressing up in costume as a character, its a big part of the convention tradition, they even have costume contests) As it happend my character had black puffy hair and  face paint as well as a torn up shirt. I have short cropped red hair so i had on a wig, face paint and a torn up shirt. I was also probably a little disheveled as I had been running around a con all day.  The first person to greet us was super friendly, even complementary (he said my costume made a beautiful picture!)  After we were seated our waiter was very insistent about the buffet being a great deal. None of us got the buffet and  he seemed irked by this. He also seemed irritated that I knew what i wanted and didn't want any recommendations. After that the service was very slow.I felt like I was being judged on my appearance and/or choice of entreatment. The food wasn't worth that much wait. It was dencet food but I've had better, faster and at a lower price. The water boy, however, was amazingly fast.

8.description: This place is actually pretty good for a hotel restaurant.  The food was fine but it was the customer service that earned all these stars!From the second I walked up to the moment I left, the staff was so friendly, so welcoming, I really wondered if I was in a higher end restaurant versus the fucntional restaurant in the center of this busy convention hotel.  The host was so gracious in welcoming me and even though I was a party of one, he sat me at a large circular booth so that I could spread out.  He also asked if I was there for the "McDonald's meeting" (I was) and then he generously thanked me for my business.  Wow!  Impressive customer service.  And my server and busser also went out of their way to make sure my coffee up was never empty or that I had everything I needed.In terms of food, they have a buffet but I chose to order off the menu.  My breakfast came up quickly and was good.  And the coffee was strong and black.  And the prices are in line with a hotel restaurant.But what I will remember from this visit will be the warmth of the staff and the host who really acted like he was happy I was there.Sometimes it's the little things.

0.description: Service is good. The food is okay, and it's nice to have this restaurant in the hotel.

38.description: O'H American Grill is located in the Hyatt Regency O'Hare hotel. We eat at this restaurant for dinner every year when we go to the Fest for Beatles Fans and this most recent time was the best ever. They have great staff retention and we recognize the servers from year to year.They had a buffet that offered lamb, chicken and white fish, soup, a salad bar and dessert bar. My husband and father went back to the buffet several times and cleaned their plates. I believe the buffet was $22 per person. The only complaint was that the food wasn't labeled so they weren't always sure what they were eating.They bring bread to your table- Italian and wheat and refill your water glasses very attentively. I ordered off the dinner menu. I had the maple glazed pork tenderloin with potato dumplings and peas- WOW- it was absolutely delicious! The meat was cooked perfectly, it tasted amazing and it was presented beautifully on the plate. I am already making plans to return. I think that my meal cost $15.We were impressed with the attentiveness and friendliness of the staff which was better this time than in previous visits.  In the past when the restaurant was very busy it felt like we had to wait a long time to be served or for our check. For this current experience I give this restaurant 5 stars!

20.description: For being confined in a hotel, this isn't bad. Being part of the convention, the dinner buffet was 20% off. The prime rib was tender. There was only one vegetable, but the zucchini was really well seasoned. Places can make it so bland. I don't think any dressings are homemade. It's pretty standard. The service is good, and if your server isn't around, there are plenty of other staff around willing to help, including the manager. I love the layout of the place, it's very out in the open, almost circular shaped. The outer part is the bar, and to the left is the entrance. The mood is very different on each side, with the buffet in the center. The left is kind of cramped. The right is very cozy with mood lighting all around. There are gaps where you can see the people walking on the outer side of it. Trust me it's really cool. I went for breakfast the next day and passed on the predictable buffet and ordered eggs benedict, which was very good. The second night I knew to order off the menu. I got the parpadelle , ribbon type pasta with tomato sauce and shrimp. I substituted mushrooms for arugula. Home run on this dish and the shrimp were sizable and cooked perfectly.

19.description: This restaurant is inside of the Hyatt Regency Hotel. Very convenient if you do not want to go out of the hotel and the food is not that bad. It's just expensive. Your appetizers are going to be around $10 or more with your entrees coming in just about under $20.I got the all you can eat buffet. It had pot roast, grilled salmon, salad bar and some sort of oriental chicken tray. The taste for everything is mediocre. I mean, everything just tasted bland from the soup to the sauce in everything. I think for $22 buffet, it may have been better to get a entree for $14 or something.The decor is defintely nice and I can't say too much about the service since the buffet was self served. But given the look of the place and the price, it expected a more WOW factor. I'm not knocking the restaurant for price or service but the food definitely use an upgrade.Eat here if you don't want to get out of the hotel. Otherwise, head over to the other hotel restaurant (there's two of them in the hotel) and get something there. Now, I didn't eat at the other restaurant because it was packed. And seemed more like a bar than a restaurant. But yeah, you can also drive 5 to 10 minutes and get some better food.

33.description: I had a lovely dinner here a few months ago when I was staying at the Hyatt Regency O'Hare.  This restaurant is located in the lobby area of the Hyatt and conveys the feeling of space and sophistication.  We came here because we were at a convention at the hotel and it was convenient, so I was very surprised to discover that not only was the food excellent but reasonably priced to boot!  I ordered the smoked chicken pasta with bacon and mushrooms for $16.00.  It had a creamy sauce that was quite lovely!  The chicken was tender and juicy, the pasta cooked perfectly, and the sauce was sheer perfection.  There was plenty of food to fill me up!  I'm not in Chicago often, but I'll definitely be back for another meal the next time I'm here!

2.description: Just had their lunch buffet. Around $20. The variety of veggies could be greater. No vegan options in the hot food or dessert area. The staff was friendly except for the "hostess" whose standard answer to vegan/vegetarian questions was "I don't know but I don't think so". Had to ask her to ask the kitchen. She hesitated but luckily Nicole was walking by and over heard my questions and immediately offered to check with the kitchen. She was great!

34.description: Not bad for a Hotel Eatery.

32.description: I have had lunch here a few times when attending conferences at the convention center.  The food is pretty tasty for a hotel restaurant, and the portions huge.  The service is strange -- from intrustive and overbearing (the manager-type guy) to hands off and aloof (my waitress basically ignored my food needs [and didn't ever bring me a bread plate/basket], but once I had the check in hand, she wanted to chat a lot about books).  I keep coming back, though, because I can sit with a book for almost 2 hours and not be pressured to keep ordering things.

18.description: Not too bad, especially for a hotel restaurant (4stars is relative to hotels -- 3 stars otherwise I imagine). Very good coffee, good steak sandwich, good side salad. Steak was well cooked, which surprised me somewhat. Perhaps it helped that there was basically no one else there at the time, so my food got the full attention from the kitchen. Chocolate bread pudding is good, but huge. Chunk of eggshell made it in, unfortunately. And would be better with vanilla, not chocolate ice cream.The service was very good, perhaps also because I was basically the only person there.As for the atmosphere and layout, the design of the space lets it stay surprisingly quiet even when the lobby is crowded. Open yet "blocked off", private without feeling confined. Probably not good when many people are here, but good when only 3-4 tables are full.

41.description: They've totally revamped this Hyatt, and it looks pretty amazing!  This review is for the restaurant inside.  I like the way that the restaurant feels so open.  It almost has a loft like feel.  I had breakfast here, and it was very impressive.  I had the Two Eggs Any Style that came with a choice of bacon or sausage and roasted potatoes, and your choice of pastry or toast.  I had my eggs over medium, bacon, the potatoes, and toast.  They did a great job cooking the bacon.  It wasn't undercooked or overcooked.  It was all delicious.  The coffee was rich and tasty.  The juices seemed to be fresh, and we also had a complimentary shot of their strawberry smoothie.  They also offer two types of breakfast buffets here.  One that includes something made to order where a chef can personalize your omelet and has the widest variety at a cost of $17,  The other buffet includes pastries, yogurts, cold cereals, etc for $12.50.  Our waitress, Eileen was very on top of her game.  As great as everything was, I thought the place to be quite pricey for Rosemont.  I could sort of understand if this was the Hyatt downtown, but even still that's not totally justifiable.  My meal cost $11.50 and I know I can get a pretty good breakfast like that in the city for around $8 or so.

13.description: Overnight first time at this Hyatt Hotel.  Read from yelp this restaurant sound pretty reasonable.  For convenience, I went downstair for lunch.  A choice of salad bar, BBQ beef brisket. Shredded pork, salmon, Marconi cheese, soup & cakes for dessert for about $20 that's acceptable to me.There's a menu for other dishes as well.

4.description: I was actually pleasantly surprised with my lunch here. I was staying across the street at the Hilton and came here because the restaurant where I was at was pretty small. Was worried it would be really busy but it wasn't and we were seated right away and had really good service. I had the salmon blt with fruit and it was good! My colleagues had the lettuce wraps and the club sandwich and both said it was good as well. The only thing I'd complain about was the price, but it's expected in this area.

24.description: Really a 3.5.  We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights so I had breakfast here 5 times and lunch once.  That makes me an expert - LOL.  We upgraded to a package that included a buffet breakfast but had to laugh when we realized it only saved us $3 a day on the buffet (from $18 to $15).  For breakfasts, the buffet included your choice of omelets made to order, healthy veggie fritatas, scrambled eggs, 2 types of sausages, bacon (not always crispy - insert sad face), pancakes, and oatmeal.  They had yogurts, cereals, some fresh fruits (though not a huge variety).  Loved the rye bread, topped by a hunk of cheese you carve yourself out of a huge wedge.  Never-ending coffee and orange juice.  Otherwise, it was a fairly bland set of offerings.If you tend to eat in volume, the breakfast items are pricy enough that it's worth it to go for the buffet.  A la carte, breakfast items were in the $12-$15 range any way.

6.description: The menu is limitedThe service is terribleThe waitress didn't explain specials or tell me there was a buffet open or anythingI ordered lobster bisque and no bread or crackers - even though I don't eat them she never offered. She gave me a dirty lid for my left overs and just seemed like she rather be somewhere else.... Don't blame her but still there goes your tip

22.description: Probably one of the best hotel restaurants I've been to. The blue cheese wedge salad and sautéed spinach were fab as was the strip.

15.description: While staying at this hotel, I chose to eat at this restaurant. I had two meals there, breakfast and dinner. Breakfast was great. They have a good buffet that includes an omelet bar. They also have menu items you can order. I chose the steel cut oatmeal. To my surprise, it came with a wide variety of dried fruits, nuts, brown sugar, honey, cream and macerated berries. I was a bit underwhelmed by dinner. I ordered the scallops and grits,which is actually an appetizer. For $16 I got three mediocre scallops and a grit cake. It was meh. The bread service was delicious though.

40.description: stopped in here just the other day for a light lunch in between conference sessions at the stephens center. its a quick walk over through covered walkways (which was nice cuz of the rain). service was prompt, courteous and extremely professional. The food was quite good. They served delicious fresh baked bread before the meal; when i commented how good it was the waiter brought out an additional 5 slices to go with my soup. The presentation was quite nice and ingredients were fresh.the only downside that i can think of is cost. the food was a bit pricey, but cost-wise it was about what i would expect from a hotel. however, it was in keeping with the quality of the food.

7.description: Based on the other, more positive reviews here, I feel like I have to assume we just happened to visit on an atypical day.We came for the buffet lunch ($20 per person). Buffet offerings included many of the same things that were on the regular lunch menu, so we figured it was good to go ahead and have some of everything. The buffet included:-salad bar-rice pilaf-zucchini cheese bake-pan seared tuna-sauteed chicken-gravy?-some type of beef-whole wheat buns, lettuce, cheddar cheese, tomatoSalad bar didn't have bacon bits, but everything else you would expect on a salad bar. Every other menu item listed above was bland. Maybe they forgot salt, and other seasonings? Maybe there was a shortage at the spice supplier. Maybe it's me and my weird taste buds. Doubt it though.

36.description: Ordered the grilled salmon with veggies.  Very healthy and very good.  I like the menu here as it has a wide enough variety and their preparation and presentation is excellent.

30.description: This restaurant is inside of the Hyatt Regency Hotel. Very convenient if you do not want to go out of the hotel and the food is not that bad. It's just expensive. Your appetizers are going to be around $10 or more with your entrees coming in just about under $20.I got the all you can eat buffet. It had pot roast, grilled salmon, salad bar and some sort of oriental chicken tray. The taste for everything is mediocre. I mean, everything just tasted bland from the soup to the sauce in everything. I think for $22 buffet, it may have been better to get a entree for $14 or something.The decor is defintely nice and I can't say too much about the service since the buffet was self served. But given the look of the place and the price, it expected a more WOW factor. I'm not knocking the restaurant for price or service but the food definitely use an upgrade.Eat here if you don't want to get out of the hotel. Otherwise, head over to the other hotel restaurant (there's two of them in the hotel) and get something there. Now, I didn't eat at the other restaurant because it was packed. And seemed more like a bar than a restaurant. But yeah, you can also drive 5 to 10 minutes and get some better food.

3.description: I'm staying at the Hyatt for a few days for a conference. This restaurant was offering a conference special for $16 lunch buffet for conference attendees. The restaurant is small and doesn't accommodate quite as many people as necessary when there is a big conference there. The buffet had a few hot dishes and a nice salad bar but there was really not anything outstanding on the buffet. I will say that I for $16 I got a sit down meal in a place where they could charge whatever they wanted since its basically a captive audience. It did look like some of the things off the menu that were coming out of the kitchen looked good Maybe I will try them again and rather than getting the buffet, order from the menu.

14.description: Really a 3.5.  We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights so I had breakfast here 5 times and lunch once.  That makes me an expert - LOL.  We upgraded to a package that included a buffet breakfast but had to laugh when we realized it only saved us $3 a day on the buffet (from $18 to $15).  For breakfasts, the buffet included your choice of omelets made to order, healthy veggie fritatas, scrambled eggs, 2 types of sausages, bacon (not always crispy - insert sad face), pancakes, and oatmeal.  They had yogurts, cereals, some fresh fruits (though not a huge variety).  Loved the rye bread, topped by a hunk of cheese you carve yourself out of a huge wedge.  Never-ending coffee and orange juice.  Otherwise, it was a fairly bland set of offerings.If you tend to eat in volume, the breakfast items are pricy enough that it's worth it to go for the buffet.  A la carte, breakfast items were in the $12-$15 range any way.

3.description: Disgusting service. The promotion they offer have to fit in timeframe of the person in store and not what it says on board. I was in store at 5:56 and they have 3-6pm small latte promotion. The moment I say small latte he goes we dont have small its till 3-6 only. I said fine I will take medium and show him TIME that its not 6pm yet he diverts as if he doesn't understand english or cant see the time. I did paid and got a medium but atleast expected him to realize his attitude and apologize. I have similar attitude of the people working here w/different clients and always gave myself an excuse. But they need to understand too. People come to get coffee after long day or right at beginning of the day and deserved to be treated with a smile. I never see anyone friendly here whether you take a donut or stay 6 min till they make a sandwich n coffee.

1.description: I am absolutely appalled at the service I received at this location. Never in my life have I ever been treated with such disrespect. This was my first time ever to a dunkin donuts and was so excited. But that was immediately diminished by the rude service I received. I walked up to the counter and was told I'm taking too long to order without even saying a thing. I finally pressure ordered on the first thing I saw and they began to exaggerate the fact that yet again I was taking "too long" to order even though I was with my entire group. This service made me very disheartened especially since I've worked in the service industry for the last 7 years and would never think to treat someone like they treated myself and my family. I highly do not recommend and even sought out to write a review about the poor service and hope that you too do not give them your service.

2.description: The manager at this location is consistently rude to his employees and customers.   He yells at the staff in front of customers all the time.   He also gets the orders wrong himself in the afternoon and when corrected by the customer, he would be upset at the customer and say negative things on his native language in front of the customer.    They have messed up my order so many times I will no longer give any money to this location despite being the only food and coffee option here.   Coffee without cream and sugar should not be that difficult of an order to fill.

9.description: Donuts are good. Service is bad! They do not know how to coordinate during a morning rush. English is semi bad and cannot understand a word she says. They just need to coordinate better. They put too much cream in my coffee.!

10.description: It's Dunkin Donuts and its location at the blue line Rosemont stop is perfect for me.  The ladies that work there are very nice and once in a while they give you a free donut for no reason..

4.description: Friendly staff...small space as it is in the Rosemont terminal.  @ parts to it...the one that is o pen in front which is more like a internal booth, which closes I think at 10 (for early rushers to or from a bus)  and the rest of it is inside, which the store front itself can get easily cramped.Some people can complain about a language barrier or crappy service; probably because they dont want to or have missed the train.  I haev had no problem with the service.Will post pics.

6.description: Awe!  Yes, we stopped by in the evening and the man working there was so cute and so friendly, got,our order quickly and with a smile and some chatter.  It's a SMALL DnD... I don't know how they do it during the rush...

12.description: Went to grab some donuts for breakfast, however  this lady cashier got some badass attiude and was rushing to get peoples out of the store.  Donuts is not fresh, taste like it was left over from yesterday.  I wouldn't reccomend this place, go find yourself another dunkin donuts with an good attitude.

5.description: Great experience here. Service was incredibly friendly, prompt, and the donuts...... Oh the donuts. We got a variety of the 25 count Munchkins. They were great, nice and light for breakfast. My wife and I both got coffee. Excellent as well. Good place to stop if you're in Rosemont.

11.description: Chris I agree the ladies that work there are very nice...they gave me a donut today for no good reason. Saved me a buck!!!

8.description: Ok, I've been spoiled by Voodo Doughnuts in Portland, OR... But this is a good place to get a doughnut and coffee to start your day. Easy to find, a decent selection and the people are pretty friendly.

0.description: This place is not for the claustrophobic. Regardless of the time of day, they seem to have a full assortment and no shortage of donuts. It is the warmest place to be at this station. For that reason alone, it's worth stopping in and purchasing a donut or two with a cup of coffee. Their coffee is reasonable but more importantly, delicious!

7.description: Damn, you can get a lot of food for $5.Nothing like getting some grub before heading Downtown.

1.description: Saw the great reviews as I was deciding where to have lunch today. Stop in at Annetti's and stood at the counter, heard some voices in back, continued standing at the counter. Nobody bothers to come out to take my order and after 5 minutes of waiting I left. 1:00 in the afternoon, nobody checks up front to see if a customer is there and there's cash on the counter out in the open. Really sloppy way to do business. Won't waste my time going there again.

9.description: Sorry I don't like toppings on top of an already made pizza luke warm

23.description: I love pan/stuffed pizza but when we're in the mood for thin crust we call out and have Annetti's Pizzeria deliver.  Sure we have Giordano's next door and Gino's East down the street but I'm not really fond of them.  Back when I worked at an office I would go to this place for lunch too. It's then they sell pizza by the slice or I'd get an artichoke hearts & tomato salad.  Sometimes I'd order for the daily special menu, like on Fridays when they have their perch dinner.They also have appetizers like breaded mushrooms, parmigianas like eggplant a la parmigiana, seafood, chicken and ribs.  I also like that they have a wide verity of sandwiches and pasta dinners like tortellini with cheese or meat.  Granted I really don't think about desert when ordering pizza but in case anyone else is interested they have cannoli, tiramisu, and Eli's cheesecake.They also have a computer system so all you have to do is give them you phone number and they know your address for the delivery.  If you save the stamps on the front of the cardboard box (20 stamps) you get a free large thin crust pizza.I've never had a problem with their delivery service (which starts at 11am).  It's pretty quick and always courteous but they only deliver to Norridge, Harwood Heights, River Grove, Schiller Park, Franklin Park, Elmwood Park, Chicago, Rosemont, and South Park Ridge.

12.description: I.am.not.a.fan.I.do.not.like.overly.gre….I really don't get the fascination with Annetti's. I guess you love them or hate them. I fall into the latter category. I've never actually eaten inside, but the office orders them frequently. And every time I find that's what were having during our working lunch - I bring my own food. Trust me, I don't like turning down a meal, but the pizza and salad is nothing to rave about, nor is the rest of the menu. Furthermore, EVERY time I eat from there, I have raging stomach issues after. And no, I'm not lactose intolerant.Let's break this down. Pizza:- Crust always seems to have a burnt flavor- Way too much greasy cheese- Never enough veggies- Soggy in middleSalad: Imagine a gigantic platter of iceberg lettuce with a few random veggies and high caloric salad dressings. That about explains it. I haven't tried much outside the pizza, salad, and garlic bread. But, given my experiences, I doubt I will. They do have decent prices, coupons, friendly service, and fast delivery, but it's not enough for me. I prefer to stay out of the bathroom all afternoon after eating pizza, especially during work hours.Eww. I'll pass.

21.description: went here again for pickup. they were extremely nice. he even told me to go online next time and look for coupons and specials for next time.

16.description: 1 of my 2 Pizza spots! Just depends on what crust I am in the mood for. I haven't eaten off their full menu, just pizza and of course their delicious cannolis! I am a Pizza Junky! Again, 1 of 2 spots I would order from to show a Tourist what Chicago Pizza is all about! We're not all about 5lb Quadruple-dough flying saucers here!!!

17.description: Decent looking place feels like im in little italy hahafood is really good pizza melts in your mouthmanager is very nice guy been going their for 6 years :]

10.description: Small place. I was recommended it by a friend of the owners. This place has served me ,on the two occassions I have gone here, a doughy pizza with a lack of kick. I have never tried their menu outside of pizza but would be willing to give it a try because of the fun, family owned atmosphere this place provides. Upside of this place is that the pizza by the slice is pretty big and a decent value.

5.description: Real friendly ownership, great service and incredible food for the price. The pizza is great and we love the sandwiches. Our kids like the pasta and there are huge portions so it's really affordable.

11.description: The mark of a great local pizzeria is CONSISTENCY. Annetti's is the most consistent, and not to mention DELICIOUS pizza in the area. Some of the comments on here crack me up! This is NOT a sit-down restaurant. Yes, they have 2 or 3 tables, but they are known for carryout and delivery type foods. Compare apples with apples! This is the BEST in the area for what it is. If you want Chicago-style pizza this is where you go.

22.description: There are only 4 tables in this joint, so it's pretty cozy. I had a jumbo slice with sausage. It was a little dry and the sausage tasted way to sweet. The lady behind the counter acted like I was bothering her. Then her boyfriend walked out by my car and just staired into it? I don't get it either. I should have stayed in bed today.

0.description: i think this is the best pizza place in the entire city of Chicago.  I always get the tomato, basil, sausage and fresh garlic and its outstanding.  I have ordered here for many of my guests over the years and they all love it as much as I do.  you gotta try it!  Great job Annettis!

20.description: best thin pizza ever!

19.description: There are only 4 tables in this joint, so it's pretty cozy. I had a jumbo slice with sausage. It was a little dry and the sausage tasted way to sweet. The lady behind the counter acted like I was bothering her. Then her boyfriend walked out by my car and just staired into it? I don't get it either. I should have stayed in bed today.

2.description: I've had a few different thin crust combinations of their pizza and enjoyed them all. Apps are also decent and their delivery is super fast. To top it all off, they have RC!!!!

18.description: nice people, great food, even sent a meatball for our dog. highly recommend them, they donate to our church too.

13.description: Senora Annetti,Youve made me fat with your delicious Italian-American cuisine! Your hot deal special of an extra large one topping pizza with an order of hot wings have taken everything away from me! My wife, my kids, my executive level career, and that $24 dollars which I was saving for the next time I was suppose to order the hot deal. That wretched RC Cola. Why must you tempt me  (At least its not Diet Rite).  And curse your prompt and convenient delivery service! Curse them! ......... see you tomorrow. Love, Dominick.

4.description: The pizza was okay I went in during my lunch break couple days ago and asked for a slice of pepperoni it took 14 minutes to warm up a slice of pepperoni. I asked if there was anything already made was told had to warm them up.  15 minutes later I ate.  Don't get me wrong the lady at registrar was nice but if you're on lunch next need a  fast slice this isn't the place

6.description: This place is my own little guilty pleasure. Sure, the pizza is greasy, but that's what makes this little slice of Italy part of America! The pizza is pretty great, the wings are good, stuffed artichoke is greasy but good. Hell, everything is good. Makes me fatter, but meh worth it.

15.description: Ordered delivery. Pizza was average. Kind of doughy. Wings were bad. No sauce and a lot of batter.

7.description: One of the best pizza places ever! So tasty and amazing. A++++++ they also sell single slices. Only thing is they add the other ingredients on top and warm up the pizza. I guess they are pre made with sausage only and if u ask for an additional ingredient they just throw it on. So stick with sausage.

8.description: The deliciousness of the pizza here.... OMG! If i had to eat pizza for the rest of my life (which I wouldn't mind) Annetti's pizza would be the pizza I would choose!  The dough is phenomenal, the sauce finger licking good (did I just write that....) the grease that's on it makes this my favorite pizza near me!!  Try it, you'll be hooked!

3.description: One of my favorite pizzas so far and prob the best pizza in the area.I usually get a huge pizza with bacon, and it's perfection. The bread/sauce/cheese all works together and it's delicious. Delivery is always on time and I never had a problem with these guys. Go get yourself a pie!

14.description: We ordered food to be delivered...arrived on time.Now my friend orders from here all the time....his girlfriend was suprised that this time it turned out better than the other times...so I wasn't sure how to gauge the service...  I would have given 3 stars, not because of bad service....but I never been here before (although I know where it is at.  But the pizza was pretty effin awesomeThey do deliver to quite a bit of the surrounding area (according to their menu.)  and take orders up to 15 mins before closing.  Open for lunch, they offer a daily special, and the menu comes with a dollar off  "14, 16" or "18 thin crust, stuffed or pan pizza.

12.description: wrong place

3.description: Killer. Great food. Nice people. Every time a plate/bowl was placed in front of me, the food stood no chance. Didn't leave 1 crumb of anything because it was too good. This is probably the only place I'll ever go back for Chinese food because I feel spoiled.

1.description: This is one of my favorite divey chinese restaurant near my chiropractor's office. I've been coming here for years. It's located within a strip mall. I can only review about the food and take out. For dinning in, they do need a serious face lift. Everything looks old, like over 15 years old!Think of this place like one of those divey establishments in Chinatown, place is old looking but damn good food! I've had their egg rolls and crab Rangoon all crispy and tasty just like Chinatown flavors! I bet they use peanut oil for frying.I also order their shrimp fried rice, extra crispy cantonese noodles with chicken and vegetables.
