Their lunch specials are pretty tasty as well and you have enough for leftovers. The lady at the counter is very nice. She even remembered my face when I haven't been there for about a year or so.Overall, if you want that Chinatown flavored Chinese food, then come here and enjoy!

2.description: Some if the best Chinese in area! Actually probably the best Chinese I've had!! Everything is so fresh and hot when you get if. The egg rolls are amazing and you can't beat the cheap prices. Recommend this place to anyone that loves good food or Chinese food! Overall amazing and the owners are very friendly and loving people.

9.description: Have sampled this place over the years when I'm in the area. A great mom-and-pop place. There may be a slight wait. But everything is made from scratch. Check out their great affordable lunch specials. Be careful Thursdays and Fridays lunch can be busy

10.description: they over charge be careful, not bad food though, especially the wonton

13.description: Went there in Fall 2012 with hubby for dinner. Wait was extreme. Another couple came and I almost got up to knock on the door to see if they'd forgotten that both of us (both couples) were in the dining room. We started talking with each other to guess what they were doing back there. No one else was there for customers, but I noticed that a take out order went fast. Hm. I liked the combination fried rice- smoky flavor. Hubby did not like it. He always gets sweet and sour chicken and fried rice wherever he goes. I usually do something different to try the menu. His chix- nasty with hints of dish washing liquid flavor. My soup was supposed to be egg drop. It was a thick, congealed egg drop gravy. His chicken soup was the same texture, and just warm, not hot. My dish was not memorable and made me wonder what they were doing in the back that was so focus-intensive that customers weren't important. By the end of it, I wanted to like the place- fun name, close, but the food was just NOT the best and the service was the worst I've had in years. My husband's been doing Chinese every Friday for lunch for ten years and continues his tradition since we married. We do not plan return business after trying this place.

16.description: YUM...very good chinese food. Their chicken chop suey is to die for.  They take no more than half an hour to deliver your food also which is always a plus when your hungry.  The workers are always kind and curtious.

6.description: This place is rock solid. Hidden little gem for a weekday work lunch. Decor leaves a lot to be desired, but I don't come here for the decor. Food is fantastic, service is good. Best fried rice I've had in town. Awesome egg rolls. Great General Tso's. Amazing Mongolian Beef and Beef Broccoli.

15.description: Great food! I have been going to this place for about 20 years now.. My grandparents used to bring me as a child! The quality of food is always consistently good. Friendly staff but they can be slow, so be patient. Especially during their busier times. If it werent for the wait at times, I would give this place 5 stars. The food definetly deserves it.

0.description: This is truly top-notch Chinese food.  My mother is a major foodie and this is her favorite.  Once I tried it I was hooked.  It's a small place and not much on the eyes, but who cares when the food is super fresh and fantastic.  Their wonton soup is fantastic, their rice dishes and poultry and beef are excellent.  The owners are good people that are extremely friendly.  This place is definitely a staple.  I took my fiance here once and she kind of rolled her eyes at the look of it, but ask her if she's been back......yup.  ;-)

5.description: Great food. Every time I've ordered from here the food has been fresh and delicious. Try the shrimp with lobster sauce dinner special. The staff are always friendly when I call in and pick up too. Another plus, when I called in and asked to make a substitution for my rice, it was no problem and no extra charge. I'll definitely be ordering from here for my Chinese food fix again and again.

11.description: Hoa My is one of my favorite places for Chinese carry out.  They are located in a small strip mall west of Cumberland on Lawrence. The place is small and is best to pick up food though you can dine in if you choose.Hoa My is family owned and the husband and wife team are very friendly and customer focused. All items are made to order so you can spice up or down as you desire.When I have a cold my go to for feeling better is their Hot and Sour Soup.  They have some of the best egg rolls around, both veggie and meat.My go to items are:General Tso's ChickenShrimp and Chicken Lo MeinBeef SatayChicken with Pea PodsChicken Fried RiceOrange ChickenMongolian BeefCall ahead for your order, stop in and meet the owners and have a great meal

8.description: We got the sesame chicken it was dry and hard. Not your typical sesame chicken very weird taste to it. Fried rice is good, egg rolls ok...

4.description: Ive lived in this area practically my whole life and this restaurant has always been my families favorite for Chinese food. Delicious and the service is awesome. I'll keep coming back for their food for a long time.

14.description: Hoa My is my favorite chinese spot, hands down! I wish I lived closer. You will never find a hot and sour soup to match theirs. Never! Their lucnh is amazing. They have so much food and for a great price. Lunch usually consists of a drink, an entree, that could easily feed two people, and an egg roll or crab rangoon and soup for around $7. You can't beat that. The place is a bit small but we never have a problem with seating.

7.description: I like the food here, the portions are nice. If your a big eater and planing to get full, go ahead. I ate like a quarter of mine and took the rest to go.

3.description: I have curly hair and also color my hair. I will never go anywhere else than the Mane Event! Melissa is truly amazing! She knows exactly how to cut my hair so it's easy for me to maintain it! I am a girl who is always on the go and doesn't have a lot of time to do my hair. I am always getting compliments on my color! If you love your hair, you won't go anywhere else, but here! Great environment, friendly staff that give you what you want for your life style!!

1.description: I have been going here for about nine years. Previously I lived in Melrose Park. Since then I now reside in Indiana. Joe Culotta is my barber and he gives a great haircut. I judge a haircut by how long it looks good. Mine lasts six to seven weeks.  It's worth the drive for me to get my hair cut by Joe. Customer for life.

2.description: I was in town for a conference and was able to get in with Lous for a cut and a color. I fell in love with her. She did a fabulous job on my color and spent extra time drying and styling my hair. She gave me some great tips that I will use in the future. I will make sure she is my go to stylist when I return again.

9.description: While not frequenting "Mane Event" as often as I should--I was happy to see Melissa today who turned my Darth Vadar Helmut hair into a "Boardwalk Empire"  masterpiece...kudos to Melissa for another job well done...1000 Malibu Ken dolls could have been made from what was left on the floorSS

10.description: In town for a conference.  Great haircut.  Ironically better than my stylist back home.

4.description: Love this salon.  Jeremiah & Melissa are the go-to's for my entire family (including my 8 yr old daughter). They are accommodating and attentive. I go to them for everything; from my oh-so-important wedding day hair style to everyday cut & color. You won't find me getting my hair done anywhere else!

6.description: Salon is open until 6:30pm, but beware manicurist "doesn't stay that late". Very disappointed that business is not accommodating, perhaps as a nail salon it should list it's real hours of operation!

12.description: I love Mane Event!  I have been going to Karen there for over 10 years and she's the best.  I constantly get compliments on my highlights.  She also really listens.  A couple of months ago, I was not able to get in to Karen due to my busy schedule.  I tried the Sine Qua Non in Andersonville (which is MUCH closer to me!) and thought it could be my new spot, since it is so much closer.  BIG mistake.  I was treated like a number and felt like the stylist didn't really listen to what I had asked her.  So, I went running back to Karen!  I'm happy to drive from West Rogers Park to Rosemont to see a really professional stylist who does what you ask her to!

5.description: This salon is responsible for the worst hair cut experience that I have ever had. The stylist was very condescending and distracted by her cell phone which made me extremely uncomfortable through the entire process. She was not respectful of my requests and I really wish that I had gotten out of that chair before she made a mess of my hair.She bragged about being trained for years under well known stylists (Mario Tricoci and whatnot) and assured me that she had been in the business for over a decade and yet she did not seem to how the first thing about how to deal with curly hair. This resulted in an awkwardly shaped cut that I still have trouble with weeks later. At the end of the cut my hair was still not the length that I had initially asked for so I requested a touch up and she scoffed at me. I said that I did not want a blow dry and she proceeded to do it anyway. I explained how my hair naturally laid and what I wanted and she didn't seem to believe me and took it upon herself to make her own adjustments. I tried to contact the manager multiple times the following week about my experience and I could not get in touch with him. Never ever again.

11.description: I feel guilty that it has taken me so long to write this review, considering how amazing this salon is!!  I have been going to Karen for 12 years and I will not let anyone else near my hair.  I have a very strange mix of curly/straight/wavy hair and Karen is the only stylist who has ever been able to not only tame it, but make it look wonderful. I always get compliments. I trust her implicitly. Whenever I go in for an appointment, I am treated like family by the owner, Joe, and the other stylists.  I am very lucky that I live nearby, but I would definitely be willing to travel many miles if one of us ever moved!  The salon is located in a large complex, and there is free garage parking.

8.description: Was in town for business and was able to get an appointment with Joe for the same day. Very friendly and great haircut.

0.description: I was in town on business from Utah and stopped into this salon. Needed a quick haircut and didn't have high expectations. I was extremely happy with the results. Best haircut I have been given in years. Joe was friendly, considerate and extremely talented. I would recommend this place to anyone.

7.description: Karen and Joe never cease to amaze. We both went back and let me tell you, there is nothing like great hair that just puts a smile on your face! Chris looks great, and Karen added more highlights to my hair and did the cutest hair style. We weren't planning to go out that day, but with the new do, I just had to, it was a blast.  Chris and I are getting married in August of this year and we are both so thankful to have found such a fantastic Men's & Women's Hairstyling Salon. And the people themselves are just so nice, welcoming and very interesting to talk to. This is only our second time after 3 months and not only do they remember our names, but everything we talked about. You just feel so comfortable talking with either Karen or Joe, and they really listen to you. This place feels like home, well, a home where you get pampered and an incredible looking haircut / hair color.There is a reason this place gets high markings and I am so glad I checked yelp first.Thanks again Karen and Joe! You guys rock! :)

3.description: For what I need, this place serves my puposes and I'm in and out. Nothing fancy but good, fast, thorough work. I have gone wtice now for no chip manicure and both times they did a grat job and took less than 45 minutes.

1.description: I just had my nails done there and am very disappointed with the person that did my no-chip manicure. Very quick and sloppy work. She obviously does not care what and how she does it. The tips of my nails aren't smooth at all! I need to smooth them down before I get dressed cause I'll ruin my clothes. The polish near the skin is messy and uneven. WHAT A WASTE OF MY TIME AND MONEY! And she told me not to use lotion on the nails or cuticles - huh?

0.description: Closest nail salon to my work. Fast, efficient and friendly. The place isn't the nicest and they don't have a huge variety of colors ... But you're in and out with great results .. Mani /pedi $30.. Great deal!

2.description: I've gotten acrylics/manis/pedis here before. It's a decent neighborhood nail salon considering the one a couple blocks away is TERRIBLE.  There's usually 2 people always working here. An older male and a middle aged female. The female has a little attitude if you get picky with your requests but the guy is super nice. They have a younger family member who's about 9 years old that helps around the salon. The place is very clean and spacious and it's almost always empty with the exception of 2 or 3 customers.What turned me off about this place was that they charged me 25 dollars for a pedicure!!!! Also,the woman gave me a two minute massage with loose plastic gloves on that made it really uncomfortable for me.Like come on for that kind of service I can go somewhere in the city to get a MANI AND PEDI for 20-25$ I try to avoid this place. It's my emergency,last minute spot.

5.description: The lady owner of this place basically hates having customers. My sisters and I came here - I wanted a no chip manicure, my sisters both wanted mani/pedis. They told us that they didn't have time to do both a mani/pedi and they could just do one pedicure. I understand we didn't have appointments, but I have never been turned away for service. She did my no chip in about 10 minutes, and gave an attitude the entire time. Never coming back here again.

6.description: Great neighborhood nail shop.  Mani/pedi $30 great price

7.description: This place was really great. I got a spa mani/pedi. They had a large selection of opi nail polish to choose from. The guy who did my pedicure gave me the best foot/leg massage for just a pedicure, and he gave me a real good quality scrub down to exfoliate the bottom of my feet... Definitely not superficial like at most salons. His massage had really good pressure and very slow. It was awesome. They have good quality spa chairs, and they appear to be very hygienic. I was staying at a hotel nearby and took a cab over, and when they saw me waiting for a cab after they closed they even offered me a ride home! Super nice and friendly staff. If you live in the area you definitely need to come!

8.description: So, I took a week-long siesta in Mexico in the beginning October. It was mid-80's and sunny everyday. I drank margaritas and ate nachos and fell asleep by the pool. ::Looks outside office window:: I was a fool to leave. ANYWAY, prior to my trip, I made a pit-stop into Sunny nails. I used to go here in high school when I thought acrylic nails made me appear older and more exotic. Maybe if I saved that money I could Have taken a longer siesta... if ONLY I could have a chat with my 16 year-old self. Ok, enough heartache on my part. So, I go back to Sunny's for the first time in 10 years. EVERYTHING is different. No, not really. They've installed directv and LCD TVs. They exchanged their normal pedicure chairs for some beautiful, "massage me all over" chairs. They updated their nail polish. The rest, however, is pretty much the same. How comforting. The reason I am all but hitting you over the head with my vacation time-line, is to inform you that, here we are, 2 months later and you can still see the slightest bit of my "In a New York Minute" polish. yeah, OK, maybe I shouldn't have told you--It's a bit gross... Well, too late; It is all in the name of an honest review. It just goes to show you that a good pedicure keeps going and going and... That baby stayed put through many nail trimmings and baths and winter shoe wars on the tootsies. Now, that is a great pedicure. The staff is welcoming and accommodating. They bring you magazines. They ask if you want to change the channel. They inquire whether they are scrubbing too hard (NEVER). They refuse to let you leave until your nails are as dry as my winter skin... man I miss Mexico... 25 bucks. Great shade selection. Good brow wax as well. Plenty of parking. My favorite nail salon on the Northwest side--10 years ago and today.

9.description: Been here several times and the service just keeps getting worse.  Manicure was useless, terrible job, old polish, never dried.  The only person who does a good job here is the man.  Brought my daughter and the woman who did her mani-pedi, did her in about 10 minutes for a total manicure and pedicure, did not trim or clean under the nails or massage or anything. And she's rude.   Not worth the money.  They were pretty good a few years ago but now I will not go back.  They lost a good customer in me.  So disappointed.

10.description: Went here on a whim after hitting up Chase bank next door.I got a mani/pedi for $30.  What a steal!!Here are my ratings:4 stars - Pedicure.  The lady that works there did the pedicure.  She did a fantastic job!  The polish lasted a good 2 weeks and never chipped.  She spent a good amount of time on the heels of my feet and gave a great leg massage followed w/ warm towels.2 stars - Manicure.  The younger man (around 19) was laying on the front couch in the waiting area before he started the manicure.  Maybe he was a bit drowsy or something because first of all he finished the painting in about 10 seconds for both hands.  The polish was really uneven and bubbled quite a bit.  i was really disappointed.I highly recommend this place for a pedicure, ask for the lady, she's great!

4.description: I get the fake acrylics and at other salons they are peeling off within five days.  I have had them done twice here and they last well over 6 weeks which is a miracle for me. The girl did some amazing designs on them the last time I was there. Absolutely love the service here.

3.description: The bagels are good, and better than most. They always have a good variety, and you can always fund a coupon for a good deal. Either buy 6 get six, or half a dozen and a cream cheese for like $7. The cinnamon and sugar and the French toast are awesome, and they a really good variety of flavored cream cheese; really good! The asiago cheese is great for a sandwich, and they are rarely out of a flavor like many places. Better than Dunkin for a reasonable price.

1.description: HORRIBLE!!!! i used to love this place but they recently changed managers/ownership and NOW its litteraly the worst bagel place ive ever been to. #1 new owners (or what ever this mexican family wants to call themselves) were rude. Long waits for service while other employees stand around not taking customer's food orders#2 The quality has definately gone down drastically. For example, the blueberry bagels i used to get frequently were very flavorful, fresh, soft, and consistently same size. Now these blueberry bagels aren't even remotely blue?! Bland as hell, smaller size and would be better suited for stale dog treats at best. I warn anybody to take their $ and go somewhere else that doesnt want to waste it on stale garbage here.

2.description: What is better than coffee and a bagel for breakfast? My husband had bagel duty this morning while I made the coffee at home, and he came back with goodies from here! I loved my cinnamon sugar crunch bagel. You can tell they let the cream cheese get room temperature before they spread it on there for you, so it has the consistency of icing which is fantastic. He got the everything bagel which looked great as well. I can't wait to go myself next time to check out their offerings in person. And you can't beat the price either!

9.description: My husband works here. Great for big orders and parties.There bagels taste "real".Huge selection.Even bagel sandwiches.

10.description: I was early to work and stopped here. This place is awesome and unknown. I made a delicious custom breakfast egg omlette bagel thing. They hav a HUGE selection of homemade unique bagels and great selection of coffee. Its a really cool place to stop in and will be back to try their lunch.

4.description: Sometimes the bagels aren't fresh.....sometimes they are....If i want to take a chance I'll go to vegas.

6.description: Clean place. Good service. Good prices. Good food.A variety of bagel flavors, spreads, sandwiches and melts to choose from. They have other selections on the menu also like soup and cookies.The day I came I couldn't eat because my wisdom tooth was growing in so I had to stick to broccoli cheddar soup (it was OK). However, I bought a sandwich for my brother and he lovedd it! Mind you, my brother is the PICKIEST eater ever...I'll have to come back here to try some other things on the menu.

12.description: AWESOME blueberry bagels.  There bagels are always fresh and theres free samples at the counter too :) They have any kind of bagel you can think of from pizza to apple cinnamon but they are all good if you ask me.

5.description: Eh, the bagels were ok. Bought a dozen and they were good, but not worth a separate trip. Some weren't fresh. The honey oat one I ate was dry. The woman working the counter was nice. Cream cheese spreads were $3.50+ (pricey, so I skipped it), and the bagels were reasonably priced only because I had a ValPak coupon (buy 6, get 6 free), which totalled a little over $7 for the 12. If the bagels had been fresher (with a 10am pickup) I might return.

11.description: they never answer their phone... ???

8.description: Great selection of bagels, w/ some unique ones. Fresh made cream cheese and friendly help. Good stuff.

0.description: Back again,  Great place to get a bagel and read the paper.Owner is friendly.  Bagels much better than down the street.Coffee is help yourself and they have flavored creamers.Keep up the good work.I am enjoying the place.

7.description: The only thing that can make a Reuben sandwich better is to throw it on a bagel. Not only is this place convenient for me, but there is enough variety to satisfy any carbohydrate craving - from a lunchtime sandwich to a breakfast sandwich to a hot dog wrapped bagel to your standard bagel n' smear.A few years ago, this place was closed by the health department (which hasn't stopped me from coming back). When I walked up to get some carryout for my family, I was quite disappointed, but not as disappointed as the little boy who was told by his mother that he couldn't get a bagel that day and subsequently threw a tantrum. That's the power of the Great American Bagel.

3.description: I get massages quite often where I live - maybe every 6 weeks or so. I was in town and googled this salon and I am so glad I did! Best massage I HAVE EVER HAD! Spa pedicure was wonderful too and the prices are incredibly reasonable. Do yourself a favor and get in here!

1.description: I came here with a groupon for a 60 minute hot stone massage. Making an appointment was pretty easy - I just sent an email and received a response within hours. They were completely booked on the Saturday I wanted to visit, but I was offered a number of alternative weekdays. I picked a day and time and received a confirmation email the next day.The place is a bit difficult to find - it's on the first floor of a very large apartment complex. It's near the leasing office, by the main entrance, just down from the corporate center.I entered and was greeted pretty quickly. I said I was scheduled for a massage and they asked me to take a seat. No problem - I was early. I looked around, and got a little nervous. The spa/salon wasn't very luxurious. The walls were a pale pink with what seemed to be painted wooden letters spelling out "SPA" hanging on the wall. The front part of the salon had a few chairs for haircuts. As you head to the back, you pass the mani/pedi stations. I didn't see where the massage would take place.Right at my appointment time, Galina called me back. She's is the owner and I think the only massage therapist. She told me she offered the groupon to help bring in business, as she knew it was a difficult place to find and attract customers. She told me that she accepted medical insurance for massages, and that if you bought a package, the massages ended up being $45 a piece. She brought me to this tiny room in the back of the salon - it was just big enough for a massage table and a little room on each side to talk around it. She told me to undress, get on the table, and she'd be back.I did as she said and she came back in a few minutes. I was comfortable, and she explained she'd give a regular massage and incorporate hot stones. Sounded good to me. A few minutes into the massage, she asked me to excuse her. She opened the door to the room and told one of her employees something about scheduling, basically that the woman's appointment would be late and she had time to give a manicure. I thought it was weird, since she opened the door as I was laying on the table and anyone in the next room would have been able to see me. I was a bit annoyed, but it was just a quick exchange, and she started the massage again. Only a few minutes later, the same thing happened - she opened the door and told her employees something else. Galina apologized, saying the girl was new, but still, I was a little uncomfortable. The rest of the massage was without incident - it didn't happen again. However, although there was relaxing music playing in the massage room, it didn't block out the sounds from the mani/pedis happening a few feet away. I could hear whole conversation between customers and nail techs, so it took away some of the relaxing element.The massage itself was good. Galina applied a good amount of pressure and really worked on my muscles. The hot stones after the massage of each body part felt really good. The heat really made the massage a lot better. I left feeling relaxed and my muscles felt great.So the pros: great massage, reasonable pricesThe cons: a little bit unprofessional, not a very luxurious atmosphereI would go back though, as Galina did a great job on the massage.

2.description: I typically go to the larger name spas so I was a little skeptical going to more of a local spa. I am glad I went against my normal routine and to try Pavilion Spa out. I called around to a few local spas and when I asked for appointments they all stated they were booked and just hung up. When I called Pavilion they worked with me on time and really fought to earn my business. The salon owner, Galina, met me at the front door to show me to the salon and introduce her team to me. Overall, the customer service she showed me was outstanding. Oxiana did the facial and she was hands down the best esthetician I have ever gone to. She explained the product and addressed the concerns I had.Overall, I would recommend this salon for its customer service, affordable price, and knowledgeable staff. It also feels good knowing I am spending my money to support businesses in the community rather than just another chain company

9.description: I have been to this salon several times and it has just gotten worse and worse.  I made an appointment earlier in the week for a haircut for me and an eyelash tint for my mom.  I showed up today for my appointment and called because I couldn't get in the building (as usual, the place is a maze and I seem to have to go in a new door every time) to ask how to get in this time.  They told me they had no record of my appointment and the girl who would have been doing it was already gone.  This place is supposed to close at 8pm not 6pm! Why is their person already gone? This is not the first time this has happened.  It's always something.  If they do have my appointment, the right person isn't in or they're not going to be able to do all my services.  This place is so disorganized it's not even funny but every time something went wrong someone had a sob story that got me to come back.  Not this time.  Avoid this place.

10.description: This is my go-to spa.  It's very reasonably priced.  I started going there because I was new to town and in a pinch and needed a masseuse.  Galina is an AMAZING massage therapist.  I always leave there feeling 100 times better.  She goes above and beyond, even coming in at 7 pm on her day off when I explained that I had a bad kink in my neck, such that I couldn't turn my head.  As usual, left feeling so much better.  Also, Lubna (spelling? she's Moroccan) gives great manis/pedis and is a phenomenally good hairdresser, not to mention she's a very nice woman.  She cuts my two toddler boys' hair better than anyone I've ever taken them to.  She is thorough and very fast when she needs to be (like with kids!), and they come out looking dapper.In reading other reviews, I agree, the decor is dated and it is a bit basement-like.  However, the women that work there are pleasant, skilled professionals, and I would go to a back alley if it meant having them provide services to me, especially for the very reasonable prices at which they offer services.

4.description: I'm a little torn if I should give 3 or 4 stars... So will give them the benefit of 4.I was here 2 times for a pre natal (pregnancy) massage.  Galena gave the massages (not sure if anyone else does there).The massage is very affordable - $60 for about an hour, however, I am not sure how truly versed she is in prenatal massage as there were some things that were different from other (4+) such massages I've had elsewhere (although she may give a number of them). The good:- she really got into my back, and relieved a lot of the tension and pain I was having- uses a very nice lavender oilThe questionable:- she rubbed my belly/baby... No one else has done that to me; didn't really seem to do anything- felt a little weird- every other prenatal massage I've had gave me a ton of pillows for comfort, surrounding most of my body, between my knees, etc, to make lying on my side more comfortable... Not the case here - just on the table with a small pillow where someone lying on their back would bend at the knees- she had me on my back too long.  I get there are some things that are better administered when you are on your back, but I ended up focusing on trying to breathe instead of enjoying the massage.  She did give me some extra pillows so I could elevate my head to her credit when I asked (but i would think that anyone claiming to be versed in prenatal massage would have just  avoided having the client on her back)The not so good--This place is in the back of a hair and nail salon- although there is soothing music in the background, the loud polish chatter from the front is very distracting -the room is also the waxing room so really smells like wax-the first time I went the room was FREEZiNG - would have been solved simply with a space heater...2nd time was not as bad, but still cold.I'd go back bc of price and location I suppose, probably would not go out of my way to travel here though.

6.description: I really like this spa.  As far as facials go Oksana is wonderful.  she is not afraid to get in there and do all of your extractions and she uses some great products that smell wonderful!  I went to Oksana right before my wedding and she did an awesome job...My skin was glowing!I did have a massage with Galina, and it was pretty good, nice and firm.... However her nails were long and did scratch me a bit.  But I will say that even in spite of the scratching I left there feeling like butter, my muscles were nice and loose and I was totally relaxed.The only thing that brings this place down to four stars is the salon itself.. Its almost like a basement, but having said that their prices are very reasonable and it is an enjoyable experience overall with very skilled staff.

12.description: This is my go to spa. Both my husband and I love the massages performed by Galina - massage therapist and owner. I also go to Oxsana for facials, waxing, manicure and pedicure. She is very very good. I like her a lot! After you become a loyal customer she will drop the prices for you. They also do eyebrow threading, cut and color! I highly recommend this place to everybody that lives in the O'Hare area.

5.description: Was at a conference needed to get my back to feel better this was the BEST message I've had in years!!

11.description: This is a wonder salon and spa on the far northwest side of Chicago.  Galena, the masseuse, is absolutely great.  Vaska, the hair stylist has been cutting and coloring my hair for about 3 years now and always does a wonderful job. They are a full service spa and salon and do manicure/pedicures, waxing, facials and many other services. The prices are very reasonable for the fine quality of service you receive.  I highly recommend them to everyone.

8.description: I went to Pavilion with a group of girls for a friend's birthday party.  They had the best prices she found for all the different services she was looking for to accomodate all of us (group of 6).  The tricky part of this salon is finding it. It's actually inside an apartment complex, in their "mall," down the hall from their leasing office and pool. And if you call, you may not always get a live person (which is annoying when you're driving around the block trying to figure out where it is).Being on a budget, I opted for just a full body massage, which was not "just" a massage.  It was fabulous. Galina is very knowledgeable. She can do lymphatic drainage for swelling and had this cool suction cup technique, as well. While I didn't have the other services, my friends who had the facials were glowing when they were done. And the manis and pedis looked great.  I won't be driving out from Naperville on a regular basis, although Galina was wonderful (and I already have my fav massage therapist). But if I was living in the area, I might be a regular.

0.description: Galena and Oksanna are without a doubt the best massage therapist and esthetician I have encountered. The spa may not be a 5 star spa like some of the reviewers mention here, but you will get the best service ever. I have been a return customer for years now, and they never disappoint. Thank you for your awesome service!

7.description: Really great spot with exceptional service and very reasonable prices.  Had a wonderful facial with Oksana (? spelling) and a massage with Galina.  Being there was like being amongst family and friends, I really enjoyed the experience.  Products used are very high quality as well.  Must try!

1.description: This place is horribile. The girls that work there have the biggest attitude,and God forbid if you have a question to ask!  Don't expect to find many lotions, or good deals!

0.description: I bought a  membership, tanning lotion and tanning goggles for my girlfriend for a valentines day! But unfortunately my girlfriend decided to quit tanning and I didn't know about it. So, when I came back few days later and  tried to return this stuff they told me that their policy doesn't allow to do that . They can only cancel a membership without refund. What a beautiful place!

3.description: When Michael's first opened in the place of Deli Time, I was excited. DT had great breakfast sandwiches but that was about it. Lunch was HORRIBLE. I heard Mike was moving in,checked out their menu and really got excited! Everything seemed fresh and it looked like they would have a better selection. Boy was I wrong. First of all, don't open if you are not prepared. The first week was HORRIBLE. The cooks had no idea how to actually...I dunno...cook. Was "short order cook experience" not on the application? The food took forever and the service was sub-par. They've gotten a little better but not by much. Aesthetically this place looks like a hospital cafeteria. I think they were going for the modern look but the concrete floors, white walls, and high school cafeteria tables and chairs are horrendous. Not to mention that they opened with signs that were printed in size 8 font. Hold on, let me break out my binoculars I get a uhhhhh...ummmm....oh hell I can't read the damn menu, what do you actually serve? They have since gotten larger signs with actual prices and a complete menu selection. Guess I complained loud enough huh. The only thing I get from this place is the coffee because it's Dunkin. However its on a little ass table in the back and the trash can is seriously a bathroom step can. So of course there are sugar packets and mixing sticks all over the floor. Here's a thought: get a bigger trash can! The salad bar is pretty decent (took them a month to actually open it up) however the rest of the food is bland, the specials are weak, the cashiers seem to always be away from the cash stand and you have to flag them down. WACK, WACKNESS, WACKTACULAR. Too pricey, not worth the $9 on a sandwich and beverage. Get in your car and go else where!

1.description: I was headed to a nearby insurance class and I wasn't feeling 100%. I was hungry though and knew that it would be about four hours until I'd have an opportunity to grab a bite. Michael's on Main was convenient, so I wandered in. This is a lunchtime office building spot to scrounge up quick eats and gossip with your cubicle neighbor. Quick?  Yes. Good?  Not so much. I was alone and made a quick decision to try the stir fry. They had grilled chicken and beef (I don't think steak was the appropriate term).  I tried a combo of both which came with a scoop of fried rice, teriyaki or BBQ sauce (I went teriyaki) and an egg roll. The food was served in a styrofoam container. When I went to pay there was confusion about who was ringing me up and I eventually paid just under $9 for this pre-cooked combo and a vitamin water zero. I found a seat at a wobbly table and started to eat. The beef was very fatty and lukewarm. The chicken looked nice but left a funny aftertaste. The rice was pretty mushy, but had a lot of egg for those who are a fan of that sort of thing. The egg roll is the only thing that I ate all of. It was crispy, lacked flavor, but at least didn't taste bad. My vitamin water was delicious!  ;-) Trash cans were basically full at noon on a Tuesday. No one wiped tables or emptied the trash or paid any attention to the dining area while I was there. It was a major disappointment and I wish I would have just grabbed fast food while I was driving to the area and ate it in my car.

2.description: I've been going to my building's cafe for well over a year before I realized Michael's was available right next door. I'm glad I did because what I was used to was certainly not good enough.I like getting their menu sent to me online and they have good open hours too. I like the layout and the variety that they have.What I usually love more than anything at Michael's is their salads which hits the spot for me almost any day of the week. They also have different sandwiches and entrees that get my attention from time to time.They do have a frequent buy 10 get one free card but I just wish you can use it on salads, entrees or sandwiches instead of one of them(picked randomly for the month).

5.description: what the hell are you people complaining about.  it's fine.  it is what it is.

6.description: Donisha's review about says it all. While her "HORRIBLE" nicely sums up my experience in one word, I think her 2 starts are WAY too generous.  I can get better food from a can.  And the *chef* reminds me more of my high school janitor than anyone remotely familiar with *cooking*... sigh.

7.description: I wasn't impressed by the che's special entree of chicken with veggies. The chicken is too salty and dried out my mouth. It's a pretty hopping spot, so perhaps there's something better, but I don't think I'd try them again.

8.description: There is no way to sugar coat the fact that this place is gross and disgusting.  You can clearly see multiple food safety violations going on there at all times.  The quality of their food is extremely low.  The only reason I've ever subjected myself to this dump is because it's the only place within walking distance of my office other than Dominick's.  I'm to the point where I'd rather skip lunch altogether than give this place another penny of my hard-earned money.  If the thought of having a bad stomach ache all afternoon is your idea of fun, have at it; otherwise stay as far away as possible.

9.description: You can not compare this place to its former tenant Deli Time. That's apples and oranges. I welcome Michael's on main with open arms. The food is a thousand times better, the prices are cheaper, better menu selection, better layout, friendlier people, etc. While I have not had the breakfast, I have had many of the lunch options and can say I was satisfied every time. The salad bar is average the soups are delicious. They have a email list for you to know the wide variety of weekly specials. I would have to say the biggest complaint is the tiniest menu font possible.

0.description: Michael's on Main Café is my walk away from my work place for lunch.  It's located within one of the office building that is open to the public.  They are only open for Breakfast/Lunch hours 7am-2pm M-F so don't come here for an early dinner.They have daily specials on the menu.  It has a salad bar to make your own salad by the pound or you can order their specialty salads of the day such as chicken chopped salad with all the fixing.  They also sell hot dishes like "chicken Marsala", wraps, burgers, hot dogs, etc.  I usually get their veggie wraps which includes artichoke, ranch dressing, grilled veggies which they also use a panni press.  I also get their homemade chips which are made offsite since they no longer serve any fresh fried foods like regular or sweet potato fries.  If it can be grilled, pressed, or nuke then they can do that.I heard from my coworkers that the meals are pretty decent but nothing that I would go out of my way to eat there every day.  They also serve breakfast like omelets all day long and prepackage items as well like fresh fruit, yogurt, drinks in a can or fountain drinks.  The prices are fair and if you sign up for their points card then you can earn free points for being a customer and get your meals free...SWEET!The dining area is bright with plenty of seating with windows to view outside and they also have a flat screen TV and an area where you can lounge.   Overall, it's an OK place.  I'd go back when I feel like taking a long walk away from my desk.

4.description: I am a big fan of Michael's on Main.  I love the sandwiches here.  They are cheap (around $5 subs) and tasty plus filling.  They come with a side, usually a pasta salad or chips and a pickle.  The sandwiches are placed on the griddle to give it a nice crunchy crust.  Tell them to add giardiniera on top to make it better.  I also had the tomato soup once and it was the best tomato soup I've ever had.  Very very good.

3.description: What can I say... I've been a captive customer for the past three years as my office is across the parking lot and I don't own a car.  I did not come here regularly (maybe twice a month) and every time I've walked away disappointed.The staff and upfront experience is quite pleasant, however, the quality of the drinks leaves you wanting.  For some reason every time I've purchased one of the 'specialty drinks' I've never had one made to the same standard as stand alone locations.  The Frappuccino's are watered down and the Macchiato/Lattes have to much milk or sugar so you can't taste the underlying coffee.  Even the coffee managed to disappoint today.  The taste is fine the problem is that the cup was only 2/3 full.  I didn't realize this until I got back to the office as it's to hot to drink right away.To rub salt in the above wounds it's more expensive than other locations and they don't honor any promotions.If you can help it, do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.

1.description: As I walk in, I'm sweating bullets.  I cut the enormous line and someMom with a Stroller yells "excuse me!"I ask the fat lady behind the counter for aMoment of her time. She says "wut?" And I say "bathroom key, now!" I dump my every loving brains out& when I walk out, it's not what I expect...The bartender manager says to get out or expect police action.  Without saying a word, I leave. You don't want my business? The place was jammed and just because I doing my "hold a shit dance" while I listen to the last guy blow dry his hands too long, doesn't mean I don't want my usual espresso and water (Americana). Needless to say, I won't be coming back again.

2.description: Hard to find. I ended up finding it as I was walking to the train station. But it's your typical down sized starbucks. Nothing crazy to.expect besides your standard coffee.

5.description: Same coffee as all the other buckies but the people who work here are amazing!Also, there is a AA meeting spot around the corner so they like th hangout here a lot and talk very loudly, not sure if their hearing went with the addiction but they do like to scream!

6.description: This is a solid Starbucks.  They are located in the Rennasaince hotel on  Bryn Mawr. There is typically a long line from the events going on in the hotel. The good news: they are quick and the hotel has outdoor seating right outside the door near Starbucks.

7.description: The first to review a Starbucks? Really? In Chicago? Where city dwellers can find a Starbucks on every other block?I don't think there are many people that know about this location inside of the hotel. Except the hotel visitors and the folks in the six close-by office towers.Since I work in one of those nearby office towers and since this is the season for giving thanks, I am very thankful for this coffee shop being in this particular area.  It didn't take the staff long to recognize me. They probably won't ever know my drink because I switch it up quite often. The are friendly and make a good drink. That is all I an ask for in the morning!

8.description: The worst Starbucks ever are here. Stopped here before work and I was waiting for regular coffee for 20 min, and there was only 3 people in line so I don't understand what was the problem to make a it. They don't have a microwave so if you prefer warm cheese danish or croissant it is not the right place ..

9.description: Like the guy above said - not sure why aren't there more reviews. This location is just as busy as their others. I come here often. It's nice, clean, and baristas are very fiendly.

0.description: I was looking for the closest Starbucks to where I was and it took me to this location. When I arrived, I thought Google map had failed me because it took me to a big parking lot of a hotel/business building. It wasn't until I looped back around the hotel roundabout that I saw the Starbucks store. It is located within the hotel itself. They also have short term parking in front of the store for you to just park and grab coffee and go. Very convenient.

4.description: I love the staff at this Starbucks because I feel badly for the hell they take daily Clearly management needs to start supporting them! Long lines, way under staffed, consistently out of products, computers not working and you don't recognize the rewards program. Starbucks should reconsider locations at a hotel that can't support the staff or customers. Are you aware that customer service suffers because the staff have no help?

3.description: Be prepared for long lines and workers who can't listen and take you order down wrong.  Speak Loud and Concisely!Long Lines are due to the conventions held there.

1.description: This place needs a sister store upstairs!!! A convention center can not rely on one coffee shop. 20 minutes for one coffee is too long!!! Service was old and product is all the same.Pastries somehow remain stocked.

2.description: This Starbucks is located within the Donald E. Stephens Convention Center. It's on the first floor and, as far as I can tell, it's an actual Starbucks (not simply a place that "proudly serves Starbucks coffee"). However, my credit card statement shows their name as Aramark, so it's anybody's guess.It recently opened and is a much welcomed change from the strange Hummel museum and the half ass cafeteria that used to take its place. I imagine it becoming quite swamped during large conventions. I'm really worried that for as many baristas as they have working, there seems to be a lot of confusion.The line moves somewhat slowly, they wait until you're at the counter to take your order instead of lining it up as you come in (as I've seen others do) and I need to repeat myself constantly to get my order right, which is somewhat strange since I only get an Outrageous Oatmeal Cookie (what?). The Oatmeal Cookie (the what?). Oatmeal Cookie (ooooh, ok.) And can I get that warmed up? (um, what?). Especially strange since they look at me like I'm crazy, but I looked at them crazy when they asked if I wanted it that way the first time and I was pleasantly surprised.I know I'm not the only one who has had issues either, though. I've been witness to quite a few people with wrong orders in the past 4 days. Hope they work the kinks out.

5.description: This location is the slowest I've ever been to. The staff has NO sense of urgency. I just stood in line for 30 minutes with 15-20 people in front of me. Also, they let you earn rewards but won't allow you to cash them.

6.description: Wow these people on these reviews are a little harsh. They're probably those stiff people who need to relax. I thought the Starbucks was actually really a nice location. I was there for the jewelry show and the workers were so nice. They looked like they were working really hard to help each costumer. Even when demands from some people were beyond rude. I actually encountered very rude people in line next to me. The employees couldnt have done any better. Great drinks and great service.

7.description: Didn't read the other reviews, but being a Seattle native I'm well versed in coffee stands.  Not only is this place slow, but the workers seem angry and not well educated on Starbucks standards.  If there was another coffee place within the convention center, this Starbucks would be out of business!!!!

0.description: It is what is. I'm just grateful there was SOMETHING here. The walk from the parking garage to the convention center is long and cold. The line to purchase tickets to the motorcycle show was also long. We can feel the wind blowing in every time someone opened the entrance door. Because there were two of us, one of us was able to step out of line and make a purchase from Starbucks. It helped warm us up while we waited in line.

4.description: "Not up to normal Starbucks standards" should be their bi-line. Was at the center for a show on a Sunday. Being Sunday, the show wasn't making this Starbucks any busier than any other Starbucks I go to on a weekend. Ordered a brewed coffee. Was told they were out, despite the sign for it on the machine. Anywhere else they offer a pour-over. Not here. So I settle for another brew. Normally, it is ready before I'm done paying. Here I was forced to wait for 6 blended drinks to be made before anyone could pour pre-brewed coffee in a cup. Coffee tasted fine, but that really isn't a major accomplishment, is it?

58.description: Kind, expert, professional service. I had never had my eyebrows threaded before, and was a little nervous, but Pratima did a wonderful job. She even gave me great advice on how to continue to shape them at home. I will definitely be returning.

56.description: I've been here twice, both times arriving with unkempt brows and departing with expertly shaped, groomed ones (without excessive redness)!  The women I have experienced are very nice, efficient, and fair--when busy (e.g. Saturday late afternoon), they serve on a first-come, first-serve basis.  Their establishment is very clean, and the employees take care to carry out sanitary practices, as well.It's also worth a mention that the prices can't be beat--$9 with cash and $10 with card.  Leaves room to leave a generous tip!I'll be sad when I move out of the Lakeview neighborhood, since this place won't be a 15-minute walk away, but I may just have to make some special trips each time my eyebrows start taking over my face.

29.description: I walked in to get my mendhi done for my wedding along with getting my eyebrows and upper lip threaded. These ladies were super nice, fast, affordable, accommodating, and even fed me sweets during my 4 hour stay. Highly recommend!

42.description: Ive been coming here for about a year now. I moved further away but I still like to stop by here to get my eyes threaded about once a month. They do a good job, and you get a discount if you pay cash!

23.description: Finally. someone got my arch right. It's so hard to find someone that won't thin my brows out or round out my arch, which is naturally angled. I wish I remembered the name of the lady that did my threading because she was fantastic, and clearly an expert. Super affordable, quick, and skilled. Highly recommend Lakeview Threading!

47.description: I have been coming here every three weeks for the past  7  months or so.  I Love, Love, Love this place.  This is the place to get your eyebrows and henna done!  Very professional and friendly.  I am excited about the eyelash extension service that will be coming soon.

8.description: Bring cash !!! And it's a little tricky to find because there are construction things blocking the business name . It's the first building after the alley on Belmont right after light . they did a nice job . Cleaned up the mess that is my eyebrows lol

31.description: First time here and I'll start with giving them3 stars (may change later) but I rate three starts due to price and results. Price: I used to pay $4 back east for eyebrows in a salon (not discounted) but $9 isn't outrageous so I'll deal. Results I wanted to go to Pratima (based on reviews) but she wasn't working and I had to get them done.. I ended up with Pinkal which I wanted to avoid (again based on reviews) but I gave her a try... Long story short... The result is passable.. B- for a grade... I'll give them another shot my next go round but I don't think I'll go back to Pinkal. To be continued..

34.description: These ladies do a great job of threading. Their pricing is a little high considering there's a place I go to near Lincoln and Barry and another lady in the movie theater building at Diversey and Clark who are both cheaper. But the lady at Lincoln and Barry is on maternity leave for awhile I think so I was desperate for a quick solution. This shop is easy to find and walk ins are welcome. They shaped my brows nicely. I need to go back already. Damn facial hair!

16.description: I've been going to threading places for about 10 years. And I will NEVER go anywhere else again. I absolutely love them here, they focus on your eyebrows and it shows.

13.description: First time here and I'll start with giving them3 stars (may change later) but I rate three starts due to price and results. Price: I used to pay $4 back east for eyebrows in a salon (not discounted) but $9 isn't outrageous so I'll deal. Results I wanted to go to Pratima (based on reviews) but she wasn't working and I had to get them done.. I ended up with Pinkal which I wanted to avoid (again based on reviews) but I gave her a try... Long story short... The result is passable.. B- for a grade... I'll give them another shot my next go round but I don't think I'll go back to Pinkal. To be continued..

11.description: I wish I can give this place more stars!!! Pratima is simply the BEST and so is her staff. Friendly, patient, gentle, and talented. The salon is always clean and they wear gloves and sanitize the equipment. Pratima takes a lot of pride in her work and will work relentlessly to get good results. I know this as I have been going here for 4 years!!!!  Simply the BEST!!!

39.description: I went in for the first time today. They were welcoming and wanted to know my name, as a new customer (in a non-creepy way).Customers are seen on a walk-in basis. I was taken immediately. All regular services are performed in the main area, like a hair salon, which was a little awkward but no one else seemed to feel that way.The person I was with shared my sense of humor about how much it hurt (first time with threading), and it did get easier as she went along. It took just a few minutes and was very inexpensive.I will be going back.

37.description: I just love this place. Always professional and friendly. I get consistently great eyebrows here. They are always open for walk-ins, though you might have to wait a bit if you come on a saturday afternoon.

0.description: Just had my first experience here for eyebrow threading and arm waxing and it was great! I am so pleased with the friendliness of the staff and the efficiency with which they work, while still managing to do a better job than most high-priced salons. Their prices are unbeatable and the quality of work is great. They made my eyebrows looks great for only $9 (because I paid with cash, $10 if you use a credit card) and they didn't miss a single hair on my arm, even using chocolate wax on sensitive areas as well as waxing my hands and knuckles! I will definitely be using this as my go to waxing salon as they do everything!

38.description: I explained that I wanted to keep the shape and thickness of my eyebrows and just wanted them cleaned up and the woman didn't listen and took off half my eyebrows, made them different shapes and different thicknesses. Then, she said my eyebrows looked better. Additionally, she kept threading the same spot over and over again which made my skin really raw and scab. I will not be going back or recommending this salon.

51.description: I come here once a month, and have been doing so for over a year. My previous eyebrow care was at Benefit Brow Bar at the Ulta at Clark and Wellington. I've been there maybe two times so I cannot speak as much for that place. However, Lakeview Threading is amazing! That's actually an understatement. I've seen (all?) three woman there for eyebrow threading and have NOT left disappointed. I almost wish there was one bad thing about their service, so I could say it isn't perfect, but I've accepted it. It's heaven there. My background: I'm fair skinned, with sensitive skin at that. And some of my eyebrow hairs are actually white! It makes it very difficult to shape/fill in my eyebrows, but once I found a product light enough for my skin tone, and found a place that COMPLETELY RESHAPES YOUR BROWS INTO SOMETHING BEAUTIFUL, I realized that it's a golden combination. On top of that, one of my eyebrows is naturally darker than the other one. I tell the women that before they start threading and I also say I prefer a bigger brow, and that's exactly what I leave with. THREADING DOES MAKE A DIFFERENCE! I'm not nagging other places, but threading reforms your eyebrow hair and puts them back into shape. Then you can comb them with a spooley, and the hair will grow in that direction. What they do here is an art. Seriously. If you're taking the time to read my review this far, and you've got these blobs of hair above your eyes that don't look like anything, go there. Now. You will come back a new person. Ps- The price...! $10! And I think it's $9 cash on top of that. Worth all 1,000 pennies. These ladies know what they're doing!

27.description: My eye brows look really nice but there were some hairs she missed.  I guess it's expected.  Service was great and quick.  Will definitely go back since it's near my apartment.

32.description: I'm giving them 2 stars until I have an improved experience.PROS:It's clean--they are not a gross establishment.They are popular--the wait can be long, so come early, or bring a book.The folks are super nice there, too!CONS:I think I managed to get the one person who isn't good at this!AVOID AVOID AVOID the lady who usually has the chair closest to the window. I think her name is Pinkal? She has worked on my eyebrows more than once now, and each time, given me uneven thicknesses and lengths. She's convinced she's doing an amazing job, but each time, I think she just is too heavy handed with the scissors, and not really good at making even eyebrow shapes. Summary:I hear the others are better, so once I've grown out this monstrosity, I'll try someone else and see how it goes.It's $9 with cash, $10 on a CC. Please don't forget to tip--even the sucky ones gotta make a living, y'know.

54.description: I needed to find a good threading place in the city because I always used to go to my go-to place in the burbs whenever I visited my parents.  I was walking back to my place down Belmont one day and decided to try Lakeview Threading Salon.  When I walked in, I heard all of the ladies speaking in Gujarati, the language I grew up speaking.  I was pretty excited that I found a Gujarati business in my neighborhood and now I feel like Pratima Auntie and Chaiya Auntie are my very cool aunts who take very good care of me :)  Pinkle is also great as well and they are all very sweet, caring, and skilled with the services that they offer.

48.description: Just had to update because I now live in Los Angeles and still LOVE these guys. Every time I come back to Chicago to visit my family I must stop here (I even missed my flight once because I requested a stop a little too close to my flight time, ha that is how much I love them)! I have not found anyone like them yet in LA! My brows are always the best after a visit! They are even and fit my face shape perfectly, you cannot go wrong here :)

44.description: I have been a loyal customer for 1 year now and I must say this is the best threading experience I have ever had! Being of Persian ethnicity, we take our eyebrows very seriously and Pratima does a great job at creating the perfectly groomed thick eyebrow look. The rest of the ladies are also great. The prices are very fair and to date, I have referred 8 friends and family members to this location who have all become happy clients!

24.description: I don't think anyone will understand how much I wish I could give this place a billion stars. My eyebrows have been ruined for years and I came here pleading for them to fix them. Not only were they so nice and helpful, but my eyebrows look absolutely amazing. I feel like a new woman!

7.description: I have been going here for over 3 years and it only takes one time to upset me when I am spending money. I called on to make an appointment for 3 o'clock as I knew it would be busy for Valentines Day (just another day for me). I am sitting here and there are people going ahead of me and I had an appointment. After several minutes, I asked if I needed to come back and was told yes. Why should I have to come back and I had an appointment at 3? I was told I could return before they closed at 5. Guess what I did, got in my car, opened up Yelp and found another salon not knowing if my eyebrows would look terrible or not. I travel all the way from Oak Park for this but never again. Sorry but loyalty to regular customers are key to continued business.

49.description: I have been coming to Lakeview Threading for 4 years.  I love this place!!! My eyebrows are very difficult to shape, Pratima has perfected them every time.  All the ladies there are wonderful.  They make you feel at home.  The prices are also very reasonable.  I highly recommend this lovely salon.

40.description: I'm hooked! Never any waiting time, no appointment needed, and constantly busy with return clients. These ladies do an awesome job of threading and making a makeup less  face look nicely groomed. My brows rock!  Thank you!!!!

53.description: The good:  They are cheap.  The bad:  You get what you pay for.  I took over a year's break from getting my eyebrows threaded here because I often had to go home and correct their work.  Over time, I must have blocked out the bad experiences as I returned.  I won't be returning again.  (Let this Yelp! review serve as a warning....)The young woman who works in the chair furthest from the window had my eyebrows two completely different shapes.  Now, I am going through the time consuming -- and not inexpensive -- process of growing my eyebrows out and correcting their shape.  Not such a bargain when you consider that.

30.description: Finally a place where they really know how to arch eyebrows. Not to mention their outstanding customer service. I called them on a Saturday afternoon to ask what time they closed. He stated they were closing but asked how far I was. To make a long story short. They waited for me to come (stayed about 15 min after closing) and did my eyebrows perfectly ! Love them. Thanks guys!!!

46.description: Great experience!  Tried lakeview threading for the first time a couple weeks ago and will definitely be back!! I'm trying to grow my eyebrows thicker and they were shaped beautifully allowing for growth in the areas I'm targeting to make thicker.  Tip: They accept credit cards but the service is one dollar cheaper if you pay in cash :)

1.description: Ladies, remember you get what you pay for!I ONLY come here to get my upper lip waxed, my hairline and for a lack of a better word as a woman, my side burns threaded. (I have a designated eyebrow woman in the city.) They always do a good job and I'm not picky on who I have thread/wax for me because it doesn't require much skill. They're friendly, and the salon is located in a convenient part of town and is clean. I always pop in without an appointment and am usually in an out within 15 minutes. DO NOTE if you have thick eyebrows or want to grow you eyebrows out this is NOT the place for you. I've noticed that they like to do thin and shaped eyebrows on the people who come and go. From my observations they try to get as many people in and out of their seats, so if you like being pampered or having great attention to detail - again this place is NOT for you.

55.description: Really friendly staff and awesome job with threading! Got a bikini wax as well- they were very accommodating with my sensitive skin. Only 4 stars because they left a few patches behind which I didn't notice until later. However Im sure if I had asked they would have removed them. If you are used to sugaring though this honey wax is not as gentle, but not as bad as the hot strip wax. Would def go back for my eyebrows though!!

9.description: I went here with full thick eyebrows that I had been growing for months and they completely thin them out even after I made it very clear I wanted to keep them thick and they said not to worry that they were only going to clean them. Now I have to wait a few months for them to grow again.

26.description: I have been here a few times and have had great experiences getting my eyebrows threaded. I love the fact that Pratima has such a gentle touch, as close to pain free as it gets!

25.description: Awesome experience! We weren't there a long time, the service was wonderful and everyone was so kind! They made us feel very welcomed while we were there!! I've only had henna once before yearsssss ago but this was awesome! Before we left she even added jewels and glitter to really make it stand out! I left 15 minute ago and have gotten non stop compliments! I will recommend and I will be back!

12.description: I wanted my eyebrows thick and at they end they were thick but perfect looking

59.description: The lady that did my eyebrows did a good job but had a rough technique and pulled off bits of my skin on my upper eyebrows. I have several cuts on my upper eyebrows that need to scab over and fall off. I will upload a picture in the images section. It was $9 so the price was right.  I recommend if you have sensitive skin you let them know otherwise you will likely experience what I did.

21.description: For a few years, I thought Lakeview Threading Salon's ladies were almost magical, finding an arch hidden in my boring brows.Now that thicker brows are back in fashion, I'm more hesitant to recommend them. Glancing at the faces around you, you'll see most of the ladies favor thin(-ish) but immaculate arches, perfectly groomed but not perfect for me. If you're new, you might want to watch the ladies work to see whose style suits you. While some will heed warnings to leave your brows thick, one of the ladies has consistently thinned mine, despite my repeated request. (Pratima is always safe but busy.)Unlike some reviewers below, I've never found any of the ladies to be too painful--although some of the stylists are gentler than others.

17.description: I've gone so many times and they're always, always awesome. My eyebrows are tricky and they get them right every time. Plus super affordable!

10.description: I've been here a couple of times and the service has been inconsistent. The first time I had my eyebrows threaded, the woman was very gentle and precise, and I was very happy with the outcome. The second time I came here, it was pretty busy, but they were still able to take me right away. I'm not sure if it was because there were a bunch of people waiting, but I felt rushed. I had my eyebrows and upper lip threaded and the woman threading was really rough. She pushed my head around multiple times as if my head was a dummy or mannequin. My skin was extremely irritated after my session with her, and the next day, I noticed skin abrasions on my eye lid. My skin was inflamed for three days.I probably won't be coming back unless I can see another woman. Unfortunately I didn't catch her name. Hopefully I can recognize her and choose to see someone else if I ever go back.

5.description: For a few years, I thought Lakeview Threading Salon's ladies were almost magical, finding an arch hidden in my boring brows.Now that thicker brows are back in fashion, I'm more hesitant to recommend them. Glancing at the faces around you, you'll see most of the ladies favor thin(-ish) but immaculate arches, perfectly groomed but not perfect for me. If you're new, you might want to watch the ladies work to see whose style suits you. While some will heed warnings to leave your brows thick, one of the ladies has consistently thinned mine, despite my repeated request. (Pratima is always safe but busy.)Unlike some reviewers below, I've never found any of the ladies to be too painful--although some of the stylists are gentler than others.

3.description: Ok. I dont normally write reviews but i need to write this one. I created a yelp account just to write this review. I am a male and i went to this Salon before my marriage to clean up my eyebrows. The people here are extremely nice and they did an excellent job on my eyebrows. It was very natural and i was very happy. Couldn't have asked for a better service. My wife came from india and she is a pro when it comes to getting waxing and threading done. We were going on vacation with family and she got her arms waxed, and her face threaded over here. They did an exceptional job on threading, but BURNT her hands. It wasn't very noticeable at the beginning but by day 2, her hands had severe burn marks. I know it wasnt intentional, but it ruined our vacation and the scars wont probably go away for a while. Please note that Pratima was upset too. She called the staff and showed the marks. She will probably train them to not have this happen again. But I am not happy at all. My wife didnt have to be the guinea pig. I would never take my wife for waxing over here. They might be good with threading, but i wont trust them with waxing. I am extremely upset that my wife has to go through this. If you do go, i would recommend Pratima since she seems to be the most experienced and seems to know what she is doing. This is my experience only.

35.description: I've been here a couple of times and the service has been inconsistent. The first time I had my eyebrows threaded, the woman was very gentle and precise, and I was very happy with the outcome. The second time I came here, it was pretty busy, but they were still able to take me right away. I'm not sure if it was because there were a bunch of people waiting, but I felt rushed. I had my eyebrows and upper lip threaded and the woman threading was really rough. She pushed my head around multiple times as if my head was a dummy or mannequin. My skin was extremely irritated after my session with her, and the next day, I noticed skin abrasions on my eye lid. My skin was inflamed for three days.I probably won't be coming back unless I can see another woman. Unfortunately I didn't catch her name. Hopefully I can recognize her and choose to see someone else if I ever go back.

19.description: I walked in to get my mendhi done for my wedding along with getting my eyebrows and upper lip threaded. These ladies were super nice, fast, affordable, accommodating, and even fed me sweets during my 4 hour stay. Highly recommend!

28.description: Pratima is the best! I found her when I first moved to Chicago over 5 years ago and would never go to anyone else for my eyebrows! We just moved to San Diego and I'm so so sad to be losing her! You will not find anyone as good as her salon, customer service and pricing.

45.description: This. Place. Is. The. Best. Sometimes I hold out for pratima, but all the women here know what they're doing. My eyebrows come is as one and leave as a beautiful, sculpted, two. As long as I live in Chicago I will never go anywhere else.

33.description: Love this place. It is quick and affordable. They are always very friendly. They are my go to place for my eyebrows. Both women that I have had do the threading are amazing and meticulous.

43.description: I absolutely love this salon for threading and waxing.  I've been going to Pratima Aunty for almost one year, and she is always generous with her time, care, and attention to detail.  I've always had a positive experience and excellent service at a great price. This place gets busy in the evenings, so I recommend going during the day, when it's a bit slower. All of the ladies are extremely talented.  You are in good hands with any one of the people you work with. I am extremely picky about threading -- in particular, eyebrow threading, and I have to say this is the best place I've found in Chicago. Thanks, Pratima Aunty, for always taking such good care of me!

2.description: I betrayed my favorite threader Mona from Unique Beauty Salon and now I am paying the price..  I came here today because A) My favorite threader is located in Rosemont and its just too far of a drive now that I'm not working in that area.. And B) I checked Yelp and this places had some good reviews. Well BOY did I screw myself. Let me start off by saying very friendly staff, I came in around 630 and they were all available (3 women) the Lady that helped me completely butchered my eyebrows .. I'm so disappointed.  I already had shape and just needed a cleanup.. She reshaped my brows so now they aren't even and she left tons of hairs behind .. I came home and had to pluck and try and even out my mess. They charged me $10.. Where Mona charges $10 for brows and lip.... I'll definitely be making the drive when my eyebrows grow back. :(

18.description: Definitely the cheapest in the city proper, but still expensive compared to almost anything in the 'burbs. I came here a couple times for a full face threading ($45+tip), always with two very simple instructions: 1. I Use retin-a so I have very sensitive skin, and 2. I like my brows cleaned up, but the thickness retained. Looking around at all the girls with pretty thin (albeit perfectly groomed) brows, I should have taken a hint.The first time, I'd give it a 3/5 because they did a great job finding every tiny hair, but definitely went thinner on my brows. I had some degree of redness lasting about 2 days, with aloe, NSAIDs and lotion. Definitely some breakouts afterwards, which is not atypical for such a clean job.The second time, I'd give it a 3/5 because while they did a fine job on my eyebrows after I repeatedly emphasized my dissatisfaction with them last time, this time they insisted on using wax on certain areas, assuring me that my sensitive skin would be fine with their appropriate technique. It was not. I looked like I had spot-leprosy for several days. Not so severe makeup couldn't reasonably cover it, but certainly painful and not at all fun. Once again though, every hair was gone. Pros: They wear gloves, minimal wait as a walk-in, definitely cheapest in the city, do a very thorough job, very nice staff, takes credit cardsCons: Parking is street parking sometimes a couple blocks away and not cheap (not their fault), variable on how well they listen to special requests, thoroughness can translate into running over the same area of skin over and over and causing inflammation and burns, average in the suburbs seem to be around $25 (a $20 difference, and more if you include the parking charge)

41.description: This place is great and am definitely going to go again!  I went in for a clean up and they knew exactly what to do and how to make you happy. The only thing that bothered me and were comments that I must be doing something wrong to them because they are a little on the thin side.  My eyebrows have always been that way. Everyone has different eyebrow thickness.

52.description: I get my eyebrows threaded here every other week- I've never found a better place anywhere else. They truly do an amazing job no matter which woman you get. Sometimes there's a long wait but there's a reason for it.. They're the best in the city and alway very consistent (which is important for someone like myself who is extremely picky when it comes to my eyebrows!) Trust me, you'll leave happy.

50.description: I've always gotten my eyebrows threaded in Michigan and haven't found a place in 4 years that I trusted. Well...I have to say this was by far the best threading experience I have ever had. The lady was so nice and the atmosphere was very genuine. I have never had someone as attentive as her. My eyebrows are really thick and tough and she not only took care of every detail she also asked me how I was doing throughout the threading process. Amazing!This is really far from home (Sox Stadium) but I'll gladly travel every 4 weeks for this type of service!

4.description: I was so sad to leave my west loop threading place and was convinced I would have to track it back downtown for great brows- but lakeview threading is great!  They keep the perfect shape and never take off too much!  So happy to have my new go to spot in my new neighborhood

6.description: Been coming to Lakeview Threading Salon for over 2 years now and I can finally say I now have the perfect brow shape! People are always asking me where I get my brows done and I can't help but let them in on Lakeview's best kept secret.  Pratima is an expert at what she does and I always look forward to seeing her every other week. The other 3 ladies who work there are equally as wonderful though so if you can't get in with Pratima, don't fret.Thank you Lakeview threading for the beautiful brows!
