22.description: Eyebrows turning out okay - so end goal accomplished. However, I was pretty beat up afterwards. I've never been so red and sore after threading before, and I did have a few small cuts.My biggest complaint was the woman's persistence that I give a tip in cash, particularly her reasoning that they have to pay taxes on it if I use my card, if I pay cash they would not.The number of times she mentioned this reasoning and that next time I will bring cash, was a turn off for me.

15.description: My eye brows look really nice but there were some hairs she missed.  I guess it's expected.  Service was great and quick.  Will definitely go back since it's near my apartment.

57.description: By far the BEST eyebrow threading salon in Lakeview.  If you're looking for a thorough threading job, come here.  These ladies are amazingly thorough and always want you to leave happy...And beautiful!It's also relatively cheap (~$18 for eyebrow and lip, tip included).  Highly recommend it!

20.description: 1st time I went in I told them it was my first time at that location and I was only there visiting. I told them to be very careful and it all worked out fine. But when I went back a second time before going back home everything was awful (the same person did both. Pratima). She BUTCHERED my eyebrows. Made Them too thin, short, and changed the curvature. Background info on me... I have been getting full face threading for 16 years and I would literally have strangers stop me on the street to tell me I have great eyebrows (weird but true). So when she completely butchered them I was devastated. They take months to grow back and 2 months later I'm still waiting. In addition she didn't even make my hairline straight so that when I try to pull my bangs back it never looks even. Overall I'm furious and devastated. Can barely look at myself in the mirror.

36.description: Definitely the cheapest in the city proper, but still expensive compared to almost anything in the 'burbs. I came here a couple times for a full face threading ($45+tip), always with two very simple instructions: 1. I Use retin-a so I have very sensitive skin, and 2. I like my brows cleaned up, but the thickness retained. Looking around at all the girls with pretty thin (albeit perfectly groomed) brows, I should have taken a hint.The first time, I'd give it a 3/5 because they did a great job finding every tiny hair, but definitely went thinner on my brows. I had some degree of redness lasting about 2 days, with aloe, NSAIDs and lotion. Definitely some breakouts afterwards, which is not atypical for such a clean job.The second time, I'd give it a 3/5 because while they did a fine job on my eyebrows after I repeatedly emphasized my dissatisfaction with them last time, this time they insisted on using wax on certain areas, assuring me that my sensitive skin would be fine with their appropriate technique. It was not. I looked like I had spot-leprosy for several days. Not so severe makeup couldn't reasonably cover it, but certainly painful and not at all fun. Once again though, every hair was gone. Pros: They wear gloves, minimal wait as a walk-in, definitely cheapest in the city, do a very thorough job, very nice staff, takes credit cardsCons: Parking is street parking sometimes a couple blocks away and not cheap (not their fault), variable on how well they listen to special requests, thoroughness can translate into running over the same area of skin over and over and causing inflammation and burns, average in the suburbs seem to be around $25 (a $20 difference, and more if you include the parking charge)

14.description: Great service, great art, great prices. Always gonna come here for henna. I don't have anything else to say but yelp has a word count requirement so lalala

12.description: The donuts were taste and my wife raved about the coffee.  We were on vacation from Omaha, NE and plan to stop back again when we are in town this month.  The service was good and the store was clean.  It was a pleasure for our first Dunkin Donut experience.

7.description: I've gone here a handful of times because it was close to work. That is the only reason. I won't be returning. The last time I bought my coffee, which was fine, I ordered a bag of hash browns. The lady handed me hash browns with no paper bag. They are greasy ....how is one expected to transport them? In their pocket?! I've never seen this happen. I asked for a bag and the lady gave me one begrudgingly.Go back the next day and she does the same thing! This time leaving the bag of greasy hash browns on the counter. I ask for a paper bag and she proceeds to leave it beside the hash browns on the counter!As an African American male I'd like to think this wasn't a subtle racist gesture but it sure felt like it. I'll leave that up for others to decided. Regardless, it's rude, unprofessional and unsanitary. It's a shame they'd treat customers this way. I submitted a complaint to corporate and I'm awaiting a response. One star from me.

19.description: The muffins are probably the best thing they have at this Dunkin Donuts.  The donuts there always seem like they have been sitting there.  The employees are very hard to understand.

1.description: Mickey, please forgive me.These were the 5:30 am workers...I asked for Hazelnut coffee, light cream.I received Cream with light hazelnut coffee.I showed the cashier and mentioned I asked for light cream.Coffee remade with no comments.  I got the same thing!  Looked the same. I want Hazelnut coffee LIGHT cream.Once again looks the same.  I finally asked the cashier for black coffee.Would you believe I got Cream with light hazelnut again?I took my coffee and left.Mickey D.  Please take me back.  I promise not to cheat on you again.  :)

2.description: Whenever I walk into this establishment witch is alit whether Im getting breakfast or a snack on the run I notice that the young workers their are always helpful and kind. But their is always an older woman maybe in her early 40's or late 30's she has often gave me wrong orders and lyes to me saying that I ordered something that I didn't and charges me extra. She also gave short change to me twice. Instead of 10 dollars back from a 20 she gave me 5 and I called her out on it and she thankfully gave me my money back. She tends to be in a bad mood and has kicked me out of the store and said that they were closing while their where other older customers that were aloud to stay because the store actually closes at 9,She kicked me out in 17 degree weather with a sweatshirt. I have not ever aprouched her in a rude matter or talked to her that way. I would recamend not to come to this establishment when she is working.

9.description: Just your average Dunkin Donuts.  I sometimes stop by here on my way to night class when I am feeling like I either need a hot coffee to keep me awake or a donut to treat me after a rough day at work.  It is a convenient location and fairly east to get in an out of quickly.  I wish they had a drive thru here!

6.description: Close to work, fast and efficient. Always busy but always friendly. Coffee is always fresh too. I don't eat donuts but they look delicious :)

18.description: This dunkin donuts is known for their patronage. There is a line long deep and they all know each customers order. There is no drive thru and they do not accept credit cards but worth it to come here for the customer service.

10.description: I drive 10 miles to get coffee from here because no Dunkin Donuts knows how to make coffee like Martha. She's beyond nice and always makes my coffee good. 5 stars

13.description: I've been going there for the last few years, they make the coffee the BEST!! Great ladies!!! Donuts got so much better, great job GALS

16.description: The food at this Dunkin Donuts is ok, but personally the service here sucks I can barely understand what the hell they're trying to say to me.

17.description: Dunkin Donuts, your donuts and coffee are awesome.  I heard you're coming over here to the west coast.  I think that's great.The one reason why you're not 5 stars is because my dog got run over right outside you guys on Cumberland.  I picture the kiler being some greaser in an IROC-Z.  He was a mean dog, though.

15.description: This joint saved my life this week via their iced coffee alone. I would stumble over from condo hell after a night of debauchery and this icy brew was so potent I flashed back to the 80's if you catch my drift.. Much to my liking I believe they formulate it for the masses that add cream, sugar and whatever else. Fools. Snort it straight and your good to go for infinite disco ball action.

0.description: I love dunkin coffee!Gives me that energy rush I need!Coconut Coffee is my favorite!

5.description: The food is good as any dds but their is problem here when communication, its hard to get a order right if you want any customization which is not an issue I've experienced at other dds, here to request a certain bagel for my sandwich requires repeating the order numerous times, the same with coffee orders, asking for no sugar takes a painful amount of interpretation process, they often get something wrong or have even attemped to give us the wrong order emphatically when there are only two orders in the store, and it clearly is the other persons.

11.description: This is the old school Norridge area meeting spot. You'll catch all the old timers up here meeting in the morning, all the people on their way to work, and all the locals starting their day. This is the best dunkin donuts in the area and because they are busy everything is always fresh.

8.description: You might ask : "how to review Donkin' Donuts - the food and drinks probably taste the same everywhere" , but ......at this location donuts are always fresh and coffee is just perfect. The most important think about this place is outstanding customer service. Very cool atmosphere and people are very, very nice. 5 stars for you guys , best wishes!!!

3.description: I stopped in here for a cup of coffee after donation blood at Lifesource, which is in the same plaza. The atmosphere in there was way more positive and friendly than most other DD that I have been to (hence the need to stop to write a review).  The women there were so friendly, saying "happy Friday" to everyone and calling everyone "honey." I wished this location was my neighborhood DD... They make grabbing a cup/donuts pleasant. Happy Friday, indeed!

14.description: The coffee tastes like it was made with water they cleaned the floors with... Food is never prepared correctly, hash browns soggy and cold, toasted beagles don't taste toasted more like microwaved. I can only think of one staff member there that is friendly. If u need your dunkin fix go to the one on Lawrence just down the street.

4.description: My local dunkin spot from home. always open and always there when needed. The guy here late at night is cool. Always positive even late at night. Wish this location would have almond or coconut milk like most of the dunkin are doing but begged can't be choosers.

1.description: Deli Time is an okay place for a lunch on the go.  There really isn't a place to sit down and eat but most people really grab their food and take it back to their office anyway.  When they first opened to replace Wall Street Deli, people really enjoyed their food.  The quality of food used to be pretty good but it's slipped a bit since - at least they're consistent now.  There used to be promotions where customers who screams out "Deli Time!" in reply to their "What time is it?" gets a free meal.  But I guess it gets stale after a few months so I don't miss it.In this place, you'll find a couple of hot entrees that vary from day to day, soups, sandwiches toasted or grilled, a salad bar, and various extras like yogurts and juices.  The soups here are decent enough and prepared fresh daily - the chili is very good actually.  The stir fries and warm salads are way too greasy for my taste (we're taking like almost a ladel of oil type greasy).  The salad bar is crazy expensive - but then again most are unless it's a buffet.  Their sandwiches are very good though.  They've a soup/sandwich combo which is a decent value.Deli Time isn't bad, but it's not the greatest.  They've breakfast items as well but it's really not worth mentioning.  Just good enough for lunch and keeps me coming back every once in a while.

0.description: I agree with the previous reviewer, there is nothing spectacular about Deli Time.  Some of their staff is good but the food is unremarkable and overpriced.  It's frustrating when you don't have another easy option, if anyone has a vehicle available we tend to go elsewhere... On the other hand, if you're working in the building the convenience can't be beat.Also, Deli Time offers prepaid gift cards with a 10% discount with the purchase of a $10 or $20 card.

29.description: Pizza is okay, decent.   But the people taking the orders by phone constantly charge the wrong price, and twice we were given the wrong change.  Happened with the same cashier shorting us a dollar when she gave us back change.  Cmon, are they doing this on purpose to fleece people a dollar here and there.

42.description: I ordered my pizza for pick up and they told me it would be about a 40 minute wait. So I came in to pick it up and they told me it would be a few more minutes. So I paid and sat down and waited some more, and a guy pulled up and walked in, and was promptly handed a pizza(mine, although I didn;t know right away). He came back a moment later and whispered something to the guy and i heard the employee say "just keep it" and the guy left. Then he called me over and said it would be another half an hour. I asked him if he had given away my pizza and he said yes. I told him I wanted my money back (which I had paid for with my credit card). He did something with the credit card machine and showed me the print out and said "its okay now" and i asked for the printout, but he refused to give it to me. So I told him I needed it in case the charge wasn't taken off my credit card. He started raising his voice and yelling that he took it off and i didn't need it. I repeated that he gave my pizza away and then didn't even apologize and now was refusing me proof that the charge was taken off. After about 5 minutes of this, the guy in back who was just watching silently, went to the machine made it print a copy of the one the other guy had, then handed it to me. I stormed out...angry and without my hawaiian pizza :(He even never apologized for giving my pizza away!!!...I will never go back here.

23.description: This review is specifically for Manager John.  "YOU" are the MAN!I ordered a plethora of food for myself along with 6 of my co workers. Close to 100 dollars of food to be exact. Our order which was originally taken by another employee was mishandled beyond belief and frankly as incomplete as it could have been. We received our order. We were NOT happy. I called and around closing time to share a few words with the Mama Mia employee who took my order. I asked him to make things right for me and my friends. What had happened next is something I did NOT expect. John the manager shows up at our door. He professionally explains the situation that had occurred and how communication had broken down amongst the employees. In addition to this he brought the completion of our order and MORE. He made things right, just like a manager should. We couldn't believe our eyes on how above and beyond he had handled the situation. All of us were in shock and awe. It gets better. The next day John calls and leaves me a voicemail offering to treat our party to dinner to (once again) make things right. He wanted to give us the opportunity to experience his establishment the way it should be experienced. I can't begin to express how much this means to me. This is what good customer service and business practice is all about. John, I will never forget how you turned a mediocre, borderline unsalvageable dinner around to one of the most enjoyable late night delivery experiences I have ever had.Thank you for "making things right".

47.description: Ever since this place got new owners it's gone downhill.  The pizza is not good at all.  We use to order from here 3 - 5 times a month.  I don't even recommend to anyone anymore.

8.description: We strolled in for the first time at 10pm after realizing that the central gyro place next door was closed. It was very good! The customer service was great and very attentive. We had a special $25.95 for a jumbo pizza four toppings, one appetizer & a 2 liter. For the appetizer we got the fried calamari which was delish. On the jumbo we did sausage, pepperoni, spinach and onions. Very very good pizza! The place is small but very nicely decorated. Great atmosphere. They did mention to us that the front windows are opened during the day. Can't wait to try their pasta! Go check them out.

31.description: We have always placed an order for pick-up, and never experienced any problems or unreasonable wait.  The service has always been good.  We have tried the Asiago, Greek, Shopska and Caeser salads (they are always freshly made) and pizza by the slice. The pizza is on a thin crust and is decent. Recently, we ordered the Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo, it was OK, but on the oily side

34.description: My ex ordered regularly from this place...the best thing about this place is the music and voice over during your "holding" experience...they always get your order wrong..refuse to correct it...and then blame "YOU" for their mistakes...despite your absolute "certainty" about the order "YOU" placed....they will not give you a credit and tell "YOU"  to come back to correct the order. HELLO I've just worked or been out all night...you should come to me "I live less than a mile away" to correct YOUR "Botched" order taking skills. Then when you get on the phone with a so called manager...YOU are attacked. As a highly trained business consultant, CEO, and entrepreneur... let me remind you Mama Mia...the customer comes first...you DON"T hang up on them in a fit of rage for your employees incompetence...and NOT the first time we have had this experience...really too bad...I really  try to support small business...but this place has very poor quality service, inability to take an order,  and ok at best food....I will and do order elsewhere!!!...horrible experience...EVERY time!!!...not trying to be scorned...but really, every time I deal with this place...they screw up the order and really need to set their own personal egos aside and service and correct the order for their customers...I will NEVER order from them again!!!

16.description: The new ownership has significantly decreased the quality of the pizza served here. I used to stop in and grab a slice every once in a while, but now there pizza never seems fresh, the pizza is much more doughy and has a lot less cheese than before. Not what it used to be.

13.description: It was open at like 2:00 A.M. The food was decent and it was relatively inexpensive. We did have to wait quite a long time for the pizza. That was the only real downside.

11.description: We ordered from Mama Mia's tonight around 7:10 pm through Groupon's website and almost immediately received an email confirmation that the order would be delivered between 8:10 and 8:20 pm. At 8:50 pm when we still had not received our order, we called the business and was assured that it was on the way. The order arrived at about 9:00 pm, and although I asked the delivery driver not to ring the doorbell, he rang the bell anyway. We weren't thrilled with the service at this point, but were starving and hoping the the food would make up it. I honestly can't tell you how the food was because we weren't able to eat it. We ordered four pasta dishes and they were packaged in the typical "foil on the bottom/plastic on the top" to-go containers. But they had stacked the heavy pastas on top of one another so the containers on top had squashed the containers on the bottom. That's not typically a big deal, but it's a huge deal when the plastic top breaks and pieces of plastic get into the food itself. Two of our four pastas had pieces of plastic in the food. They had also put garlic bread in with the pasta, and it was flattened by the time it arrived to us. Again, that's not so bad, but the garlic bread was so stale that we couldn't even bite through it. We'd also ordered mozzarella sticks that were ice cold by the time they arrived to us. After multiple conversations with the manager (in which he said he'd have to call the owner if we wanted the order sent out again and/or a discount on the order - as a side note, I'd recommend that the owner give a manager this power so a call to the owner isn't necessary), we finally decided to return the whole thing and get all of our money back. I also put in a call to Groupon to ensure a refund was processed. I had high hopes for this place because it's close to where I live and relatively inexpensive. But overall, it was disappointing, frustrating, and a general waste of time. There are a number of great Italian restaurants in the area, and I would recommend taking your business elsewhere.

39.description: I'm surprised that Mama Mia's has such poor reviews.  My family orders from this place about once a month, and we always pick up our 18' inch pizza in about 20 minutes, which is ridiculously fast.  On top of that, their prices are cheaper than many of their competitors.  We only paid $18.75 for our pie tonight, while we usually pay over $20 at other pizza places in the area.  It is also conveniently located on Cumberland avenue, and there is always parking right in front of the pizzeria.

37.description: I stopped in here for a quick dinner, a slice of cheese pizza to be precise. A slice was only $2.75 and huge!  I really liked the pizza here and the service was really quick and friendly. So why only 4 stars you ask?  I tried the fried calamari. I knew that it would most likely be the frozen variety, but it was pretty bad. It was chewy and the fried part was soggy. Next time, I will stick to just the pizza!

0.description: Love the pizza here. I usually get sausage and pepperoni. They're not skimpy with the ingredients! I also love the cheesy curly fries. They're addicting. The tiramisu is delicious.   The prices are reasonable.

38.description: Get the zerotti that's where it's at!  Grilled pizza dough filled with whatever you want and a side of marina.  I haven't had the pizza but a previous yelp review about the zerotti was right on the mark! It's even good with  spinach mushroom, onion, peppers and bacon all the veggies are fresh and you can just do veggies if you watn.

27.description: I ordered via Eat24, and was a little leery because of the reviews, but since this restaurant was the only thing open that would deliver to my hotel, I took the plunge.My order was correct, delivered promptly (45 min, with a courtesy call to let me know it was on its way), and nice and warm when it arrived. Delivered straight to my room by a very nice driver, even though I offered to meet them in the lobby.Moderately priced, good sized portion of chicken fingers (6) and potato skins (5) for less than $12 (before tip). Hit the spot for my 1am craving, and I'm quite content.

32.description: If no stars were an option it wouldn't do this place justice. I placed an order for delivery after working all night. It was promised at 01:24 at 02:46 they called to tell me it would be a little bit late. I asked her how much longer she said about 40 minutes. When I asked seriously you're calling me 25 minutes late to tell me you're going to just be a little late the woman arrogantly said "aha". Will never order from here again.

48.description: The pizza there isnt too great.  I wouldnt recommend it because I got sick and threw up from it before.  Also the pizza sauce is very spicy and the crust was doughy

44.description: Mama Mia is right...You step in and order at the counter a generous slice of luke warm flat bread pizza (I've been here on a few occasions I can vouch for the fact I've never had a piping hot slice) and take a pop out of their cooler for your beverage. Plastic silverware and paper plates. Sitting in is cramped and dirty. However you may want to so not to compromise the last wisps of heat flickering out of your food...Not good for groups, but if you're in a rush it's a relatively tasty quick lunch.

24.description: Love this place.  The pizza is so good. Love love the grilled zerotti. It is so delish. The cheesy beef is so good too.  The pasta portions are so big i have for two meals.  Panninis and sandwiches are plentiful and tasty too.  Just tried the chocolate cake for dessert tonight and it was so good. I recommend you try it for yourself.

7.description: This used to be my favorite place for pizza but I feel like In the past few months they've been really slacking. I ordered a stuffed pizza for delivery and it came burnt! I really don't know how they sent out a pizza looking like that. I called and complained and they said they'd send a new one and that the driver will pick up the first one. The second one they send was perfect but considering we were starving and ordered this pizza around 8pm, we didn't get to actually eat until 10:20 pm.

40.description: This place ain't so bad. The pizza is good, although I can't remember a time i've ordered it without it being 3am and drunk as hell. But there is one thing about this place that is awesome! The grilled zerotti! This thing is goood. It's basically pizza in the style of breadsticks but with a different kind of dough maybe? The zerotti is good, but when you got a big case of the munchies, this thing is beast! Take my advice. Next lazy sunday, while you're packing a bowl and watching Dexter on netflix. Call mama mias. Order a grilled zerotti ( I get mine with peperoni and bacon) maybe some cheese sticks (which are good here but you probably won't need any more food!). You won't regret it!

30.description: The Good:They deliver to the airport (O'Hare International airport). At 11PM I found out I would be stuck at the airport overnight (until 6am). The delivery man found his way to me in the airport at exactly the time they said they would when I placed the order. The bad:I ordered a 12" Deep Dish Stuffed Pizza with mushrooms and sausages. The crust was a little under cooked for my taste. It had a soft, inconsistent texture on the bottom, and the sides were very very hard. The toppings were a little scarce and the cheese was a little too tough. (It did not stretch, imagine a hot pizza after sitting out for a while). Regardless, they saved my butt. I called the nearest Giordano's first, but they would not deliver to the airport. Their deep dish pizza wasn't the best, but it did the job.

46.description: The new ownership destroyed this place. The prices went up, the quality went down.

1.description: Employes scattered at all tables. Nowhere to eat .felt uncomfortable .always hang out in front.pizza is great though.

9.description: Definitely a quality and taste change after new ownership. Chewy and doughy pizza. Miss the thin and crispy slice. Paid 9 bucks for 2 slices and a can of Coke which I thought was high for the taste and quality of the product.Hopefully they catch on and improve the food.

26.description: My friends and I ordered from this place .. at 10:45pm and was told we would receive it at 11:10pm .. waited till 11:30pm. .called and was told he would be here any moment. . So we were thinking 5 to 10 min max.. ended up waiting till 12:00am .. called back was told he was in the hotel.. he comes about 12:45 .. as we figured. . The food was lukewarm wt best if that.. fries were soggy.. rings were soggy..  food wasnt that great.. considering the price we were not expecting a whole lot in flavor .. but was expecting at least fast food quality. . And the meal bing warm... and wasn't even that..  we called them about the foods temprature and our unsatisfactory. . And he refused to comp the 50$ meal that wasnt worth even half that.. and refused to replace all that we ordered instead he only replaced the appetizers. . Which didnt include my soggy regular fries.. but my sisters cheese fries that he replaced was still quite soggy.. if you can avoid this place do. The food isnt that good.. the service is bad and their aditude is deplorable. . Again avoid if possible. . This was our only way of a meal tonight.. unfortunately. .

25.description: Pizza was good, but the rest of the experience was bad. I ordered through Eat 24 and paid through PayPal but the delivery driver was looking for money. The driver also could not find my house which is less then two miles away if he does not know the neighborhood he needs a GPS

12.description: During the day the place is nice, the staff is friendly and for the most part the orders are correct&on time. However, once you get past say...10pm the place turns into a hell hold..I've ordered many times after 10 thinking it was just that time but no, the pizza is always burnt and the staff is always rude.

21.description: They have excellent customer service !!! I read the reviews I never EVER experienced any of the bad reviews. I mean my God  reviews about delivery time or mistakes is not the place to blame but the driver him self so it's not fair to give two stars to the restaurant !!  Good is great, all the fancy restaurant have great food and horrible customer service which is why I will never go back but THIS PLACE is absolutely GREAT. Think about it with great customer seevice they can please u easily even when they make a mistake . And for waiting over 20 min they manager have is free pop!!!!! Love it and recommend it to anyone

17.description: I read a couple reviews and I wanted to just ignore them and give these guys a shot... This is fed a place you order from when you don't want good service... I order zucchini sticks small 10 inch veggie, carrot cake and a ginger ale they call me 45 mins later they called and said they are out of artichokes so my meal came to 31$ instead of 33$ when the delivery boy gets here 1hour 15 mins later (it's late at night) he hands me my food and says I forgot your pop. I said lol you forgot my pop? Which I saw happened in another review. Ok so he goes to get my pop. Then he comes back with my pop I have 40$ I said yeah I am going to need some change 8$ tip for you for what? I don't think so.. He looks at me with this face like "are you serious" yeah I am your a delivery boy you should be carrying money on you. He went down stairs and got me my change. Finally I pay the guy give him 5$ tip I was going to give him 3$ I should have he even knew I should have by this response "thanks beautiful" so basically what i gathered from this place is they aren't professional they are open until 2am which is nice. But I was to hungry and tired to even bother arguing. I won't eat here again bc of the U professionalism. It makes me think something gross could be in my food (this is what to expect when you eat here) and btw cake is really good zucchini fries OK pizza was OK not enough sauce at all the cheese wasn't melty it was a little hard. (Btw pizza boy smelt like weed) which is prbly why he forgot my pop and didn't carry any change on him or he really thought I was going to give him a 8$ tip lol

10.description: This is the only pizzeria in the area that I have found that has football/party (3 feet of pizza) for a good price. We ordered 6 of these fantastic pizzas for our daughters birthday party. The delivery guy showed up to survey the scene a few minutes early and we showed him where we wanted the pizzas and he took care of the rest. He was very polite and considerate of our party space. The pizza was served to our guests a few minutes later and all I kept hearing was "Where did you order the pizza from? It's fantastic! I've never seen a pizza this big before".  As a party host, all I want is for my guests to be happy and also not have to break my bank account while I'm at it. Kid birthday party expenses can certainly add up! I was happy that my guests were happy! If you are looking for exceptional customer service and great pizza look no further to Mama Mia's pizzeria. This place is under new management and it's a good thing considering all the other poor yelp reviews on here. They have really turned this place around and are on their way to making this one of the finest establishments in the area.

5.description: Best pizza on Cumberland Ave more ppl should try this over Al's greasy over priced pizza.  This place has great size n fresh slices always available now it's cheesy n good  Been going there a lot more

3.description: Ordered takeout at 12:15 am got my pizza at my hotel door in less then 30 min, so yummy, I got the thin 2 topping for 16 bucks, this will be my go to for late arrival flight to Ohare. Great pizza great service!

35.description: Their double dough cheese pizza is hands down my favorite pizza EVER - in fact, I consider it one of my favorite foods ever. Yes, in my opinion, it is better than all the fancy Chicago places - Giordano's, Lou Malnati's, Gino's East, etc. When I went to another country for a month, my family actually surprised me with Mama Mia's double dough at the airport when I got home... that is how much I love it!! I would recommend their double dough if you like doughy, cheesy pizza (rather than well-done/crispy pizza). I used to order it around every other week in high school, but I haven't had it for a couple months now because I'm trying to eat healthier (wahh). I plan on getting it soon though, because I am having some serious withdrawals!In all the times I've ordered from there, they only messed up and brought us the wrong pizza once. I work as a phone girl at a pizza place, so I completely understand that these things can happen. My boyfriend, on the other hand, called back angrily and said we would never order from there again. Yeah, that lasted a good long week. We just couldn't resist.There's other good things about this place, too. Namely, that it is open so late (4AM)! It is perfect for drunken nights when you don't want to/can't drive somewhere to get food. Or just if you're hungry in the middle of the night. I've also eaten inside the restaurant once and the workers were all friendly and very accommodating to our large group.All in all, I would definitely give this place a try if you're in the area. I'm so glad I did!

19.description: I placed a delivery order for my boyfriend and me at 6:29 PM this past Wednesday.  The lady who took the order said to expect the delivery within 45 minutes, "especially since I live so close."  I am 1.5 miles away and about a 4-5 minute drive from the restaurant.  The delivery man came 20 minutes late.  I ordered a "fantasy panini sandwich" - a make your own item - which was overpriced in my opinion; it cost 4.50 just for the bread, the guy said when the lady I spoke to inquired to answer my question, and they charge you for every single item you add.  Nothing else on the menu appealed to me so with the meat, veggies, and cheese, it came out to $10.74.  Their panini offerings are limited so I think they do this so they can charge you extra:  75 cents for each type of meat you want, 65 cents for each type of vegetable and 85 cents for a slice of cheese - ridiculous when their other paninis are 6.99-7.99. My boyfriend ordered a chicken parmigiana sandwich. Neither of the meals came with fries or any side - you have to pay extra, $2.50 for french fries.When the delivery man came and left, I noticed a delivery charge of $2.50, which was not disclosed on their flyer or on the phone when I placed the order.  First of all, I live 5 minutes away, secondly, you need to inform customers of this charge.  Had I known I was being charged for delivery, I would've tipped the guy less.  Plus, I live 4 minutes away!!!! Absurd.  If you want to keep customers happy, you need to be transparent about your charges and not inconspicuously hide them to surprise us later.By the time the delivery came, both of our meals were not warm and barely edible.  The bread on both of our sandwiches was soggy.  I couldn't even pick up my sandwich as it immediately fell apart due to the soggy, soaked bread.  The bread fell apart, and I could only eat the veggies and meat with a fork.  My boyfriend's meal was the same; his bread was thicker than the panini bread, though, so he was at least able to hold it and start eating it like a sandwich is meant to be eaten.  He ended up eating the chicken only because like my bread, it was too soggy to continue eating - taste wise and mess wise.  The french fries were cold, some soggy and some just not fresh or even chewable.  Their temperature, taste, and texture were like fries you'd eat as leftovers the next day.  Therefore, we both didn't eat our fries.The meals were not enjoyable at all, timing of delivery was horrible, and pricing was way too expensive.  Furthermore, it was a WEDNESDAY!  If it was a weekend, I could at least justify the time it took because they'd be busier, but there was certainly no excuse when I live 5 minutes away.  I've ordered from restaurants way further and they've gotten warm, delicious, well-prepared meals to us within a half hour to 45 minutes. I would've rather cooked in this time frame than spend $25 on two horrible, inedible meals.  I would strongly encourage you to choose another establishment for your dining experience.  Stay away - you WILL be disappointed, guaranteed.

28.description: i like to try out the majority of the restaurants menu before i attempt to give my overall opinion.  so i have tried the deep dish, stuffed, thin, extra thin,  pizza by the slice, salads , burgers, paninis, zerrottis (pan and non-panned), fettecini alfredo, spagetti, ravioli, their array of parmigianas... if you are looking for cheap pizza this is the place. there thin pizza is really thin . i don't know if it is because the economy is bad  or what that they are really cutting back on materials like dough when producing pizza. seriously thin. now, this is what i found ironic. i ordered a stuffed and it was quite the opposite. it was more dough than cheese. anyone who has had a stuffed pizza knows there's a lot of cheese. i have pizza from giordanos, suparusa, ginos east, unos, etc. setting the standard of stuffed, with mama mias falling short by a long shot. the sandwiches are smashed together doused with salt, so are the pastas and surprisingly salads. there zerottis. if grilled is definitely burned more than grilled. the prices are just about what you would expect at a pizza place. it is actually a little less. maybe that is why the quality is so low. but i never would have guessed that the a few bucks cheaper result in like dominos or little ceasar style pizza. regarding delivery, i have had about 7 deliveries come to my house. i guess depending on who's driving,  the pizza  or food is either, loppsided, leaking through, or in place. where in the world do they get these drivers? ive had an asian guy, a couple of Caucasian males (one who looked like a homeless guy) and small hispanic guy. out of all the drivers i like, the asian and the little hispanic guy. the asian guy didn't really speak english well but he was very professional, and curteous. the small hispanic guy wasnice, pretty happy and cheerful (which was very surprising). these 2 guys didn't throw the food at me, they actually came in the house and placed it in my designated area. real good customer service from those 2 guys only. eating there is not recommended. it stinks. there is a smell of mold and must that i have not seen in the other local pizza places around the hood. the walls and the ceiling look dingy and need to be done over. this seems like it would be a nice episode for nightmare kitchens. the time of deliveries is ok. i guess from like 30-45 minutes on average except when i ordered the stuffed and deepdish, which took about an hour.  delivery charge is 2.50, not including tax. one thing that i liked was the range of house in the weekend. they close at 4am on fridays and saturdays. so overall food quality is definitely not the best, far from it. yeah, they might be a little cheaper but you get what you pay for. if you are drunkj and don't care, this is a place for that.  they either need a make over new staff because this is ridiculous.

45.description: If you ask me, their pizza is pretty good.And they're open til 4am, which has got to be the latest in Park Ridge.Just don't order the cheese ravioli if you're actually hungry.  I got only five raviolis.  Five!  That 's $1.60 per ravioli BEFORE tax/tip/delivery fee.

33.description: No stars, I am beyond fucking disgusted with this place. I've decided to try them out after a recommendation from my mother. Firstly I ordered some items which include Panzerotti, their cheese fries,  3 pizza puffs, and a can of sprite. Phone lady said out will take 1 hour for delivery. Okay fine. 1 1/2 later. I give her a call, she said he'll be there in 5 min. Good. Delivery guy comes, I pay him and he gives me the bag.  so then I take everything out, sprite is missing, I ring them, she says he'll be back in 5 min... 15 minutes later.... He brings a 2 liter. Okay.... Now for  the food, fries were shit, ever heard of poking holes in the box ya wankers? It tasted shitty. Lastly the panzerotti was just horrid shit! tasteless and they barely put any cheese in it! I've had other panzerottis and this takes the hall of shame! It wasn't seasoned properly, barely any sauce, for f**** sakes that is very un Italian! Screw this place, don't even order from here unless you plan to be disappointed with their fries and panzerrotti's especially!

43.description: I got the Panzerati ( HUGE!!!!)..... First time trying this place and it is truly amazing. It's not top of the line pizza but a great place to get lunch delivered to work. HIGHLY RECOMENDED

2.description: This was the only option for late night food in the area. They have classic American staples of pizza and wings, which are any 3am muncher's favorites. We ordered for 8 people and it took about one and a half hour from the time we ordered to the time we could bring the food up to the hotel room. The wings were fatty and the pizza was subpar, but I rate this place 4 stars because I was happy they were able to get us food when nobody else could. For that reason I advocate for Mama Mia's as the best after mid-night spoil yourself meal.

18.description: Hello, I rated this 1 star because I had a horrible experience on the phone with the man who took my delivery order. He cut me off at every second that he got and sounded somewhat foreign. He didn't care about what I wanted and he tried to push me along so fast so I couldn't get off the phone and even order. He sighed and made comments about my questions like I was a huge problem to him. He was NO WHERE NEAR FRIENDLY and I was shocked and distraught by the way he treated me. When I saw this place by a flyer that says new owners I was so excited but he's worse then I ever imagined. When he answered he said "what" and I had to clarify that he was at the pizza parlor. When I was explaining directions how to get to the front of the apt building when he came he freaked out on me thinking I meant when HE actually came when I meant the delivery driver and said "I can't cook the damn food and bring it to you" and when I said goodbye he said "k bye" and hung up. This is among many other things he ranted in his upraised yelling voice towards me that terrified me of him. I would be dead scared if I worked with or for him. Do not support this disgusting man he does not deserve to work in the food industry AT ALL. And by the was this was at 12:39 on a Thursday night. Ugh, just ew and disappointment. When we answered the door my husband and I were nervous to see who would be there waiting to chew us out... However is was a very very very friendly man named Tony who was great! He seemed to be under so much stress and pressure he was nervous handing out of good and forgot our pop. He looked over worked and if he had just been yelled at by this horrible boss he's working with and couldn't think straight when this older gentleman Tony was so sweet I could she the upset in his eyes. I will call back to talk to a daily manager and If it gets no where there will be other consequences. Pizza and wings were great, 10-10 but service  0/10 would NEVER ORDER AGAIN WITH THAT MAN.

41.description: I like this place and look forward to stopping by every time I'm back in Chicaco. Order their flat (not the double dough) pizza with a few ingredients and you won't be dissappointed.

4.description: I love this place! We LOVE the fact that they are open until 2am! This is our go to place after going to the Allstate Arena!

6.description: This place wasnt good when the original owner had it. It was a spot to order a pizza at 3am before Sarpinos came around (not that they are much better)Now with the new ownership, this place is awful. The food has changed flavor, for the worse..The staff is weird and creepy now, especially the owner/manager John who will give you a slice with his bare hands into a Styrofoam box, after touching money and credit cards.I'm only giving this review an extra star because of how late they are open. If they werent open until 3am, I would give 0 stars if possible. Oh and not to mention the prices have went up. A slice and can here is almost 5$ now. Go to als during lunch and get 2 slices and a can for just about the same price.

22.description: I placed a delivery order for my boyfriend and me at 6:29 PM this past Wednesday.  The lady who took the order said to expect the delivery within 45 minutes, "especially since I live so close."  I am 1.5 miles away and about a 4-5 minute drive from the restaurant.  The delivery man came 20 minutes late.  I ordered a "fantasy panini sandwich" - a make your own item - which was overpriced in my opinion; it cost 4.50 just for the bread, the guy said when the lady I spoke to inquired to answer my question, and they charge you for every single item you add.  Nothing else on the menu appealed to me so with the meat, veggies, and cheese, it came out to $10.74.  Their panini offerings are limited so I think they do this so they can charge you extra:  75 cents for each type of meat you want, 65 cents for each type of vegetable and 85 cents for a slice of cheese - ridiculous when their other paninis are 6.99-7.99. My boyfriend ordered a chicken parmigiana sandwich. Neither of the meals came with fries or any side - you have to pay extra, $2.50 for french fries.When the delivery man came and left, I noticed a delivery charge of $2.50, which was not disclosed on their flyer or on the phone when I placed the order.  First of all, I live 5 minutes away, secondly, you need to inform customers of this charge.  Had I known I was being charged for delivery, I would've tipped the guy less.  Plus, I live 4 minutes away!!!! Absurd.  If you want to keep customers happy, you need to be transparent about your charges and not inconspicuously hide them to surprise us later.By the time the delivery came, both of our meals were not warm and barely edible.  The bread on both of our sandwiches was soggy.  I couldn't even pick up my sandwich as it immediately fell apart due to the soggy, soaked bread.  The bread fell apart, and I could only eat the veggies and meat with a fork.  My boyfriend's meal was the same; his bread was thicker than the panini bread, though, so he was at least able to hold it and start eating it like a sandwich is meant to be eaten.  He ended up eating the chicken only because like my bread, it was too soggy to continue eating - taste wise and mess wise.  The french fries were cold, some soggy and some just not fresh or even chewable.  Their temperature, taste, and texture were like fries you'd eat as leftovers the next day.  Therefore, we both didn't eat our fries.The meals were not enjoyable at all, timing of delivery was horrible, and pricing was way too expensive.  Furthermore, it was a WEDNESDAY!  If it was a weekend, I could at least justify the time it took because they'd be busier, but there was certainly no excuse when I live 5 minutes away.  I've ordered from restaurants way further and they've gotten warm, delicious, well-prepared meals to us within a half hour to 45 minutes. I would've rather cooked in this time frame than spend $25 on two horrible, inedible meals.  I would strongly encourage you to choose another establishment for your dining experience.  Stay away - you WILL be disappointed, guaranteed.

15.description: This review is specifically for Manager John.  "YOU" are the MAN!I ordered a plethora of food for myself along with 6 of my co workers. Close to 100 dollars of food to be exact. Our order which was originally taken by another employee was mishandled beyond belief and frankly as incomplete as it could have been. We received our order. We were NOT happy. I called and around closing time to share a few words with the Mama Mia employee who took my order. I asked him to make things right for me and my friends. What had happened next is something I did NOT expect. John the manager shows up at our door. He professionally explains the situation that had occurred and how communication had broken down amongst the employees. In addition to this he brought the completion of our order and MORE. He made things right, just like a manager should. We couldn't believe our eyes on how above and beyond he had handled the situation. All of us were in shock and awe. It gets better. The next day John calls and leaves me a voicemail offering to treat our party to dinner to (once again) make things right. He wanted to give us the opportunity to experience his establishment the way it should be experienced. I can't begin to express how much this means to me. This is what good customer service and business practice is all about. John, I will never forget how you turned a mediocre, borderline unsalvageable dinner around to one of the most enjoyable late night delivery experiences I have ever had.Thank you for "making things right".

20.description: I read a couple reviews and I wanted to just ignore them and give these guys a shot... This is fed a place you order from when you don't want good service... I order zucchini sticks small 10 inch veggie, carrot cake and a ginger ale they call me 45 mins later they called and said they are out of artichokes so my meal came to 31$ instead of 33$ when the delivery boy gets here 1hour 15 mins later (it's late at night) he hands me my food and says I forgot your pop. I said lol you forgot my pop? Which I saw happened in another review. Ok so he goes to get my pop. Then he comes back with my pop I have 40$ I said yeah I am going to need some change 8$ tip for you for what? I don't think so.. He looks at me with this face like "are you serious" yeah I am your a delivery boy you should be carrying money on you. He went down stairs and got me my change. Finally I pay the guy give him 5$ tip I was going to give him 3$ I should have he even knew I should have by this response "thanks beautiful" so basically what i gathered from this place is they aren't professional they are open until 2am which is nice. But I was to hungry and tired to even bother arguing. I won't eat here again bc of the U professionalism. It makes me think something gross could be in my food (this is what to expect when you eat here) and btw cake is really good zucchini fries OK pizza was OK not enough sauce at all the cheese wasn't melty it was a little hard. (Btw pizza boy smelt like weed) which is prbly why he forgot my pop and didn't carry any change on him or he really thought I was going to give him a 8$ tip lol

36.description: The pizza was decent, your standard Chicago thin crust cut into squares. The problem is it took almost two hours for the pizza to arrive and when the delivery guy got here he didn't have any change so he ended up with a huge tip. I don't make it a habit of giving mediocre reviews on the first try, but seriously, a delivery guy who doesn't have change is like a cab driver without a gas pedal. A baseball player without a glove. A nurse without a stethoscope. A... you know where I'm going with this. In this economy, being down money because a delivery guy wasn't prepared is a big deal.

14.description: Horrible. Ordered pizza for delivery. Told it would be an hour. Food never showed up. Called twice 30 min apart and was told it was being delivered both times. Ended up going somewhere else cause they never showed (McDonalds because after 3 hours nothing else was open). Horrible service, total scam.

3.description: A while back I scheduled a hair cut appointment for my husband with Eva. He got a call from a receptionist half hour before his appointment that Eva couldn't see him. The receptionist stated that he could come in the next 2 or 3 hours. He was already on his way, however they require a 24 hour cancellation notice if you can't make it. Eva didn't even pick up the phone, offer an apology for a inconvenience nor bothered to set up a different time. He ended up going elsewhere. Once they established their clientele, don't expect special treatment.  On a side note, stylists should wear more appropriate attire and be more professional.

1.description: Although the customer service wasn't 100% at all the ladies there were nice. My mother and I went for color and Olivia did both of our hair. She did an amazing job on my mom's hair and did a good job o mine although the hair dye died off within the first week and a half so that was very dissapointing because it looked ridiculously washed out. The customer service could have been better and I agree that they made you feel like you're bejg judged the second you walk in the door, making it an uncomfortable atmoshphere.

2.description: Have stopped here twice first time was to make a haircut appt. no one would help me but everyone was outside smoking! Stopped in there again to buy shampoo and conditioner the woman at the front desk was so damn rude I left the bottles on the counter and walked out! TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!! I'd give it a zero if it were allowed!

9.description: So happy I went there. Anna did my cut and color. she did an amazing job. She was so nice and funny and for the first time a hairstylist recommended a style that would look good on me . overall the salon was ok and prices are reasonable.

10.description: My experience was horrible. I came in for highlights and the lady who was doing them Agi (agnieszka) was extremely rude and made me feel uncomfortable. I had shown her a photo of what kind of highlights I wanted and she told me she couldnt do them as light as I wanted them because my hair would fall out. I had highlights done previously, roots grown out and all and when I had gotten my highlights done a different time by another women there they came out exactly how i wanted them to. But she told me she wouldnt put bleach on bleach because my hair would fall out. That WAS NOT THE CASE before i had gotten them done. After asking her a few questions about how she was going to lighten my hair, she turned the chair got in my face and said "who is the hair stylist, me or you?" I have been to this location about seven times and will never be coming back. That is beyond rude and unprofessional, you're not supposed to talk to any client that way. So not only did I leave the salon angry because of her attitude, but also unhappy with how my hair came out. Beware of this place.

4.description: Wow, it is quite fascinating how all of the 1 star reviewers bashing Oliwia have a history of only a single review on yelp- i.e. that particular review.  That's not phishy at all!! Lol.  Wish yelp would investigate such ratings site wide, kinda makes me question everything about my life as a yelp reviewee.Either way, cannot attest to any color or cut because I never had those done there; but what I can say is that ZigZag is the ultimate place for me when it comes to special dos.  Had several done for different occasions, anything from a conservative twist to a funky up-do braid, loooooooooooooooved them all.  All the girls there seemed to be very fashionable, which is what was my determining factor in deciding to entrust them with my special occasion look in the first place.

6.description: The vibe at that place is strange....not very welcoming at all. The staff is not too friendly. The two owners don't seem to care about their clients. Went for a haircut with Oliwia and did not like it at all. For a senior stylist she did a poor job. My gf went for color and cut with Ewa and was disappointed. Not to mention the wait....even with an appt I waited 30 mins....come on. Will not be going back...Don't bother going there :(

12.description: I went there to get a haircut, nice and easy, nothing crazy. Iza was great and  very friendly. Made me feel welcome and comfortable. I'll go there again for sure. The atmosphere there is awesome. You won't regret it :o)

5.description: What is wrong with this place? The vibe at Zig Zag is very strange- basically they stare at you and gossip what are you wearing and how you behave. This is really very unprofessional. You can easily feel very uncomfortable -especially because most of girls don't wear their best clothes when going to do their hair (I am talking about dresses, nice shoes etc..). I saw stylist Monika twice. The first time she did ok job - my UpDo last for most of the party. When I tried to schedule my second visit with Monika to do color; Olivia told me that Monika is not available and she will take me.  I told Olivia that I would like to see only Monika. Olivia wasn't happy about that but after a few minutes she scheduled my appointment with Monika. I told Monika about that incident. I just wanted to find out what is going on. Monika told me that Oliva very often steals clients from other stylist- in the same way she tried to "steal me" (or the service). It is very, very unprofessional and sad that the owner is doing such a terrible things to their employees. I agree with Alla K's review- "stylists made you feel like they are doing a favor to you". I wish I could give zero stars... I would never be back.

13.description: Love love love love love this place!  My friend who's been going there for 7 years now recommended it to me.  I came with an unfortunate at-home hair color (which left my hair yellow), but they worked their magic and "yellow be gone"!  Cuts are very European!  Very happy with the service overall.

11.description: Please do not go to this salon. This was my first time at this hair salon. My stylist, Anna, took me in 15 mins past my scheduled appointment. I knew as soon as I saw Anna I was in trouble. She had the weirdest hair cut and bleached hair.  When she washed my hair, I thought I would not have any hair left on my head. She was so rough. Hair should be treated with care like silk not like laundry. Then she proceeded to blow dry my hair which was also a terrible experience. So rough, pulling on my hair. I showed her the picture of the hair I wanted which was just basic beachy curls. I was so annoyed with her, then she went to the owner of the salon (Ewa) because she did not  want to do my hair anymore. Ewa was nicer but she still did not do the curls that I wanted. I left looking like Shirley Temple and ot beachy curls.Overall horrible experience. I felt rushed and they did not care how it looked especially when I told them I was going to a black-tie event.

8.description: I went to get a trim. I brought several photos, requested long, side swept bangs, no crazy layers...waited for 45 minutes. It has been three weeks. I am growing out my bangs... The layers are all over the place. It could not have been the language barrier; I speak both. Not happy :(

0.description: Weird vibe in the salon- I could not help but feel out of place. Then again, I do not like getting my hair cut, so I feel uncomfortable in pretty much every salon. I think my stylist was double booked, because I ended up waiting even though I had an appointment. Meanwhile, I saw a couple of other stylists just chilling. No problem for me, but I felt bad for her.My stylist was nice and down to earth. I have challenging hair and she did a good job. She was actually pretty quick... I've had haircuts that have taken up to 2 hours before. I was done in a little over an hour (haircut, hair straightening, eyebrow wax). Prices are very reasonable, also.

7.description: Horrible place. Run away. Wish I could give zero stars.. Made an appointment, was standing up in a wedding. Waited for an hour on the day of the event, before I angrily got up and left. Rushed home crying and had to get ready myself, with only 20 minutes left :( they're rude, unprofessional, and do not care about their customers. So disrespectful it's not even funny... Do not trust them if you have a special event.... Or anything else ...

3.description: Dorina's Eurospa is the most reasonable place around. I will not go anywhere beside Dorina's Eurospa. I always go there for my eyebrows, mani/pedi, etc. Dorina is such a sweetheart too! I would highly recommend this place!

1.description: I have been going to Dorina since my Junior year of high school and I absolutely would never go anywhere else! She always finds time to fit me in for an appointment whenever I call. I live in Champaign now for school and whenever I'm back in town, I always make sure to get my beauty services done by Dorina. Like I said, I won't go to anyone else! She does a great job with everything (facials, waxing, manicure, and pedicure). She is also a licensed esthetician as well. I never get cuts or ingrown hairs or blisters from the wax. She is very gentle and definitely knows what she is doing unlike a lot of waxing businesses in the area.

2.description: I absolutely love Dorina. Her place is a hidden gem.  She makes you feel comfortable - even if the service itself might not be.  She offers great service for a fair price.  I will definitely be returning.

5.description: Dorina does the best waxing I have ever had.  Hands down!  Very clean and professional, using sterile cloth strips and the best quality wax, she cleans areas without too much irritation, and with minimal pain.  After I went to her based on a recommendation, I am now driving all the way to Norridge every month to see her (I live in Old Town, so in traffic it can be a long drive, but she is well worth it).  I have been to most "posh", downtown spa's, but Dorina's waxing is much superior and a lot less expensive.  I highly recommend her.

0.description: Dorina is such a sweet woman she will accommodate so you can have your services done. She makes you feel comfortable, she is honest and you can talk to her about anything. I had a facial by her and she did an amazing job and she didn't poke my face with needles. I will definitely be coming back. Parking maybe tricky if you come in the P.M. so give yourself time to park

4.description: This place is the best because of Dorina.  She is the kindest person and gives the best massages.  I have been coming here for years and no matter what ache or pain I have she will fix it.  I have tried other places through the years and nothing compares to a massage by Dorina.  When I am finished I am so relaxed I can barely drive home!  I would go there daily if I could.

36.description: Love this place.  Have been going here for 9 years.  I used to work right next door to the place.  Eventhough I don't work or live near the place.  I still go out of my way to go there to get my Chinese food.  I don't even have to tell them what I want they already know when I walk through the door.  You can't beat the prices either.  I will be going for as long as they are there.  Thanks Chin Kitchen.

29.description: My wife and I picked up some food to take back to the Hyatt Regency O'Hare on vacation in 2011.  I am going back this month and can't wait to get some more food.  Its rare that a place leaves an impression that long so I thought some props online would be in order.  Stop in if you have a chance.  The BBQ pork fried rice was great :o)

42.description: 2 min walk from my house so I've never used their delivery but the food is good and one thing i like about this place is that you can actually watch the chefs cooking your food.  and let me tell you, these dudes are really good at what they do.  Price is decent and the freshness of their vegetable and meat is good too.  Definitely going back to this place.

23.description: Not very good.  General Tso's fried chicken was dried out, but covered in a thick sweet sauce.  Not spicy. Fried rice is rice and soy sauce.  Not even one circle of green onion.  I will not order again.

31.description: Love love love love this place!! A little pricey but food is excellent, my favorite chinese resturant.

34.description: The best garlic chicken I have ever had...seriously!Honestly, garlic chicken is the only thing I've had here because it is so good I don't want to so-called cheat on it by ordering something else. The portions are HUGE. I don't live anywhere near China Kitchen and by the time I drive home, the food is still hot. I usually get the lunch special that comes with an egg roll (way back when it used to come with a can of pop). At one point, I used to eat here so much that the guy behind the corner knew my order without me even having to say anything. I don't eat here that frequently (think 2x a year) and I haven't seen that guy since.I love the garlic chicken dish so much that I would always recommend it to friends or co-workers. It is super potent though so your car will smell like garlic and if you bring it back to your office, the whole office will smell like garlic. That's not a bad thing though.I tried going here a while back and it was closed for the day. We were told to go down the street to another Chinese restaurant (actual sit down service) as both restaurants were affiliated (I can't recall the name but it is just south on Cumberland, in another strip mall...it is tucked away in the corner..Lin's maybe?). Wish I lived closer!!

16.description: Worst Chinese food ever, the lo-mein was so garlicky, that was only flavor, wonton soup had no taste, dumplings all dough, only saving point was fried wonton, nice and crispy.

11.description: I always order the Mapo Tofu dish and the ba pork appetizer from this place. I prefer picking up my order from there and avoid having my food delivered especially during peak dinner hours because everyone in the area orders from them and they are really busy during those times.

39.description: I go there for lunch almost every day.  It's very inexpensive and you always get what you asked for.  This is your standard Chinese-American fill-you-up yummy cuisine.  If you like no-nonsense Chinese food then this is your spot.  Carry or order out ONLY!

37.description: Great carry out. The Hot and Sour soup is very good.

0.description: For a greasy spoon/hole in the wall Chinese place, this place is pretty good. But... That's what you're getting. It's a hole in the wall Chinese take out place. Expect no more. We've been going here for years. Love the General Tao's and Mongolian Chicken.  The wok guy makes all the sauces as ordered so sometimes it tastes better than others and sometimes it's thicker or thinner than others. But each time it's still good. The 'dinner special' is great: fried rice plus an egg roll. Portions are decently sized as well. Some of the other Yelpers mention the counter lady.....  She can seem a little rude but she isn't. She's actually nice. She's just busy.  They run the kitchen with just a few people. She is taking multiple calls and helping the guys out.

38.description: Been going here for years...amazing food their specialty is their orange chicken and kung pao chicken

27.description: If I could give this a 0 I would. Very rude - inability to provide fresh mustard sause (fresh) which all Chinese restaurants on the planet would have. Worst was the inability to accommodate very easy, very accessible requests.  May I have some extra red pepper; well that's an extra dollar; may I have vegetables, no that is an extra X dollars...I could go on....never again

32.description: Order from here all the time. Delicious!

13.description: I'm all for supporting mom-and-pop businesses but in this case, SKIP THIS PLACE.Ordered lunch special "to go".+ Cheap lunch special ($4.95 to $5.45)- Dirty- Crappy food. Ordered cashew chicken. Everything was doused with soy sauce.  That's all you taste.  The chicken tasted sour.  I stopped eating it for fear of the meat being old and getting food poisoning.  Threw all of the dish away.Never again.

24.description: China kitchen used to be good 6 or 7 years ago but now its disgusting and dirty!the chinese lady at the front her hands and nails are disgusting and dirty and she was picking up the phone,counting money,writing down orders and with the same philty hands touching freezer burn sweet ands sour chicken to put in the dirty looking deep fryer not once washed her hands, and my mongolian beef tasted rubbery and was watery ewww,sweet and sour chicken mostly greasy fried dirtt batter no chicken! NEVER AGAIN waste of money id rather go somewhere where its clean and fresh

7.description: Great Crab Rangoon and Garlic Chicken. Price is good too. Fast service. Never been for lunch just for dinner, but I heard its just as good

40.description: Their General TSO chicken is excellent.

30.description: I've been going here for years as it's by my work and where I pay volleyball.  The staff are friendly but be patient as their accent/english could be a challenge.  This place has a table for 4 but it's mostly for take out.The lunch specials are pretty affordable and you can literally serve it for 2 people.  I like their chicken cashew or Kun Po Chicken with chicken friend rice with an egg roll.  It has a lot of fresh vegetables which I like and it's not greasy.  Hubby loves their Orange chicken, crispy and sweet chicken nuggets with fried rice.

1.description: The only reason I'm even giving a 2 star review is because the delivery man was kind and the fried rice was pretty good, aside from pulling out a piece of hair from it which definitely was NOT mine because it was a totally different color! That was enough reason for me to NEVER order from there again. If I can't trust that my food is safe/sanitary to consume, why would I give it a second chance? I'll pass.I also ordered sweet and sour chicken. The breaded chicken wasn't that bad but the sweet and sour sauce, yuck! I can't even begin to describe what I tasted. It was watery and had a not-so-appealing kick to it. Nothing of what I expect my sweet and sour sauce to taste like. Luckily there were about 4-5 packets of sweet and sour sauce and thankfully those were fine.Normally I'd be the type to call and make a complaint but I don't know how far I'd get with the language barrier. Plus, I wouldn't want to eat anything else from there establishment since I now have major trust issues.

9.description: I've been going here for years as it's by my work and where I pay volleyball.  The staff are friendly but be patient as their accent/english could be a challenge.  This place has a table for 4 but it's mostly for take out.The lunch specials are pretty affordable and you can literally serve it for 2 people.  I like their chicken cashew or Kun Po Chicken with chicken friend rice with an egg roll.  It has a lot of fresh vegetables which I like and it's not greasy.  Hubby loves their Orange chicken, crispy and sweet chicken nuggets with fried rice.

26.description: I get my orders faster than Jimmy John's. I feel like I'm their sensei.

25.description: Love Love Love this place! We always order from here and even though we aren't that close they still deliver to us and quickly! The food is always good, hot, and I love how they always give extra sauce! They have great dinner specials that are huge at a great price. Whether you go in or order over the phone they are always very polite and I love saving the plastic food containers to use for my own left overs later on. Can't wait to order from this place again!

12.description: It is a hole in the wall kind of joint in a strip mall but you never judge a book by it's cover. I think that China Kitchen is one of the best places to get Chinese food in the area. The vegetables still have that bite to them and the meat isn't overcooked which is excellent which is a big + to me

21.description: The food is good, the prices are good, and the portions are decently large.  I've tried several things off the menu (Kung Bao, General Tso's) and have yet to go wrong.

17.description: I ordered a dinner meal and it appeared to be a good amount of food until u realized they put rice under the chicken to make it look like there was a lot. Food was ok. It took the delivery guy over an hour to bring the food which sucked!

10.description: I am from south suburbs (15 miles away) but every time I am in this area I return here to order food. I love this place Great food.

5.description: I don't really go to the "hole in the wall" chinese joints for trust issues. But I was craving fried rice and chicken so bad I decided to walk there after the gym. I ordered orange chicken with fried rice to go. When I got my order approx 15 minutes later I was so hungry I sat down and ate it there. The rice came out okay with no complaints. The orange chicken though was questionable. The orange sauce was way to sweet and the quality of the chicken wasnt the greatest. It tasted mostly like breading. I was in no position to complain since I already paid and half those people don't speak English. Gave it a chance and won't be coming back.

35.description: I used to live a 5 minute walk from here. Ordered from here out of convenience. This place is nothing to write home about, nor complain about. No dish stands out in my mind as either exemplary or disappointing. The prices are competetive and likely to bring you back for more if you live near by. The soups are great and so is the staff.

19.description: I'm a regular there  and so far have been happy with their food, portion size and price.  The only time I was disappointed was when I ordered some new Thai dishes they added to their menu.  It was lesson learned  -- I know better than to order a hamburger at a Colombian restaurant so same rule should apply here.  Stick to the Chinese dishes and you won't go wrong.

28.description: Garlic chicken was a nice sauce with a good amount of veggies with chicken. Seemed like a friendly place and is definitely take-out Chinese ambiance. Will eat here again.

3.description: If I could give no stars I would. Called in at 7:56pm to place an order for pick up, was told 15 mins and literally waited over an hour. Other people were ordering as they walked in and got their food. I was waiting for a small order of shrimp fried rice and large orange chicken and the lady was rude when i had asked about my food. Be more organized!

33.description: My favorite chinese food place, hands down.  The lunch and dinner specials are so affordable!  Best egg rolls I have ever had, same goes for their kung pao chicken, and the crab rangoon is amazing.  I have been going here for over 5 years and make out of the way trips just to grab some China Kitchen.  No matter how far away I move, the food is still hot when I get home, and I have enough for lunch the next day.  Simply delicious.

43.description: I love chineese food! This is nestled in the little plaza between white hen and plush pup. Food is good. And so cheap! Good lunch specials. Fast delivery. Really nice CS, even gave me free pop.

2.description: We ordered take out, and had it delivered. Everything was ok except the sweet & sour chicken. It was in a styrofoam container that had literally melted into the chicken. I called to ask for a new order, in a different container, and I was told it comes in styrofoam! The woman was rude and had no idea why I wouldn't eat my dinner from a melted container. I took my meal and drove it back there to show her. She had ZERO concern and offered to put my chicken in another container! Seriously?! I told her the chicken had melted chemicals in it and she still didn't get it. Got my refund and threw out their menus. We will never order from them again! Absolute worst customer service!

18.description: Quick delivery at a great price. Minimum amount is $10. We had wonton soup and Kung pao chicken and it was good. Kung pao had a great amount of spice to it. I'd order again.

41.description: Big fan of their lunch specials! Call ahead as it gets busy around lunch/dinner time. Keep in mind that they only have 2 tables for dine in. We always order in at work and they are always on time. T

4.description: I was hoping to finally find a good Chinese restaurant around me and when I entered China kitchen I was impressed. Very clean and the young lady working there was bringing my online order to the front desk as I entered. Unfortunately this was all that impressed me. I want to warn people not to order any Shrimp in any of their food. This place does not devein their Shrimp. None of it. All my shrimp including the shrimp egg rolls, and sweet and sour shrimp had veins in them. The only thing I liked was the Mongolian Beef. Stay away from the Shrimp!

6.description: BBQ pork was a little weird, as it was drenched in sweet and sour sauce. Shrimp and broccoli was perfect. Overall China kitchen is solid delivery Chinese food.

22.description: As an update to my last post, we did order from here again and instead of ordering the "meal" I ordered the dish and one fried rice for our diners to share.  The price was definitely more expensive this way, but you also got more of the actual dish too.... so I guess the meal isn't as bad as I thought, it just depends on how much you want to spend/eat.The dishes come with sides of rice.  not really stated on the menu so we didn't need the fried rice, but the fried rice was good.Same as the first time, the soup was a great bargain, the egg rolls were fabulous and everything else we ordered was decent and plentiful American Chinese.

15.description: I'm an airline pilot who gets around to enjoy my fair share of good food.  I also love Chinese food.  This place belongs out of business.  The women working the counter could not have been more rude.  The entire place smelled like dead fish.  I ordered Kung pao chicken.  Some of chicken isn't edible and the rest of it has zero flavor.  This place must be avoided.  I would have given it a zero if I could.

20.description: Husband and I went there for dinner in fall, and got sick doing it. The place is dirty and kind of scary. I like dives, but I will never go there again and will warn others away from it. Food was ...not amazing. Just kind of meh, and an hour later, we knew that we'd chosen the wrong place as it gave us food poisoning. Beware.

8.description: Pretty good Chinese food.I ordered from here after looking for a Chinese place open on a Monday (or usual spot was closed). Ordering was easy - we called but you can also order online. They told us it would be ready in 10 minutes, and it ended up being pretty close to that estimate.My husband and I each ordered a dinner special (he had orange chicken, I had kung bao chicken) and we enjoyed our meals.
