The dinner came with the main dish, a side of rice (fried or white), and an eggroll.When we arrived, the place already had quite a few people waiting for their food. I was glad to see that since we were straying from our tried and true spot.Once we got home and dug in, I thought the food was actually quite light, except for the heavy, greasy eggroll. It wasn't my favorite. However, the crab rangoons were tasty and had extra scallion, which we both enjoyed. They give you a ton of food too -  the dinner special easily fed me 3 meals.I haven't yet declared a winner for our Chinese food business, but this place is definitely in contention. We'll certainly order from here again to try some other dishes.

14.description: As an update to my last post, we did order from here again and instead of ordering the "meal" I ordered the dish and one fried rice for our diners to share.  The price was definitely more expensive this way, but you also got more of the actual dish too.... so I guess the meal isn't as bad as I thought, it just depends on how much you want to spend/eat.The dishes come with sides of rice.  not really stated on the menu so we didn't need the fried rice, but the fried rice was good.Same as the first time, the soup was a great bargain, the egg rolls were fabulous and everything else we ordered was decent and plentiful American Chinese.

3.description: I love this place. Their food is so good and facility looks very clean. Everything is well packed. Prices are resonable. Never had an issue with staff. Delivery is great. I'm from Chicago and temporarily in LA, but whenever I'm in chi town I have to get their food.

1.description: Decent food and quick service as expected. Nothing fancy, would prefer if need a quick but and don't need anything fancy.

2.description: Five star review for their delivery service - I haven't actually visited the restaurant, so I can't comment on the space or the table service. However, the food quality is high. Egg foo young is done to a nice consistency, not overcooked and hard. Fried rice is just average, egg rolls are good, chicken chow mein is solid. Overall, they have great variety on the menu, fresh ingredients, good use of seasoning, good prices, and a really courteous delivery driver. Give it a try.

9.description: Fast good food. Great prices...Lady @ the counter could be lil more friendly, sometimes hard to tell if she's even happy for customers, but oh well...good place near my work for actual chinese food.

10.description: Just moved to the area and was craving Chinese takeout. Stopped by and ordered some Mongolian beef.  When I got home I was disappointed to see that it was beef and peppers instead. I called to let them know of the error. They told me that their Mongolian beef has mushrooms, onions, carrots and green peppers instead of scallions and that if I wanted it with scallions, I need to let them know.  They exchanged my order but it was the same thing plus green onions. I tossed their menu in the garbage. On top of them creating whatever they want and calling it whatever they want, the food was pretty tasteless. Lesson learned.

4.description: This is my favorite spot for carry out chinese. Food portions are great, the dinner specials are budget friendly and flavors never disappoint. My favorite items here are the wonton soup, vegetable lo-mein and kung  pao chicken.

6.description: I have not eaten food here yet, but I can reflect on the fruit smoothies and quality of the service.  I stopped by for a smoothie because it was an 80 degree day in March.  I was enticed by the picture of bubble tea on the menu.  When I went in to order, I was told that they did not have the tapioca beads.  I was sad.. but hot and thirsty... so I ordered a smoothie anyway.  They allow you to combine two flavors, so I picked honeydew and pineapple.  This was one of the best smoothies I have ever had.  The consistency was perfect and the flavor was sweet.. but not too sweet... a perfect blend.  The service was prompt and friendly.  I will have to return when I am hungry!

12.description: AWESOME chinese food. The sweet and sour chicken is awesome probably the best i have ever had. The people there are real nice and they have you in and out real fast.  The beef chow mein is also very good and i would recommend this place if you are looking for some good chinese food .

5.description: For a little, neighborhood Chinese restaurant, the food is quite good.

11.description: This place has great cheap fast Chinese food that hits the spot. Plentiful portions, great prices, and fruit smoothies.

8.description: Easily the worst Chinese food I have ever eaten. Ordered delivery. Sweet & sour chicken with some pot stickers. Pot stickers were edible, but that is as far as I would go. Sweet & sour was basically KFC style chicken fingers with watery, tasteless sauce. I had two bites and threw it out. Called China House and got their version. It was better (but not much). I will stick to Chicago-style pizza when in Chicago from now on. I may never eat sweet & sour again... Sigh...

0.description: My husband and I have ordered take out food from here since late October/Early November, and LOVE it. Husband has gotten sweet and sour chicken for lunch on Friday's for over a decade and this is the only place that does a decent job that we've tried in Chicago. And yes, we've tried a few places by now. Fried rice is GOOD. I don't like fried rice by nature, and we both like our lunch specials with half and half (half fried and half white rice.) I tend to get different menu options every time, and they are willing to make spicy dishes less spicy or to substitute ingredients as needed (I don't do broccoli and they can do beef and broccoli, hold the broccoli and add other veggies I do like.) Lots of dishes with almonds in them.They care about what they do, and recognize us now and say hi. Their eggrolls are happy things. Although they have a small dining area that is fine, we usually do take out. They carry fruit tapioca smoothies and Pepsi products. HUGE lunch specials. Yummy!

7.description: Great food for a cheap price!

1.description: The lunch we had here was awesome.  We tried the falafel platter ($8) and a gyro and it was delicious.  The new owners were super friendly and welcoming.  At first glance, the place doesn't give off a warm welcome vibe but the owners were very friendly.  In addition to our ordered food, they brought out some delicious lentil soup, which they definitely need to add to the menu.  Their falafel ($6) was perfect and their hummus and baba ganoush was great too.  One commenter mentioned that the food temps were a bit off and it did seem like that were true.  The pita wasn't warmed and some of the food was only lukewarm but I didn't think the temps seriously detracted from the taste.  I'm glad they took over from the last owner as the food has significantly improved.

9.description: Wow!  What a great find.  My boyfriend mentioned seeing this place on his way home from work, so we decided to give it a try.  I'm so glad we did!  Everything was fresh and tasted so good!  I kept it simple with hummus and falafel. The service was great- friendly, helpful, and the staff seemed genuinely excited to share the delicious food. I will be coming back soon, and encourage you to check it out- you won't be disappointed!

23.description: Satiated, happy, and SO GOOD! Although slightly sparse decor-wise, it's very clean and bright. Solid, simple menu items with owners focusing on really fresh, made-to-order plates. We brought take-out home although there was available seating. Dinner smelled amazing when we got it home and the result? GOOD. Food. Not spicy (read: not hot/caliente), but flavorful. We've tried other Middle Eastern places in the area (tied with Chinese for favorite family cuisine), and this place does stand out for freshness- chicken shawarma and chicken tawook (menu spellings) were good for first trying out the menu. Falafel is freshly formed and fried (I watched the chef from a distance). Hummus had surprising tahini notes, and like the rest, FRESH. Add a little of their home garlic sauce to items and it's heaven on a plate. I could taste the individual spices in their rice and a little sliced pickle and was overall pleased.  Owner also asked us if we liked beef and gave us a little beef shawarma to try to go. Excellent.Less-expensive than some other Middle Eastern restaurants in the area and brand new, portion sizes were just right. Well-designed bright menus shout competency in the restaurant business for casual, inexpensive, modern Middle Eastern food.  Parking directly in front wasn't bad during rush hour. Two people with dinner plates, extra falafel (came with appetizer, salad, 1 piece falafel, 1 piece pita), and soda for $20 and change. Public restroom available.

12.description: The food here is delicious, but what really makes it stand out is the service. The people that work there are extremely sweet and thoughtful. They seemed genuinely happy to see us and genuinely  interested in what we had to say about the food. As I mentioned before, the food is delicious! You get a lot for your money and you will not leave hungry. I am so glad to have experienced this wonderful little place and would highly recommend it to anyone that lives nearby.

21.description: I went here with my mom and brother for lunch today. We wanted to try something new. This place was great! The three of us were completely stuffed for $27 with drinks. The staff was very nice, beyond what you get anywhere else, and they basically had us try a little of everything. This is a great new place for lunch.

16.description: UNDER NEW MANAGEMENT NOW: My review is based on the previous Owners and Management. You can smell the wonderful herbs and spices, and delectable meats as you walk into this joint. The food is made fresh everyday. We ordered two sandwiches: beef shawarma and chicken shawarma. The chicken had a wonderful garlic sauce and stuffed with excellent, savory condiments which made for the perfect amalgamation. It was tender, meritorious, fresh and scrumptious! I really liked how fresh the pita bread tasted. It was light and fluffy. We learned that they make it fresh everyday. Sweet! The sandwiches were a generous size and very filling for only $4.95. We ordered a Tahini salad for $2.95. They also offer Tabouleh and chopped shawarma-matik salads for the same price. Our sandwiches did not come with anything, so we assumed that maybe some items are a la carte. For an extra $2.29 you can purchase fries or a side of yellow rice. They have a very simple and limited menu, but I like this because this means great quality for the customer. Their kufta kabab plate is only $8.95 and it is a bargain considering that it comes with two skewers of ground beef and lamb mixed with a bit of grilled onions, tomatoes, garlic and parsley. If you do not eat meat, you may want to order a veggie falafel sandwich stuffed with fresh chopped salad and tahini sauce for only $2.95 (it is a huge sandwich) and get a side of humus or baba ghanouj. By the way, they offer lunch specials Monday - Friday for only $6.95, but I have no idea what their lunch specials consists of so if you go here for lunch just ask about their lunch specials. If you like hot tea, you must try their mint tea, which is excellent (only $1.45)! They have a self-serve area for your beverages with free refills. My friend had a soft drink, but I don't drink soda pop at all, so I was happy with a tall glass of water with my meal. NOTE: We tried this restaurant again on our way to O'Hare as I was on my way out of the country for my employer. We stopped in for Lunch, and notice it was dead empty. It is now under New Management. The quality of the food is worthy of three stars (very average tasting food -- The Pita Inn is so much better). The service could definitely be improved. Price point and portions = 4 stars.

17.description: Satiated, happy, and SO GOOD! Although slightly sparse decor-wise, it's very clean and bright. Solid, simple menu items with owners focusing on really fresh, made-to-order plates. We brought take-out home although there was available seating. Dinner smelled amazing when we got it home and the result? GOOD. Food. Not spicy (read: not hot/caliente), but flavorful. We've tried other Middle Eastern places in the area (tied with Chinese for favorite family cuisine), and this place does stand out for freshness- chicken shawarma and chicken tawook (menu spellings) were good for first trying out the menu. Falafel is freshly formed and fried (I watched the chef from a distance). Hummus had surprising tahini notes, and like the rest, FRESH. Add a little of their home garlic sauce to items and it's heaven on a plate. I could taste the individual spices in their rice and a little sliced pickle and was overall pleased.  Owner also asked us if we liked beef and gave us a little beef shawarma to try to go. Excellent.Less-expensive than some other Middle Eastern restaurants in the area and brand new, portion sizes were just right. Well-designed bright menus shout competency in the restaurant business for casual, inexpensive, modern Middle Eastern food.  Parking directly in front wasn't bad during rush hour. Two people with dinner plates, extra falafel (came with appetizer, salad, 1 piece falafel, 1 piece pita), and soda for $20 and change. Public restroom available.

10.description: Nothing changed. Very disappointed. I ordered a chicken shwerma sandwich and it takes to much time to prepare it. I wouldn't come back to this "restaurant".

5.description: I had a Restaurant.com certificate for this restaurant. The owner/manager refused to accept it. At first, he said he didn't know what it was, then he said it's new management, and he just wont take them. Then, he said he wont take it because they don't pay him, and what did I pay for it. He was so rude and ignorant, I walked out. So, I gave it one star based on service. I have no idea what the food tastes like, and I never will, not that I am too upset about that.

11.description: I went here on a weekend during lunch time with my wife and daughter and we were the only people in the place. The food was so slow. The only thing really edible was the falafel. The rice was flavorless, The chicken was super dry, the kaftka was under cooked and had a super strange taste to it. I doubt I will ever go again and spend 30 bucks on a horrible lunch.

22.description: The food here is delicious, but what really makes it stand out is the service. The people that work there are extremely sweet and thoughtful. They seemed genuinely happy to see us and genuinely  interested in what we had to say about the food. As I mentioned before, the food is delicious! You get a lot for your money and you will not leave hungry. I am so glad to have experienced this wonderful little place and would highly recommend it to anyone that lives nearby.

0.description: The food here is a 4 out of 5, but the service is amazing and truly makes this place special. It's one of those small restaurants that endear you to them with their hard working scrappiness and hospitality.We got the chicken kebab platter to-go with extra meat and a side of hummus. The chicken was great and different than other Middle Eastern kebab spices...the chef seemed to have added cinnamon to it, creating an earthier flavor than usual. The platter also came with baba in one and hummus in the other, and the jasmine rice was generously portioned. Total with extra chicken came out to $16 for each plate ($10 otherwise).While we waiting for the chicken to be grilled, the owner gave us a small free sample of falafel. He also insisted that we go home with sauce samples and drinks. The cherry on top was that this all happened around 10pm New Years Eve, when all the other middle eastern places closed early, weren't doing takeout, or flat out lied about being open when they actually weren't (I'm looking at you, Shawarma Inn).Some small things I'd love to see improved: a bigger pita to hummus ratio, less oil in the baba ganoush, and using white meat for the chicken kebabs (dark meat is more flavorful, but it came with untrimmed fat).

20.description: Delicious food,  very friendly staff!  Have been back here multiple times.  Huge portions for lunch specials. Great when you want a home cooked meal with a great price!!

19.description: SO GOOD

2.description: Schiller Park has a new winner on its hands with Shawarma-Matik! Only 2 miles from O'Hare, it's worth the trip even if you're not in the neighborhood. Open only 6 weeks, owner Hani has a couple of guys working so they can get to know the customers. Sami took our order at the table, which surprised me because it looks like a take out place. The interior is clean and spartan, and the logo design and menu belie the fact this is a single location operation. All of the food is made fresh daily. It's influenced by Lebanon and Jordan cuisine according to Hani. We tried the tahini salad with veggies and the tabbouleh, both fresh and delicious. Then came the baba ghannouj and the hummus, which had a smoky flavor because they pan roast the ingredients before blending them. Falafels were tasty and so was the chicken shawarma, but the lightly spiced yellow rice stole the show. The portions are huge. The service was so nice! Sami came over multiple times to refill our drinks and salads and then introduced the owner. The generosity overflowed. The taste was awesome. The value is off the hook. Go there immediately! It's amazing.

18.description: Delicious food,  very friendly staff!  Have been back here multiple times.  Huge portions for lunch specials. Great when you want a home cooked meal with a great price!!

13.description: We had a great dinner there tonight  The food was very tasty and well prepared,  with a good char on the edges of the shawarma meats.  The flavors come in interesting combinations and really complementary to one another--definitely try their hot sauce and garlic creamy sauce with whatever you eat.  We had babaganoush (sp?) and combination plates but everything is excellent.  The staff/owners are very friendly.  Seating is a bit limited and it's not a place to go if you're in a rush but the warm atmosphere and delicious tastes makes it all worthwhile.

4.description: Nope!  Sorry Shawarma-Matik.  Fool me once, shame on you.  Fool me twice, shame on me.Twice in the last few weeks I've attempted to order Shawarma-Matik through GrubHub.  Twice.Both times, they failed to confirm my order and the order was cancelled.The only thing this is good for is losing customers.

6.description: There is a sign stating "under new management" so hopefully people will give this place another try.  I have tried falafel once and was not impressed.  Being a novice to Middle Eastern cuisine I decided to try this place close to where I work.  While waiting for my chicken schwarma plate, the man behind the counter offered me a piece of fresh homemade baklava (amazingly delicious and melts in your mouth) and a fresh falafel out of the fryer to try.  I ended up ordering a falafel sandwich as well.  So flavorful.  The salads and sauces were fresh and flavorful.  I can't wait to go back.

15.description: First of all, this place changed hands as of a few weeks ago.Second, I experienced the worst customer service here. So bad that I walked out mid order. Don't waste your time on this restaurant. There are too many other good middle eastern places nearby.

7.description: Over the past two years, we have tried every place within 5 miles of here and this is by far the best Lebanese in the area.  We eat here at least twice a week.  It's a local mom/pop joint.  They are teaching their son ins and outs of the business and the husband/wife team make everything food to order.  They are very pleasant and warm.  This isn't fast food to please don't expect your order to come right out right away.  Just like at Harolds Chicken, it takes a little time to prepare a good meal, be patient.  We really hope that for the success of their business, the operations will continue to improve especially because some customers just aren't very forgiving and these little places live/die by word of mouth.  Here's a tip that works well for my wife and me --  stop in, place your order.  Then go run a few errands and come back in about 20 minutes.  Do that and you'll never wait.  At all the other places around, you can tell they just carve meat off a rotisserie and give it to you.  Shawarama- Matik adds some more flavor and does something else on the grill the makes it that much better.  The baba ganoush and hummus always looks beautiful, with olive oil, giardinera and spices.  Tabaloueh is fresh and smells and tastes wonderful.  They always add little salads to sample.  Very, very good.We're so happy they are within walking distance from us and hope they are here for a very long time.

8.description: Really disappointed with this place. We have heard nothing but great things about the food so we decided to try it on a Friday night. We placed an order at 8 for delivery - the weather was bad so we didn't expect fast delivery - except that we received a phone call at 9:30 from the restaurant telling us that they cant deliver the food because they don't have a delivery driver.  Then they stated that we can come pick it up, and to top it off the woman who called us was extremely rude and very unprofessional. We didn't receive a single apology nor were we offered a different solution other than "pick up your food after over an hour of it being cooked".If you know that you don't have a delivery driver then why even accept an order for delivery, and better yet, why wait an hour and a half to inform us of such? Extremely disappointing experience, will not be dining there in the future. Just glad that we didn't use a credit card with the order!

3.description: We tried this place with a Groupon.  We got offered a couple of lunch plates with the Groupon and tried the chicken shawarma plate and a kufta kabob plate, each valued at $8.95.  I can't in good conscience go with more than 2 stars here though.  The pita bread was cold, everything else that should be hot was lukewarm at best, and the beef plate had a quite strong lamb flavor.  The hummus that came with the kabob plate was refrigerator cold.  The place is barren.  With the Groupon, we didn't make a fuss, and left after a quick and somewhat unappetizing meal.

14.description: Excellent food, good prices. The only negative about the food is the cold pita. The place itself isn't nice but it doesn't matter for take-out.

1.description: The absolute worst massage ever, and they have the nerve to charge  $85.  What a total joke, just left and I'm more stressed then when I arrived.  It's also 80's retro dirty

2.description: I went there one day when I couldn't turn my head because of a knot in my neck.  Not good vibey place, kinda reeked of happy endings.  The little massage girl insisted on helping me shower before the massage (I think it was required) which was kind of - no - very - weird.  On the happy note she did get out the knot, but I was so freaked out during the whole ordeal I didn't relax a bit the entire time.  Save your money for somewhere else.

0.description: Went to get waxed up. Must say shoulda backed out when the estetician said it was her second time. I forged on. The whole experience was so painful cause the wax was too cool. We actually had to stop and wait for the wax to warm up. By the time we were done I had double the wax left on me than I came in with hair. I had to go home and sit in a warm bath and am still sticky. Annd I still have hair all over.  I dont know why but I actually  felt bad since the wax job was not done properly and I still had hair everywhere, she was going to have to give me a break on the charge. So I stayed for a massage to relax from the horrible wax experience. Man was I wrong...  Rushed massage. The therapist went in and out. Horrible...I was completely over charged and just astonished that she charged me double than what she quoted me on the phone for the wax. Plus massage. Completely shady and should noy be liscenced to offer these services. These places should be closed immediately.

1.description: Oh boy.... well we stopped here as a joke since it was the illest cafe in Norridge... you had to be there.But I kinda got the sense that this place was a front for something.  It contains-A snack bar that serves machined espresso, factory pastries, and some other assorted junk.A bunch of tables and chairs.A plasma TV.A pool table.Some shady Italian guys hanging out reading Italian newspapers.An ATM.The ATM is useful for when you want to visit the snack bar.  They only accept cash, and directed me over yonder.  Of course I obliged, and tried to withdraw some bills while I was paying 2.00 for the privilege.  But ho, $40 was too much.  I tried $20 and hit the jackpot.  As soon as my cash spit out (the most wrinkled, dirty 20-spot) the machine goes out of service.  I mentioned it to the girl at the snack bar, who then said, "oh yeah I'll call the guy to take care of that."  I smiled, bought an espresso, and slowly made my way to the door, taking care not to make any sudden moves.4 stars for letting me know the Italian mafia is alive and well.

2.description: nice little euro place....tv's everywhere pool table ...perfect chill place

0.description: Stopped by for espresso and a Half gallon of ice cream...Very nice. The German lady behind the counter was very nice.  Overall a good snack, I had fun-but not as much fun as the time I took a bath with a rooster...

3.description: I was dissatisfied with my experience at this location. I am a stylist of 10 years and will never step foot in this store again or give them any business. The employee I dealt with was not helpful and rather than buying what I needed I was so put off by the attitude I received I ended up returning everything I had already purchased the day before, and she did not make that easy on me. I returned to the store 3 times before I was granted the return. With a receipt, with a cosmoprof card, she just kept giving me reason after reason the return couldn't happen. What ever happened to customer service? Would it hurt to smile? Be friendly.... ? I suggest Cosmo prof rethink their staff before they lose all business.

1.description: Earlier today I entered your Harwood Heights Illinois location with my girlfriend whom was your customer. I was a bystander. I am in management I manage 600+ people on a daily basis and your manager on duty today disgusted me completely. While we were standing at the register for about 5 minutes waiting to be checked out, this individual decided to confront and reprimand a new employee on the store floor. Not only is this display completely inappropriate while customers are waiting to be checked out, the way she was speaking to this young woman was completely out of line. So out of line, I offered this young lady a job to remove her from this disgusting establishment. No one deserves to be treated in that manor. And for one of your $12 an hour paid managers, with a power trip, I advised my girlfriend to go to a separate establishment.

2.description: If I can give a negative star I would every time I come her I always have a prob here... They are rude.. They don't help you out... They have convos  w each employee but the customers.. The manager is rude they look like they hate their lives... And half the people here don't even know about any of the products!!!

0.description: After being treated very badly at a different location (being treated like shoplifters when walking into the store), I visited this location with a group of ladies and was very pleased with my experience. They were friendly and helpful. This is the only location I will visit from now on

3.description: I actually give this place 3.5 stars.   So my gf and I made a weekend trip to Chicago.   The first night of our trip we stayed at the Renaissance hotel.   Because it was freezing outside we decided to dine in at the hotel restaurant.Place:The atmosphere is quiet because there weren't too many people at around 9 pm.  Actually, around this time more people would be hanging out at the bar area.   Service:The waiter is pretty nice.   He came back often just to check up on us.  Since there weren't too many people our food came out pretty quickly.   Food:Frito appetizers - it's not bad.   A mix of calamari, fried artichoke, and shrimp.   Sea Bass - the fish is a tad bit oily for our liking.   They used ginger that was not entirely fresh as well.   Somewhat disappointing for a $36 entree.  Pork tenderloin - this isn't too bad.   The meat mixed with the apple sauce had this nice combo taste.  They added the sweet potatoes on the side which was tasty as well.

1.description: This review is only for breakfast, and I believe they have lunch here but no dinner. There aren't a ton of options right here when staying at the Renaissance, especially without a car. This is ohare and not downtown Chicago obviously. So for that it isn't bad.However, the buffet itself is really small for $21. They do have an omelette lady who makes the perfect large omelette super fast. The rest of the buffet is just meh, especially when compared to other Renaissance hotels. The service was nice and the Ala carte menu looked decent.

2.description: I've been here probably a dozen times, but only for the lunch buffet. The lunch entrees are roughly the same price, so it just makes sense to get the buffet if you like the options. There are typically a couple prepared cold salads, a hot meat dish, a hot carb side, and a hot veggie side, plus fresh pizza, soup, bread, and made to order salads and pastas. Dessert options are typically either cookies or petit four type options. Service is hit or miss, and the drink glasses are tiny. It's still a great lunch option though, and can definitely be healthy if you want it to be.

5.description: Flight was cancelled so ended up at Fresh as I wanted to not wander from the hotel.  Dinner menu was concise and covered your meat, fish, chicken options.  I went with the salmon and vegetable hash sans potatoes.  Fish was cooked correctly and was very tasty.  The vegetables were obviously fresh and cooked perfectly.  Service was wonderful as I never had to ask for water and they constantly checked on me for any needs.I'd recommend the meat and cheese tray as a starter/small meal.  Great variety of cheeses and they actually had Iberian ham!  Nice touch and thoroughly unexpected.I'll eat here again.

6.description: I am always against eating in a hotel restaurant but recently I ate here with a client who was staying at the hotel.  I must admit that the lunch special was really good.  There was a full menu or you could order the lunch buffet for $13.99.  I looked over the menu and noticed that most of the items were over the $14 price point so I figured with the buffet I could make what I want.  I was very impressed when I realized there was also a chef standing there who would make you fresh pasta combinations and fresh salads.  Score!  I went with a wheat pasta with peas, asparagus, onions, grilled chicken, peppers, olive oil and a small spoon of red sauce.  They mixed it up in the frying pan and served it up fresh to me.  It was kind of like Italian's version of Mongolian BBQ!For my salad...I went with Romaine, avocado, tomatoes, cucumber, crumbled blue cheese, some crispy bacon and a small squirt of blue cheese dressing.Everything was really good plus it gave me control of what i was eating.  Salad was not drowning in dressing nor was my pasta covered in a heavy salt laden sauce.  This ended up being a great alternative to ordering off of the menu.I noticed the buffet had various salads and hot food but I did not make my way over there to sample anything.  But I did have to try the flat bread pesto pizza.  The chef took it out of the oven fresh and placed it out at the buffet.  I was very happy with the quality and with the variety of what Fresh offered and if I find myself in the area with a client near the airport I would stop her again.I was also very happy that they valeted my parking because I ate in the restaurant.  I wish that the other hotels in the area were that cool too but they are not...after all I am spending money inside the hotel.

7.description: Fresh may be difficult to locate, as it sits in the corner of the Renaissance Chicago O'hare hotel. I wouldn't necessarily drive out of my way to eat there, but for a nice, healthy lunch outside the office walls, Fresh is always a favorite choice. The menu is somewhat limited featuring some salads, sandwiches, and a couple of soups. They have the most delicious grilled cheese sandwich with smoked mozzarella, olive tapanede, and fresh tomatoes - all smashed between two slices of sourdough bread. Mmmmm. Most recently I had the egg white omelet with feta, spinach, and tomatoes. ((Ask for it without olive oil, or else your eggs will be swimming in it)). The omelet was incredibly fluffy - the fluffiest I've yet to encounter. Fresh's biggest selling point is their lunch buffet. For $13.95 you have access to an all you can eat "make your own" salad bar and pasta bar. In addition, they have daily specialties - usually a meat dish, potato/pasta dish, and a vegetable dish. It doesn't stop there. They also have fresh cold salads made daily, as well as the soup of the day. Is there dessert?? Yes. There is! The buffet has a couple kinds of cakes or brownies and fresh fruit. The food is always fresh and delicious. It doesn't sit out for hours on end getting cold or soggy. The biggest downfall? The prices. I suppose this goes with the territory of being in a hotel - it's the convenience factor. A salad will run you about 14 bucks...as will a sandwich. However, the service is great and so is the quality. When my omelet came out drowned in a vat of oil, I asked for it to be remade dry. No questions asked, the waiter had a new and oil-free omelet out to me in a matter of minutes. Big points for that. Great, fresh food only walking distance from the office makes my belly happy. It might make my wallet a little light, but it's worth it each time.

8.description: Fresh is in the lobby of the Renaissance hotel and is the only restaurant in the hotel.The food is priced fairly for a hotel. The chicken noodle soup is tasty.Pork chops were cooked well and were better than I've had at pricier restaurants.The Turkey club was good and had a lot of bacon on it.Service was very fast and they refilled drinks immediately.They checked up on me often and didn't make me wait forever for the bill.

0.description: Typically I try not to eat dinner in hotels unless it is a unique well known restaurant.   I have eaten here for breakfast a number of times and they do a good job on the buffet.  But tonight I did dinner.  The menu was not extensive but covered all the bases and the prices were in line with other similar venues.  The service was almost immediate as Melanie came over to say she would be bringing me water and rolls.  The restaurant was not busy and she was the only server and handled the spreadout tables very well.  I gave her my order and she commented on my entree selection saying it was her favorite.   I ordered the Walnut Spinach Salad and the Pork Tenderloin dinner with roasted sweet potatoes and vegetables.  The rolls were ok but would have been better if they had been warmed.   The salad was huge and just as delicious!  In addition to the named items it had sliced pears and a variety of cheese squares. And it was topped with a Balsamic vinegar dressing that was outstanding.  And they allowed the right amount of time to enjoy the salad and let it settle before the entree came out.  How I wish many other restaurants could learn this.  The main course came out and looked delectable and without being all piled on top of each other in the center of the plate.  There were four healthy slices of pork tenderloin with a tasty glaze; the roasted sweet potato was skinned and ready for butter; a lot of Asparagus  cooked perfectly;  and, a small amount of what was described as restaurant made Applesauuce.  And it tasted like it was.  The pork was cooked perfectly and almost made this review a 5. But the rolls and the very small amount of applesauce took it down.Melanie did a great job and I really enjoyed this meal.

4.description: Had dinner here last night with a bunch of coworkers and although service took a little longer than we are used to, the food was good.  I really enjoyed the beet salad and the mushroom flatbread.  Also, the bread basket had pretzel bread...which is always a nice surprise.

12.description: Clean fresh  friendly and delicious food. Prices are also reasonable. I highly recommend this place .

7.description: Welcoming & great service! Ahmed was accommodating to my allergies (soy & sesame)and even gave me free falafel once he found out! I had the chicken shawarma plate and the rice was cooked perfectly, the chicken was moist and delicious!!! He even served us their lentil soup on the house for us to try! I was very happy he did because I will be back for it! It was fantastic! Make sure you try their dessert I had the walnut baklava which was a perfect sweet ending!

3.description: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! had the combination plate and the BEST lentil soup EVER!! It has a little bit of a curry taste but oh my goodness to die for especially with some of their hot sauce. Died and went to middle eastern heaven. The staff is soooo nice, we were served by a middle aged woman she's sooooo sweet. You don't find this kind of service AND food anywhere. Price is also very affordable compared to most middle eastern restaurant... 12.99 for 3 types of meat!! So amazing. So happy with my visit

1.description: I have been eating a lot of Mediterranean food lately.  Sultan kabob has pretty good Mediterranean food.  The owner is super nice and very friendly.  When he found out it was our first time there he gave us a small bowl of lentil soup.  We all ordered a chicken shawarma sandwich as it was late and I have been reducing my food intake trying to lose weight (so far I've lost 8 lbs since Jan 11th). We did order a side of hummus.  The hummus, bowl of lentil soup and 1/2 Chicken Shawarma was enough to satiate my hunger and I had a 1/2 sandwich for lunch today.  Like I said the food was pretty good, but to me nothing really stood out.  Great service and reasonable prices.

2.description: Took a chance and tried this place and WOW!!!The lentil soup we had was absolutely delicious and the chicken kebab was to die for!!!The service was so friendly and welcoming.We are so glad we stopped in because we will definitely be back to try more stuff on the menu!!Yum!!!!!!!

9.description: Great food .. Very friendly staff .. You should try their beef Shawarma sandwich.. it is just A+++

18.description: I had the sultan beef kebab and it was generous portions, really tender and grilled perfect. The owner gave us complimentary lentil soup that was fresh,savory, and I will definitely order next time. The place is clean; the service friendly and efficient.

10.description: My family and I really enjoyed all the food we ordered. I loved the chicken shwerma, my husband loved the smokey baba ghanoush, and my kids liked the chicken kabobs.  Everything was so flavorful, I didn't have to drench it in sauce.  The staff is excellent!  We will be coming back soon.

13.description: This place is delicious! Went here with my husband one night just because the place was near our house and we wanted to give it a try. The staff here is very friendly. The food is delicious and very fresh.This is definitely going to be my new go to spot.

16.description: Fresh, clean food with prompt service and a friendly owner. Nicely priced but I'd rather pay another dollar or two for a bigger sandwich but hey I suppose this Irish guy has been in America to long.

17.description: I was craving falafel and my boyfriend decided to give this place a try. He went in to place a to-go order for some falafel but also ended up ordering the combination plate. He said that the person behind the counter gave him a complimentary red lentil soup which he enjoyed very much. In addition, he said that the place looked very clean and well maintained. Once he got home, we devoured everything, it was delicious. The chicken was juicy, the beef was medium given the small pieces and the kafta was seasoned well. I especially liked the salad that came with the plate because it had Romain lettuce as suppose to Iceberg. The only thing I was not crazy about was the rice, it was long and thick. The sauces that came with the meal were tahini, spicy red and green (garlic and green hot pepper). The last one didn't go very well with the meal but would have been great on empanadas. I would love to try the place for their lunch special.

15.description: Very good meal.  Even my kids enjoyed the lentils and meats.  We will return.

0.description: Food was great!The portion size were very good, lots of flavor in the chicken shawarma and hummus along with being affordable and FAST.If you're looking for great Mediterranean food at an affordable price (which is a rarity in this neighborhood) you would do wise to go here!

5.description: The restaurant is so clean and the food is made fresh ! Our waitress was amazing and so sweet ! Also the food is amazing , it's fresh and seasoned just right . I will for sure come back on my on my next stay in Chicago !

11.description: Great service,nice people and delicious food. I ordered food for to go and the service was outstanding

8.description: I just finished lunch here with my son and two other people and everything we ordered was fresh and delicious.  I had a chicken kabob, my son had a beef kabob and the Lam was also ordered.  Each plate had huge meat portions.   We also had sides of hummus and falafel and everything rocked. Highly recommended.

4.description: Order the combo platter like everyone suggested, excellent choice and loving it. Chicken are so moist & juicy. Beef is so tender & delicious. Would definitely come back again.

14.description: The food was really good! Probably one of the best spots around this neck of the woods. Loved the clean atmosphere and the friendly staff.

6.description: OMG... the food here is sooo good I can't stop coming back!! I usually get the combination platter and it never fails to get me full. The chicken is spiced the right way, the beef is cooked the right way and the portion is perfect. The owner is extremely nice. I will definitely be back with my friends and family.  I love this place!

3.description: Food was averagge. Vegetable with dinner was a mix like you'd get in a frozen bag at the store. Kids pasta sauce tasted like it came out of a can. Won't be back

1.description: My experience here is much like the others below.  Dark, dreary and smells like old smoke.  The waitresses barely speak English and have an attitude.  We ordered Panzarotti which is a  stuffed pizza, fried to golden perfection.  Forty minutes later we received BAKED dough, thick at the crust, hard to cut into, let alone bite into which is how Panzarotti is supposed to be eaten.  We asked the waitress why these are baked when the picture on the menu clearly shows a fried pizza pillow.  She said she didn't understand what we were saying and we asked her if we could speak to someone who spoke English.  She never came back so I guess she's still searching.......I won't go back!!

2.description: My dining experience here was delicious! THE BEST tiramisu I've ever tasted. The entree was delicious, the staff was polite. I wonder why there are reviews here from 4-7 years ago?

5.description: The worst dining experience I've ever had! I dine out a lot and am not very hard to please.So I bought a Restaurant.com gift certificate for this place since its close to work. Three of us went for lunch.Ambiance:First tip off, the place was empty at 1pm. Patrons in the outside seating were smoking right by the entrance.All the lights were off making it seem like they were too cheap to turn on the lights.There was one waitress for the whole place.It reeked of cigarette smoke.There was blaring techno music the whole time - not good techno mind you, they played the mix versions of various songs the whole way through 15 minutes each of repetitive beats that were never mixed into anything else.On to the food:We all ordered iced tea. One of them had a HAIR in it. It took 15 minutes to get a replacement on the drink and the waitress didn't seem to realize what the problem was even after we explained it twice.We waited 15 minutes for our salad course. I got my entree salad half way through the other's salad course which was fine. It took another 40 minutes to get the hot entrees.Steak Salad: bagged salad, 4 slices of cuke, a handful of greek olives, 1 skinny steak which was the tough as leather and full of gristle.Bolognese: bland. How do you screw up pasta sauce?Saltimboca: OK. The prosciutto was not crisped up or anything  it was rather rubbery.The one plus: hot bread and butter. Yum. Even though it took 15 minutes to get a refill on the bread tray after we requested it.The icing on the cake: Even though I presented my restaurants.com certificate before ordering, when it came time to pay, the waitress tells me its cash only because of the cert. I had no cash. She promptly offers up the ATM in the back hallway. OY.So, service was crappy, food was crappy, ambiance was crappy. Its CRAP.

6.description: Like Teresita, I came with a restaurant.com certificate in hand. I read the part about cash only though so I came prepared for that. I did NOT come prepared for the bad food, nor the repetitive euro dance music that droned on endlessly in the background. Small glasses for the iced tea promised the need for numerous refills and the waitress had to be flagged down for most of them, even though we were one of the only two tables in the place. Chicken nuggets were worse than the ones served at McDonald's. Salad came with 4 slices of cucumber, 4 tomato wedges, and 4 olives. Really? The house Italian dressing was extremely bland. The waitress seemed proud to offer that it was made there. I wouldn't have been. Oil was all I could taste in it. Ribeye steak sandwich was the THINNEST piece of beef that I have EVER seen. Seriously. Tough and full of gristle. The toasted sesame seed bread was the only redeeming part of this sandwich. Good bread. Bad sandwich. My friend enjoyed the cheesy Italian beef, which I have to admit looked great. I would not dine here again, $25 off or not...

7.description: This place has been consistently managed horribly since about 2005.  I pop in about every two years just of lunch and coffee and it never really changes.  The service is so slow and the waitresses barely speak English and most often have an attitude.  And yes, ignorant people do smoke there and could care less about others customers or the rules.  On my last recent visit for coffee only,  I waited over 20 minutes for my bill and I had asked the waitress who told me " I am not your waitress, while she was smoking outside."   I walked out and hit the road.  Pass this place by,  not worth your time.  Stay home.

8.description: If you want a dark cafe with lot of euro and middle eastern ethnicities, this is the place to go. This place has great food and a european style fast food dining. Come here with a casual date or friends. Be ready for some loud chattering and big groups of ethnicities eating or just having coffee. My favorite is the Calzone or Buffalo Chicken Sandwich w/ a side salad and peppermint tea. The prices are great and the service is ok but remember its  like europe! You have to usually ask for the check. People hang out there for HOURS!

0.description: I don't know why this place has such bad reviews...I had a very nice salad and espresso while I was there. The service was very attentive and it's big portions for the price. It's a nice little place to stop and sit outside to relax.

4.description: This place been open for many years. During working days is almost empty, but on weekend is busy. Food is OK.

58.description: DO NOT order the bruschetta! Its basically garlic bread with tomato and onion on it and wayyyy too much garlic. The pizza is nothing great either. The only reason why I gave 3 stars is because the staff was very friendly and seem to care about their job unlike the manager. The manager was a total tool! Very unprofessional n didn't seem to care about his job at all. I wouldn't go to Gino's East again.

56.description: Sorry Ginos, but your deep dish is officially off my go to list from now on. What was that?! Canned spinach?!

29.description: The pizza was very good and lived up to the hype but my favorite part of the meal was the meatballs and garlic bread to start. Some of the best meatballs I've ever had. This meal was definitely worth the diarrhea.

42.description: I have to say, I have only eaten Gino's East from the freezer section in the past. Eat at the restaurant! You wont regret it at all!! I made a comment that it tasted how pizza hut did WAY back in the 90s when we were kids and the table agreed. Only reason why they didn't get 5 stars was because some of the soda selections are can/bottle only and not free refill AND because we swear that our waitress had a free too many drinks during her shift. She seemed very off and never introduced herself. BUT the deep dish pizza we ordered was good and our appetizers were nice and hot! If you have 4 people a large pizza will be satisfying, if you are like me though insist on 2 different ones because you will want more than 2 slices!

23.description: We decided to try thin crust at Gino's East. Not the worst pizza I've had but definitely the saltiest. So much so you couldn't taste any flavor but salt. We've had their deep dish before and it was good. Maybe sticking to that is the key. In the meantime, we will try elsewhere.

47.description: Not to bad of a place. I think I still prefer Lou Malnati's Pizzeria for a better flaky crust

8.description: Ginos East has a pretty decent Happy Hour special. I came on a Friday evening after work with coworkers and really enjoyed what they had to offer. I'm not 100% if their happy hour is every weekday, but I can vouch that they have it on Fridays at least. The bar area has plenty of spots at tables and around the bar to secure a seat. During Happy Hour they offer unlimited FREE thin crust pizza, and this is a great perk in my opinion. I really thought that the thin crust would be very average, but now I consider it to be one of the best thin crust pizzas I've had in the Chicagoland area. The drink prices were pretty reasonable for beers and mixed drinks. My margarita was $7.50, and I would rate it an 8 on a 10 point scale. Come check out Ginos for some good food, drinks, and moments with coworkers or friends.

31.description: Service was just about average...if you ask me our waitress was in a bad mood. Patio area was fantastic! Ordered a deep and a thin.  Thin came back not what we ordered and it was remade pretty quickly. Deep dish was delicious!!! Haven't been to ginos in years and I'd come back for that. Thin crust is nothing worth writing home about. Ive had bettet store bought pizzas...just not what I was expecting. Good price on the house wines.

34.description: Just had a mason jar caprese salad for the first time. It was great. This location seems more family oriented but the service is great. Pizza is the best.

16.description: Chicago pizza yes, but only ok. I would not write home about it. Definitely lacking taste and well you just can't pin point it, but not a great experience.  Ok in a pinch, but not a go to place.

13.description: On a Saturday night at 6pm the restaurant is 3/4 empty and were told there's a 20 minute wait.  Don't get it.Once seated there's nothing better than Gino's Pizza. Service was very good and little pitcher of soft drinks ordered is a nice touch.

11.description: was visiting Chicago and decided I needed to have Chicago style pizza. Went to Gino's east because  heard that is a popular place in Chicago.  We got the meat pizza.  I was kind of disappointed.  the crust had no taste and the pizza was a little dry.  It might have been because we came late but overall I wasn't all that impressed.

39.description: This was my first time in Chicago so I tried a few different pizza spots. This might have been my favorite. I agree with the other review that the spinach tastes like it came from a can and fresh spinach would be a major improvement. Otherwise delicious. I love the cornmeal crust.

37.description: Q11For plain old pizza- it's amazing. Compared to Lou malnati's- it's trash. Not for the conoussiour anymore...

0.description: Sadly, I have forgotten the secret location of my favorite Gino's East (seems like it was somewhere by Loyola U, I don't know because my old Impala used to drive there automatically whenever I was within 30 miles of Chicago), but I will never forget my love of GE. Lately I have been going to Higgins since I've been a shuttle service for my son flying in & out of O'Hare.You can go with other reviewer's "opinions," but I have scientifically tested ( ;-) ) most of the major Chicago Deep Dish joints and I have *proven* Gino's East is the best, especially the Legend. Great sauce, great sausage, smokey flavor. I could eat there everyday if it weren't for the 6 hour commute, and the traffic (mostly the traffic,  I'm not willing to risk my life on the Dan Ryan for that much pizza).

38.description: Ate here for the first time. Had the Caesar salad and deep dish pizza. The food was great, the crust was crispy and buttery. Delicious! I give it a 4 star only because it took a bit long getting the pizza out. Over 45 mins.

51.description: I feel bad for having to share this as my thoughts have always been that you could never have bad pizza but our pizza experience last weekend proved me wrong. Our Deep dish Pizza came out burnt with so much tomato sauce there could have been whole grape tomatoes on there. It was so overcooked and crunchy that when you tried to cut the pizza it was like trying to cut a hard chocolate chip cookie in half and it was soooo watery. How in the world do you make pizza watery?? I have no idea but they achieved it. Sorry Gino's... Service was great for being understaffed that night but the pizza... Yikes!

27.description: You can't visit Chi town and not make a stop at one of their famous pizza joints, especially one that makes the traditional deep dish pie. Gino's East fits that bill just right. The atmosphere is relaxed. Our waiter was a bit edgy,  but nice enough. The price was a bit on the high side, even for the city ($28 for a large deep dish), but it won't break you. Parking was adequate. And, the location is convenient. A large deep dish pizza will feed six to eight adults. I particularly liked their selection of craft beers (you gotta try the 312 on draft). After a couple of mozzarella sticks, one deep dish slice, and a point of 312 I had no room for dessert. So, I can't comment on that part of the menu.All in all, a nice place to enjoy a hearty meal and a good drink. I do wish the prices were a little more budget friendly. But, it's worth the occasional trip, especially if you bring a group and split the bill.

32.description: We had the spinach cheese sticks (fantastic!) and thin crust supreme pizza. While the cheese sticks were great, the pizza tasted like frozen pizza. We were totally unimpressed. Maybe the deep dish is better but the bell peppers really tasted like they had been frozen. Overall, I'm unimpressed. Sad because I'm only in town a few days and only have so many opportunities for pizza!

54.description: Walked in was empty . Hostess was snippy with an attitude. . Waited forever to eat we ordered ahead and she didn't submit order. Slow in attentive service food was really salty and the service was awful.

48.description: Good place. Quaint. Good service and gives a pitcher of soda. Pizza was ok.  Portions are big so if your only one get the personal pizza.

44.description: A great place to grab a bite with family and friends. My family has been going to Gino's East since I was little and I can't say I've ever had a bad experience! We've held numerous parties at this location and their old location further down Higgins. The staff is very accommodating. Parking is fairly easy to find - they have a whole lot! It's also never so busy that you have to wait a long while unless you go later in the evening on a Saturday or when there is a sporting event nearby (Wolves game, for example). In the summer, they have outdoor seating available, and you can play cornhole. They have a nice selection of beer, including craft. As for the pizza, I'm not a huge deep dish girl, but their thin crust is really good. I like their garlic and spinach thin crust the best. Their garlic sticks are to die for - they'll literally melt in your mouth... And definitely get the antipasto salad!

24.description: Walked in and was escorted to the bar area with green tables and wooden chairs reminded my of my uncles bar in the basement. I waited and the bartender appeared from behind the bar chipper as can be with her delightful Eastern European accent. I ordered the 5 rabbit beer and a coke I made a good choice as the beer was so bitter I needed a coke chaser... Note to self don't order beer names after a rabbit. So I ordered cheese sticks and a small sausage patty pizza  since this place is known for its sausage patty pizza I thought I couldn't go wrong although the the 45 min wait does make you question yourself lol. Cheese sticks came out half way through my beer tastes like crispy crunchy cheesy for the first 4 then they get cold and it's like bam shoulda ate me already. After I finished a beer and 4 cokes the sausage smell hit my nose as it got closer and closer and closer and I was so excited. The warm cheese, the sweetness of the sauce the saltiness of the pepperoni and a little bit of spice of the sausage kicking in. I must say I remember the sausage patty use to be on the bottom now it's above the cheese and it tastes different but everything else was great. I would recommend ordering ahead for the stuffed pizza and trying Gino's east.

7.description: When I learned of this mysterious third party in the Chicago deep dish wars, I had to stop by the next time I was in town! We flew in to O'Hare and drove out, so there was no time to sit down. Instead, we called in a pie when we landed and 45 minutes later, I was wolfing down a slice in our rental car.We got the 12" supreme with sausage, mixed in rather than layered. The sausage was hearty and full of flavour - would definitely recommend! This is not a deep dish heavy on cheese, and there's a lot of sauce/acid. The crust is pretty crispy, closer to pretzel than dough. The service I did get was helpful and courteous.My rating is unfortunately skewed by my bias - at the end of the day, I'm a Lou's girl. You want sauce and crunch in your crust? That's New York pizza to me. However, Gino's satisfied my deep dish craving. Until next time, Chicago!

49.description: Delish five stars. Got the Gino's East Supreme Pizza with the Toasted Ravioli. Would order the same next time.

40.description: This review is for delivery. My husband grew up in Chicago and wanted his Gino's. Well, the whole town is shout down due to the Stanley Cup and a Cubs game AND rain with tornado warnings. He couldn't get near the city. Since he was only there for one night, he had Gino's deliver a small sausage pie with added green peppers to his hotel. They were 30 minutes earlier than they said they'd be and it is just as he remembered. Good job Gino's.

53.description: We wanted to try a traditional deep dish pizza and after reading reviews decided to give this place a try. Dint want to go to downtown location just to save on the wait time and crowd. But half hour after opening time we went it and there were already 20 people seated. People wait in line to get in or what?? Anyways we ordered spinach sticks and they were pretty good but this is not we had come here for. The real deal was the deep dish. And oh boy I bet it was. The crust was crisp and made of corn bread, good full layer of cheese and meat topped with veggies. I think the time taken to get the crisp crust is worth it. Super heavy to eat. A small could easily fill 2 male adults with large appetite. So you can judge for yourselves! A must visit and this location is pretty good too. Not sure though how different the experience would have been if it was in the downtown location. I will visit again and bring my friends too.

30.description: Conveniently close to hotels near east side of O'Hare. Walked over from Renaissance. Sat outside and watched planes coming in on final approach. Great pizza. Taking one back to Colorado for dinner tomorrow.

46.description: Fantastic atmosphere, the only thing that beat the service was the pizza.  Sweet and tangy sauce mixed with ham,  sausage and cheese made me forget about the heart attack I'm sure to have after this meal. Worth the money and will be sure to return during my next visit to Chicago!

1.description: I truly believe it is just this location that is bad. I have eaten at a different location that is better before. We were here about a month ago with a Groupon. Failure to read the small print meant we could not use it on a Saturday. We ordered a deep dish Supreme and the new nachos. The nachos came out and the cheese was solidified on the top and cold. We pointed this out to the waiter who said :What do you want me to do about it?" We politely asked for it to be re-heated. They were ok, but there is paper at the bottom of the pizza pan they are in and everything sticks to it so you end up eating paper if you eat the bottom layer. The pizza was overcooked. We returned to this location this sunday - because the groupon was for this location.  We ordered the same pizza but ordered the spinach.artichoke dip.  The dip was thick and pasty and the bread that came with it seemed more like stale bread than toasted - no toasty color to it, just bone dry.  There is no way you can call this deep dish pizza. The bottom layer was a soggy, limp mess, you could not even pick up to eat. If this is deep dish, what is the thin crust? The crust was thinner than a saltine cracker! The crust was 1" thick by about 1/4" and hard as a rock. Deep dish is supposed to be "bready". - chewy, not crunchy. The pizza sauce is watery and tasteless. Everything just slid right off the slice. Mom still has a $20 gift certificate for this location but I am not interested in giving it a third try.  I would vote Uno's or Giordano's any day  or even Lou Malnati's over Gino's.

55.description: In town visiting family and was lucky enough to be taken here...love love their pizza and even more amazing was the service!!! We had a large party of more than 20 and the staff was on point with food and drinks especially!!! Did not keep us waiting forever for refills.

9.description: One of my favorite Chicago pizza places. Can't compare to places outside the Chicago area that claim to be "Chicago style". This particular spot is not as busy due to being a bit off the beaten path. Tonight was first time I tried the chili, I was pleasantly surprised, but I am here for the Pizza.

26.description: Friendly service and the awesome Chicago-style pizza I adore. Had a meeting near this Gino's location last week and stopped by with the parents for an early dinner - mainly to avoid rush hour traffic back to the western suburbs.I had a small deep dish with cheese,  sausage and pepperoni and it was great. I left kicking myself for eating so much at lunch. But on the plus side, delicious leftovers.The parents got a large supreme thin crust and were very happy with that as well. Would for sure head back - Gino's is perfect for when this Denver girl needs a Chicago fix.

25.description: I'm not a big fan of Chi-town style pizza, but this was very representative of the genre.  Loved the sausage - it was nice and spicy.  Sauce a bit sweet for me, but tons of cheese.   The pies are huge - family of 4 including 2 bottomless pit teens had a small deep dish with an appetizer and took home leftovers.

12.description: As my son says, best crust ever!  When it comes to deep dish this is my favorite place to go.  You can't go wrong with the sausage patty or the crumble.  One of the places I don't mind driving 40 minutes each way to a couple times a year.

59.description: Deep dish!!  this place is amazing. I had delivery and it was still great. #bdt

21.description: Bad services my sever seem to be drunk and the food taste so bad. Order fries calamari and it was too dry and cold. Deep Dish pizza is tasteless.

17.description: This was my first deep dish pizza. I'm happy to say it did  it disappoint. There is no good pizza at the airport. So, based on a blog post I read, I jumped on the blue train and went two stops to Cumberland. Once there it was a short walk to Gino's. I had a small sausage and mushroom. Wow!! That was excellent. Takes about 1/2 hour to prepare, so plan ahead.

10.description: You can't visit Chi town and not make a stop at one of their famous pizza joints, especially one that makes the traditional deep dish pie. Gino's East fits that bill just right. The atmosphere is relaxed. Our waiter was a bit edgy,  but nice enough. The price was a bit on the high side, even for the city ($28 for a large deep dish), but it won't break you. Parking was adequate. And, the location is convenient. A large deep dish pizza will feed six to eight adults. I particularly liked their selection of craft beers (you gotta try the 312 on draft). After a couple of mozzarella sticks, one deep dish slice, and a point of 312 I had no room for dessert. So, I can't comment on that part of the menu.All in all, a nice place to enjoy a hearty meal and a good drink. I do wish the prices were a little more budget friendly. But, it's worth the occasional trip, especially if you bring a group and split the bill.

5.description: I reached there at 9:29 and the guy says sorry, we close at 9:30 so can't help you. :- ( I guess that tells me about the service I was about to receive. Not going there again.

3.description: It's good Gino's East is very good. I like their deep dish sausage pizza and their chopped salad. The wait staff was very nice and our kid's enjoying have a simple family dinner there.

35.description: If you like great pizza, look no further! Gino's East is uniquely original. The crust is a work of art before the additional ingredients are even introduced. I know you will agree, Ginos East is the stuff of legends.

19.description: We had the spinach cheese sticks (fantastic!) and thin crust supreme pizza. While the cheese sticks were great, the pizza tasted like frozen pizza. We were totally unimpressed. Maybe the deep dish is better but the bell peppers really tasted like they had been frozen. Overall, I'm unimpressed. Sad because I'm only in town a few days and only have so many opportunities for pizza!

28.description: Gino's is tremendously convenient for an extended layover at O'hare. I've come here multiple times for my friends to get a taste of the deep dish (which I order in advance since we're always on a time limit). I would definitely prefer other places for taste of the crust, but the sauce isn't that bad.

45.description: Pizza was just fine. My complaint though-- please clean your high chairs. The sides of them were caked with day's or weeks worth of nastiness.

33.description: This review was for Giordano's.  I'll delete later.   Nice going yelp

43.description: I did not enjoy the veggie pizza- none of the veggies tasted GOOD.  The crust was deep dish and just too plain...the entire pizza was tasteless.

2.description: During a brief stopover in ORD I decided to offer something very Chicagoan to my colleague: deep dish. As this is one of closest to the airport and I haven't yet tested Gino's we went here. Being here the first time, the colleague was frankly rather astonished with offering. So to maximize the effect I chose Meaty Legend... Oh boy, that certainly was meaty! There was so much stuff I could have actually stopped after one slice and not feel especially hungry. Out of six slices we managed to finish five. And that was frankly more than enough... It was not just about quantity though, the pizza was very tasty with bacon nicely complimenting sausage & pepperoni.Is this the best deep dish? Based on my very limited sample of three (Giordano's, Uno and now this) I would say it is slightly above the rest. Of course it's not fair to compare meaty legend here with pepperoni pizzas elsewhere. Would I return? Yeah, sure! Though not for a while, it probably takes my system one week to consume all that stuff... Oh and extra points for the beer menu, extremely nice to be able to select a beer flight in a pizza restaurant. I don't think I'll ever see that happening back home

18.description: This franchise location is no where near what the real corporate chicago ginos east are. Bad representation of food quality. We ordered the deep dish nachos and the chips were stale. Then our pizza came and the crust was burnt and dry. The pan that the restaurant used was so old and beat up. Get some new supplies!Take the time to go into the city if you want the REAL GINO'S EAST.

41.description: Ordered online and delivery was faster than estimated. Very pleased, just wasn't a huge fan of the crust.

52.description: I'm giving this place 4 stars in comparison to its other locations, the pizza is legendary no matter who you ask.I grew up loving Edwardos pizza (same company as Gino's) and I eventually worked there! Learned how to make the deep dish and other offerings, it's an awesome company with lots of Chicago history and roots.That being said,  the pizza is not what it once was. Quality in ingredients has been downgraded but not terribly. Today I ordered (preordered actually) a medium deep dish with my favorite ingredient (spinach) and my Gf's fav topping (pepperoni), we ordered garlic cheesy bread for an app. The app: the garlic cheesy was amazing it kicked off the experience very well it was perfect (would've liked marinara sauce which does not come with it) The deep dish: it was hot and it was fresh out of oven. The crust was delish as always (reminds me of a corn biscuit)  the pepperoni was also tasty as always BUT the spinach used is without a doubt not he same as before. Before it was distinctly fresher and now it definitely tastes like it might be canned spinach, it's very stringy and just bring down the overall taste of the pizza, I still enjoyed it however Good news!! This place has some craft beer choices which is a big plus for me (they had Anti-Hero IPA yummm) As far as service goes this place gets a perfect score, nothing above and beyond but just excellent friendly efficient service, our server was a young lady who was polite and attentive All in all, I would definitely come back! I just will no longer be getting the spinach pizza

50.description: 2 stars - five star taste pizza, one star management, and another one star for serving cold pizza.  I like Gino's deep dish pizza regardless of location.  But at this location, they booked three big parties on saturday night, and results were one hour wait, got cold pizza, and no waitress (understaffed).  As soon as we got there, we were told the wait time was 45 min and we could preorder deep dish pizza. So we did. After one hour waiting in the hallway and another 20 minutes waiting on a very unstable wobbly table, we were served a cold (just warm) deep dish pizza with dried up crust. A home delivered pizza would be warmer than that! This place was obviously understaffed, not well managed, as our waitress was serving one packed area of 40 seats, and it was again Saturday night. Poor servers!!  We came all the way here to have a cold pizza!? Nonsense.

4.description: Exactly what I expected: Fresh, tasty, predictably filling authentic deep dish. Convenient to O'Hare.

6.description: Friendly service and the awesome Chicago-style pizza I adore. Had a meeting near this Gino's location last week and stopped by with the parents for an early dinner - mainly to avoid rush hour traffic back to the western suburbs.I had a small deep dish with cheese,  sausage and pepperoni and it was great. I left kicking myself for eating so much at lunch. But on the plus side, delicious leftovers.The parents got a large supreme thin crust and were very happy with that as well. Would for sure head back - Gino's is perfect for when this Denver girl needs a Chicago fix.

22.description: When I learned of this mysterious third party in the Chicago deep dish wars, I had to stop by the next time I was in town! We flew in to O'Hare and drove out, so there was no time to sit down. Instead, we called in a pie when we landed and 45 minutes later, I was wolfing down a slice in our rental car.We got the 12" supreme with sausage, mixed in rather than layered. The sausage was hearty and full of flavour - would definitely recommend! This is not a deep dish heavy on cheese, and there's a lot of sauce/acid. The crust is pretty crispy, closer to pretzel than dough. The service I did get was helpful and courteous.My rating is unfortunately skewed by my bias - at the end of the day, I'm a Lou's girl. You want sauce and crunch in your crust? That's New York pizza to me. However, Gino's satisfied my deep dish craving. Until next time, Chicago!

15.description: Best deep dish pizza I've ever had. I've tried Gino's East at other locations but this original one seems to be the only good one. Definitely one of the top food spots in Chicago.

57.description: The deep dish pizza was good but Im giving them a 2 because the prices were more expensive in the restaurant than what was listed online. False advertisment!

20.description: During a brief stopover in ORD I decided to offer something very Chicagoan to my colleague: deep dish. As this is one of closest to the airport and I haven't yet tested Gino's we went here. Being here the first time, the colleague was frankly rather astonished with offering. So to maximize the effect I chose Meaty Legend... Oh boy, that certainly was meaty! There was so much stuff I could have actually stopped after one slice and not feel especially hungry. Out of six slices we managed to finish five. And that was frankly more than enough... It was not just about quantity though, the pizza was very tasty with bacon nicely complimenting sausage & pepperoni.Is this the best deep dish? Based on my very limited sample of three (Giordano's, Uno and now this) I would say it is slightly above the rest. Of course it's not fair to compare meaty legend here with pepperoni pizzas elsewhere. Would I return? Yeah, sure! Though not for a while, it probably takes my system one week to consume all that stuff... Oh and extra points for the beer menu, extremely nice to be able to select a beer flight in a pizza restaurant. I don't think I'll ever see that happening back home

36.description: The deep dish pizzas are delicious but they do take about 45 minutes to cook. The this crust pizzas are also great and only take about 25 minutes. The pricing is average and the environment is great. Check them out and give them a try!!

14.description: Not great pizza.  I expected better from such a "popular" establishment.  The appetizers were very basic and tasted like bad bar appetizers.  The pizza was not good.  Flavorless and dry crush.  Unflavored tomato sauce with a little bit of cheese.  Also, the service was pretty bad...as in we didn't really receive any service except when the food was delivered to the table.

58.description: I have been coming here with my fiancé since it first opened. I go here with family, and co workers and visit pretty often. $18.99 for all you can eat dinner, for good quality, tasty rolls is amazing. The staff has always been very polite and I always get good service :)

56.description: I have been here more than a few times now and every time I come here it gets worse. The sushi, if you can still call it that, is so filled with fillers and what seems to be dyes that I'm not even sure if there is fish in some of the rolls anymore. The worst offender has to be the spicy tuna. It's absolutely the worst spicy tuna I have ever had and that includes take out from the grocery store just before they throw it away. It really is that bad. The service is awful especially second or third rounds if you get that far and to top it off, today they brought our table 4 pieces of white tuna that wasn't even white. It smelled like it sat out all night and was brown. When I asked them to remove it, it was a big deal. I can't be more upfront about this place when I say if you like sushi, don't go here.

29.description: This is my first yelp review! I'm from the southwest suburbs and wanted to do something different for my boyfriends birthday. I did my research and had my eye on Umami for dinner with some friends. It was a complete steal. Byob and 5 star sushi for a couple bucks. Can't wait to go back!!!!

42.description: I would never recommend this place to anyone. I had the most ridiculous experience ever. The sushi rice portions were extremely large and the food was tasteless. The staff was very rude about requests. I rarely get upset over things like this, but I seriously had a really bad experience.

23.description: Delicious sushi. Fast service. And they even offered to open our champagne and place flowers in a vase!

47.description: The sushi is prepared per order and all the fish and other ingredients were fresh. There are many choices with some specialty rolls. You can request the rolls as a hand roll instead of being cut. They were very busy but the wait time to get served was reasonable.  I also tried the tempura calamari which was very tasty. We will go again.

8.description: My waitress is so f-ing cute omg. Food is great and it's an amazing place to go for a first date. It is BYOB they are so helpful with that too.

31.description: came here twice.. first time was with a friend and second time with a party of 20..the staff is nice and service is good..both time we did the ayce .. the price is comparable to any other sushi buffets..good thing about this place is that it has a parking lot.. so no worries on looking for street parking..first time the sushi has less rice which was a plus and made me like the place.. the second time i went back there was a lot more rice.. so the consistency is not there..they do have a good variety of sushi to choose from.. also their appetizers are pretty good too!..oh and its BYOB for the ppls that care...i give it a 3 and a half star as of now...

34.description: Got food poisoning the next day. Girlfriend was fine but she didn't touch the nigiri. It's Byob but I'd go elsewhere

16.description: Two of us went in about 45minutes before close but we were rushed to put in our order. The waitress was nice, the food came out super fast and was great. It was a Sunday night, so maybe that is why they tried to kick everyone out the second the clock struck the hour. Still enjoyed the overall visit.
