13.description: I was skeptical about Umami Sushi, because, let's face it, 1) AYCE, 2) my boyfriend raved about it.  He's not nearly as picky about his sushi as I am.  On top of it, he took me there as a "surprise" on a night where I didn't remotely feel like eating sushi.I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised, and would definitely return to Umami.The only type of AYCE sushi place I will go to is one where the sushi is made to-order.  No buffet line, and GOD, please NO revolving sushi conveyor belts.  How long has that been sitting there?!?!I ordered the spider roll and a few pieces of nigiri, as well as some edamame, and a hot green tea.Service was prompt and fast, I think our server was disappointed that we didn't order more than one round of sushi - I think they're used to people coming in really ravenous.Both the rolls & nigiri were very good - although there was a bit more rice with the nigiri than I would've liked.  Luckily, my man loves sushi rice, so I ate my nigiri as sashimi and gladly handed him the uneaten rice.  The spider roll had awesome fresh avocado, and the soft shell crab was tempura'd perfectly and also fresh.For $19.99 per person for dinner, you really can do some damage.  Please keep in mind that Umami is BYOB and they will gladly point you to the liquor store across the street!

11.description: This restaurant is probably the best sushi restaurant in Chicago. The one reason I came to this place on a Friday night was because of the AYCE (All You Can Eat) sushi. The sushi there taste fresh and they have great rolls and nigiri. Great place to stop by.Lunch AYCE - 15.96 per person Dinner AYCE - 19.99 per person

39.description: Not many all you can eat sushi places around and they have a great selection this is definitely my go to place for sushi!

37.description: We love our AYCE sushi! Umami was our go-to AYCE sushi place for the past year and a half and we have not regretted it a single time! It's a little out of the way, coming from the city, but was always worth the drive. It's BYOB or you can get free refills on your sodas, as well. I don't think there was a corkage fee or anything like that. There's usually a big group eating at Umami every time we go, usually for a birthday or graduation, so it does get pretty crowded quickly, especially on the weekends. We always get the Spicy Sanshoku, hand rolls of either the Spicy Tuna or the Spicy Salmon, the Deep Sea roll, Sapporo roll. We tried the new Angel Roll, which was decent. My boyfriend's brother loves the Dynamite roll. The Bay roll and the Sakura roll are solid choices as well. While their rolls taste delicious, they do pack on the rice, especially for the nigiri pieces. We usually pick off most of the rice and our waitress has never said anything about it. After all, we're paying to eat sushi, not just rice! Gyoza is always a good choice and my boyfriend always gets a house salad for an appetizer. This used to be our go-to AYCE sushi place, but we found a new AYCE sushi place in the city, right near our new apartment, and they don't pack on the rice: Sushi Tokoro on Western Ave. in Lincoln Square!

0.description: Umami Sushi is by far one of my favorite restaurants around the Chicagoland area that offers unlimited sushi. Despite the insane amount of customers that dine in, the cooks always make sure to keep their sushi rolls tightly packed so they won't fall apart. Also, the aesthetics of the food display is beautiful! The waiters are always pleasant, and they do check-up on their tables frequently to make sure their customers are being serviced well. I really enjoy dining in at this restaurant! Come in, and enjoy yourself a boat full of sushi!

38.description: BYOB!? Are we in 1963 Salt Lake City?I'm a business traveller and would like to not have to go to the liquor store to have a saki with my sushi dinner!? Same thing at next closest sushi place. Back to my hotel where I can order a drink with dinner.  Arrgh

51.description: We thought the place was open until 9:30 pm, but we got turned away by the hostesses at 8:40 pm because there was a 20-minute wait. I guess the kitchen closes at 9:15 pm, so what happens at 9:30 pm? Hmm. I mean, we could've ordered food within 15 minutes. Disappointed, to say the least.

27.description: Cold appetizers, smelly old fish, and terrible waitress!!! The whole dining experience was ruined by her mainly - some blonde, short stocky chick with blue contacts-the check said her name was Rizza (?). She had the personality of a wet mop so be warned if you get her. Our apps came out cold even though the place JUST opened and she was nowhere to be found for refills. The older Asian guy is who we usually get and he is amazing but unfortunately we will not be coming back because of our terrible experience today.

32.description: I really like this place. They have a great all you can eat menu and price. Always delicious, could always go for some Umami Sushi

54.description: AYCE Sushi lunch price is 16$ not bad for AYCE. The sushi was so so. The place was packed and wait time for the sushi was a little longer than expected. The actual sushi was ok I suppose. They seemed to skimp on the fish and add more cucumber for filler. Over all good experience.  You get what you pay for ya know

48.description: All you can eat sushi at a reasonable price $18 per person and its BYOB. The quality of the sushi is not all that but expected for the price still worth trying out. The place is very clean and has a modern feel to it. The service on the other hand leaves a lot to desire. They are quite slow at bringing the sushi out and seems like the servers are little disorganized and unfocused.

44.description: If you want to consume a lot of food then this is the place for you. For &19.99 per person you can order as much sushi on the menu as you can eat but if there's leftovers they will charge you extra. It is hit or miss, some of the rolls were delicious and some lacked flavor. I would say it's a 50-50 split. The volcano roll was delicious, well the Buffalo chicken roll seriously lacked in flavor. If you consume a lot and volume is important, this place is for you.

24.description: Stopped in with my boyfriend around 3:30pm on a Sunday, and we opted for the $19.99 all-you-can-eat. Overall, we had three rounds of sushi, the first being the rolls, the other two the single sushi pieces. I have to say, the sushi itself was great. Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious and we walked out of there happy as a clam and stuffed. However, the service was definitely not on the strong side. I mean, we literally waited about 20 minutes at a time to fetch our waitress to bring us the yellow cards to mark what we wanted, another 20 minutes for her to pick them up, and yet another 20-25 minutes for the selected sushi to arrive (we saw our precise sushi orders sitting by the sushi bar, just waiting, and were inclined to pick them up ourselves, as it took the waitress at least 10 minutes to transport them two yards across to our table). She never checked on us, didn't bring us the drinks we requested, and we had to flag her down very tumultuously in order for her to even notice us LOL. Also, there was a strong odor of weed coming off of her - which could serve as some sort of explanation as to why she was so incredibly slow and confused. I would be back for the sushi itself (maybe a take-out/pick-up order next time?), however, if you don't intend to sit there unattended and ignored for at least 3 hours and get a pot-head as a server... Don't go there. We left between 6:30-7:00 and our butts literally hurt from sitting in a booth for that long.

7.description: Been here often and although it's been a while, I can't wait to go back. The sushi is so fresh and it's convenient that there's a Jewel right next door since its BYOB. Sometimes it takes longer than others to get your food but it's understandable.Service is debatable. I've had GREAT service most of the time.

49.description: This is probably my favorite go to restaurant! My fiance and I go there at least twice a month. It's all you can eat sushi for under $20 and the quality is amazing!!!! Everything is super fresh and delicious. The place gets busier every time we go and sometimes there is a short wait during the week and a long wait on the weekend. I have been frustrated a time or two with the wait, but then I put that delicious sushi in my mouth and everything is ok again. It's BYOB as well, which means they always have the beer I want. I highly recommend it even though I don't want my wait to get any longer.

40.description: We have come here for more than a dozen times. Date nights, hang-outs or family gatherings. This place never disappoints us!We love sushi and Asian food. We never have to argue whether we should come here or not. It offers wide range of rolls, nigiri (single piece fish with sushi rice), and appetizers!!! The food is fresh and service is good. Only once a while we had to wait for a table. Oh, this place is BYOB! You can grab drinks from the Jewel nearby becoming coming here. They also have good takeout price if you are in a hurry!

53.description: Went here for their all you can eat sushi lunch for $15.99 didn't expect much given the low price but people at worked at spoke highly of the place so gave it a shot. I was pleasantly surprised. The sushi here was amazing, avocado roll was my favorite. Also had the salmon, crab, avocado rolls. One thing to remember though is if you don't finish your plate they will charge you per item.

30.description: The all you can eat is a great deal. We have been 5 or 6 times in the last few months! I have tried several rolls and everything is fresh and delicious. The appetizer selections are also great, the chicken yakitori and house salad are my favorites. The interior could use some updates, but the things we keep coming back for are the food and price.

46.description: Being from California I would say that this sushi place is one of the best I've been to in the Midwest. I first time in the Chicagoland area I came here and I was amazed at this place. $20 for all you can eat ? That's ridiculous!!!! These rolls are $12/$13 each and you can get them all for $20. So and it's good like the rolls aren't authentically Japanese but the sushi I actually incredible and don't even get me started on the spicy mayo wow is it amazing!!! Idk of its store bought but it's soooo good!!!! Also the BYOB policy is great cause you can bring whatever drink you want and it's cheaper you can't not come to this place 10/10 OMG

1.description: What isn't to love about this place. It's local, not too far from O'Hare Airport, 2 minutes away from the Kennedy Expressway and last, but not least, the sushi is fantastic! The atmosphere is very welcoming, the staff is very friendly and definitely on point with their service! They have other items on the menu to choose from, but me personally, I go for their all-you-can-eat sushi! It's always fresh and always made to order. $15.99 for lunch and $19.99 for dinner, which isn't bad at all! It's also B.Y.O.B. So, if you're coming from or going to O'Hare, the Rosemont Theater, Fashion Outlets, or anywhere in that vicinity, Umami is definitely the spot to go to for your sushi fix! P.S. If you're coming with a large crowd, I'd suggest to call in ahead to reserve a spot because it gets packed on weekends...DEFINITELY WORTH THE WAIT!!!

55.description: Over priced for the portion sizes, bland flavor to the rolls, wasn't impressed! Appetizer 2 $5 Japanese egg rolls where so small and not worth it!

9.description: First time here and def going back. They have all you can eat sushi for $20. They were very busy when I went but you couldn't tell by the service, they were fast with the plates and kept checking back to see if we wants to order more. Its not a very big place so it fills up fast too. They are located in a strip mall so there is plenty of parking too. The rolls were real good, I would have guessed bc its all you can eat the quality would be so so but they were delicious. My nephew goes all the time so I wanted to check it out . They have a app section, main rolls, and even a dessert roll, which was AMAZING. It was a banana split roll, warm banana and cream cheese rolled in rice and covered with whip cream topped off w chocolate and strawberry sauce. The main rolls come in 6-8 rolls each and then you can also order the simple rolls individually too . cant wait to go back : )

26.description: Horrible service!! We got here at 9:00.  Ordered once, next order grumpy waiter said we had 5 min to order.  Rice portion on sushi too big.  Put rice on side. Waiter said he was gonna charge us for extra rice!! Threatened us with cameras!  Turn our awesome night to the worst night in Chicago!  Can't believe we paid $30 in cab ride to get here!!

25.description: Usually with AYCE sushi places, what you make up for in price you lack in quality. Not so with Umami! 15 dollar lunch is the cheapest I think I've ever been to, and it was REALLY good! I just wish we lived closer!

12.description: Literally here now and having the worst time, the gyoza is awful, the server completely forgot about our water and miso soup the place is half empty and everything is taking forever. Utterly ridiculous. The kids and I ordered off of the menu and my husband ordered the everything you can eat special and they "charge you" if you have any left over pieces lol so here we are trying to help him finish a few pieces and they come over and tell us that they will let it go this time but next time they will have to charge us all the lunch price and that they have cameras so they can watch us. Really, don't worry we won't be back. The food was not worth it, go somewhere else. If I could give them zero stars, I would.

59.description: All u can eat $18.99! Not just sushi but includes appetizers too! Great deal- server was nice

21.description: Food is good , but waiter was sexists. Only acknowledged my boyfriend and not me. Which was extremely disrespectful.

17.description: This is my go-to place for sushi on the northwest side of Chicago. I will eat here over any fancy "fusion" Japanese place around Logan Square for two reasons: price and authenticity.First, the AYCE menu is one of the best prices for sushi in the city, and the quality of the sushi doesn't suffer at all. Second, having lived in Japan for over two years, not only the sushi but all of the appetizers taste like authentic Japanese cuisine. A lot of the food at Japanese restaurants in the city taste "off" to me, but Umami doesn't. Highly recommend.

10.description: The All you can eat (AYCE) is the reason we rolled into this place at 11:30am on a Friday morning and trust me we ate our fill and more. It's 15.95 for lunch and there is a nice selections of rolls, nigiri (piece of raw seafood atop a cube of rice), and appetizers. The place is very clean and cool on a hot summer day in Chicago. The sushi does take time to get out to the tables, but I feel that time in between sushi plates is filled best by stocking up on the yummy appetizers like calamari, haramaki (fried rolls), and gyoza (dumplings). My personal favorite was the spider rolls (soft shell crab) and the huge hunks of salmon nigiri. They do NOT skimp at this place and if you get there early and hit it often, you will get more than your money's worth. We will definitely be see Umami again.

5.description: This place is great if you need a sushi fix for cheap. $20 for all-you-can-eat, made-to-order sushi is a pretty sweet deal, and there are some unique items on the menu (i.e. banana rolls). And FYI, the place is BYOB and conveniently located next to a liquor store. So why the 3-star rating, you ask? Well, a few reasons. First, the place is pretty small, so there are really long wait times (40+ minutes) during prime dinner hours. Second, the hostess is not the most personable. In fact, she borders on rude. Third, the sushi is good but not necessarily great... definitely not worth a 45-minute wait. So if you're in the mood for inexpensive sushi, go at an off time to avoid waiting.

3.description: If you're thinking about coming here to eat, come for the AYCE!  I came here for dinner on a Thursday night and it was packed!  I waited for about 20 minutes for a table.  Not realizing that the popularity of this place was due to the all you can eat menu, I went ala cart.  The nigiri pieces were good, but the fish was on the dry side, thinly cut and came with way too much rice.  I can see why they were made this way for the AYCE, but it should be adjusted for ala cart.  You can order most of the rolls on the AYCE menu, and it's only $19 for dinner!Soft Shell Crab Tempura Appetizer $6 - This was actually decent for the price.  The crab was a little crabby in some parts, but overall it was good.Spicy Sanshoku Roll (8 pieces) $14 - This was the smallest roll I've ever gotten at this price point.  It was good, but maybe for half the price.BYOB - There's a Jewel Osco nearby.Conclusion: Good for AYCE, but be prepared to wait.

35.description: Just left this restaurant and I have to say I am so disgusted with the manager from there. First off I've eaten there before and everything was great.. this is the second Time I've been here.. well as I was eating with my friend I looked to my right (I had the window seat first table to the left) I looked at the wall and they were infested with ants... I didn't want to make a scene so I asked for the manager.. mind you i am not a person to complain.. she gives me the check I tell her I  don't feel that I should pay seeing how this affected my friend and i..  she was so disrespectful and rude just snatched the plate away from me and said "fine you don't pay but you can never come back here again.. I will report them to corporate sorry but customers come first and restaurants must always stay clean and insect free! that is not normal like she claims it is... I just can't believe the way I was treated and by a manager.. she should've known better!

19.description: We have come here for more than a dozen times. Date nights, hang-outs or family gatherings. This place never disappoints us!We love sushi and Asian food. We never have to argue whether we should come here or not. It offers wide range of rolls, nigiri (single piece fish with sushi rice), and appetizers!!! The food is fresh and service is good. Only once a while we had to wait for a table. Oh, this place is BYOB! You can grab drinks from the Jewel nearby becoming coming here. They also have good takeout price if you are in a hurry!

28.description: Umami sushi is AYCE/BYOB and it is truly great for sushi lovers. Have been coming here for a while now and all of my friends and family love this place! Definitely worth it to visit!

45.description: The quality of the food is excellent and the rolls are especially nice, but the nigiri come with waaaaaay too much rice. Even so, the rice was tasty so it wasn't too painful to eat alone. The staff are very attentive and the appetizers came very quickly, but the sushi itself arrived slowly considering how the restaurant wasn't full and there were 3 chefs making rolls. Great value for the price

33.description: Come here probably weekly...food has always been good and seemingly fresh. I alternate with the sushi and with getting a hot meal. When i get a hot meal i generally get the salmon teriyaki, which can be hit or miss. when it is right, it's great! and when it isn't its pretty badly overcooked and very dry (usually good though!) service is okay, the females who work there have always been great and very friendly, the males who work there seem a bit clueless and out of the loop, also it might be cultural but they really only speak to my boyfriend and address him/his needs/concerns/water refilling/ordering first and before me (small tidbit). we dined there today in a corner seat and there were ants EVERYWHERE. very unappealing and unappetizing...we really do enjoy coming there but that was a turn off and i think we are going to take a little break

43.description: I was skeptical about Umami Sushi, because, let's face it, 1) AYCE, 2) my boyfriend raved about it.  He's not nearly as picky about his sushi as I am.  On top of it, he took me there as a "surprise" on a night where I didn't remotely feel like eating sushi.I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised, and would definitely return to Umami.The only type of AYCE sushi place I will go to is one where the sushi is made to-order.  No buffet line, and GOD, please NO revolving sushi conveyor belts.  How long has that been sitting there?!?!I ordered the spider roll and a few pieces of nigiri, as well as some edamame, and a hot green tea.Service was prompt and fast, I think our server was disappointed that we didn't order more than one round of sushi - I think they're used to people coming in really ravenous.Both the rolls & nigiri were very good - although there was a bit more rice with the nigiri than I would've liked.  Luckily, my man loves sushi rice, so I ate my nigiri as sashimi and gladly handed him the uneaten rice.  The spider roll had awesome fresh avocado, and the soft shell crab was tempura'd perfectly and also fresh.For $19.99 per person for dinner, you really can do some damage.  Please keep in mind that Umami is BYOB and they will gladly point you to the liquor store across the street!

2.description: Side note: My boyfriend was a long time sushi chef and we like to check out any sushi restaurant we can.We came around 8:55pm on a Thursday and as soon as we entered, we were told that the last call for sushi was at 9:45. Lots of choices on the menu in regards to sushi, lunch specials, dinner, and AYCE for $19.99 a person. We ordered calamari tempura, Japanese fried chicken, miso soup, 25 pieces of a mix of salmon, tuna and super white tuna nigiri, 1 Viper Roll, 1 Thunder Roll, and 1 Spicy Sanshoku.As for quality of the sushi, if we could give 1 1/2- 2 stars we would. The rice was dry and had an overall hard texture. We came towards closing which I guess makes a little sense, but that isn't an excuse (the place was still busy! I'm surprised no one complained about it.) For the fish, definitely okay, but didn't blow us away in freshness. The rolls were also quite large for AYCE. We also arrived and ordered straight away since we knew the last call was soon, but at one point we noticed that our plate of sushi was ready and sitting on the counter untouched for at least 10 minutes. Honestly we were planning on doing another order, but by the time the food made it to us, it was 9:35 and practically last call. (Our server didn't bother to ask if we wanted anything else)If you're in a hurry and the location is convenient for you, come here. If you want quality, definitely check out Royal Sushi on Foster (it's actually only a couple blocks away.) Quality of the fish/rice is 10x better and is the same price for AYCE.

18.description: We came here on a Friday night and it was pretty busy. The staff were intentional on seating everyone as soon as possible. We waited about half an hour and it was worth it. Every roll we ate was delicious! Glad we have a pretty good sushi buffet in our area!

41.description: If you're thinking about coming here to eat, come for the AYCE!  I came here for dinner on a Thursday night and it was packed!  I waited for about 20 minutes for a table.  Not realizing that the popularity of this place was due to the all you can eat menu, I went ala cart.  The nigiri pieces were good, but the fish was on the dry side, thinly cut and came with way too much rice.  I can see why they were made this way for the AYCE, but it should be adjusted for ala cart.  You can order most of the rolls on the AYCE menu, and it's only $19 for dinner!Soft Shell Crab Tempura Appetizer $6 - This was actually decent for the price.  The crab was a little crabby in some parts, but overall it was good.Spicy Sanshoku Roll (8 pieces) $14 - This was the smallest roll I've ever gotten at this price point.  It was good, but maybe for half the price.BYOB - There's a Jewel Osco nearby.Conclusion: Good for AYCE, but be prepared to wait.

52.description: This restaurant has very good food and the service is  great. They have a big selection of sushi and appetizers for the buffet. If you're lucky enough to get a table without waiting you dodged a bullet. The hostess at the podium are air heads who stand around a their phone while tables are empty with people waiting out the door. Good food, bad hostesses

50.description: Love the sushi here. Always fresh and taste GREAT! Although, it could be a bit pricey, however, that's the case at almost all sushi restaurants. Over all, highly recommend you try Umami sushi if you haven't yet. They have a great all you can eat deal. Without having to waste any food. (No complaints there).

4.description: The food is good! Very good value for the money. One of the better all-you-can ear sushi places around that I've been too. Place is very clean and the staff is very helpful. My wife LOVES sushi but she is a vegetarian and every time I go in there they staff helps me pick out good things for her!

6.description: I have to start this out by saying I have never liked sushi... So I cannot review the sushi because I haven't had it... But! I've gone here with my Fiancée quite a few times and we are always pleased with everything!Always be prepared to wait 20-40 minutes for a table... It always busy!So as most reviews say, it's $20 all you can eat Rolls, Sushi, appetizers and Sides. Make sure you only get what you can finish because they will charge you if you don't eat a bunch. They give you a sheet of paper and you mark off what you would like and you can hand it to your waiter and boom. Your all set. You can keep ordering so pace your self and don't order too much on the first sheet. My Fiancée loves the Spicy Tuna Rolls. She gets them every time and every time she tells me about how fantastic they are. But when I go! I usually get the Chicken Teriyaki which comes in a HUGE portion and it also comes with Rices, plenty of wonderful vegetables, Miso Soup and that awesome Salad thing (forgive me I forgot the name). But it has always been great! Cooked extremely well! Next time we visit I am going to have to decide between the hibachi style chicken (which comes with a few house made dipping sauces) or trying their Buffalo Roll or Chicjen Teriyaki roll (I may like those). I will update the review when I try them!

22.description: Can't say enough good things about this place. It has been a favorite of my husband and I for quit some time now and it is hands down the best sushi we have ever had!!! Their all you can eat for just $20 is an amazing deal. I would recommend paying them a visit!!! They are fantastic!!!

15.description: The sushi here is so good!  The staff is friendly!  The place is very clean!  I will be back for sure!!!!!

57.description: What happened??? We have not been to this place in a long time and I will not be back ever again.  The rolls tasted bland. All you could taste was the sauce on some of them. The white tuna was not fresh... It had a funky texture. Usually it is like butter and melts in your mouth. Not this time. It's too bad. However, We have a fresh tasting, exciting and very delicious place in town now.  Nami sushi for now on!!!!

20.description: First time here and def going back. They have all you can eat sushi for $20. They were very busy when I went but you couldn't tell by the service, they were fast with the plates and kept checking back to see if we wants to order more. Its not a very big place so it fills up fast too. They are located in a strip mall so there is plenty of parking too. The rolls were real good, I would have guessed bc its all you can eat the quality would be so so but they were delicious. My nephew goes all the time so I wanted to check it out . They have a app section, main rolls, and even a dessert roll, which was AMAZING. It was a banana split roll, warm banana and cream cheese rolled in rice and covered with whip cream topped off w chocolate and strawberry sauce. The main rolls come in 6-8 rolls each and then you can also order the simple rolls individually too . cant wait to go back : )

36.description: The All you can eat (AYCE) is the reason we rolled into this place at 11:30am on a Friday morning and trust me we ate our fill and more. It's 15.95 for lunch and there is a nice selections of rolls, nigiri (piece of raw seafood atop a cube of rice), and appetizers. The place is very clean and cool on a hot summer day in Chicago. The sushi does take time to get out to the tables, but I feel that time in between sushi plates is filled best by stocking up on the yummy appetizers like calamari, haramaki (fried rolls), and gyoza (dumplings). My personal favorite was the spider rolls (soft shell crab) and the huge hunks of salmon nigiri. They do NOT skimp at this place and if you get there early and hit it often, you will get more than your money's worth. We will definitely be see Umami again.

14.description: Go to stop for me and my boyfriend with their all you can eat for $20 and lunch special. The staff is very nice and remembered us when we came back. I enjoy their sushi and they give you a good  portion of fish. Exceeds expectations for the price. Highly recommended.

3.description: So I wake up and started my day which means I turn on my three year old 32 inch ViewSonic N3235W tv. I start my coffee and all of a sudden I don't hear the crew at the old number 9. I look over and the tv is off. I go and power it back on, a few minuets later its off again. THIS TIME IT DON'T COME BACK ON...now being a technician the first thing I do is Google up the symptoms. Turns out the power supply maybe the culprit, again I am a technician that is use to opening up all kinds of electronic devises. So I go about the job of removing the power supply. I look closely and sure enough the capacitors are blown! So now I look to ebay and of course there are a variety of power supplies. Now like everyone else I don't like the whole "not the right part shipping back and forth till I get it right" part. So I go about the job of finding a guy  in the city. So I turn to YELP and sure enough I find Amlin. I wanted to replace the part, but Ronnie gave me a great price to replace the capacitors. Here comes the best part. I love saying this "HE MADE ME AN OFFER I COULDN'T REFUSE" and now my tv works and I AM HAPPY. Thank you Ronnie and I appreciate the way you run your business.

1.description: This place is amazing. The repair TVs, VCRS, DVD players, etc. They are very reasonable too. They look at your TV, tell you what's wrong with it, and tell you how much it is going to cost to fix it, and if it is worth fixing. They also sell very good TVS, and come to your house to set them up. They also go on service calls to your house to fix your TV. This company is very honest, and I would definitely recommend it to everyone!

2.description: I met Ronnie after calling him with some TV problems. I brought my 32" Vizio TV in and was very happy with the repair options which allowed me to save some money and make the best choice possible for repair.I recommend this place highly.Steve

0.description: Ronnie and his brother did a really nice job fixing up our broken Samsung HDTV. It was an older model, and the power supply went out. They couldn't find a reputable replacement part initially, so it took a while ... but Ronnie kept trying, and finally found a new original part ...  so it was worth the wait. Still working great today. Thanks guys. Highly recommend them.

58.description: Cheap Eats on lunch...hell yeah!!! I ordered hot dog and fries. Fries tasty...hot dog cold!I was a bit disappointed because I had been here before and the food was very good. Maybe they were having an off day! I am sure I would give them another chance.

56.description: I give the Plush Pup hot dog 4.25 out of 5 stars - but I was disappointed with the Italian Beef. Nice, clean, 50's dinerish decor.The Plush Pup hotdog is the typical Chicago hotdog: Vienna Beef frank, topped with a pickle spear, hot sport peppers, neon green relish, mustard, & tomato. It was very good, I'd go back for more. It was a great value for $2.35. If you are from out of town and at O'Hare Airport or one of the nearby hotels - this is a great option to try a Chicago hotdog. But I wouldn't recommend anything else.I was disappointed with the Italian Beef sandwich. The beef itself was very dry and flavorless. It should be melt in your mouth and spicy. It was as if they took 3 day old roast beef, and soaked it in water to bring it back to life. I didn't finish it. They have a more extensive menu than I'd think - gyros, BBQ, even Reuben sandwiches. But I don't think I'd go back except to get another hot dog.I could see how other reviewers would rate this place higher - but in my opinion the food just doesn't seem consistent enough to rate higher. Although the Plush Dog was excellent, in my opinion, a place has to be more than a one trick pony to get 4 stars.

29.description: Before I gave this place a chance, it appeared to be like most fast food joints, with lots of fried food options...I was wrong! My favorite is the Chicken Kabob plate! They serve two chicken skewers with a pita and rice pilaf. When in the mood for something lighter, I get their Greek Salad with grilled chicken...it's super fresh and their Greek vinaigrette/marinate is fantastic! Their BBQ chicken is awesome too...They're super fast and very friendly!...even when I've called two minutes before closing (unaware of their closing time, of course!) to place a carry-out order. They already know me by name...what can I say? It's like my second kitchen...

42.description: 11 dollars for double cheese burger, fries and small drink? Give me a fuc#king break.  Burgers are good, fries have no salt on them and drinks are small.  For $11 I could've gotten double cheeseburger combo and gyro combo at Jeff's Red Hots.  And that's with better fries and bigger drinks.  This is the last time you gonna get my money homeboy.

23.description: I absolutely love it here! The food is always on point and the customer service is fantastic.

47.description: Its like Portillos only lower quality. Maybe over time I have just neglected to get all the "speciality" dishes here, but the hot dogs, hamburgers, and chicken I can assure you are lower quality. I don't know where the "cheap" part people are talking up is coming from. Even portillo's, Al's Beef, and comparable chains are much cheaper with larger, fresher portions.

8.description: Prices are good,  and food is over stuffed.  Staff was friendly. Had the gyro combo and it filled me up.   Will definitely go again when in town.

31.description: Good gyros, good chicken sandwiches, good fries and shakes. AMAZING PITA BREAD. It was also very clean and had great service.

34.description: Use to order from here when I worked next door years ago. Stopped by a couple months ago on my way down to the city and my chicken didn't seem to be like it was. It maybe that it seem like it had been sitting there for a long time. If your in the area its worth stopping by. And maybe the day I went was just a bad day for them. Prices are really good.

16.description: Years and years ago I would drive all the way to Plush Pup's for a solidly good hot dog or a fairly good Italian beef sandwich. What happened? Years later, their prices have soared while the quality of the food went down. Maybe it is under new management. We drove by here last week, so we decided to grab a bite since we were in a hurry to get somewhere. I admit that the charbroil burger is still 4-star worthy. I love the flavor of the charbroil taste, and the burger was cooked to perfection. The quality of the meat was different from what I remember years ago, but it wasn't horrible. On the other hand, the quality of the Italian Beef meat was disappointing and way too salty. It was 2-star worthy (if that--maybe I am being generous rating it with 2-stars). My husband had the beef sandwich and he gave me some of the meat since it was loaded with tons of meat. I took one little bit of the meat and couldn't eat the rest of the meat that he so generously shared with me. I am not sure that I would stop off here again. The quality seemed to be lacking in some of the food items that we ordered. However, I would recommend their charbroil burger and freshly cut french fries. I am not usually a french fries fan, but my husband ordered some and insisted I try them. He was right -- they are really, really good fries. I hate to say this but the fries were much better than the Italian beef. The restaurant is located in a very small strip mall. Parking can be a little challenging since it is a small parking lot. They have a few tables with umbrellas outside, but with the restaurant being located on a busy street, you don't want to sit outside and ingest the truck, bus and car fumes with your meal. Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives -- this is definitely a diner and it has not changed since the last time we were here. The service is fast and hospitable. The restaurant vibe reminds me of something out of the 1970's. There are a lot of old-fashioned Coca-Cola fixtures throughout the restaurant. There were people of all ages here and it is definitely a family-friendly restaurant.

13.description: I just paid $12.82 for 3 items!  I didn't bother to look up at the menu because most places are about 3-5 bucks for a double cheeseburger.  Theirs is 6.49!  Small fry is 2.25 and a "Jumbo" drink is 2.99??  I knew I should have went to McDonald's for a large drink for 1.00.  I will never come to this place again.  Goody's on Belmont right by me isn't this expensive!

11.description: The food was ok but $8 for a hotdog fries and a drink?!? Over priced for sure. I don't think I would be coming back any time soon.

39.description: I used to live in the neighborhood and loved the food. Now, 23 years later, the food is just as good with friendly staff, varied menu, and clean decor. Close to O'Hare so it's a great place to grab your first hot dog or Italian beef while visiting.....or your last on the way back to the airport.   Since I live in AZ I miss this type of restaurant and love to see that this place has been going strong for more than 30 years..

37.description: The previous reviews commenting on the pricing are dead on. Over $6 for a hot dog, fry, medium drink combo is a tad high. Everything was really good and the staff was friendly. They have a huge menu and I will be back in the future.

0.description: I find it hard to believe that I have worked literally down the block from this place for nearly two years and I have never been here for lunch.For what it is, short order, you should really expect a good, tasty well-prepared meal. Everyone one here is on the pleasant side and they get you your food quick. It was everything I expected and my belly was thoroughly satisfied when I was done eating.

38.description: Good food, quick service, convenient location.

51.description: This place has some pretty cheap food and its right by where I work.I got the hot dog's and wondered why they were so inexpensive (I think like only $1.85), well they were small and not all that great.The fries weren't good either. Also the decor and experience wasn't all that great either.Overall I would probably not go back, but if I did I wouldn't get a hot dog. This area really needs some better eats.

27.description: They have the best grilled chicken sand which!  They never disappoint.  The service is friendly.  I like to call in my order if in a hurry.  I would definitely consider Plush Pup a neighborhood favorite!

32.description: Plush Pup is great for a quick lunch or pick up.  The parking lot is small and gets very crowded during the lunch hour.  The menu offers hotdogs, burgers, gyros, fries, mozzarella sticks, salads, chicken, etc... The prices (like many others have noted) are a tad high for the average Vienna hotdog, fries, and drink combo- probably by a buck or two but still..  There is also a small patio which is nice for summer.

54.description: A barker!I know people love the Plush Pup.  The dogs are just ok, but the burger (slimy and mealy) tastes like horsemeat.  Crowded, slow, and expensive for what you get.   So disappointing that when I see it, I drive past and go somewhere else.

48.description: Plush Pup is a little pricey for simple, traditional american food, but everything I had was good.  Chicken Philly was huge and a mouth full.  It came with a small order of fries.  Also tried the fish sandwich.  It was very neatly put together and overall good. This place a convient stop to grab a bite before going on a flight at O'hare airport.  Its a quick exit there and a fast jump back on to the highway.

44.description: I have found a lot of menu items at Plush Pup to be either hit or miss. It's nothing fancy, nothing special, and nothing great. In a pinch, or for a quick bite, it definitely serves its purpose. ((Matt M. said it best below  "It's like Portillo's, only lower quality.")) That's exactly it. Plush Pup serves similar menu items...they just aren't as good. The prices are similar to that of Portillo's. So yes, be prepared to spend almost ten bucks on a loaded dog, fries, and a drink. Here's the good, the bad, and the ugly...+ Huge variety of menu options+ Love the 1/2 chicken plates - Greek, BBQ or plain+ Fast and friendly service+ Tamales!! + Cute retro decor.- Avoid the noon rush. Or be prepared to wait in line...most likely out the door. - Pass on the zucchini sticks - the breading falls off. Every. Single. Time. ((annoying))- The salads blow. It's literally a plate of lettuce with a few odds and ends on topIf there were a Portillo's around the corner, you bet your ass I would be going there instead. But when the grease craving hits, Plush Pup is around the corner from the office and definitely fills the greasy, fatty food void.

24.description: I went here for the first time the other day. Walking in, I saw a large menu with a lot of different kinds of food, which all looked amazing. It was late and my friend and I felt like just getting a burger and a hotdog. Upon opening my food when I got home, I was extremely dissappointed to say the least. Not only did my friends burger bun taste old, but my hotdog looked like the person who prepared it put little to absolutlely NO EFFORT into making my food. The toppings looked as if they were thrown on and it was drenched in mustard. I'm happy to read such good reviews from other customers, especially if they ordered ribs or gyros; however, I doubt my friend and I will ever return to this place.

7.description: I wish I can give this place ZERO stars. The food is overpriced, and below average. The owner is extremely rude, and always seems like we are doing him a favor by walking in there. We actually walked in as he talked down to his employees.. very uncomfortable. Never again!

49.description: It's good for avoiding room service at a nearby hotel, they offer quick food and some variety, mostly Mediterranean.  Tried the hot dog with chili and cheese and pork kebob sandwich.  The cheese was processed which was disappointing, the chili was good.  The unfortunate thing was that the clerk behind the counter must've thought I asked for an onion sandwich and not no onions.  They couldn't have possibly gotten more onions on the pork sandwich if they tried.

40.description: First time here and I ordered what seems to be their signature dish, the Pork Kabob Sandwich. It's basically a Gyros but with marinated Pork instead of the processed meat on a rotisserie. It was a good departure from the usual burgers and dogs but I won't be going out of my way for it. I would order it again though, just won't be my first choice. The pita and sauce were good, the tomatoes and onions were fresh, the pork was tender but not juicy. Compared to Gyros it's relative bland. It lacks the punch of pepper and garlic. I would have liked it to be more flavorful. The atmosphere is great for a fast food lunch. Nice decor and clean. I will definitely return to try other dishes.

53.description: Great food , fast service , good people !!!!

30.description: I've just stopped by and my first impression was not good. Prices are a little bit higher that the other places and I had to wait 10 min for my gyros, maybe because is Friday. Food was delicious and good to know where I can come to eat next time when I will be around.

46.description: Its usually a good thing when the owner is present in a business. However, after a couple of years of eating here I have determined this owner is a stroke. He never smiles, he looks miserable, as a customer you feel that you personally ruined his day or inconvenienced him in some way just by stopping in to order food. The place is usually busy around lunch, the food is ok. I like the grilled chicken with greek dressing and the greek salad with house dressing. I wanted to tip his staff once when he was not there and they told me they are not allowed to take tips. I was shocked, the employees are the only people making you feel appreciated, the owner is a prick. Eat somewhere else.

1.description: Just walked into Plush Pup.  Place is completely empty. I stood and looked at the menu to decide what I wanted.There was a worker infront of me the whole time just looking down.  Also another 3 feet away who saw me walk in.  I looked up to order and no one looked at me or acknowledged me.  I waited awhile.  Still nothing.I will mention I did not see the owner out front.I left.

55.description: This place rocks , but the prices are wayy to high for such quality food , I mean its fast food , people who work in the buildings and surrounding area should have the leisure to go there every day , but their prices are very discouraging. Great food , ok service , but prices earn this place a 3.

9.description: There food is very delicious. The guys there are very nice people and your food will be served to you in seconds !

26.description: I've been here twice, both while on business trips to Chicago and staying at the Renaissance Hotel just down the street. There's not a whole lot in the area, so if you want a quick lunch this is one of your only options. The first time, I had the Italian beef, which was really tasty and came with spicy peppers. Like all greatest Italian roast beef sandwiches, and totally fell apart, but that's kind of the point. If this were my only experience, I would give this place a better rating. The second time, however, I tried one of the Chicago hot dogs and was totally underwhelmed. To give you some background, I love Chicago style hot dogs, particularly the sport peppers and pickle on top. This one, however I found to be mediocre at best. It just wasn't that flavorful and I'm not even sure they put sport peppers on top. I would give the place another chance but I wouldn't get hot dog again. Maybe back to the Italian beef or gyro...

25.description: Two gyro combos for around $22 dollars? Ridiculously overpriced for sub-par food. Onion rings were a disappointment. I guess it is a tiny step up above McDonald's, but I would honestly take McD's over this. One extra star for cleanliness. There's a guy who's constantly walking around wiping tables down and bringing used trays to the back.

12.description: Gyros, Greek Salads, and Rotisserie Chicken!That's what I usually get... CLEAN and great customer service.

59.description: I grew up next to this Plush Pup 25 years ago when it was a tiny dive with fantastic Chicago-style hot dogs (who ever thought of putting celery salt on a hot dog?!), and it is still cranking out some TASTY diner food - try the chicken wings, they're crispy, plump, and juicy and I could eat then by the bucket.  Disregard the staff who tend to stare at you when you order, and even after you sit down, any establishment that's been around for 20+ years knows how to make some tasty food.

21.description: Classic 50's diner feel: checkered floor, vinyl seating, posters of glass Coke bottles, etc. This is a gyros place so there is a ton on the menu to choose from besides burgers and fries. Some items include hot dogs, sandwiches, ribs, fried appetizer items, and various entree plates. Service is pretty quick, even when it gets busy. You line up along the kitchen if it's busy and someone goes down the line and takes everyone's order. Pretty nice since by the time you get to the register to pay, your food is basically done. Food is good and prices are totally reasonable. Outdoor seating is available when it's nice outside.

17.description: Stopped in here to eat something before a client meeting and was blown away! My grilled chicken on a pita hit the spot and the Greek salad could have been served in Greek town. Very clean and casual, it looks like the name of the game here is great food served in a 50's style diner atmosphere at very good prices. The outdoor patio looks like a comfortable area for warm weather dining. Somebody sitting near me was enjoying the barbecued ribs which looked and smelled incredible...I'll be back for the ribs, and a Vanilla Milk Shake!Well, I finally picked up some ribs to go and oh yea!!! These baby back ribs were both meaty and tender and the sauce was phenomenal. The cole slaw and garlic bread were a perfect compliment. Nicely done Plush Pup!

10.description: Unpretentious place with standard fare: Gyros, Bbq ribs, onion rings, half greek chicken, etc - and you dont get overcharged, either, which is a welcome change. Ive got no major complaints: On the cheddar beef i ordered, the lazy employee put nacho cheese sauce instead of a real cheese slice... not too big a deal, but if you wanted an extra 25 cents for a cheese slice, i would have paid it. Will probably return amd would recommend.

5.description: I have lived in this neighborhood for years now. And I just started getting into the Yelp game so here is my review on my most recent of visits. I came here after work one day and it was just about dinner time. When you come in you stand in a line you see the giant menu they have. A guy comes up to you and asks what you want. I order the ribs to go just because I was starving. I move down the line and hit the register. The manager i assume takes the payment and I wait. The dining area of it is pretty nice and well kept. During the summer they have a decent patio on the side of the building.

3.description: Hotdog just ok and overpriced. 6.99 for a dog, fries and small drink is ridiculous. There are better places in the area and cheaper!!!!

35.description: Gyros, Greek Salads, and Rotisserie Chicken!That's what I usually get... CLEAN and great customer service.

19.description: I got the chicken kabob dinner. The chicken was overlooked and very dry. As it was cooking, the three cooks were staring at a younger girl outside and making comments about her. It was very oblivious and awkward for me as I waited for my food. The guy rang up my meal incorrectly and looked at me as if it was my fault. Defiantly a 'Soup Nazi' style place. Won't be back.

28.description: I used to come here a lot back in the 90's with my high school buddies, and it has changed a lot since then. A while back I was with one of my old high-school friends and for old-times sake, we decided to vist a place of our youth. The Plush Pup has gone down-hill over time. When we first walked in the owner had this attitude, like we just ruined his day, by going into his restaurant and buy his food, with our money. He never smilied, he just scowled. The hot dogs, were small, and unfilling, and our sodas were jam packed with ice, with hardly any soda in there at all. Its sad to see a once great place go the pits, all because of some arragont  greedy owner.

45.description: Had the taste for a dog and thought we would give this place a try as we passed by. I'm glad I took the time to turn around. Nice staff, good dogs, looking forward to stopping in one day to try the ribs. They looked good.

33.description: I had the salad and added Gyro meat both times. The order comes with a side of Pita bread. The Pita bread is tasty. Here on the west coast our Pita bread comes from a bag and there aren't many places that make their own Pita bread; so I don't know if it's handmade at another location and then brought in, but it doesn't taste like its from a bag. Kudos on great Pita bread!The salad's are fresh, everything is fresh, no wilted lettuce or funky tomatoes. Finally, the Feta cheese. Again, the kind of Feta cheese we get on the west coast is grocery level, and has that funky feta after taste we're all used to. Not at Plush Pup. The Feta cheese is firm. It is slightly salty. And it doesn't have that "grocery store feta cheese" taste, this is what fresh Feta tastes like. I wish I could take some home or learn how to make it on my own. Oh, and it doesn't taste like it is made with goat's milk which may explain why there isn't a funky after taste. Anyhoo, I could've gone here everyday for lunch.My associates had the Gyro sandwich and the Chicken with rice. Everyone had only good things to say about the food. I also so other people order the hot dogs and wish I could've had time to try one, but my mind was on the salad, the pita and feta. The staff are courteous and professional. The establishment is clean.

43.description: I've 'Been coming here since they opened and go there almost after every workout, and even before that when they used to be in Park Ridge. And no, it's NOT Portillo's, and I'm glad it's not  because Plush Pups Greek Salad with a Chicken Breast on top is AWESOME and far better than the chicken cesare from Portillos! Plus, they have their own Home made dressing for the Greek Salad and they serve the BEST FETA you can buy as well as real greek olives! FAR BETTER THAN ANY SALAD FROM PORTILLOS - now that I made that point again for the 2nd time........They also serve many baked chicken dishes or Chicken Kabobs with rice, Pitas and vegetable sides - a much better tasting selection and healthier than Portillo's.As far as their hot dogs, Gyro's, and Beef - I don't eat that stuff anymore, but when I did, they were ALL excellent!!Good job Plush Pup!!! Don't  be worried by the moronic negative comments made by those who only think Portillos is king - remember, these are the same people who like the Olive Garden and Pizza Hut.................................

2.description: Food was average. Went in and upon ordering felt like I was the meat on display. Beware if you are a female trying to get a hot dog here. I didn't feel safe with their other customers and left as fast as I could once I got my food. Haven't been back since.

18.description: In the mood for gyros? This is for you. I ordered just a standard gyro without fries and had plenty of food to be quite full instead of the normal food coma I get when I eat the fries too :D. The staff were nice, and the restaurant also offers ribs and Italian beef subs. I'll have to come back and try those, as well.

41.description: This place is FANTASTIC. The 1/2 BBQ chicken is awesome and to die for. I'd eat here again and again.

52.description: Great food if you like this type of establishment. I was in the area visiting an ex and decided to see this place for once. It reallynis just an average hot dog stand, but the Greek chicken is perhaps the best I have ever tasted at any place in a real long time. They are cheap with dishing out the ketchup after I asked for the fries and had to go towards the window where they have the pump for sit down. Just give more than one ketchup package next time and this is enough to drop the rating one star.

50.description: The Plush Pup has the worst effing prices in America......way too expensive for anyone's taste. I just paid $6.31 for 1 hotdog fries and drink....Almost everything on their "value" menu is $$8.50...what a joke!!!They have a neighborhood monopoly and they exploit it...I wish someone with more reasonable prices would come along and put these sorry bastards out of business.

4.description: i'm giving 2 stars because the mexicans that cook the food cook great.  the owner is a racist clown that gets mad when you order a cup of water with your $10 burger! !! not including fries food is over priced he swears he's god's gift to cumberland ave . smh i blame the white ppl that stay filling this place up n buying all the over priced food it's a robbery

6.description: Here in Chicagoland we have tons of these Vienna joints on every corner. They all serve pretty much the same thing on the menu but they all can be radically different for whatever reason. Plush Pup is one of the better ones. Big menu here and everything is good. Great hot dogs made how they should be and really good fries. Large seating area if you want to stay or they will wrap it to go if you'd rather.

22.description: Had the pork kabobs.  They were excellent. In area for vball and stopped here.  Was clean and food was good.  Would have given it 5 but the silver ware is as cheap as it gets

15.description: The food is not good but not horrible.  I been here for times so far and not once have they gotten my order right.  There is always something made wrong or missing. The staff the make you feel very welcome and almost as if it is suppose to be a privilege they are making your food. Very arrogant every visit.  The prices are high end for a fast food so beware.

57.description: Been driving past this place for years. After reading the YELP reviews I decided to give it a try. Ordered a basic cheeseburger with onion rings and a Diet Coke. The food was just OK. Somewhat uninspiring. The onion rings were a big disappointment. Over cooked, no taste other than "greasy oil". The burger was OK. The big complaint I have is with the staff. The guy taking the orders was disorganized. There was a large carryout order ahead of me and the guy had it all screwed up. I ordered my simple request and waited. And waited, And waited. The worker actually completed and served the order for the folks behind me in line. I inquired as to the whereabouts of my cheeseburger and was met with a blank stare, like I had NOT been standing there right in front of this guy. He found my onion rings (near cold by now), then my burger appeared. He gave me my Diet Coke. I watched him draw it from the regular Coke tap. I asked him about this and he acted annoyed and then reread the order form. Without saying anything he dumped the Coke and filled the cup with Diet Coke. UGH. Not the experience I was hoping for after hearing such good things about this place. Maybe I was there on a day when the "B-Team" was working .... LOL......

20.description: The food (Gyros) is good but it's a lot.  They should have the option for us to choose such as large, medium and small or large and medium.

36.description: Got the greek salad with gyro meat and it was pretty good. Nice diner atmosphere and seemed like a good crowd.

14.description: Awesome place to grab lunch or dinner. Try the gyros or the gyro plate, both really good. Pricing was very affordable. Highly reccomend!

28.description: This place is awesome! DUDE, try the $5.00 doner kebab sandwich it's def delicious and crazy too. Marinated chicken wrapped in a whole wheat pita with gyro sauce, fries, lettuce, pickles, onions and tomatoes. I love the tarator which is a yogurt, cumber, dill and garlic, cold soup. Served with homemade bread too. The place has lots of Bulgarian food, so if you're looking for something new and fresh try this place  :) Cheers to that!

1.description: Review based on delivery:My boyfriend ordered me a gyro sandwich with fries and a cheesecake. The gyro was delicious. It was a great price for the amount of meat. The fries are your typical steak fries. Unsalted fries. Not the tastiest, but they're still fries!Delivery was speedy! I appreciated that as I work in a corporate office building and that can get a bit confusing. Here's where it all went wrong. My cheesecake had mold on it. I didn't have to open the package up to see that big blue furry thing on top. I called and told them that it had mold and that I would like a refund, as it really wasn't worth the drivers' time to deliver me a new slice. Instead, they sent a driver to me with a new piece of cheesecake because the refund may have been to complicated...I'm sure if I ate on premise, they would have just given me a new slice and I would have been completely okay with that. But now I feel bad that the driver is coming all the here to give me a slice of a non-moldy cheesecake.UPDATE: Updating my 2 star to a 4 star based on customer service. Again, delivery was super quick and the guy was so nice about it! They not only replaced my cheesecake slice, but also gave me tiramisu and a can of coke.

9.description: Finally, Bulgarian Fast Food that delivers! Just ordered from here and I have zero complaints. The spanakopita, cheeseburger, and greek feta fries are awesome. The borek was pretty good, but I might order the guveche instead next time. So glad I tried this place.

23.description: This place being popular among Bulgarians, of course has great kebapcheta. I did not know what to expect ordring a Doner kebab sandwhich. It intrestingly contained french fries and pickles and by the way was delicious!The price range is very reasonable and parking in front makes a quick lunch easy.

5.description: I ate here only once. One thing, I'm not Bulgarian so I can't assume if the food is up to standard.  But I had a salad and some soup with my friend who introduced me to the place and I liked it.

25.description: Great food and def cheap. I love their lunch specials you get a soup and a main dish with homemade bread for less than 8 bucks. And so far they haven't disappointed with taste either. I def recommend this place.

12.description: Love their Salads. Large Greek Salad was only $6 and was so big I had it in two servings. Come with warm bread and plenty of delicious Greek cheese. Ordered it about a dozen times now.

21.description: This seems to be one of those times where my husband and I disagree because the two times we have ordered from here his stuff was excellent and mine sucked. I'm giving them three stars based on his food alone. On try number one I ordered the whole wheat veggie pita that had tzaziki sauce. Zero flavor and tasted like cardboard but I probably had that coming by getting an all veggie sandwich. I will say the Greek salad I got on the side was perfect. A little heavy on the feta but delicious all the same. Today I branched out and got a Roma panini which has prosciutto, mozzarella, tomatoes, red onions, and olive oil. Now I love prosciutto, really I do but this particular kind was AWFUL. It tasted about a week past its expiration date, so much so I actually ripped the rest off the sandwich and ate it without. I can tell you though not to give up hope yet. My husband graciously let me have a few bites of his Italian sub and it was fantastic. It tasted like it came from a different place entirely than my order had. The bread was fresh, the salami wonderful, just a night and day difference. The prices are great, and we like having a delivery option that is fresh and outside of the typical pizza norm

16.description: Hands down, the best greek salad I've had in Chicago. Feta is not overpowering, dressing is adequately mixed, generous portions of cucumber and tomatoes. If you add chicken, it's nice and warm and freshly cooked. It also comes with warm, delicious pita bread.  Can't wait to try the rest of the menu!

17.description: Great food nice staff.  Most thing are homemade.  The Greek salad was fantastic.  Thanks!!

10.description: Was going to rate it 3 stars however that one said a- okay.I have seen this place forever but have never gone in.First reason is parking,  Lot is bad news.I read the reviews here and there seemed to be more good than bad.I should have just kept driving by.Ordered a gyros sandwich.  I have to say it is a good price and much meat.That is where it ends.  Tzatziki sauce tasted like sour cream.  Gyros meat, not much flavor.  I did not like that the tomatoes and onions were not cut smaller and interspersed throughout the sandwich.I might have sat down and eaten, however it looks dim and not welcoming inside.Service quick, staff friendly, food plentiful, prices right.

11.description: This seems to be one of those times where my husband and I disagree because the two times we have ordered from here his stuff was excellent and mine sucked. I'm giving them three stars based on his food alone. On try number one I ordered the whole wheat veggie pita that had tzaziki sauce. Zero flavor and tasted like cardboard but I probably had that coming by getting an all veggie sandwich. I will say the Greek salad I got on the side was perfect. A little heavy on the feta but delicious all the same. Today I branched out and got a Roma panini which has prosciutto, mozzarella, tomatoes, red onions, and olive oil. Now I love prosciutto, really I do but this particular kind was AWFUL. It tasted about a week past its expiration date, so much so I actually ripped the rest off the sandwich and ate it without. I can tell you though not to give up hope yet. My husband graciously let me have a few bites of his Italian sub and it was fantastic. It tasted like it came from a different place entirely than my order had. The bread was fresh, the salami wonderful, just a night and day difference. The prices are great, and we like having a delivery option that is fresh and outside of the typical pizza norm

26.description: Kabob sandwiches? check. Giant kabob sandwiches? Check. This place has doner kebobs and if you're in the hood, definitely go for one of the sandwiches. Get it to go, though, because parking is almost non-existent and the decor is dismal.

27.description: O yeah, love ittThe new owners are awseome, very very yummi bulgarian food.Everything is super fresh made it right on time. Great service.All of the dishes are prepared from very experienced chief. Every time i enjoy their food i feel how much i miss the good time in Bulgaria.If you wanna try authentic Eastern European food thats the place ;)Wish you a lots of succes guys!!!!

0.description: Me family and I have been going to Tasty World for quite some time. Although it is not the closest food option to home, it is by far more worth it than other places that are closer. In our countless visits, we have tried a number of the items on the menu and they are all delicious! My sister and I love the burgers, as well as the gyro the most! Aside from the amazing food, the service there is always exceptional! The staff is extremely friendly, helpful and caring; they make our visit worthwhile! Unlike many restaurants where the owners are absentee, the owners here go above and beyond to ensure that their customers are happy!! Would recommend this place to everyone who is looking for delicious food at affordable prices and with outstanding service!!

20.description: We placed a big order. The greek fries were terrible,  the chicken gyro was not edible. Hamburger was okay. Rice was stinky, and wasn't eaten. The regular gyro was fine. The breaded mushrooms tasted like it was cooked with dirty oil.  The caprese salad wasn't special.  The cheese fries were also okay. Nothing was really good,  I only ordered from this place based on it's rating.  Never again.

19.description: This place is awesome! DUDE, try the $5.00 doner kebab sandwich it's def delicious and crazy too. Marinated chicken wrapped in a whole wheat pita with gyro sauce, fries, lettuce, pickles, onions and tomatoes. I love the tarator which is a yogurt, cumber, dill and garlic, cold soup. Served with homemade bread too. The place has lots of Bulgarian food, so if you're looking for something new and fresh try this place  :) Cheers to that!

2.description: This review is for a delivery order.I was staying at a hotel in Rosemont and decided to try a new place out for pizza. I ordered a "small" 12" bacon pepperoni pizza, mozzarella sticks and cheesecake. The pizza was very large. It was the smallest one on the menu and I'm not exaggerating when I say it could feed three people. It was alright, quite doughy and a little too much cheese. The mozzarella sticks were pretty good but I'm sure some people would prefer them crispier. And the cheesecake was probably an 1" teeny tiny little slice but still tasted great.It wasn't a bad meal. They do offer a wide variety of things on the menu. But if you're in the Rosemont/Des Plaines area there are much MUCH better pizza places in the area.

18.description: This place being popular among Bulgarians, of course has great kebapcheta. I did not know what to expect ordring a Doner kebab sandwhich. It intrestingly contained french fries and pickles and by the way was delicious!The price range is very reasonable and parking in front makes a quick lunch easy.

13.description: Visited again after a long day of shopping at the Fashion Outlets - we were salivating in anticipation of having another lunch here.  Ordered two gyro plates - the feta cheese was just as delicious and creamy and fresh as we had remembered and the portions of the gyros and pita was generous.  Wish we lived closer because I'd probably eat here once a week.  Service was friendly just like the last time :)

4.description: Tried this place for the first time.  Good food!  Had the Greek Burger and Greek Fries.  Delivery was faster than expected

24.description: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Rosemont and ordered delivery the first day.  The food was so good that the next day we ordered from here again.  The Kufte Burger with Egg was amazing and had it both days.  Support this business.  The food is great and the delivery time is accurate.  I'm so happy I found Tasty World, just wish they were closer to where  I live.

6.description: Got the bacon cheeseburger and it was the best burger I've ever had. All ingredients tasted extremely fresh and everything was cooked to perfection.Honestly, the curb appeal doesn't convey how good the food really is! Definitely recommend and will be returning.

22.description: Unreal crazy good delivery place by hotel--ordered here 2 nights out of 3!  Great gyros, tiramisu, greek salad, suasages--you name it, it was good.  It was also delivered well ahead of the 45 mins they told me it would take to get it to me.  The cheesecake was just ordinary (and not made by them) but the rest of it was OUTSTANDING!  Even the delivery guy was nice!

15.description: Found this gem about 3 months ago and was very surprised that I haven't heard about this place before. They have some good food, I recommend their GREEK SALAD & Greek fries. Their feta cheese is pretty bomb too.

7.description: Tasty World has a rather large menu, but food that falls between being good and being "meh". On my quest to fi the best gyro in Chicago, I figured I'd check out local eatery, Tasty World. The delivery was fast, the food arrived hot and the fries arrived crispy. I ordered a few things off of the menu to try and left a little disappointed in the overall quality of food. The gyros were one of the juiciest sandwiches I had, but the meat was over spiced to the point were it was visually noticeable. The spicy chicken pita was dry and left a lot more to be desired. Don't go in ordering it expecting something along the lines of fresh. You'll receive a sub-par dry chicken patty that just tastes overcooked. The fries had a nice crunch to them, but we're pretty standard steakhouse-esque fries. The drink from my value menu was just thrown into the bottom of my bag. I understand the placement of putting the drink with my order, but I don't appreciate my soda being tossed around carelessly and my food being wet from not being in a separate bag. Overall, I'll try it again someday, but for now it's far from the top of my list.

8.description: Excellent gyro! Amount of meat, outstanding and the taste was fabulous.  The sauce was unique and delicious! Would recommend going and I will be returning!

3.description: Would expect to find this place on DDD.  8 tables, large sandwich menu but you got to try the Chicken Shawarma.  Wife had the Greek Salad with Chicken and was fantastic.  Bottled/canned soda, friendly staff.  Only down side is the attmosphere, if you like little kinda dark places, then no problem.  If in the area,  will stop again.

14.description: When I phoned, they said the chicken gyro is their most popular item.  It certainly is not cut from a traditional hero, but instead consists of dry strips of pressed chicken.  It isn't awful, but it isn't very good either.

3.description: I wish I could give this location no stars after spending a good section of my day in the ER I came in with my prescriptions and the guy is being very unhelpful saying he can't fill it with out talking to the dr.mind you it is now 12:15 and this is ridiculous. I need to get to bed not wait forever for mess I need to take

1.description: This pharmacy doesn't even deserve a star! They're terrible and couldn't fill the prescription and gave some crap about the insurance not approving it either and lied to our faces. They played stupid after we originally called AHEAD of time to confirm it was ready. We ended up driving over to the Walgreens a mile away and they filled it right away without us even having to leave! Ridiculous! Even the pharmacist couldn't figure out why they couldn't fill the order when the insurance had already approved it! Never coming here again! Waste of time!

2.description: I been here one time and my son was sick and they helped out to give him the amount of medical he need that day cuz he broke out in a bad rash thank god we had the medical and people were there too us out. And I like cool phone case they had there also

5.description: My impression started when I walked in to this Walgreens.  It's the typical feeling of walking into a lowest bidder situation when it comes to the construction of a place.  The lack of style and over bright florescent lighting reminds me of a hospital.  Only difference is that hospitals are sterol and I wouldn't put anything in my mouth that came off a shelf from this place.  The slogan "be well!" Sounds like, "good luck!" To me.  As in the employees feel like I may have caught something whilst browsing their store.But the pharmacy on the other hand is like a whole different place.  My initial impression as I came around the corner of the Nexium 24 hour shelfs was an angel with blonde hair and blue scrubs.  I was greeted with a smile and she was even concerned that I was getting pain meds, I stood there and told her the entire story of how I crashed my motorcycle and broke my hand.  The service was fast and caring despite the amount of people who needed to be helped.  The pharmacy tech helping me was answering calls the entire time!  But was still clicking away at what ever else she was doing!Best pharmacy experience ever!Note: this was my first pharmacy experience.

6.description: My shelves-- stocked with unlimited Red Bulls.  Lean cuisines, lining ever corner of my freeze door.  The occasional eye drops or cold medicine, right on hand.That's life.  This is Walgreens.  Close, convenient, campy.

0.description: Cashier was clueless  about Apple Pay didn't  know rewards card are automatically scanned with tap and pay. Kept asking for my phone number

4.description: It never fails that "when" I actually need a prescription of any kind, I can count on the. Cumberland Walgreens to screw things up.No one can figure anything out. Always people waiting. Pharmacy workers all staring at screens instead of handling waiting customers. I never have these issues at other Walgreens. Just this one, it seems like it's a mix of confusion, incompetence and failure to be able to multi-task. Something I would think would be a pre-req to work in a pharmacy anywhere.Bottom line, they claim "we are always backed up". If you "need" something filled; go somewhere else. Unless you need cards, batteries, simple items, then they are ok. If you're suffering and in bad shape, might be faster to pay the ER co-pay and get the meds right away, or you could end up taking a dirt nap at the Walgreens speed.

12.description: Ladies--- if you were confused on the first go around then let me be clear.  I press my hair--I do not have a relaxer. I have been chemical free for 8 years.  I get asked if I have a weave at least once a week..why? Because Willie helps me keep my "do" looking right. Willie and Carrie the dynamic duo. Remember you heard it here first!If you want "natural hair styling" this is NOT the recommendation for you.  If you you wear your hair straight from time to time holla at me. However, they do carry a great product called CURLS at the salon that Willie told me all about--I liked it better than curly pudding. Might I also add my favorite hairstylist was recently featured in Chicago Magazine.  chicagomag.com/Chicago-M…

7.description: Hey ladies! Just an fyi that Mikke is no longer stylin' it up at this salon. She has since moved to Toss Salon. It's just down the street on 13th St. in between Wabash and Michigan.  As I mentioned before in my previous review, wherever she goes, my hair will follow! Check her out!

20.description: I adore this beautiful new salon in the South Loop.  The owner, Lillian, and staff are both friendly and know how to do some hair!!  They carry the Italian line of hair care products, DAVINES (davines.com) and Avlon's Keracare(avlon.com/KeraCare/index…).  The salon itself is gorgeous with white walls and  dark wood accents,  hardwood floors, massaging chairs that you sit in while your head/hair is washed and massaged, and huge plasma screen TVs you  can dork out on while you get your hair done!  The prices are a little high but worth it!  They also have a private room you can request if you are having a salon service done that you want nobody to know about, like extensions or a weave/wig.  This is the place to go for people with all different hair types and no one is ever  made to feel awkward as in "we don't specialize in THAT type of hair" or "ethnic hair, what is THAT?"  Multi- racial hair salon?  Love that concept!  Welcome to the neighborhood Lillian Dion.

19.description: I stopped by here since I live in the area. This salon and owner are so pleasant. The entire staff is awesome. The salon's design is what attracted me as I walked by about a week or so ago. I walked in for a mani/pedi. It was the best Mani/Pedi I have ver had. Honestly it was very pricey but for an awesome treat I highly recommend this place. I met the owner who was so sweet and asked me what I normall do with my hair. I told her a roller set and right away she introduced me to the roller set expert. I have an appointment in two weeks. for right now, Calandra, my manicurist was AWESOME! thorough and what attention to detail. Highly recommend this place.

1.description: Lillian Dion broke my heart. I trusted her with my locks- I thought we had something special but I guess she didn't feel the same. I have called and called, almost a stalkerish amount, and she doesn't return my calls. I guess she doesn't want to use her magic on me. Which is a huge shame because I don't think I will ever find a better hair cut. This is the most painful form of rejection. I will have to talk to my therapist about it. Seriously a bummer. I'm actually pissed. WORST BREAK UP EVER!Update: Lillian and I are on speaking terms my therapist says this is a start to my recovery.
