I'm very excited to have my hair look like the gods have blessed my head.

2.description: BEWARE! Of this salon! They have amateurs working here. I went in for an ombré and came out with a buzz cut! A stylist by the name of Dedric Deshon applied bleach to my hair, left me under the dryer for way too long, and burned my hair completely off. Maybe he should start paying attention to his clients.... He had to do an emergency sew-in because I refused to leave without my luscious long locks. The weave was OK, nothing special. To my disbelief, I asked him to redo the ombré on my weave because that was what I came in for the first time and I still wanted to achieve that look. He actually burned my hair a SECOND TIME! Yes! A SECOND time! Why did I go back to the salon you ask? Because we had an agreement because of the color mishap and I forgave him for the FIRST mistake. But the SECOND? Ridiculous!!! The owner thought this was laughable... Terrible customer service and I had never thought someone would keep someone on staff who clearly needs to go back to HAIR SCHOOL. BEWARE of this salon if you are considering color!!! Beware of the owner who will do nothing but offer you some cheap hair and claim that it's top of line just in case the hairstylist accidentally burns your hair off.

9.description: I have seen several really good stylist leave this place due to the extreme lack of professionalism. On the flipside, I met a really great stylist there, Micki Faine, who is now at Toss. I am consistently pleased with Micki's professionalism and talent.

6.description: Now to be fair, I'm sure the other stylists are also excellent, but this review is really just for Crizen.  She is PHENOMENAL.  And worth it to follow her to any salon.It's amazing how much she knows about hair...and all different kinds of hair.  I've seen her work with my girlfriend's hair which is thick and super curly, whereas I have really thin hair, and it was her that convinced me to chop off my long hair and have a really short, trendy, angled cut.  When I returned for a trim, she gave me the best highlights I've ever had.  And the best part is....she is super nice!  She really listens to what you want, what your hesitations are, and she's not afraid to tell you what she thinks would look best.  I've come to just trust her with everything that involves hair and makeup.  When I moved to NY I actually refused to go anywhere else for my hair and I would wait to come back to Chicago just so Crizen could do my hair!!  Granted it's been a while since I've been back and although I'm happy with my stylist now, no one compares to Crizen.  And FYI..I saw her yesterday and she's preggers and about to give birth, but STILL working as hard as ever to make your hair look fabulous!

18.description: I went to Crizen for highlights and a haircut (after asking someone where they got their hair done; so I saw her work in advance). She gave me the best cut I've had in years, at a fraction of the cost from the Gold Coast. area.  My Color is also great; and a price I didn't choke on.  Crizen took me a few minutes early, didn't b.s. and went right to business.  I also want to mention the ladies at the reception desk couldn't have been nicer; I will certainly be back and referring clients!  Thank you Crizen!

10.description: I went here once, during July.  Let me start with the positives... my hair actually looked really great.  The stylist (can't recall her name, but she is Caribbean) was an amazing colorist.   Cut was so-so, but the color was great.  And yet, even with the great color, I will never go back:First,  I was in the salon for a total of over seven hours.  Second, there was a weird stylist switch...  I went in after making an appointment for a highlight touch up.  The stylist that I had the appointment with called over another stylist (the Caribbean woman), who suggested that I add low lights because my hair was very blonde and did not "look serious" ... okay, fine.  Not what I asked for, but fine.  The weird thing was that the first stylist  then sort of started picking at my hair for about an hour or so, and then kept calling over the second stylist to help her decide what to use.  And then she just left and let the second woman take over for the entire service.  And then, even though the second stylist did my entire color and even blow dried me, when I went to pay, the owner of the salon (who was also the cashier) told me that the two stylists split the service.  I asked her whether I should just tip on the total amount, even though one of them did the whole service.  She said "well, did you like your service?" which made it sound like she thought I was asking how tipping worked or something.  So I ended up having to tip both of them on the total amount, which was sort of unfair considering the first woman got a giant tip (see below for cost of service) but didn't do anything.The worst part, though, was that I was honestly shocked by the cost of the service when I went to pay ...  over $400! ... the stylist charged me for a corrective color, without telling me at the outset that she considered low lighting/ highlighting combo to be a corrective color. That really surprised me.  I did not go in seeking a corrective color.  The stylists did not say "we need to do corrective color" or "this will be pricey" or any of that... she suggested low lights, and then charged me for corrective color.  I felt a bit trapped by when I saw the bill.   I honestly had no idea that was coming.   I am just too weirded out to go back.  But that being said, the color was quite good.  So my advice is to be prepared to pay a lot, and to be very clear on the pricing....

13.description: Don't let Tracey from Lillian Dion color your hair. She RUINED my hair. I had to come in a total of 4 times and spent close to 24 hrs at the salon rectifying her horrible job. She left me with half of my already thin hair gone. All I wanted was her to touch up my roots on the tip of my head which had been highlighted. She messed up the first time so I had to go back the next day which she messed up even more. The third time she left bleach in my hair for over 5 hrs and my hair was so plastic like it just fell off. LUCKILY the owner has been able to help me and put extensions free of charge to rectify the HORRIBLE job Tracey did to begin with. The owner is very nice and professional and told me she will work with me to get my hair back to what it was but that it will probably take up to 6 months to get there. I would only recommend letting the owner do your hair unless you want half of your hair burnt off and want to look worse than how you originally came in.

16.description: If you have natural Black hair.  DO NOT come here!  The only thing they know how to do is blowdry it to cut it, or give you a straw set...I mean hello!    Just because you have natural hair doesn't mean you want to change the style of your curl into small shirley temple ringlets!  Also beware of the amount of heat they apply to your delicate hair...I had to cut a couple parts out since they singed it straight with hot combs and what not.  Plus it's very expensive.  Lastly, the shampoo lady did not know how to properly comb through wet naturally curly hair.  Natural hair takes time and care.  these people didn't care.

17.description: The salon looks great, but is way overrated. I saw the article in Chicago Mag and the reviews on here, but my experience was far from what I was expecting based upon the reviews and the article.I had Willy as my stylist. It was a bit uncomfortable, because of his attitude - very superior. I was worked on for 20 minutes, period - the time I spent waiting was longer than that. He didn't wash my hair, or have my hair washed by anyone else; I had a trim (two - three inches), and told him I wanted bangs. When I went in, I didn't have them; I told him what I wanted and that I hadn't had bangs before, and he started cutting. When he was done, that was it. No shampoo at the end, no advice on how to style my hair or how to make the new bangs do what I wanted them to do. Then he asked if the receptionist had told me how much it would cost; I told him now, and was floored when he told me that it would be $80. I can't believe how ridiculous that is - $80 for 20 minutes of cutting and discussion, no styling advice, and no shampoo? After that visit, I was thinking about how I really should enroll in a beauty college if I was going to be able to charge $320 per hour. Never would I visit again, regardless of how convenient it is to my work, and I wouldn't suggest the place to anyone.

15.description: Were do I begin with this place..... Well for starters I choose to have my gorgeous hair cut here because the place looked cute and what the hell I live across the street.   So I did the everyday research of looking places up on line and comparing prices and what not. Well for starters the price range for a hair cut was $35-$90. So you would assume 1. maybe the range is for the length and/or type of hair and 2. they would tell you what the price would be for you service before hand since the range is HUGE. (I worked at Mario Tricoci and I understand the range for new stylists versus senior ones, im down with that lingo). But no I wasnt told anything except to be at my appt at 1pm. Hey it was 11 and I thought I could relax my behind a lil more before I got ready. Hey it's summer and I like to relax!!!   Anywho, I was greeted my a receptionist who asked me to be seated and my shampooer would me with me shortly. Well once he decided to come back into the salon at 1:15pm I was taken to the shampoo bowls, which I have to admit was the absolute highlight of the whole experience. They recline and massage you like the chairs at the nail salon, oh and I forgot to mention how cute they are by serving ginger ale in wine glasses. Ok now back to the "experience", so I get to the bowl and see another woman sitting at a bowl with her hair everywhere, and I really do mean everywhere. Thought she was for another stylist. Ooh little did I know we had the same stylist and she was before me. Its now 1:20pm and I am getting shampooed. Now mind I tell you that I have naturally curly hair but I straighten it. I take great care of my hair and it was in descent shape, I was just having a girl moment ad wanted a lil different edge to my current cut. The shampoo guy went into great lengths to tell me how horrible my hair was and he was going to put a deep conditioning conditioner on it. Well who the hell am I to know any better. So I sat there, and sat and sat. I started to feel like a lost child. Now its 2:15pm and I get rinsed and brought to the chair. Only to be greeted by a rude stylist who rolled his eyes at me when I was discussing what I wanted. Thank god I paid attention because I had to stop the cutting before I looked like Sinade O'Connor. Then as he "blow-dried" my hair he just just a plain flat brush and talked on his phone the whole time. My hair was curly on the bottom and I had a Farah Faucet flip on the top. He took the cape off and walked away. I then only assumed that we were finished and I proceeded to the front desk. At this point it was after 3pm and I had already rescheduled 2 work meetings because of the ridiculous tardiness of the salon.    Then the heart attack came when she told me my bill was $90. I was so disgusted that I paid and left. Seriously? Does that salon think they are in the Bloomingdale's building doing Jennifer Aniston's hair? I will never and I mean never personally step foot in that place and I hope by reading this you never will.   There was "1" stylist there and they charged $90 and were over and hour late? Yeah im pretty sure I was in Chicago and not London.   So please do yourself, your time and your pocket book a favor and dont get services here. Go to Aniko Salon across the street where they are so nice and upfront with their services..... oh yeah and on time.

0.description: Dedric Deshon is my stylist and has been for several years...he saved my hair from completely falling out of head! He cares about his work! He does the best sew-ins and keratins! Period. So if you need a stylist I highly recommend Dedric and I am picky as they come :)

5.description: This review is for the magician herself...Miss Lillian. I came here on a whim as her salon is in my neck of the woods and while skeptical at first it turned out to be a grade A decision.For as long as I can remember I've had a huge complex about my hair. Shallow? Maybe. Necessary? 100%. My hair is pretty wavy/curly and thick. With the exception of my hairdresser in my college town circa 2008 I've had the worst time finding someone who gets me. I can't tell you how many times where I've heard, "Oh...wow. You have so much hair" which as we all know is code for "Cough cough your hair sucks girl." Lillian just got me. She's absolutely adorable and the sweetest thing ever and most important girl is amazing at hair. Not once did she complain or make a bitchy comment (which most girls know goes a long way). She can blow dry like no one else I've ever met and the best part is she took the time to teach me how to do it myself! She's always giving me great tips and tricks and mentoring me on what to do next with my hair.I like to think of Lil as my own personal Nick Arrojo from TLC's What Not To Wear. :)Side Note - Minus 1 Star for the guy who answers the phone. I'm not sure he quite understands the art of being a receptionist. It's pretty much like pulling teeth to get that damn appointment...homeboy needs to lock that shit down.

11.description: My stylist Dedric is amazing! My hair always looks incredible after I leave. He creates contemporary styles but his primary concern is maintaining healthy hair. He's def one of the best!

8.description: UPDATE: This place is either closed down or renovating. All the stylist stations are gone and most of the stuff has been taken off the walls. Hmm...I received an incredibly nasty, error-laden message from Jai, who saw my review. I was accused of being a "loser" and a friend of former employees, which couldn't be further from the truth. What I am is a longtime South Loop resident who doesn't like having her time or money wasted. I was truthful about my experience at the salon and absolutely stand by my review. Instead of trying to make improvements in service, I get an illiterate and disgruntled customer attacking me. Even further proof of why I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

3.description: Crizen is hands down the best ever!! I followed her here from another salon actually. I just go for haircuts, but I am picky...  the wash and styling they provide with it is very enjoyable.Everyone that works here is very nice and helpful too! I have been able to sneak in a last min cut before due to others canceling, and the online booking system they use is nice and easy too.

14.description: My review is based on merely attempting to get an appointment there, but never having actually set foot inside. The experience alone was enough to let me know I would NEVER give them my money. A friend gave me a gift certificate for a pedicure, and after 3 failed attempts at an appointment I gave up. The first time I called I had to leave a message and never got a return phone call. The 2nd time I actually spoke to a live, albeit flippant receptionist, who sounded like she was doing me a huge favor by answering the phone (should have been my first clue) and granting me the privilege of booking an appointment for me. The day of my appointment, which was scheduled for after work and right before I was leaving for a business trip, they called me (no joke here, people) 15 FRIGGIN MINUTES before my appointment to tell me that the person scheduled to do my manicure & pedicure had called in sick, so I'd have to reschedule.  Now what, now?? You have ONE person in the entire salon who does mani/pedis? For reals? There was no other hand and foot specialist who could handle my appointment? Is it me or is that bad business? Oh, and, mind you that the oh-so charming imp who called me didn't bother to ask if I wanted to reschedule while she had me on the phone. The third time was the charm. Called to make yet ANOTHER APPOINTMENT, and was left on hold for 7 minutes. At that point I gave up and decided that a prepaid pedicure wasn't worth the janky atmosphere.

4.description: Let me first start off by saying that I have never actually made it through the door way of Lillian Dion Salon, and let me explain why...In the mart I made the mistake of making eye contact, and therefore getting roped into a 15 minute sales pitch for a groupon-esk package at Lillian Dion Salon. ....Partial Color, Cut, Style, Deep Conditioning treatment, Mani/Pendi a $300+ value for a mere $65...it seems too good to be true and as it turns out, it was! Well, I was tempted and ended up buying int the package receiving my voucher right on the spot.The first two times I called the salon was to try a schedule my mani/pedi..."try" being the key word. I was met with the response "Oh our manicurist actually just left the salon, we don't know if we'll be replacing her". Interesting, well you ought replace her and pronto if you're selling deals that include that service, no?So I figured, OK I'll let them work that out and in the mean time I DO need a haircut, so I'll give that service a whirl. I called an additional 4 times throughout a 3 month period to schedule a cut/style. The receptionist was pleasant enough but I was blocked with filled schedules, or "Lillian is sick" or let me get back to you about availability. (mind you i never asked for or requested lillian herself).We all know where this is going...there was never a call back. Never an appointment scheduled. I'm not one to back down after I've paid money up front for a service or PACKAGE of services - after 6 phone calls I was feeling stalkerish but I moved up to Lakeview and decided this battle wasn't worth the fighting for anymore. Hell, Lillian Dion Salon may be miracle workers with hair, pampering and the rest....I wouldn't know. Instead they left me extremely pissed off and with a bad taste in my mouth by the way they run their business.Lesson learned, if it seems too good to be true...it most likely is! Such was the case here.

12.description: I live close by and made a mistake going there two times. They are really quick getting you in one of the chairs but quick on getting you out as well... Both times they didn't cut my nails straight and same lenght. They kept asking do you want this, that... The lady owner tried doing a design on my toe and it looked like a three year old did it. I'm just not going back.

3.description: The woman who is in charge is rude and rough. I will never go back and I will never recommend to any one. She scrapped my toe so hard that it was bleeding!!! I was horrified to say the least. She doesn't know that dogs don't belong in a place of business.

1.description: I have had manicure/pedicures for a very long time. I came here because they were open on Sunday. These people are unprofessional and were very rough with my hands. I noted he left my nails uneven he looked upset. I was told u can go. My polish job was a mess by the same evening. Plus their poor pups who walk around salon clothes were too tight.  DO NOT GO HERE!

2.description: I don't understand how they stay in business! Went there out of convenience because I desperately needed a manicure and I was in the area. I had the no chip done by the man (husband?) and it looked like it was done by a 5 year old child! Horrible run outs, streaks, I even had to ask him to buff the tips because he left them really sharp and uneven. To make this experience even more disgusting, he had really long and dirty nails himself and no gloves on! I should have walked out as soon as I walked in.

9.description: What a disappointment.I went here on a recommendation from an acquaintance that always has great nails. They do have the cutest dog as their greeter, but anything else went downhill. The lady was constantly trying to upsell me ... Do you want your eyebrows waxed? Do you want a french manicure? Do you want a pedicure ... etc. I just wanted a very plain and simple no chip manicure. I asked them to be particularly sensitive around my cuticles on my thumbs, and that caution went right to the wind. Nothing better than bloody cuticles before a no chip manicure.  They charged me an extra $1 to use my credit card ... and I also tipped handsomely ... more than 20%. To say the least, my pointer finger completely peeled off after 48 hours. (I didn't even do the dishes!) I went back and I just wanted to take them off and forget about the whole situation.  She made me stick my fingers in straight acetone for a painful 5 minutes, then she made me take off the manicure myself with some sort of metal apparatus. Then she told me to wash my hands ... then she told me, $5 for removal!!!! I looked at her, she smiled and said $5. I said, "you're kidding me?!" She said, "No, we always charge for removal." She essentially blocked the exit until I paid, then her husband 'escorted' me out. I was completely floored by the business practices at Tips N  Toes. Never again!

10.description: I have never been so disappointed from a nail salon EVER in my life! I have been getting my nails done for about 10 years now and after 2 years of an initial bad experience in this salon; I decided to give them another try. I was charged 91 dollars as my total for 2 Mani and Pedi's. My partner's job was well done and mine was just horrible. Today is day 2 and the nail paint is chipping off. My toes have a mediocre painting job and I am not sure if it is from the "ESSIE" polish I chose or the paint job that was done. DONT WASTE YOUR TIME!!

4.description: I read reviews and even though most were bad I decided to try it because it was convenient. First off, it is extremely unprofessional to have 2 dogs walking around. I did hair for 10 years and that is just something you don't have in a salon.  The 1st time I went for a regular mani. The girl did a pretty good job but she had her young kid with her, who kept interrupting. This made a simple mani take quite awhile. I was on a time crunch, but didn't say anything. The 2nd time I got a no chip mani from the owners husband, I believe. Worst no chip I've ever had! There was polish all over my skin,  cuticles and under my nails, which is causing them to peel not even 24 hours later. I asked for a 3rd coat of polish, which most places I've gone automatically do for free, and was charged an extra 6 dollars! I guess that was his opportunity to up charge when I declined a French mani. I will not be back!  For now on I will go the extra distance to get my services done correctly.

6.description: Worst service ever. My gel manicure began chipping after 2 days. And the guy kept arguing with me when I told him I know what works for my nails. And he Took so long getting off my old gel (he did not use the usual wrap method) and I needed to get to work so didn't have time for him to do a true manicure I E cutting the cuticles etc. and yet he charged me full price. This is the worst manicure I have ever received I would never ever ever go back there again. I have been doing gel manicures for four years and I have never had one like this!!!!

0.description: Its okay. I don't really have any complaints, but its nothing special. My nails always look fine and the prices are reasonable. The pedicure really lasted which is nice, and my regular manicures generally do too. I am not a big fan of the dogs, but other customers seem to like it. (?) My complaints are that the people working there seem genuinely unhappy, the never run the air and its way too hot and humid, and its not the most relaxing place. It does the job in a hurry, but not my first choice.

5.description: I used to go here quite often. I took a break during the winter and thought I would get a pedi with the nice weather. I called at 12pm & made an appt for 4:15. I got there at 4:10. A walk in took my spot. They got me set up and I soaked for 45 mins. During that time she kept saying it will be a few more minutes. I said 'it's been 45 minutes'. I finally got my pedi. I declined the massage due to time. She took 5.00 off the bill & said she'll take care of me next time. I said 'if there is a next time' (there won't be). Don't bother making an appt. You have better luck as a walk-in.

13.description: Omg!!! I went here 2 weeks ago for a mani pedi and the only saving grace to this place is LING! She was awesome. I wish she was there today. Me and my cousin went here today and some guy did her pedi and the older bigger built bib cut lady did my no chip...horrible experience for both of us!! Worst customer service I have ever experienced especially since this is a customer based industry. The guy was rushing to do my cousins toes... She didn't like the color on half of her foot so she decided to change it... Happens all the time no biggie right... Well he gave her attitude told her to pick something else so she did but he told her my lady was gonna finish her toes so she sat by me and nothing happened so I asked my lady who's gonna finish her pedi and she stated in the biggest attitude that he was waiting for my cousin to pick a color!! Even though she had 20 min ago and sat back down in her chair and watched him clean and pay no attention to her. So my lady told her he's gonna finish and he did but not without bumps along the way... He did not file down her nails evenly one was still cracked same as she came in.. She combined that there were clumps on her nails and she wanted him to fix that... Reasonable request since you're paying for a PEDICURE... There should be no lumps or running duh!... Well he acted so angry it made everyone uncomfortable.now to me.. I originally wanted to change it up and instead of a French no chip I wanted to do orange tips... Well after a one round one hand trial I decided nope, that looks stupid and decided on classic French... Well I got an awesome attitude(sarcasm)...she was horrible. My middle fingers didn't even match in color tip length and two were bunching..I asked her if that was normal...knowing fully well it wasn't, and she said oh yes that's normal! Uh huh looks like a child painted my nails!! I'm stupid and bc I have worked in the customer service industry I gave her a 30% tip which I regretted the tenth of a second I signed my receipt!!! Worst experience ever!!!!! I will never spend my money here again! Please be aware stay away!!! If you're not satisfied they won't fix it without attitude and tension. So uncomfortable!!! We both had the worst experience ever and this is a luxury.. Not many people can afford this luxury they should be great full for everyone that walks in but apparently not! Ughhhh hard earned money thrown away!

11.description: DISGUSTING!!!!! By far the WORST nail experience I have had in my life! I don't even know where to begin. I normally have my own nail salon that I go to, but as a last minute event came up, I needed my nails done last minute and had no time to drive all the way to my usual salon. So I decided to try this neighborhood place. So to begin, this establishment is run by a husband and wife. My nails were being done by the husband. To start off, I told them that my nails were medium pink powder and they took out their light powder and told me it was medium thinking I wouldn't notice that my nail color wouldn't match. I asked for medium again and they insisted that I wouldn't know the difference. Then, if anyone is unfamiliar with acrylic nails, I was having a typical fill which required using the drill. As I'm sitting there, another technician comes stumbling behind mine and FALLS into him jolting his hand and CUTTING my finger with the drill! I immediately jumped from the pain and a few seconds later there came the blood. He continued doing my nail as if nothing happened!!! I couldn't believe it. Didn't ask if I was ok, nothing. Then I asked if he could please wipe the blood off my finger and told me that when I put my hands under the light that it would dry my blood....? Disgusted and annoyed I just thought whatever, I'm not going to argue I just want to leave. As my nails were under the light, in comes his wife to do a client with their salon dog. As she begins doing her client, her cuticle cutters falls to the floor. I turned to watch her as she looked around thinking about what to do. A moment later she blew on them and used them on her client! She didn't disinfect, sanitize them, nothing! Disgusted, I continued watching. She then proceeded to talk to her dog, and I watched trying to figure out what she was wanting him to do. In complete SHOCK I realized what she was asking!!! She wanted the dog to put the bottle of nail polish in its mouth and bring it to her husband for another client! At this point I was so disgusted I just wanted to leave. I said I needed to use the restroom before I left, which turned out to be like everything else...GROSS and UNSANITARY! As I looked around the bathroom I was surrounded by a knocked over mop bucket and the floor covered in nasty cleaning supplies. It was so filthy you could barely reach the sink to wash your hands. Needless to say, I high-tailed it out of there the minute I paid my bill...NEVER AGAIN IN MY LIFE!!!!!!!!!!

8.description: I've seen the other reviews and I'm glad I didn't check them before coming because I might not have come. I have NEVER had a bad experience here with their service. I've waited sometimes for longer than expected because they are always so busy but big deal. My nails always look great and so do my toes. I always get the no chip mani and deluxe pedi. The massage is pretty amazing with the deluxe. For a few bucks more it can't be beat! I will not go anywhere else

14.description: Went here a while ago and will not be back!! Got a mani and pedi (no prices posted by the way). She rushed through both my manicure and pedicure (and I was there 3 hours before they closed). Had chipped nail polish on my nails still, which I had to ask her to remove because she was just going to paint over it (huh??). She smudged my toe and finger, she noticed both and did nothing. I had to ask her to fix both which she did but didn't seem happy about. Then I had to pay an extra $2 because I was paying with credit (yes I know $2 is nothing but there's not a sign anywhere).  Plus side, they did have a really cute dog in the shop (shrugs shoulders).

7.description: I've known the owners of this Spa for years and they are nothing but nice and polite. The spa is clean and always busy. It's sounds to me that the people who had problems are not very nice people at all and are very demanding. If you are ever unhappy about your service they are always happy to make things better so you will come back.

0.description: Offers an entree daily, grill section and salads.

1.description: Made an appointment to have brown/chocolate highlights and trimming, instead I got some orange highlights in the front part, mostly the bangs part...Angela wanted to use flat iron to straighten my hair before trimming and when I disagreed with her on the use of flat iron and requested to blow dry instead she was doing it with irritation pulling out my hair. I paid 130$ +tip for ruining my hair and my day...came home and straight to shower. Also bought a color to get rid of those awful highlights if I can call it highlights ....I am very disappointed. This is the last time I was there. Though I had a nice experience with Roberto before. A nice person and a professional.

2.description: Roberto is THE MAN!!! Knows something about everything, always goes that extra mile to make sure you are happy with your hair. Bonus if you have a good sense of humor because Roberto is hilarious too!!

0.description: I love this salon. Had a fabulous customer experience.  Angela did an awesome job cutting my hair that was totally hacked by another salon. Jasmine's attention to detail during my manicure was spot on. I will recommend them to everyone and I will be back. It's my new one stop shop for beauty!

3.description: They do an okay job on what I usually get - mani and pedi. Service could be better - they rush onto the the next client and eat in front of you. I got my first eyelash extensions for a wedding and I don't know what was I thinking doing them here. We could say I'm waiting for some of my real eyelashes to grow. I found another nail salon so won't be coming back here.

1.description: I highly recommend this place. I went in for a no chip manicure and toe polish change after leaving a Yelp event. I found this gem by looking for a nearby salon. When I arrived, there were two techs. My person helped me pick a color. She suggested one of the newer blues for summer. I was reluctant but decided it was worth a try. After all, it will be a new color in 2 weeks. The service was quick and I loved the color. If I lived closer, I would totally frequent this place.

0.description: So I tried going to other places in the area but wasted a half hour driving around only to find the various nail salons only do nails on select days. This was frustrating bc I was in a particular hurry today. I settled on this place bc I called and they were open (mind you its 4 on Tuesday). I was not blown away by them but I am very happy.Pros: The manicure is super cuteThe price was more than reasonable ($12)They had a pretty good selection of colorCons:The tools weren't taken from a airtight bagThe ladies didn't try to chat and only talked in their language (Tagalog?)

2.description: I have been a patron of this location for 5+ years now and I must say this place has taken a turn for the worse. This salon is now owned by a family. At first it was alright. Being the closest and most convenient location to me I looked past the awkward ambiance and kept returning. Let me detail exactly what happened on my most recent visit: 1. They sat a woman at a pedi station without turning the water on to soak her feet. When she asked for water, they filled the tub (no salt) and walked away for long enough for the tub to be a second away from over flowing. 2. Woman came in for mani and pedi with her daughter. They say the mother down and ignored the kid. When the mother told them she wanted a pedi for her daughter too, the owner responded with "whatever you want. If you pay. We're too busy" the woman was shocked. Little girl ended up sitting on her moms lap to get her feet done. 3. The owners started face timing on their phone with a LOUD screaming baby while working on customers nails. Like I mean propped up phone while filing and painting. I'm sorry but the last thing I want to hear is a screaming infant when I'm trying to relax...I've been to my fair share of nail salons and typically the workers speak to each other in their language  I'm sure everyone has the feeling that they're talking about our hairy legs or ugly worm toes but this place. Jeez it's almost like they make it a priority to make you feel like they're talking about you. Needless to say I need to find a new salon...

5.description: Will never go to this place. She scrapped my toe so hard it was bleeding!!!stay away. The technicians are constantly talking and laughing to each other in their language, how rude!!!!

6.description: I came in here on Saturday and got a fill, the salon was not busy and I was attended right away. My nails were done just the way I like them.. medium length,  square, and not thick.  I've seen cleaner salons but I was happy with the outcome,  and the price ($15) was the cheapest out of all the salons I have been to. Being so close to home and cheap, I was seriously considering becoming a regular. My mom went there today to get her nails done, and she was charged $50.. her nails were also done nicely but this is way too expensive for what she had done. This place needs to keep consistent with their prices.. I was thinking of going back but don't want to risk getting overcharged. If money is not an issue for you this place is worth checking out if you're in the area.

7.description: Below average. Bad choice. Will never go again. Staff was ok but work was poor quality.

8.description: This place is amazing. Staff is so friendly and accommodating. I have come here to get many fill-ins and messed up acrylics fixed and they always make them look amazing. They also take their time making your nails look great and never rush to get through customers.

9.description: I have been coming here for many years and this place has been owned by various people over the years.  It is now owned by a family.  When I came here for a manicure about a month ago, the son-in-law, who speaks very little English did my nails.  When I complained to him that he was putting the polish on too thick, the daughter (his wife) jumped to his defense.  The daughter was also watching her baby on her propped-up cell phone instead of paying much attention to her customer.  The next time I came here, I got the same guy, and as he was getting his instruments from the sterilizer, I noted some facial expressions and conversation between him and his wife and she looked at me with a smirk on her face.  Then a few moments later, I saw her whispering to the woman whose pedicure she was doing and they were both looking my way and laughing.  When I asked "What's so funny?' she shrugged and I told her I felt she was whispering at laughing about me since they were both looking my way.  I felt embarrassed and humiliated and after about 12 years coming there would never come back.  The parents who own the place are OK, but this place has definitely gone down and that daughter has an attitude.

10.description: Worst service ever! Don't waste your time. Go to Nail Tech 8 on Irving. Much better service, cleaner, and more relaxing.

4.description: When I go in for a mani - pedi I'm there to relax! I walked in this guy didn't speak to me at all and didn't know what he was doing the entire time. On top of that a baby was crying the entire time in the back employee room. Also the guy doing my nails burned me with really hot water when rinsing my feet I scream loudly of the shock and pain. I'm all for a family business but it's just disturbing when people go in for some personal time and receive lack of quality, service and knowledge plus getting burned and a screaming baby. I will not be returning to this place again.

3.description: Worst place ever. Made me wait for 30 minutes. They also gave me frozen fries and uncooked meat. I will never come here again!

1.description: My daughter and I just got breakfest burritos from there. She left the lower portion of hers so I took it and had a bite of it. I ended up spiting it out into the wrapper cause it tasted funny. There was mold on the tortilla shell. I called them to complain but they transferred me all over the place because half of them can't speak English. I will never go back and I told them if my daughter gets sick I will make sure they are held responsible for this. McDonalds is not what it use to be, no wonder they are going downhill.

2.description: Awful service- very sloooow drive thru times- i hate coming to this McDonalds location because the staff is unprofessional and basically i'd rather save my $ and not go here. Biggest problem is the cold food and the drive thru employees are constantly giving the wrong orders all the time. Why should i waste my time?

5.description: I used to be a regular patron at this McDonald's location before it was remodeled.  Since they reopened the service and quality of food has been dreadful.  Since the reopening, the service has been very slow and every time there has been something wrong with my order.  For example, today I ordered a medium coffee and a medium fry.  When I received the food, my fries were room temperature.  This leads me to believe that the employees are leaving food sitting out which can become a health concern.  My coffee was not even room temperature... it was cold which was disgusting.  I threw out the food and went to a café down the street to get a hot cup of coffee to feed my craving.  I have also been hearing a plethora of poor reviews on this locations since it has reopened.  I really hope something is done about both the quality of service as well as the food quality soon; I would truly hate to lose such a convenient location!

6.description: Drive-thru service is isn't always the greatest and when i ask for condiments they are often left out. It does take a long time for my food to be prepared.

7.description: ppl dont know how to speak english how can they take an order?

0.description: There has been a definite slide in service and quality since this McDonald's was closed and rebuilt last year.  I used to be a regular at this location which is convenient to me when I work or go to the gym, but I find myself purposely avoiding it now.The orders are consistently wrong and the general level of service is just bad.  I also hate that you can't pull out of the drive-thru back into the parking lot anymore.  A good example of how something good was turned into something pretty bad very quickly.

4.description: Drive through is very bad. I was waiting for 10 minutes in the right lane and no one took my order, I had to tell the cars behind me that this lane is not working and we all had to drive back and to the left side lane. Bad service won't come back.

0.description: I wouldn't normally review a mini market, but this is a gem of a store, and it's run by a wonderful woman who is always friendly, helpful, and polite.  I visit this area often for work, and within a few visits, she was greeting me by name.Her prices are incredibly reasonable; I love me some Diet Mt. Dew and Pepsi Max - she sells them for well below what the nearby 7-Elevens or gas stations do.  She also has a great selection of Vitamin water and other convenience store items.  Need some Airborne?  She's got it.  A sugar fix?  No problem.  A salty snack?  Yep.  Lotto ticket?  You betchya.Great store, great owner, great service.  WIN.

3.description: What a great addition to the neighborhood! I hadn't had my eyebrows done in quite some time, and they did a great job. Everyone there is so kind and friendly!  I have found my new regular spot.

1.description: I stopped by Brows Threading about a week and a half ago. I was really excited that a threading salon opened in North Center. The women who did my brows was nice and friendly. The thread was a little thinner than I prefer. However, my brows looked great and the price was fair. I will definitely come back!

2.description: I love my eyebrows! The lady was very thorough and would stop to give me recommendations on where my eyebrows needed more growing and what not. I used the groupon which included eyebrow threading and upper lip for 8$ where their regular price eyebrow 10$ and upper lip 5$. I'd say that's a great price for the area. On the downside, the type of thread that was used hurt more than previous experience with other salons.

0.description: Great place added to the neighborhood. Staff is always nice. Staff is very thorough when threading.

Nice store, organized, small...I am guessing it used to have a web presence since it ends in .com but was informed it isn't there anymore.I come here once a month to pick up a couple of small things, and the staff has been friendly.  Part of a strip mall where the Jewel is, it is kinda small and cramped and usually full.  This should not of course (nor does it) affect the score here, but other than being friendly, it wasn't like...wow.I plan on coming back here though...because for what it is...it does the job. :)
